events.name: Hiwinui Sunflower Field Open Day
events.venue: 465 Ashhurst Road, Palmerston North,465 Ashhurst Rd, Bunnythorpe, Palmerston North 4481, New Zealand, Ashhurst
events.long_description:
Hiwinui Sunflower Field Open Day
We’re thrilled to welcome you back for our 2026 Sunflower Season 🌻
A breathtaking summer experience just 10 minutes from Palmerston North and Feilding. Hiwinui Sunflower Field is a rare and unforgettable destination open for a limited time only.


🌻 ENTRY (CASH ONLY)
🚫 NO EFTPOS facilities on site
• Adults (13 years +): $10
• Children under 13 years: FREE

🌻 PICK YOUR OWN SUNFLOWERS
• Bring your own secateurs or hire for $15 (includes 4 stems)
• $3 per stem
• $1 from every bloom donated to Arohanui Hospice 💛

🌿 EXTRA ACTIVITIES
• Wander our walking and flower track – a brand new field design for 2026
• Stunning photo opportunities & new photo props
• Plenty for the kids including:
– Giant Swing
– Scavenger Hunt
– Lawn Games
• Meet the farm animals: Dior the pony and Poppy & Rambo the pet sheep
• Fonterra Barrel Train Rides – (Gold coin donation)
• Face Painting – (Extra charge $5 per person)
• Extended picnic area with our Hamptons marquee for shade and shelter
• Food Trucks (opening weekend & Food Truck Fridays)
• Real Fruit Ice Cream (opening weekend & Food Truck Fridays)

🕒 OPENING HOURS
📅 Saturday 24 & Sunday 25 January
⏰ 10:00am – 4:00pm

🌻 PRIVATE FIELD HIRE
The sunflower field is available for private hire from 5:30pm – 8:30pm.
Limited spaces available — bookings must be made directly.

📍 LOCATION & PARKING
465 Ashhurst Road, Palmerston North
• Located off the main road — please indicate well in advance
• Follow signage to the main car park
• 🚫 Do not enter via the main entrance of Hiwinui Country Estate
(This is EXIT ONLY)

⚠️ HEALTH & SAFETY
As we are a working farm, please note:
• Leave animals at home (except service dogs)
• Wear suitable footwear — tracks may be uneven
• There are bees and pollen in the field — bring medication if required
• Basic first aid is available at the site office

🌻 We can’t wait to welcome you for another unforgettable sunflower season at Hiwinui

events.venue: King Lion Hall,St Paul's Lutheran Church, 12 King St, Upper Hutt Central, Upper Hutt 5018, New Zealand, Upper Hutt
events.long_description:
Personal Spiritual Healing
Spiritual Healing is a healing modality where the practitioner acts as a clear channel for the healing energy to come through. Spiritual Healing is an effective method to bring about a deep, relaxing, enjoyable state which promotes self-healing. In some cases it will deal with the emotional release that is required at the time.
Spiritual Healing enables you to feel an inner peace. The loving touch of comfort and reassurance to regain the power within you, is always present.
The healing can be a moving and a heart felt experience.
Energy is transmitted to you during the healing, all you have to do is open your heart to receive the healing energy.
It strengthens your whole wellbeing.
No appointment is necessary on Saturday, just come on in.
A Spiritual Healing session usually takes 20-30 minutes.
Where: King Lion Hall
12 King Street, Upper Hutt
When: Every Saturday except the last Saturday of each month.
Time: 10am-3pm
Cost: Donation/Koha

events.name: Silent Retreat - A Day of Calm, Creativity & Inner Connection
events.venue: Lotus Yoga Centre,91 Ruapehu Street, Paraparaumu, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Silent Retreat - A Day of Calm, Creativity & Inner Connection
🌸 Silent Retreat – A Day of Calm, Creativity & Inner Connection

Hosted by Lisa Conroy from Living the Sweet Life & Tracey Crandall from CharlieRae/TraceyLidene Art

📍 Lotus Yoga & Retreat Centre, 91 Ruapehu Street, Paraparaumu (a short stroll from the train station)
🗓️ Saturday, 24th January 2026
🕐10.00am - 3.00pm
💰 $125 — all materials provided
🥗 Light refreshments available throughout the day (BYO lunch)
✨ Event Link: https://facebook.com/events/s/silent-retreat-a-day-of-calm-c/1831388837742351/?

Shhh… can you hear it? That gentle whisper calling you back to yourself? 💫
Join us for a day designed to quiet the noise and awaken your inner calm through creativity, meditation, and mindful stillness.

You’ll be gently guided through soulful experiences — from sound bowls and meditation to creative journaling, intuitive art, and sacred self-care. This retreat is your space to exhale, reflect, and simply be. Surrounded by nature, a pond and birdsong.

✨ What’s Included:
🌿 Begin your day with a guided meditation and soothing sound healing
🌿 Infuse your crystal of intention — your quiet companion for the day (and it goes home with you)
🌿 Wander between creative stations at your own pace:

* Write a letter to yourself 💌
* Connect with nature through leaf rubbings & botanical sketches 🌸
* Create an intention or dream page from magazines 🌈
* Try teabag art, intuitive breath drawings, and mandala inserts 🎨
* Pull a symbol stone and reflect on what it means to you 🪶

Your beautiful journal (included) will grow with colour, words, and meaning as the day unfolds.

🌸 Pampering & Peace
Because we all need a little nurturing...
🩷 Foot soak stations (ahh, yes please!)
🩷 Self-pampering including warm stones to hold and melt away tension

Prompts to guide your day:
💫 Inspirational gentle prompts
💫 A space to leave little love notes of encouragement to be shared at the end

A gentle, soul-soothing day to rest, create, and reconnect — surrounded by stillness, soft energy, and kind hearts.
✨ Spaces are limited for this intimate experience.

Contact for further information or to book your place.

🪷Tracey Crandall -
🌸Lisa Conroy -


With Creativity, Sparkle & Soul,
Tracey & Lisa
CharlieRae & Living the Sweet Life

👯‍♀️ Meet your co-creators:
Tracey Crandall and Lisa Conroy are two creative souls who live for colour, connection, and sparking joy. Together, they blend art, play, and nurturing rituals into experiences that lift you up, light you up, and leave you glowing inside and out.

UTUKORE | FREE 🌊 Rā o te Whānau: Te au kakara i te moana | Whānau Day: The sweet aroma of the ocean breeze

events.id: Gardens Magic-Wellington Botanic Garden ki Paekākā, Soundshell-Wellington NZ
events.name: Gardens Magic
events.venue: Wellington Botanic Garden ki Paekākā, Soundshell
events.long_description:
The Wellington summer nights just got warmer with the return of Gardens Magic. The capital’s talented musicians are on full display across January. The annual event, brought by Wellington City Council, presents a series of free concerts in the Botanic Garden Soundshell. 
Each year, a huge range of music genres is represented across three weeks. Choose from rock, folk, country and western, soul, jazz, pop, reggae and many more. Come early to grab a good picnic spot and sit back and enjoy the show with the whanau or a group of friends. Prolong your stay in the gardens by exploring the evening light display afterwards. The pathways near the Soundshell will be colourfully illuminated between 9 and 10:30pm every evening. During the day, the Botanic Gardens host a Kids Garden Trail and Kids Explorer Days. 
See the full 2026 programme online and keep an eye out for rain day announcements. This is your chance to join in on a beloved local tradition.

The Wellington summer nights just got warmer with the return of Gardens Magic.
The capital’s talented musicians are on full display across January.
The annual event, brought by Wellington City Council, presents a series of free concerts in the Botanic Garden Soundshell.
Each year, a huge range of music genres is represented across three weeks.
Choose from rock, folk, country and western, soul, jazz, pop, reggae and many more.

events.id: Gindulgence-Waitangi Park, Wellington, New Zealand-Wellington NZ
events.name: Gindulgence
events.venue: Waitangi Park, Wellington, New Zealand
events.long_description:
New Zealand’s most celebrated boutique gin festival. Waitangi Park hosts Gindulgence in January. A group of 18 distillers will showcase a fabulous selection of more than 90 gins and other spirits from New Zealand and around the world. The ticket price includes samples from distillers, so you’ll be able to explore an exceptional range. Delight the senses with botanical flavour combinations. 
This year, it’s not just gin that features in the outdoor fair. You’ll find rum, whisky, vodka, liqueurs and other specialist spirits. Shop for a summer tipple or listen to presentations from some passionate distillers. Alternatively, just sit back on the grass and soak up the atmosphere, accompanied by live acoustic music and great local food.

events.id: Michelangelo — A Different View-Tākina Wellington Convention and Exhibition Centre-Wellington NZ
events.name: Michelangelo — A Different View
events.venue: Tākina Wellington Convention and Exhibition Centre
events.long_description:
There’s no need to look up to see true greatness. The intricate beauty of Michelangelo’s Sistine Chapel ceiling will be on full display at Tākina over summer. Michelangelo — A Different View invites you to experience the genius of the sixteenth-century artist from an entirely new perspective. You get to be above and up close. 
Under license from the Vatican Museums, this exhibition offers a complete and authentic reproduction of over 50 stunning works. This once-in-a-lifetime exhibition allows you to experience the colour and detail of multiple works from just two meters away.

events.id: Waiora Te Ūkaipō — The Homeland-The Opera House, Wellington, New Zealand-Wellington NZ
events.name: Waiora Te Ūkaipō — The Homeland
events.venue: The Opera House, Wellington, New Zealand
events.long_description:
The impact of colonisation and urban drift are themes in a theatrical reboot at the next Aotearoa New Zealand Festival of the Arts. ‘Waiora Te Ūkaipō — The Homeland’ was originally commissioned by the festival in 1992. Its return 34 years later at the 2026 festival is highly anticipated. It has become a landmark piece of New Zealand theatre — exploring the tension between past and future. Set in the summer of 1965, the play follows Hone, who brings his family from New Zealand’s East Cape to the South Island in search of a better life. As they gather for a beachside birthday hāngī with their Pākehā guests, buried secrets and cultural tensions rise to the surface. Far from their  tīpuna , the family must navigate questions of identity, belonging, and survival. 
Waiora Te Ūkaipō was conceived, written and directed by Hone Kouka (Ngāti Porou, Ngāti Raukawa, Ngāti Kahungunu). The multi-award-winning writer/director has penned 13 plays. Many have been staged in Aotearoa and further afield in Canada, South Africa, New Caledonia, and the UK. Waiora Te Ūkaipō is presented in partnership with the Aotearoa New Zealand Festival of the Arts, Te Ahurei Toi o Tāmaki Auckland Arts Festival, Auckland Theatre Company and Tawata Productions.
events.description:
‘Waiora Te Ūkaipō — The Homeland’ was originally commissioned by the festival in 1992.
Its return 34 years later at the 2026 festival is highly anticipated.
It has become a landmark piece of New Zealand theatre — exploring the tension between past and future.
Set in the summer of 1965, the play follows Hone, who brings his family from New Zealand’s East Cape to the South Island in search of a better life.
Waiora Te Ūkaipō is presented in partnership with the Aotearoa New Zealand Festival of the Arts, Te Ahurei Toi o Tāmaki Auckland Arts Festival, Auckland Theatre Company and Tawata Productions.

events.id: Heathers the Musical-The Opera House, Wellington, New Zealand-Wellington NZ
events.name: Heathers the Musical
events.venue: The Opera House, Wellington, New Zealand
events.long_description:
It’s Westerberg High, where popularity is a matter of life and death. Welcome to ‘Heathers the Musical”. Based on a movie with the same name, the show is a coming-of-age story dealing with love, heartache, defying expectations, and being true to yourself. It originally premiered in Los Angeles in 2013. Since then, the musical has had record-breaking seasons across the globe. It now makes its professional New Zealand debut in 2026, and Wellington is in line to join the school assembly. Described as a high-octane, black comedy rock musical, Heathers is packed with a mix of ballads and showstoppers. The catchy tunes are written by Kevin Murphy (Desperate Housewives) and Laurence O’Keefe (Legally Blonde: The Musical). 
The 1989 film starred Winona Ryder and Christian Slater. It quickly achieved cult status among audiences. Both the movie and musical follow high school student Veronica Sawyer. Veronica is just another nobody until she’s unexpectedly taken under the wings of the beautiful and cruel Heathers. When mysterious teen rebel J.D. arrives, Veronica learns that it might kill to be a nobody, but it's murder being a somebody. 
This special production will feature a stellar Australasian cast. So grab your scrunchies, break out the Corn Nuts and wait for the bell to ring.

events.id: Sapphic Summer Clothing Swap-Thistle Hall Community Venue,293 Cuba St, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand, Wellington-All Events In
events.name: Sapphic Summer Clothing Swap
events.venue: Thistle Hall Community Venue,293 Cuba St, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand, Wellington
events.long_description:
Sapphic Summer Clothing Swap
Kia ora e hoa, we’re back with more sapphic events now that silly season is winding down! Our first gathering of the year is gonna be low-key, eco-friendly, and full of sweet community ✨

All sizes and styles of clothing are needed for this to be a successful swap, so please bring everything you want to leave behind in 2025! Clothing will be sorted by type (shirts, pants, dresses etc) and general size range (0-6, 8-12, 14-18 etc) to make it easy to find something fabulous that will fit you. Please make sure all items are clean and in decent condition!

What to bring: Clothing, togs, shoes, jewelry, and books
What NOT to bring: Underwear/used socks, home decor, random knick-knacks

There will be an upcycle station to gay-ify your finds complete with sewing machines, scissors, DIY tools, and knowledgable volunteers to help you make the most of your new wardrobe. And if you get peckish, there will be fresh lemonade and cupcakes for sale by lovely members of our queer community!

Instead of selling tickets this event is koha-based - which means it’s totally fine to rock up for free if finances are tight right now, but please consider contributing a few bucks to support the venue hire/labour that goes into putting these events together ☺️

Thistle Hall 2nd floor is accessible by elevator and has gender neutral bathrooms. We’ll be playing vibey tunes for a fun swap experience (perhaps just the Heated Rivalry soundtrack on repeat?) but will keep the volume to a comfy level so everyone can chat and connect.

events.id: Porirua Parkrun-Bothamley Park, Champion Street, Porirua - Mana-Event Finder
events.name: Porirua Parkrun
events.venue: Bothamley Park, Champion Street, Porirua - Mana
events.long_description:
What is Porirua parkrun? It is a free 5km walk or run event - It’s not about coming first or winning. You can go at your own pace and just enjoy being with other people. It is inclusive and the perfect way to start your weekend in the outdoors chatting to people.

The start occurs just upstream of the Bothamley Park carpark. This car park is off Champion street, opposite the intersection with Windley Street. Head to end of carpark where the concrete ends and there is a gate. For location see https://goo.gl/maps/wEohfp9bRu82.

The course is following the old coach road (circa 1870's) established for the early farms in the area. Today this historic track is located within a park, away from cars and now used by walkers, runners and cyclists.

The track is generally 3 metres wide with a gentle gradient and a compacted gravel surface beside the Kenepuru Stream through a picturesque wooded wild valley. (Note there is a pinch point for a short section after the 2km marker where participants need to go single file each direction for approx 30 metres)

The valley runs east-west with mature trees which means this has to be one of the most sheltered places, out of the wind to exercise in Wellington.

What does it cost to join in? Nothing - it's free! but please register before your first run or walk, so you can get your timing results. You only need to register with parkrun once, to participate at any of the parkrun events around the world. Don't forget to bring a copy of your barcode. If you forget it, you won't get a time.

How fast do I have to be? Walking is fine as long as you can finish the 5km. Please come along and join in whatever your pace!

One dog per adult is welcome, as long as it is on a short hand held lead.

Children welcome but those 10 years and under need to be kept within arms reach of a supervising adult.

Note there is no toilets in the park, so go before you go.

We're friendly! Every week we grab a post park run/walk coffee/tea at Get Fixed within Kai Tahi at 20 Parumoana Street, to mix exercise with socialising.

There are volunteering opportunities even week. So those doing Duke of Edinburgh or similar challenges can get volunteer credits. Ensure you contact us well in advance at "porirua@parkrun.co.nz"

This is a FREE rolling party with LIVE DJs, a fully stocked bar on board, and nonstop energy as we turn a bus into Wellington’s most mobile dancefloor. Expect big tunes, good vibes, and a one-of-a-kind party cruising through the city.

Soundtracked by Waves, Danger & Tonka, bringing the vibes with House, UKG & DnB all night long.

events.id: PADI Open Water Diver Course-New Zealand Sea Adventures, 9 Marina View, Porirua - Mana-Event Finder
events.name: PADI Open Water Diver Course
events.venue: New Zealand Sea Adventures, 9 Marina View, Porirua - Mana
events.long_description:
PADI is by far the largest and most popular Scuba diver certifying system in the world and for good reason. Courses are fun, safe, relevant, and packed with excitement! No matter what country you are in, your PADI qualification will be recognised.

The practical part of your Open Water Scuba Diver course takes just four days! During the first weekend, we make it very easy and convenient for you with our on-site dive pool (the only one in the Wellington Region). Our pool is where you learn to dive, so we can go at your pace, no matter how long it takes. During the first weekend, you learn and practice all the necessary dive skills. Once completed, you will be ready for the sea dives.

Once you are a certified diver, you will receive an eCard on your PADI App showing your qualification – and any PADI Dive Centre will be able to confirm your certification on-line. You will also be qualified to attend the PADI Advanced Open Water Diver course, and our regular Dive Days.

We want to make your diving safe and enjoyable. Welcome to the exciting world of Scuba diving!

If you have any questions please call, email or stop by our Dive Store.

Kind regards,
Tony Howell
PADI Course Director
Tel: 04 233-8238 Email: nzsa@scubadiving.co.nz Web: www.scubadiving.co.nz
9 Marina View, Mana, Porirua 5026


PADI Open Water Diver course at a glance:
•Digital theory: Open Water Diver eLearning Course (allow 8-14 hours)
•Practical: One weekend pool training, one weekend with four sea dives
•Options: One-on-one or unscheduled dates – additional costs apply.
•Start Time: Please be at NZ Sea Adventures by 8.30am daily.

Location:
We are located at 9 Marina View, Mana, Porirua; just north of the Paremata bridge on SH1. Look for the big yellow building. Check our website for location.

Prerequisites:
•Be at least 10 years old (special conditions apply for 10 and 11-year-olds)
•Be able to swim 300m (no time limit) and swim/float for 10 minutes.
•Be medically fit to dive. Check the Diver Medical Participant Questionnaire. If you answer YES to any of the questions or have any doubts, a visit to your doctor is required.
•Elearning must be completed before your pool training can begin.
•Complete the RDP Tables Quiz and Exam if you don’t have a dive computer.

What to Bring:
•Completed Diver Medical Participant Questionnaire.
•If Under 18 years – bring a Parent or Legal Guardian to sign your forms.
•A pen, swimming costume, towel and a snack for the breaks.
•Any personal dive equipment you wish to use.
•The $450.00 balance of your course fee.

Cost:
•Scheduled Open Water Diver Course Fee: total is $750.00; deposit is $300.00.
•Includes: PADI eLearning Course, Dive Gear Rental, Pool Sessions, and Sea Dives. Rental wetsuits are available in stock sizes only. Other sizes are available for purchase. Made-to-measure options can be ordered and purchased
•10% off all in-store purchases during your course. Does not include packages.
•$20 off your course fee for every person you get to sign on with you.

When:
Our PADI Open Water Diver Courses are scheduled year-round. See our online calendar for scheduled course dates or ask in store. Booking early guarantees your place and price.
Looking for different dates or smaller classes? Ask about our one-off course options. Let us know what you need and we will do our best to help (conditions may apply).

Booking your course:
•Course bookings can be made in-store, via email, online or over the phone
•The deposit of $300.00 secures your place on a course and purchases your eLearning course.
•Deposits are transferable to another person but are not refundable.
•Elearning courses, once redeemed, cannot be transferred.
•Before we can send you the eLearning link, we require your full name, date of birth, a valid personal email address and phone number.
•Your course balance is to be paid before we can begin your pool training.

Fresh local produce, seafood, flowers, eggs, meat and plants from Greytown and the South Wairarapa. From 9am Saturday mornings at Truckstop Greytown, 102 Main St.

Crop Up is Greytown's very own ultra-fresh, ultra-sustainable and ultra-tasty Saturday morning pop-up place to get your fresh food. It's all about crops, coffee and community.

events.long_description:
Ecstatic Dance Wellington
💫 Move. Release. Connect. 💫

🌟✨ Ecstatic Dance Wellington ✨🌟

With DJ Kimba Jade @ Vogelmorn Hall, Wellington

Kimba Jade & Bernie Cruise are thrilled to be hosting Ecstatic Dance Wellington! 🎉

💫 What is Ecstatic Dance?
A freeform, drug- and alcohol-free dance experience where you move however your body wants. The music flows like a wave — starting slow, rising to ecstatic peaks, then softening into stillness. It’s therapeutic, uplifting, and a powerful way to connect with yourself and community.

Please note, that this Ecstatic Dance is not verbally guided, we let the music guide you 😊. Dance freely how your body moves you.

🎶 This Dance Floor
Guided by DJ Kimba Jade, expect an immersive journey through deep bass, tribal rhythms, and global soundscapes that awaken both body and spirit. With 25 years behind the decks—including 9 years dedicated to Ecstatic Dance—Kimba crafts transformative spaces of joy, release, and connection. Originally from Auckland, she curated Alchemic Dance Floor events for 5 years, now co-runs the Ecstatic Dance Festival, and teaches Ecstatic Dance DJ Trainings. She’s thrilled to share her magic and move with you on the dance floor!

🎶 The Sound System
Here at Ecstatic Dance Wellington, we believe in using a phat sound system with lots of bass for our dances. We will be bringing an ultra vibey and super bassy experience for you!


🗓 Event Details
📍 Vogelmorn Hall, 13 Vennell Street, Brooklyn, Wellington 6021
🕖 7:00pm – Opening Circle
🕢 7:15pm – Ecstatic Dance
🕘 8:45pm – Closing Circle
🕘 9:00pm – Chai & Chocolate (for those wanting to socialise)

🎟 Tickets
$25 online
https://events.humanitix.com/ecstatic-dance-wellington-e5sre8te

$30 cash on the door

**If you would like to come but are unwaged or struggling, please send us a message directly, we'd love to help.

☀️ Extra Info
- Doors will open at 6.45pm for you to socialise in the lobby, we'll start promptly at 7pm.

We are very much looking forward to co-creating with the conscious dance community in Wellington and sharing our magic.

❤️ What to Bring

Water bottle

Loose, comfy clothes

Warm layers for afterwards

A pillow and Blanket if you wish

A friend!

🌟 Guidelines

Drug & alcohol free event

Silence on the dance floor

Without phones/cameras on the dance floor

Respect the space & each other 😊

🎧 Tune into Kimba’s ED sets:
Mixcloud: https://www.mixcloud.com/kimbajade/

✨ Come dance with us at Ecstatic Dance Wellington — a night of music, movement & magic. ✨

Galette Des Rois Workshop
Learn to authentically create Galette Des Rois. Taught by a Le Cordon Bleu Master Chef.

About this Event

During this workshop, our Le Cordon Bleu Master Pâtisserie Chef will demonstrate and guide you through the preparation and baking of authentic Galette Des Rois (Kings Cake) a traditional French dessert enjoyed in Januray.
What is a Le Cordon Bleu Workshop? A Le Cordon Bleu workshop involves hands on kitchen activity. Be personally guided by world class chefs within our industrial kitchen classrooms. Learn techniques to elevate your cooking during an intensive day course, light lunch included.
Date: 24th January 2026
Time: 9am – 4pm (light lunch is included)
Location: Level 2, 52 Cuba Street, Te Aro, Wellington
Allergies: Ingredients in this class contain the following allergens: Wheat, egg, treenuts, soy, and dairy. Please note, our pâtisserie kitchen stores varieties of nuts and traces will be present in the environment (but only almond will be directly used in this workshop).
You Will Create:
Inverted Puff Pastry
Almond Cream
Two Galettes des Rois to bring home
Course Details: During the workshop, you will learn the following skills:
The roles of the ingredients
Making inverted puff pastry
Lamination skills
Cutting and decorating skills
Course Includes: All ingredients and equipment supplied, a light lunch is included. Everything you make is yours to take home.
Contact Details: +64 4 472 9800 |

events.id: Neurodiversity Workshop-Wellington High School, 249 Taranaki St, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Neurodiversity Workshop
events.venue: Wellington High School, 249 Taranaki St, Wellington
events.long_description:
Neurodiversity seems to be a hot topic of discussion lately. Famous singers such as Lewis Capaldi and Sia and actors such as Ryan Gosling and Channing Tatum have discussed their neurodiverse conditions. Lockdowns and social media have driven many adults to have startling realisations about their own neurodiverse conditions. It seems suddenly – all at once – the world has become aware that 15-20% of people have different types of brains. (Free for NZ citizens/residents, all others pay $99).

Description
This one-day workshop introduces you to the topic of neurodiversity and considers some of the key conditions that people live with. We look at:

-ADHD – Attention Deficit Hyperactivity Disorder
-Autism
-The “Dys family” – dyslexia, dysgraphia, dyscalculia, dyspraxia (Developmental Coordination Disorder)
-OCD – Obsessive Compulsive Disorder
-Tourette’s Syndrome

TikTok creator and public speaker on neurodiversity, Nigel Sutton, will introduce the subject and help you discover the definitions and impacts of each of the key kinds of neurodiversity. Working together with other participants, you will consider many key commonalities that those living with various neurodivergent conditions experience. We will expose the realities of being neurodivergent in a “neurotypical world”, and this will allow you to develop empathy and practical strategies to support neurodivergent people to be their best.

New Zealand’s leading dyslexia expert, Mike Styles, will provide an interactive and participatory session to assist you in understanding and supporting a family member or friend who has dyslexia or a similar learning difference.

You will be able to ask anything you want with our neurodivergent hot seat session.

Find out from those offering “lived experience” what it is really like to have a different kind of brain. This one-day workshop is: ”Neurodiversity in a Nutshell” – whether you know a little or a lot, whether you are a relative, employer, partner, friend, or just interested to know more about neurodiversity – this workshop is for you!

[You must be a NZ citizen or resident to register in this course for free, and you must provide photo ID when you attend. If you are unable to attend the course, we cannot guarantee that you will be able to enrol again for free for a funded course in the future.


Note: Courses need a minimum number to go ahead, so if we don't have enough enrolments a few days before the start date, we have to cancel. We'll let you know by emai,l so please check yours regularly. If you need to cancel your registration, here are our terms and conditions: "What You Need to Know".

You will be able to ask anything you want with our neurodivergent hot seat session.

events.long_description:
The Barker Boys Live at Sprig + Fern Berhampore
The boys are back in town!

Get ready for the annual summer fun of The Barker Boys at the Sprig + Fern Berhampore. Every year the lads bring an evening of fun and sing-alongs. Music kicks off at 7.30pm.

This father and son acoustic duo play songs from the 50’s and 60’s through to modern day including The Beatles, Elvis, Taylor Swift, The Rolling Stones, Coldplay, The Who, REM, Oasis, Foo Fighters, Frank Turner and more...

Sean Barker is a Berhampore local and member of Wellington based bands The Wooden Box Band and Search For Yeti. His dad Geoff Barker is a popular performer across the Dordogne region of France where he lives, after an extensive career on UK radio.

Together Sean and Geoff become The Barker Boys.

They’ve played together over the past 25yrs (when in the same hemisphere!) and this is a chance to catch them during Geoff’s extended holiday in Aotearoa.

Free entry but a good idea to grab the crew and book a table by calling or sending the Sprig a message on Facebook — the gigs are always busy! It's an all ages gig with space inside and outside.

And if you've never seen the boys, here’s some video highlights from a UK gig...


Book a table now, and see you soon!

events.long_description:
The Velvet Glove Play the Songs of The Velvet Underground, Unplugged
The Velvet Glove Play the Songs of The Velvet Underground, Unplugged

In the early 70s Cripple was one of the first bands to fall under the influence of The Velvet Underground, a signature ingredient of the Dunedin sound. Lou Reed’s remarkable songwriting - songs like “Sweet Jane” and “I’m Waiting for the Man - found a natural home at the heart of Cripple’s set.

The Velvet Glove reunites three members of that band - John Dodd (Midge Marsden, The Chaps, Skin and Bone), Chris Nichol (The Dunstan Rangers, The Zimmermans) and Lindsay Gregory (The Dunstan Rangers, Heaven Bent). They’re joined by Martin Durrant (Sneaky Feelings, The Zimmermans) and Bill Nichol (Baby) for a one-off performance at The Undercurrent.

Be sure you’re there when The Velvet Glove breathes fresh life into two sets of classic songs from The Velvet Underground catalogue.

The Undercurrent, Saturday January 24.
Doors at 7.00pm
Band at 7.30pm
$20 at Under the Radar (link coming soon!) and the Door.

Snacks, wine, beer & soft drinks, tea & coffee, and of course...books available for purchase!

We’ll see you there ☆

events.id: Botanical insights display - Ancient plants-Wellington Botanic Garden, 101 Glenmore St, Kelburn, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Botanical insights display - Ancient plants
events.venue: Wellington Botanic Garden, 101 Glenmore St, Kelburn, Wellington
events.long_description:
Ancient plants and a few animals

A boom in ‘modern’ palaeobotany started in the early 19th century and continues to the present day. A pictorial display at Wellington Botanic Garden’s Tree House highlights key discoveries in this long trek, and also gives us a glimpse of some of the animals that shared the world with plants.
The display is in two halves. From 1 November to mid-December, the ‘scene’ is set, and includes a look at the landscape preceding the rise of trees. It then moves on to the Silurian, Devonian and Carboniferous periods, characterised by the appearance of the likes of scale trees, seed ferns and calamites…. and the swamp forests that gave rise to the production of coal.
The mid-December to 31 January half focuses on the Permian period, including Gondwana before its eventual breakup, and the beautiful, strange, gymnosperm Glossopteris that was widespread in the ancient southern continents. It then, finally, progresses to the world of ‘living fossils’ such as ginkgo and the even more primitive horsetails.
A public talk associated with the display will be held at the Tree House on 2 December.

Treehouse Visitor Centre
1 Nov 2025 to 31 January 2026
Monday - Friday 9am - 4pm
Weekends & Public holidays 10am - 4pm
Closed Christmas Day
Free

events.id: Colossal Squid: Freaky Features-Cobblestones Museum & Early Settlers Village, 169 Main Street, Greytown-Event Finder
events.name: Colossal Squid: Freaky Features
events.venue: Cobblestones Museum & Early Settlers Village, 169 Main Street, Greytown
events.long_description:
Colossal Squid: Freaky Features comes to Cobblestones, Greytown

The ever-popular Te Papa exhibition Colossal Squid Ngu Tipua opens at Cobblestones on 11th December 2025 and runs through until 1st February 2026.

The Colossal Squid is so rarely seen that only eight adult colossal squid have ever been scientifically reported. Now venue name, in co-operation with Te Papa, is set to reveal some of the fascinating science and wonderful secrets of one of New Zealand’s most significant natural history specimens.

Te Papa's Head of Natural History, Phil Edgar, said, “In learning about this weird and mysterious creature, we hope visitors will have a greater appreciation for life in the deep sea, much of which remains undiscovered.”

The Colossal Squid is one of the most iconic specimens at Te Papa, and while touring the complete specimen is impossible, some of the important parts of the squid have found their way to Cobblestones.
Te Papa’s Curator of Invertebrates, Dr Rodrigo Salvador, explains how important the Colossal Squid has been for the science community, and how popular it has been among the public.

“Te Papa’s Colossal Squid has been a major source of information for scientists and the museum’s most popular exhibit since its debut. They live in the deep Antarctic waters, and despite being one of the largest invertebrate species in existence, they are very rarely captured”.

Colossal Squid Ngu Tipua centres around an interactive table displaying many different objects, including the lens from an eye of the Colossal Squid, part of a tentacle, and a complete tiny squid, a miniature of its colossal relative. Touchable rotating models of a squid’s tentacle hook and the Colossal Squid's beak are also on display.

The exhibition also displays two documentaries which show life in the depths of the Southern Ocean, and how the most complete Colossal Squid ever found ended up at Te Papa.

The public can continue the experience and learn beyond the exhibition with a new Te Papa press book for children, Whiti: Colossal Squid of the Deep, and online Te Papa resources, including a free downloadable Colossal Squid Activity Book.

“Thanks to the support of WBS and Te Papa, Cobblestones is delighted to be bringing this fascinating exhibition to Wairarapa during the summer holidays. It’s a must-see exhibition for the young and young at heart to learn about this fascinating creature, its world, and habitat.”

Colossal Squid Ngu Tipua is developed and toured by the Museum of New Zealand Te Papa Tongarewa.

For further information, please contact:
Cobblestones Museum - 063049687 or cobblestonesmuseumgreytown@gmail.com

events.id: Michelangelo - A Different View-Tākina Wellington Convention Centre, 50 Cable Street, Te Aro, Wellington, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Michelangelo - A Different View
events.venue: Tākina Wellington Convention Centre, 50 Cable Street, Te Aro, Wellington, Wellington
events.long_description:
Last 4pm last entry

Under license from the Vatican Museums, this exhibition offers the most complete and authentic reproduction of Michelangelo’s beautiful ceiling frescoes of the Sistine Chapel to be shown outside the Vatican.

Featuring over 50 stunning pieces, including a life-sized reproduction of The Genesis, famously painted on the Sistine Chapel ceiling. But instead of craning your neck to look up, A Different View invites you to experience Michelangelo’s genius from an entirely new perspective – from above and up close.

This immersive experience, completed with guided audio, allows visitors to admire every intricate detail of Michelangelo’s work, many from just two metres away – offering a far more intimate and comfortable viewing experience than the Vatican itself, where some 20,000 people queue daily for a glimpse.

With no time constraints, visitors can allow these masterpieces to truly soak in.

As an addition to – and to complete – Michelangelo — A Different View, reproductions of 14 of these impressive frescoes await visitors inside the exhibition. Scenes from the lives of Jesus and Moses, painted by Sandro Botticelli, Pietro Perugino, Domenico Ghirlandaio and Cosimo Rosselli, provide additional historical background and allow for a deeper insight into this epoch.

Enhancing the exhibition further, VIP guided tours will be led by Dr Christopher Longhurst, a theologian and aesthete who served for 17 years as an operatore didattico at the Sistine Chapel, St Peter’s Basilica, and the Vatican Museums' Papal Art Galleries.

* Booking and credit card fees apply

events.name: Pick Your Own Sunflowers - A Fundraiser For Hōkai Tahi
events.venue: Stolte Ag Dairy Farm, 153 Wiltons Road, Carterton
events.long_description:
Come and enjoy the simple joy of sunflowers, grown by the Stolte Dairy Farm team!

Wander through the sunflower field, pick your own blooms, and take home a bunch of sunshine - all while supporting Hōkai Tahi, a local not-for-profit organisation providing free pregnancy, baby loss, and perinatal support to whānau across the Wairarapa.

Updates on opening days/times, bloom availability etc will be posted on Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/share/17bUymPdWU/

Event details:
- Open Wednesdays and Saturdays throughout January 2026
- Entry: FREE (koha welcome)
- Sunflowers: $2 per stem
- Location: Gate entry just past 153 Wiltons Road on the left-hand side - look for the flag when we’re open
- Payment options: Cash, bank transfer, or online via debit card

What to bring:
• Your own secateurs or scissors
• Sun hat, sunscreen, and water bottle

The field includes a small number of florist-grade blooms, with the majority being the classic bright yellow sunflowers we all love. Whether you bring a picnic and stay for a while, or just pop in for some photos and a quick ice block treat, it’s a beautiful way to support a local charity and enjoy the season.

Please note: Opening days and times are weather and bloom-dependent.
Dates may change, and updates will always be posted on Facebook

We can’t wait to welcome you to the farm!

events.venue: Stonehenge Aotearoa, 51 Ahiaruhe Rd, Carterton
events.long_description:
Explore Stonehenge Aotearoa at Your Own Pace

Our self-guided tour includes a map and a 12-minute audio-visual presentation to help you uncover the secrets of the henge. Afterward, head down to the stone circle and try out its unique acoustics — clap your hands and hear the echo respond, or whisper and see how far your voice carries.

A self-guided tour typically takes around 30 minutes, but many visitors stay longer simply because it’s so much fun. The bigger your group, the better the experience!

Please arrive at least 30 minutes before closing time.
Available during our opening hours: 10 AM – 4 PM.

events.id: Summer Soirée: Psychedelic & Melodic Techno feat Kozy (CA), Aztoria ( Au) & Local Legends-Valhalla,154 Vivian St, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand, Wellington-All Events In
events.name: Summer Soirée: Psychedelic & Melodic Techno feat Kozy (CA), Aztoria ( Au) & Local Legends
events.venue: Valhalla,154 Vivian St, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand, Wellington
events.long_description:
Summer Soirée: Psychedelic & Melodic Techno feat Kozy (CA), Aztoria ( Au) & Local Legends
Wellington, join us for a night of Psychedelic & Melodic Techno featuring 2 international artists Kozy ( Canada), Aztoria ( Australia) supported by Aadhi, Blair & Uday. This event will be hosted at the legendary venue, Valhalla on the 24th of January, 8pm onwards.

Kozy will be playing a 2.5 Hour Extended Set, Aztoria will be playing a 1.5hr set & local legends will be playing an hour each.

International DJ Bio's:

KOZY ( CA)

KOZY aka Jeff Koz is a Montreal-based DJ & Entrepreneur specialising in dark & groovy underground techno music.
KOZY's dedication to music is evident in his tight mixes, solid track selection and inclination towards groovy synths and heavy, disruptive bass.

In 2019, he founded AlpaKa MuziK, a Montreal-based record label pushing world-class underground progressive, minimal and psychedelic techno beats. With releases from some of the biggest names in the game, AlpaKa MuziK has been paving the way for this fast emerging genre with relentless quality music and has become one of the most prominent labels in the psychedelic techno sub-genre.

With over 125 releases and over 650 tracks under their belt, AlpaKa has quickly become a powerhouse label in the underground techno community.

Since early 2022, in a little over 2 years, KOZY has gone on 9 international tours, including 5 euro tours, Australia, South Africa Mauritius, India, Mexico and has played over 150 gigs in 24 months in over 30 countries and counting.

Some prominent festivals he has performed at include, Esoteric in Australia, Hadra in France, Texas Eclipse, Boom Festival and many others, bringing to many of them the AlpaKa MuziK takeovers that showcase the cutting edge psychedelic techno sound through countless live sets around the world.

He recently finished his 4-month long 2025 summer euro tour where he performed at Boom Festival in Portugal and many more AlpaKa Showcases all around Europe and beyond. His 2025-2026 world tour is in motion, with Japan and a large Southern Hemisphere schedule in the works. With an unstoppable arsenal of unreleased, cutting edge bangers, he'll leave you wanting more after every set.

AZTORIA ( AU)

Aztoria is the psytech project of Ashley Zadel, also known as Flow Theory.

For more than 16 years, his melodic bush techno sound has evolved through auditory storytelling on stages across the globe, from Cape Town to London, Israel to Brazil, Portugal, New Zealand and Australia.

Rooted in progressive soundscapes with an organic flavour, Aztoria blends melodic deep house grooves with minimal techno to craft psychedelic atmospheres that ignite the imagination.

Aztoria burst onto the scene with his debut EP Reborn (Dense Nebula Records), hitting #4 on Beatport’s Techno charts. His 2024 single Birds of Paradise (Soliq Records) soared to #33, while his Inner Groove remix landed at #23 in Progressive House (Techgnosis Records). With fresh releases on Techgnosis, Recovery Collective and Puzzles Records and more in the works, Aztoria is carving his path in the underground with relentless energy and innovation.

Whether in the depths of a forest or the heart of a concrete jungle, Aztoria’s tunes will captivate and elevate you with his storytelling magic.

events.id: Twisted Rings for Summer-Workspace Studios Ltd, 65 Abel Smith St, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Twisted Rings for Summer
events.venue: Workspace Studios Ltd, 65 Abel Smith St, Wellington
events.long_description:
Craft an elegant twisted silver ring from solid silver! Learn to soften and twist wire to create the twist you want, then learn how to form it into a ring that fits you. Learn to use the jeweller's torch to solder, then clean up and polish the ring to a beautiful finish.

This 3-hour class is ideal for beginners, groups of friends and visitors to the city.

An excellent, fun class if you have already taken one of our Stacking Rings or Textured Earrings classes and fancy adding to your jewellery collection.

Included in the class fee are copper and brass for practising on, sterling silver bar to create your twist ring and all consumables such as sandpaper, solder and chemicals. Extra metals are available for purchase in the studio.

Kids aged 12 (or so) are welcome to attend the class, but any person under the age of 16 must be accompanied by an enrolled parent or caregiver.

events.id: Vietnamese Pâté Chaud (Bánh Pa-tê Sô)-203 Willis Street, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: Vietnamese Pâté Chaud (Bánh Pa-tê Sô)
events.venue: 203 Willis Street, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Join Viet Hub NZ for a free Vietnamese cooking workshop celebrating one of Vietnam’s most-loved pastries — Bánh Pa-tê Sô (Vietnamese Pâté Chaud).
In this relaxed, hands-on session, you’ll learn how this golden, flaky pastry is made, explore its key flavours, and hear the cultural stories behind a snack many Vietnamese families grew up with. The workshop is beginner-friendly and designed as a welcoming space to cook, taste, and connect through food.
What makes this workshop special is not just the recipe, but the sharing of culture, memory, and community. Whether you’re new to Vietnamese cuisine or reconnecting with familiar flavours, you’ll leave with new knowledge, warm food, and a deeper appreciation of Vietnamese food culture.
Free to attend | All ingredients provided | Limited spaces – registration required
Come cook with us, meet new people, and enjoy a meaningful cultural experience through food.
This workshop is proudly delivered by Viet Hub NZ, in collaboration with Te Tai Ohinga | Central City Youth Hub, supporting accessible, inclusive spaces for cultural learning and connection ❤️.

events.id: Wellington Regional Stamp, Coin and Postcard Fair-Knox St Columba Presbyterian Church, 574 High St, Lower Hutt-Event Finder
events.name: Wellington Regional Stamp, Coin and Postcard Fair
events.venue: Knox St Columba Presbyterian Church, 574 High St, Lower Hutt
events.long_description:
The Regional Fair offers stamps, coins, postcards and similar collectables from dealers and local stamp societies. It will provide an opportunity for collectors to find items missing from their collections, meet like-minded people, or seek answers to questions they have about their hobby.

People who have been given collections from family members will find that the dealers and societies can make offers to purchase, advise alternate ways of selling, or perhaps encourage you to take up the hobby yourself.

If you have items you would like identified or would like to gain some understanding of their value or saleability, why not bring them along and seek answers?

The venue has free parking available. A café offering a wide range of food and refreshments will be available.

events.id: Whānau Day-Museum of New Zealand Te Papa Tongarewa, 55 Cable St, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Whānau Day
events.venue: Museum of New Zealand Te Papa Tongarewa, 55 Cable St, Wellington
events.long_description:
Join us for a FREE day of family activities exploring the connection between the whenua (land) and the moana (sea).

Discover raumati (summer) through workshops, performances, and hands-on activities. Learn about seaweed varieties, native plants, and how we can protect our natural environment for future generations.

Activties:
* Identify diverse seaweed species with Mountains to Sea
* Drum and dance to Tokelau rhythms with the Kupega Affect
* Create Moana-inspired crayon pāreu designs with the Pacific Climate Warriors
* Enjoy a live reading of I Love My Island by Moemoana Asfa'ato'a Schwenke, narrated by Inangaro Vakaafi
* Grow native plants and take a cutting home with Te Rito Gardens
* Get your face painted with sea and land creatures by Daizy Designs
* Paint watercolours inspired by botanist and seaweed expert Nancy Adams
* Explore Te Papa's Collections with our art and botany curators

events.id: Whānau Print Making-ZEALANDIA Eco-Sanctuary, Waiapu Road, Karori, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Whānau Print Making
events.venue: ZEALANDIA Eco-Sanctuary, Waiapu Road, Karori, Wellington
events.long_description:
Join us at Zealandia these school holidays for a free, nature inspired craft event!

Local artist Tayla Hartemink has designed a series of unique stamps featuring beautiful native manu and ika, perfect for decorating cards, and printing fabric and clothing. A limited amount of materials will be provided, but we encourage you to bring your own T-shirts, tote bags, tea towels, or other fabric items to personalise with these stunning designs.

Tayla Hartemink (Tūhoe) is a multi-media artist, illustrator and creative workshop facilitator based in Te-Whanganui-ā-Tara. Tayla’s work is rooted in a deep connection to whakapapa and indigenous storytelling. Her work incorporates graphic design, painting, print-making and traditional motifs. Through her artwork she hopes to inspire and empower people to connect with Te Ao Māori.

Suitable for all ages— drop in, get hands-on, and make something colourful to take home!

This show event will be held in the Visitor Centre Foyer and is suitable for all ages, normal admission to the sanctuary applies. Overflow parking is available on Birdwood Street.

events.id: Wilson Blackley The Remain Tour with Oscar LaDell-46a Victoria St Alicetown,46 Victoria St, Alicetown, Lower Hutt 5010, New Zealand, Lower Hutt-All Events In
events.name: Wilson Blackley The Remain Tour with Oscar LaDell
events.venue: 46a Victoria St Alicetown,46 Victoria St, Alicetown, Lower Hutt 5010, New Zealand, Lower Hutt
events.long_description:
Wilson Blackley The Remain Tour with Oscar LaDell
Wilson Blackley The Remain Tour with Oscar LaDell.

Wilson Blackley is an Australian multi-instrumentalist and producer currently based in Melbourne.

Born and raised in Poowong (Victoria), Wilson was surrounded by music from an early age. At just 2 years old he started playing the drums along to his mother’s music collection consisting of old soul, funk and r&b from the 60’s and 70’s. He started learning the guitar as soon as he could, and had the habit of making anything he could get his hands on into an instrument. Growing up far from the city instilled a strong sense of curiosity and work ethic in him from a young age, leading him to produce his first batch of demos in his teenage years. A stand-out among these demos was the song ‘Home’

‘Home’ found its way to Sam Teskey (The Teskey Brothers) who would go on to co-produce the song alongside Wilson when he was just 18.

Following the release of ‘Home’, he went on to sell out The Gasometer and play a string of festival slots alongside a variety of artists including The Teskey Brothers and Boy and Bear.

At this time, Wilson moved to St Kilda and in the heart of Melbourne began collaborating with Sensible J (Sampa The Great, Remi, Immy Owusu) on his debut EP ‘Material Plane P1’ which was released to critical acclaim in August 2022. After that, he co-produced Oscar LaDell’s EP ‘No Blue’ and subsequently embarked on a co-headline tour of Aotearoa and Australia with LaDell. After a three year break from releasing music, Wilson Blackley will return with his new song ‘Wired’ that bridges the sonics from his first EP with what's to come.

Also appearing Oscar LaDell hot off a US tour.

Doors open 8pm for an 8.30pm start.

events.id: Eat Your Art Out: High Tea-Museum of New Zealand Te Papa Tongarewa, 55 Cable St, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Eat Your Art Out: High Tea
events.venue: Museum of New Zealand Te Papa Tongarewa, 55 Cable St, Wellington
events.long_description:
Eat Your Art Out brings a creative twist to high tea, inspired by the bold and brilliant works of Toi Art.

Enjoy a menu of classic treats with an artistic edge: from the Sweet William’s Dish, Golden Ratio Scone, Madeleine Moment, and the Mint to Be mousse. Each dish is a playful nod to the world of art, clever, colourful, and made to be shared.

Your high tea includes your choice of tea or coffee. Alcoholic beverages are available for purchase, and dietary options are available on request.

Every purchase helps to support Aotearoa New Zealand’s national museum.

------

Set Menu
(Includes one of each item per person)

Cheery Cherry Curator
A silky milk chocolate crémeux layered with vibrant cherry glaze and topped with a dark chocolate disc creates a perfectly balanced blend of tart and sweet

Mint to Be
Cool mint and sweet strawberry mousse gently resting on a white chocolate base, combining vibrant flavours that are meant to be together

Madeleine Moment
A citrus-infused madeleine paired with silky sambuca namelaka, vibrant green apple gel, and an elegant chocolate garnish delivers golden flavours with a playful twist

Sweet William’s Dish
Mānuka honey ganache nestled in a crisp vanilla tart shell, topped with a chocolate ‘The Dish’ by William De Morgan. A refined take on New Zealand’s liquid gold

The Golden Ratio
A perfectly proportioned cheese scone layered with sundried tomatoes, olives, and fresh basil brings Mediterranean flavours in perfect balance

The Pecking Order
Tender horopito-spiced chicken layered with creamy Tatua mayo and peppery watercress on fresh focaccia fingers, with native pepper leaf adding a bold, warming kick

Still Life with Eggplant
Tangy eggplant and native kawakawa caponata with buffalo bocconcini and fragrant basil pesto on artisanal brioche. A bold sandwich blending native botanicals and classic flavours.

Alcoholic beverages are available for purchase, and dietary options are available on request.

events.id: Shared 90-Minute Guided Tour-Stonehenge Aotearoa, 51 Ahiaruhe Rd, Carterton-Event Finder
events.name: Shared 90-Minute Guided Tour
events.venue: Stonehenge Aotearoa, 51 Ahiaruhe Rd, Carterton
events.long_description:
Join a Shared Guided Tour and experience Stonehenge Aotearoa through the eyes of an expert. In this 90-minute journey, you’ll uncover how ancient cultures measured time, tracked the Sun and Moon, and connected the heavens with life on Earth.

Your experience begins with a captivating introduction and a 15-minute audio-visual presentation explaining how the Henge works. Then, step outside with your guide for a detailed tour of the stone circle, where astronomy, archaeology, and mythology come together in one unforgettable setting.

Perfect for visitors seeking a deeper understanding of the stars and stories that shaped human history.

events.id: Telescope Mastery-Star Safari Observatory, 1169 Ponatahi Road, Carterton-Event Finder
events.name: Telescope Mastery
events.venue: Star Safari Observatory, 1169 Ponatahi Road, Carterton
events.long_description:
Our Telescope Course is back!

You already own a telescope, but...

If you already have a telescope and would like to learn more about how to use it, how to collimate it and any other maintenance they need, what type of eyepieces are the best to buy and any other equipment.

BRING YOUR TELESCOPE ALONG!
OR

You don't have a telescope, but...

would like to learn how to use one, don't fret! We have 14, and you can learn all about them.

Your instructor:
Sam, our resident astrophysicist.

Sam is skilled in explaining the intricacies of telescope operation and makes learning both accessible and engaging. Our course offers hands-on experience with our diverse collection of 14 telescopes, ranging from classic reflectors to sophisticated refractors and versatile catadioptrics.

Where: Star Safari Observatory - 10 minutes from Martinborough


There's no "but" after our course. You'll know exactly:

- Where to start?

- What to do?

- How to get the best out of your telescope?

- What must you consider if you wish to plunge into deep-sky astrophotography?

You get:
A collimation cap - no more guesswork on how to collimate your telescope. With this tool, you can keep your telescope sharp.

Tea and coffee - refreshments.

Bring your lunch and a picnic blanket! We have a spectacular setting at Star Safari Observatory, and we will stop for a lunch break to enjoy our Moon garden and the surroundings.

Take the giant leap; reach for the stars!

At the end of the course, you'll learn all about the types of telescopes available and mounts, attachments, and eyepieces. We cover the whole lot. We have been using telescopes for a long time and now have an excellent range for our public sessions and at our home observatory.

We're not affiliated with retailers, so our advice is unbiased and based on our years of experience with lugging telescopes around the world, maintaining them and using them.

events.id: Vietnamese Art Exhibition: Những Miền Đất Nhớ | Lands We Remember-287 Cuba Street, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: Vietnamese Art Exhibition: Những Miền Đất Nhớ | Lands We Remember
events.venue: 287 Cuba Street, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Những Miền Đất Nhớ (Lands We Remember) is a Vietnamese contemporary art exhibition by respected artist Đặng Mậu Tựu, proudly presented as part of Viet Hub NZ’s Lunar New Year (Tết) Festival 2026.
This exhibition shares the journey of an artist from another country and culture who immersed himself in life in Aotearoa New Zealand. Through approximately 30 original artworks, he reflects on how two worlds - Vietnam and Aotearoa - meet, overlap, and quietly converse. The works explore cultural memory, identity, belonging, and the emotional experience of living between homelands.
Created during the artist’s stay in New Zealand, these paintings offer an intimate, lived perspective - capturing moments of connection, unfamiliarity, and shared humanity through a deeply Vietnamese artistic lens. This exhibition is both a cultural bridge and a personal story told through art.
This is Viet Hub NZ’s first Vietnamese community art exhibition, created with care, whānau values, and a strong commitment to accessibility and cross-cultural understanding. Whether you love art, culture, storytelling, or simply discovering new perspectives, Những Miền Đất Nhớ invites you to pause, reflect, and connect.

Join us at the Thistle Inn, Wellington’s only Scottish pub, for a lively celebration of Robbie Burns!

events.id: Family Watercolour Art Class - Paua Shell at Pencarrow-Alfred Memelink Artspace Gallery, 223 The Esplanade Petone, Lower Hutt-Event Finder
events.name: Family Watercolour Art Class - Paua Shell at Pencarrow
events.venue: Alfred Memelink Artspace Gallery, 223 The Esplanade Petone, Lower Hutt
events.long_description:
In this class, the whole family can share 2 hours of creative fun, and grown-ups can join in for a youth price of $25. All materials supplied, including quality watercolour paper, just arrive empty-handed, and in two hours, they will have a completed painting. No previous art experience is required as these workshops are suitable for both beginners and artists who’d like to fine-tune their skills and style a little further. Don’t worry about drawing, as this will be done, so we can focus on the joys of watercolour painting. A step-by-step teaching style is used, and this all happens in a wonderful, relaxed and enjoyable classroom overlooking the harbour.

Check out other classes; each has a different subject to choose from. Also available are Saturday family art classes as well as Wine & Watercolour evenings on Friday and Saturday evenings.

events.id: Forest Giants, Fragrant Herbs and Birdsong - Guided Walk-Wellington Botanic Garden, 101 Glenmore St, Kelburn, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Forest Giants, Fragrant Herbs and Birdsong - Guided Walk
events.venue: Wellington Botanic Garden, 101 Glenmore St, Kelburn, Wellington
events.long_description:
In this 75-minute walk we will get up close to some delightful pygmy pines before, on a gentle slope, passing under and being awed by their towering cousins en route to a wonderful view of Wellington City. In the Herb Garden we will see and hear a little about the aromatic, culinary and medicinal properties of familiar and not-so-familiar herbs, before descending, possibly accompanied by some birdsong, through a tract of native forest down to Lady Norwood Rose Garden.

Meet at the Founders’ Entrance, Glenmore Street.
Cost: $10 - book now
Free for Friends

This is part of the regular walks run by the Friends of the Wellington Botanic Garden. They run throughout the year with a different topic every time.
Join the Friends for only $30 a year and all the walks will be free, as well as other great benefits.

events.id: Natural Textured Rings-Workspace Ōtaki, 6 Hewson Crescent, Ōtaki-Event Finder
events.name: Natural Textured Rings
events.venue: Workspace Ōtaki, 6 Hewson Crescent, Ōtaki
events.long_description:
Make your own personalised ring - a gift for yourself or someone special! :-)

Learn the basic technique first in copper or brass, and then craft your final piece in silver!

Over this taster class, you’ll be guided through the process of heating and texturing metal, cutting and shaping with traditional jewellery tools. Use feathers, leaves, or fabrics to create a unique texture for a beautiful ring!

Learn to measure your finger, cut metal to length and texture it without rolling mill, hammers and punches. Then use a jewellers torch, sandpaper and polishing, and your beautiful new ring will be ready to wear.

This 3-hour class is ideal for beginners, groups of friends and visitors to the city.

Included in the class fee are copper and brass for practising on, a sterling silver ring strip and all consumables such as sandpaper, solder and chemicals. Extra metals are available for purchase in the studio.

Kids aged 12 (or so) are welcome to attend the class, but any person under the age of 16 must be accompanied by adults.

events.name: Weber Bros 'The Circus'
events.venue: Avalon Park, Taita Drive, Avalon, Lower Hutt
events.long_description:
Join us for an unforgettable experience at ’The Circus’, where excitement and wonder come alive under the grand big top! Prepare to be amazed by exhilarating performers showcasing death-defying acts that will leave you on the edge of your seat.

From the heart-pounding thrills of the Globe of Death to the jaw-dropping spectacle of the human cannon, each act promises a breathtaking display of skill and bravery. Marvel at our dazzling aerialists as they soar through the air, and don’t miss the delightful slapstick comedy that adds a lighthearted touch to this extraordinary show and so much more.

This 2-hour family-friendly event features international artists whose captivating performances will charm audiences of all ages. Bring your family and friends for a night filled with laughter, gasps of astonishment, and memories to cherish forever.

Experience the magic of the circus like never before.

events.id: Wonderful Wahine-Bolton Street Cemetery, Bolton Street, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Wonderful Wahine
events.venue: Bolton Street Cemetery, Bolton Street, Wellington
events.long_description:
Hear entertaining stories of the remarkable women who helped shape Wellington's history. Learn about their lives as wives, daughters, mothers, and heroines.

This tour features entertaining stories of women – settlers and Māori – who lived in Wellington and helped shape its history. They are wives, daughters, mothers, housewives and heroines: an artist, a nurse, a teacher and a song-writer, as well as boarding house operators, shopkeepers and inspiring leaders.

This tour starts at 2.00pm at the Bolton Street Cemetery Museum, lower Bolton Street, and finishes 1.5 hours later back at the Museum.

Children aged 12 and under are free; well-behaved dogs, on leads, are welcome.

events.long_description:
Valentine’s Special Macaron Class

Love is in the air… and in the oven.
This Valentine’s season, step into the dreamy world of French patisserie with our Valentine’s Special Macaron Class — designed for lovers, besties, singles who love dessert, and anyone who believes sugar is a love language.
In this hands-on class, our pastry chefs will guide you through the art of making perfectly smooth, heart-shaped Valentine’s macarons from scratch. You’ll learn all the secrets — from macaronage and piping to baking, filling, and decorating — so you leave confident, inspired, and slightly obsessed.

events.id: Anna Fält - Vocal music from Sweden and Finland-The Bakehouse Collective, 4 Wakefield Street, Featherston-Event Finder
events.name: Anna Fält - Vocal music from Sweden and Finland
events.venue: The Bakehouse Collective, 4 Wakefield Street, Featherston
events.long_description:
Anna Fält is a versatile singer-songwriter who is passionate about Nordic folk singing. She ́s been touring around Scandinavia, as well as outside Europe, for years with her unique concept of solo vocal concerts. Specializing in different singing traditions from her two home countries Finland and Sweden, she combines the bright Scandinavian and dark East-European tones, performing in churches, museums, festivals, folk music venues, clubs and concert halls.

These concerts are tributes to the human voice, a one woman band, singing like you've never heard it before! Tradition meets vocal arts, avantgarde and story telling in an innovative and personal, intimate way.

Besides her solo concerts, Anna works with performing arts and multidisciplinary art projects, with folk music research and teaching various folk song workshops. She has 3 music degrees and she ́s been studying folk music in 5 different countries. Her main work is, however, being a solo artist and developing the solo a cappella singing.

Saturday 24th January
The Bakehouse Collective, Featherston
Doors 7pm. Performance 7:30pm.
Tickets: $25.00
Email: commonground.wai@gmail.com

events.id: Ecstatic Dance Wellington-13 Vennell Street, Brooklyn, Wellington 6021, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: Ecstatic Dance Wellington
events.venue: 13 Vennell Street, Brooklyn, Wellington 6021, New Zealand
events.long_description:
💫 Move. Release. Connect. 💫
🌟✨ Ecstatic Dance Wellington ✨🌟
With DJ Kimba Jade @ Vogelmorn Hall, Wellington
Kimba Jade & Bernie Cruise are thrilled to be hosting Ecstatic Dance Wellington! 🎉
💫 What is Ecstatic Dance?
A freeform, drug- and alcohol-free dance experience where you move however your body wants. The music flows like a wave — starting slow, rising to ecstatic peaks, then softening into stillness. It’s therapeutic, uplifting, and a powerful way to connect with yourself and community.
Please note, that this Ecstatic Dance is not verbally guided, we let the music guide you 😊. Dance freely how your body moves you.
🎶 This Dance Floor
Guided by DJ Kimba Jade, expect an immersive journey through deep bass, tribal rhythms, and global soundscapes that awaken both body and spirit. With over 24 years behind the decks—including 8 years dedicated to Ecstatic Dance—Kimba crafts transformative spaces of joy, release, and connection. Originally from Auckland, she curated Alchemic Dance Floor events for 5 years, now co-runs the Ecstatic Dance Festival, and teaches Alchemic Ecstatic Dance DJ Trainings. She’s thrilled to share her magic and move with you on the dance floor!
🎶 The Sound System
Here at Ecstatic Dance Wellington, we believe in using a phat sound system with lots of bass for our dances. We will be bringing an ultra vibey and super bassy experience for you!
🗓 Event Details
📍 Vogelmorn Hall, 13 Vennell Street, Brooklyn, Wellington 6021
🕖 7:00pm – Opening Circle
🕢 7:15pm – Ecstatic Dance
🕘 8:45pm – Closing Circle
🕘 9:00pm – Chai & Chocolate (for those wanting to socialise)
🎟 Tickets
$25 online
$30 cash on the door
**If you would like to come but are unwaged or struggling, please send us a message directly, we'd love to help.
☀️ Extra Info
- Doors will open at 6.45pm for you to socialise in the lobby, we'll start promptly at 7pm.
We are very much looking forward to co-creating with the conscious dance community in Wellington and sharing our magic.
❤️ What to Bring
Water bottle
Loose, comfy clothes
Warm layers for afterwards
A pillow and Blanket if you wish
A friend!
🌟 Guidelines

events.id: Summer Camp | Daisy Grae and Yawner-San Fran, 171 Cuba St, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Summer Camp | Daisy Grae and Yawner
events.venue: San Fran, 171 Cuba St, Wellington
events.long_description:
Join us and some of Te Whanganui-a-Tara’s finest artists over five nights across January and February with tickets from $10 or a season pass for $40, featuring drink specials and cocktails thanks to our sponsor Jameson.

Our second instalment is one for the books! Featuring local legends Daisy Grae and rising stars Yawner.

Daisy Grae is a Wellington-born band that has been grooving in the local scene since their early high school days. Taking influence from genres across the board, Daisy Grae has crafted their very own brand of alternative funk rock. They consistently bring a refined, heavy, and psychedelic energy to the Pōneke music scene. Feeding off a fresh sound, this ever-evolving 4-piece of passionate personalities continue to be recognised as one of Pōneke’s most exciting live homegrown experiences.

Yawner are a Poneke-based R&B group formed in late 2024, bringing together a tight, groove-driven sound alongside the unmatched vocal talents and timbre of Eden Brown. Since their formation, the band have spent the better half of 2025 meticulously refining their identity as a unit, and are now more ready than ever to share it. Focusing on a heavy-hitting but soothing craft, they’ve put together an enormous live set which is not to be missed.

events.id: The Glass Menagerie-Circa Theatre, 1 Taranaki St, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: The Glass Menagerie
events.venue: Circa Theatre, 1 Taranaki St, Wellington
events.long_description:
Acclaimed American playwright, Tennessee Williams penned emotional powerhouse hits like A STREETCAR NAMED DESIRE, BABY DOLL, CAT ON A HOT TIN ROOF and SUDDENLY LAST SUMMER but it was his tender and autobiographical ” memory ” play, THE GLASS MENAGERIE, that catapulted him from obscurity to international fame.

THE GLASS MENAGERIE follows a family trapped by dreams and delusions in 1930s St Louis. Times are tough. Amidst the turmoil of a changing world, solo mother, Amanda Wingfield, a faded Southern belle, is hellbent on finding a better future for her emotionally fragile daughter, Laura, while her restless son, Tom, is caught between his duty to his family and his desire for freedom.

Deftly blending humour and pathos and suffused with the eloquent poetic language that became Tennessee Williams’ trademark, The GLASS MENAGERIE is an achingly beautiful study of four people struggling to conform to the expectation of others.

Featuring Circa stalwart Simon Leary, as Tom and Hera Dunleavy (Blithe Spirit) as Amanda, with Jackson Burling as ‘The Gentleman Caller’ and exciting newcomer Ashley Harnett as Laura, this is a rare opportunity to experience the urgent relevance of Tennesee Williams’ haunting and uncompromising masterwork.

Reviews:
” Will lodge in your mind and soul for years to come” The Observer
” Spellbinding theatre at its very best” New York Times

By Tennessee Williams
Director Colin McColl
Design Tony Rabbit
Design Nic Smillie
Design John Gibson
Company St. Louis Blues

Sat 24 Jan – Sat 21 Feb
Preview Night Friday 23 Jan
Tues – Sat 7pm, Sun 4.00pm
Special midweek matinees 1pm Thurs 12 Feb a& 1pm Thurs 19 Feb
CIRCA ONE
$25 – $60

events.id: Sunset Guided Tour-Stonehenge Aotearoa, 51 Ahiaruhe Rd, Carterton-Event Finder
events.name: Sunset Guided Tour
events.venue: Stonehenge Aotearoa, 51 Ahiaruhe Rd, Carterton
events.long_description:
Experience Stonehenge Aotearoa at its most breathtaking — as the sun dips below the Wairarapa horizon.
Our Sunset Guided Tour blends astronomy, storytelling, and the natural beauty of twilight for an evening you will never forget.

Led by one of our knowledgeable guides, this 90-minute experience explores how ancient cultures used the Sun to track time and mark the turning of the seasons. You’ll discover the scientific and cultural thinking behind the Henge’s unique Southern Hemisphere design before watching the sunset alignment from inside the stone circle.

Weather permitting, you’ll witness how the setting Sun interacts with the structure — a striking moment that links ancient knowledge with the rhythms of the natural world.

Duration and Schedule
• Allow: Approximately 90 minutes
• Start Time: Begins one hour before sunset
• Availability: Offered any day with advance booking

events.id: SUMMER SOIRÉE: PSYCHEDELIC & MELODIC TECHNO FEAT KOZY (CA), AZTORIA ( AU) & LOCAL LEGENDS-Valhalla, Wellington-Valhalla
events.name: SUMMER SOIRÉE: PSYCHEDELIC & MELODIC TECHNO FEAT KOZY (CA), AZTORIA ( AU) & LOCAL LEGENDS
events.venue: Valhalla, Wellington
events.long_description:
Wellington, join us for a night of Psychedelic & Melodic Techno featuring 2 international artists Kozy ( Canada), Aztoria ( Australia) supported by Aadhi, Blair & Uday. This event will be hosted at the legendary venue, Valhalla on the 24th of January, 8pm onwards.
Kozy will be playing a 2.5 Hour Extended Set, Aztoria will be playing a 1.5hr set & local legends will be playing an hour each.
International DJ Bio's:
KOZY ( CA)
KOZY aka Jeff Koz is a Montreal-based DJ & Entrepreneur specialising in dark & groovy underground techno music.
KOZY's dedication to music is evident in his tight mixes, solid track selection and inclination towards groovy synths and heavy, disruptive bass.
In 2019, he founded AlpaKa MuziK, a Montreal-based record label pushing world-class underground progressive, minimal and psychedelic techno beats. With releases from some of the biggest names in the game, AlpaKa MuziK has been paving the way for this fast emerging genre with relentless quality music and has become one of the most prominent labels in the psychedelic techno sub-genre.
With over 125 releases and over 650 tracks under their belt, AlpaKa has quickly become a powerhouse label in the underground techno community.
Since early 2022, in a little over 2 years, KOZY has gone on 9 international tours, including 5 euro tours, Australia, South Africa Mauritius, India, Mexico and has played over 150 gigs in 24 months in over 30 countries and counting.
Some prominent festivals he has performed at include, Esoteric in Australia, Hadra in France, Texas Eclipse, Boom Festival and many others, bringing to many of them the AlpaKa MuziK takeovers that showcase the cutting edge psychedelic techno sound through countless live sets around the world.
He recently finished his 4-month long 2025 summer euro tour where he performed at Boom Festival in Portugal and many more AlpaKa Showcases all around Europe and beyond. His 2025-2026 world tour is in motion, with Japan and a large Southern Hemisphere schedule in the works. With an unstoppable arsenal of unreleased, cutting edge bangers, he'll leave you wanting more after every set.
AZTORIA ( AU)
Aztoria is the psytech project of Ashley Zadel, also known as Flow Theory.
For more than 16 years, his melodic bush techno sound has evolved through auditory storytelling on stages across the globe, from Cape Town to London, Israel to Brazil, Portugal, New Zealand and Australia.
Rooted in progressive soundscapes with an organic flavour, Aztoria blends melodic deep house grooves with minimal techno to craft psychedelic atmospheres that ignite the imagination.
Aztoria burst onto the scene with his debut EP Reborn (Dense Nebula Records), hitting #4 on Beatport’s Techno charts. His 2024 single Birds of Paradise (Soliq Records) soared to #33, while his Inner Groove remix landed at #23 in Progressive House (Techgnosis Records). With fresh releases on Techgnosis, Recovery Collective and Puzzles Records and more in the works, Aztoria is carving his path in the underground with relentless energy and innovation.

events.id: Wilson Blackley Plays The Shed (The Remain Tour with Oscar LaDell)-46a Victoria Street, Alicetown, Lower Hutt 5010, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: Wilson Blackley Plays The Shed (The Remain Tour with Oscar LaDell)
events.venue: 46a Victoria Street, Alicetown, Lower Hutt 5010, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Wilson Blackley The Remain Tour with Oscar LaDell.
Wilson Blackley is an Australian multi-instrumentalist and producer currently based in Melbourne.
Born and raised in Poowong (Victoria), Wilson was surrounded by music from an early age. At just 2 years old he started playing the drums along to his mother’s music collection consisting of old soul, funk and r&b from the 60’s and 70’s. He started learning the guitar as soon as he could, and had the habit of making anything he could get his hands on into an instrument. Growing up far from the city instilled a strong sense of curiosity and work ethic in him from a young age, leading him to produce his first batch of demos in his teenage years. A stand-out among these demos was the song ‘Home’
‘Home’ found its way to Sam Teskey (The Teskey Brothers) who would go on to co-produce the song alongside Wilson when he was just 18.
Following the release of ‘Home’, he went on to sell out The Gasometer and play a string of festival slots alongside a variety of artists including The Teskey Brothers and Boy and Bear.
At this time, Wilson moved to St Kilda and in the heart of Melbourne began collaborating with Sensible J (Sampa The Great, Remi, Immy Owusu) on his debut EP ‘Material Plane P1’ which was released to critical acclaim in August 2022. After that, he co-produced Oscar LaDell’s EP ‘No Blue’ and subsequently embarked on a co-headline tour of Aotearoa and Australia with LaDell. After a three year break from releasing music, Wilson Blackley will return with his new song ‘Wired’ that bridges the sonics from his first EP with what's to come.
Also appearing Oscar LaDell hot off a US tour.
Doors open 8pm for an 8.30pm start.
