events.id: Draw the Moon: A Lunar Sketching Workshop at Star Safari-Star Safari Observatory, 1169 Ponatahi Road, Carterton-Event Finder
events.name: Draw the Moon: A Lunar Sketching Workshop at Star Safari
events.venue: Star Safari Observatory, 1169 Ponatahi Road, Carterton
events.long_description:
See the Moon like an astronomer — and draw it like an artist.
Join us at the Star Safari Observatory for a unique 90-minute experience where astronomy meets art. In this hands-on workshop, you’ll learn how to sketch the Moon directly at the eyepiece of our telescopes while observing its craters, mountains, shadows, and changing light in real time.

Using quality sketching materials (provided on the night), you’ll be guided step-by-step through:
- recognising key lunar features
- capturing contrast, relief and texture
- translating live telescope views accurately to paper
- fast sketching techniques for an object that’s constantly moving

You’ll have dedicated telescope time with our team, adjusting the optics for you and helping you get the sharpest possible view. This experience is designed to be accessible for beginners, while still rewarding for those with some astronomy or art experience.

Set beneath Wairarapa’s internationally acclaimed dark skies, this workshop offers a quiet, focused creative moment under the Moon. Whether you come for art, astronomy, or simply the pleasure of observing slowly and noticing deeply, you’ll leave with a sketch that is uniquely yours — shaped by the night and the light you saw.

Who is this for?
Adults and older children with an interest in drawing, the night sky, or simply trying something new.

Included:
✔ High-quality sketching pencils and paper
✔ Expert lunar observing guidance
✔ Dedicated telescope time
✔ Use of Star Safari’s professional viewing equipment

What to bring:
Warm clothing, curiosity, and any of your favourite drawing tools if you’d like to use them.

Take home more than a drawing — take home a moment of looking closely.

events.id: Bri Louise Album Release Event-The Rogue & Vagabond-Rogue & Vagabond
events.name: Bri Louise Album Release Event
events.venue: The Rogue & Vagabond
events.long_description:
Yippee! The time has finally come to celebrate the release of the Bri Louise Album.
Rogue & Vagabond on 24th of January.

Elly Mae and her band will be opening up before the Bri Louise Band takes the stage. The night will also feature some very special friends of ours, including Keira Batten-Copgan, Felix Hilton, Leji, Gala Baumfield, Meihana McGee, the Bri Louise Choir, and the Bri Louise Jazz Orchestra.

Heres a few words about the two bands if you arnt acquainted with them:

Bri Louise blends sultry queerness with smooth love and undeniable groove. Rooted in gospel and neo-soul, their sound expands into a rich fusion of jazz, hip-hop, and R&B. Poetic lyricism is supported by a tight live band that features colourful keys, phatty bass, flashy beats, vibrant guitar, and fruity woodwinds. We will be joined by many guests but our core features Bri Louise (vocals/keys), Molly Wyatt (flute/vocals), Becky Devine (bass), Theo Thompson (guitar), Eloise Edmonds (saxophone), and Jonathan Stolk (drums).

Elly Mae crafts songs that encapsulate the bittersweet ache of growth, the quiet unraveling of time, and the soft glow of nostalgia embedded within. Her music is an amalgamation of folk, dreampop, indie, shoegaze, and anything in between. From lullabies that make you feel weightless to being wrapped in a blanket of sound, Elly Mae’s folk/country melodic guitar style is accompanied by experimental, spatial bass from Arran Cargill-Brown and textured pocket drumming from Sasha Francis-Murray.

Come celebrate this very special night and the release of this cool project with us.
Tickets available via UTR. Poster artwork by Keelin Bell.

events.id: 🩷 Dance for Kanan: 24-Hour Dance-A-Thon Fundraiser 🩷-302 Kapiti Rd, Paraparaumu Beach, Paraparaumu 5032-All Events In
events.name: 🩷 Dance for Kanan: 24-Hour Dance-A-Thon Fundraiser 🩷
events.venue: 302 Kapiti Rd, Paraparaumu Beach, Paraparaumu 5032
events.long_description:
🩷 Dance for Kanan: 24-Hour Dance-A-Thon Fundraiser 🩷
***NEW DATE***
Join us for an unforgettable 24 hours of movement, music, and magic as we come together to raise funds for our beloved Kanan’s unfunded breast cancer treatment.

Last month, Kanan received the shock of her life when she was diagnosed with HER2 positive breast cancer, an aggressive sub-type of breast cancer that can spread and grow rapidly. Unfortunately, the targeted treatment isn't funded, and Kanan is looking at costs of approx $35,000-$40,000.

This is more than just a dance event — it’s a celebration of her community, strength, and the power of showing up.

We’ve rallied an insanely talented team of 20+ dance professionals, each donating their time and energy to teach a class. From hip hop to heels, contemporary to line-dancing — there’s something for everyone.

Thanks to the generosity of Hannah from Sweet Studios, we’ll be dancing non-stop on the Kapiti Coast, and we want YOU to be part of it!

💃 4 Ways to Join the Movement:

🕚 Mini Movers (5 hours, Year 1-4)
Take on the mini challenge by getting sponsored while you learn some new styles of dance and how to present yourself on a stage!

🕛 Half-Day Hero (12 Hours, Year 5 - Year 8)
Get sponsored for every hour you dance — rally your supporters and groove for a cause. Can be done individually or split between a group!

🕘 Full-Day Fighter (24 Hours, Year 9+)
Take on the full 24-hour challenge and let your sponsors pledge per hour. Every step helps Kanan get closer to healing. Recommended todo this as a group!

🩰 Drop-In Diva ($25/class)
Choose any class that speaks to your soul and join us for just $25. No strings, just good vibes.

Register here: https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSfEhUtS2rawbqzFrAQUDKtrjTZAG2e4iXZuwDMZCzWWS3B3Gw/viewform?usp=sharing&ouid=103696675397207234907

Let’s dance with purpose. Let’s dance for Kanan. 💕

Follow this page for the full class schedule, teacher lineup, and donation links, all coming soon!

Tag your dance crew, share the love, and let’s make this a night (and day!) to remember.

If you would like to make a donation that is not in relation to this event we have a givealittle page to go towards medical treatment!

https://givealittle.co.nz/cause/help-kanan-beat-breast-cancer?fbclid=PAZnRzaANRYQNleHRuA2FlbQIxMQABp5fzszelgEfNjzqdy_kw4dT_eE7zFgotopBZphiGHLWVgZrVrrgbEwAmhgSI_aem_JNj2Mm1s5SZkz5LknQkBxA

Artisan Craft Market (25/01/25 Wellington)
The Artisan Craft Market is a premium handmade event that takes place across various locations in the broader Wellington region. This high-quality market is designed to foster a welcoming and friendly atmosphere.

Our vision at Artisan Craft Market is to make the market accessible to those who appreciate shopping locally. We aim to provide a platform that supports local artisans, allowing them to showcase their meticulously crafted, high-quality products. events.id: Manu Park Site Viewing-Karuhiruhi St, Waikanae 5036,Waikanae, New Zealand-All Events In
events.name: Manu Park Site Viewing
events.venue: Karuhiruhi St, Waikanae 5036,Waikanae, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Manu Park Site Viewing
Meet us and find out how you can build your dream home in a new subdivision that combines outstanding natural beauty and a real sense of community.
The agent is on-site at the end of Karuhiruhi Street every Sunday between 10.00am - 11.00am.

Since its establishment in 2018, Manu Park has become a highly sought-after community, with Stages One and Two fully sold out. Don’t miss your chance to secure a piece of this paradise in Stage 3.

Manu Park isn’t just a place to live—it’s a place to belong. Designed with families in mind, it offers a safe and welcoming environment where kids can ride their bikes down quiet streets, explore nature on their doorstep, and grow up knowing their neighbours. Centrally located near Waikanae township it offers expansive open spaces and a strong sense of community; Manu Park is a neighbourhood where friendships flourish and families thrive.

Nestled within protected native bush, Manu Park offers breathtaking surroundings, generously sized sections, and the opportunity to build a home tailored to your vision and lifestyle. Named after the Māori word for bird, it sits beside the renowned Nga Manu Nature Reserve, close to Waikanae’s excellent schools and amenities, just minutes from the beach, and under an hour from Wellington city.

Teaming up with local building companies, Manu Park offers House and Land packages for a seamless home-building experience. Visit Manu Park to explore Design and Build opportunities to create a home that perfectly fits your lifestyle.
Don’t miss this rare opportunity to be part of a vibrant community where nature and modern living come together. Visit manupark.nz to learn more and secure your section today

events.long_description:
Otaki Market - January
Nau Mai Haere Mai, meet you at the Market. 🌞
Discover a vibrant outdoor market nestled on State Highway One in Ōtaki, just across from New World. Join us to greet our regular stallholders and special guests from the community.
---

PARKING
There is plenty of free parking available at the Otaki train station.
Main Highway is a perfect spot for customers to the market
60 Minute Parking zone behind Riverstone Cafe.

CASH / ATM
Some vendors have eftpos, and all take cash. There is an ATM located on the main highway.

FOOD VENDORS
And when hunger strikes, our lineup of food trucks and stalls is ready to tantalize your taste buds. From waffles to hangi, seafood chowder to fry bread, sausage sizzles, and a delectable assortment of rice, noodles, and home baking – a feast awaits.

BUSKER
We often have an awesome busker, who'll be playing chilled out middle of the road tunes.

🎨 Art & Craft
🌳 Native trees, flowers and plants
🍶 Candles, soaps and wax melts
🕰️ Antiques and collectables
🍯 Produce, including yummy honey!
👚 Pre-love clothing, shoes and accessories
⚒️ Tools for the home and garden
🧸 Toys and books for tamariki

Come for the finds, stay for the flavor.
---

STALL HOLDERS
Would you like to be a stall holder?
Join our market family, fill out the enquiry form: www.otakiwomensclub.org/stall-holder

events.name: Improv Workouts- Undisputed Champions w. PopRox Improv
events.venue: Toi Poneke Arts Centre,61 - 69 Abel Smith St, Te Aro, Wellington, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Improv Workouts- Undisputed Champions w. PopRox Improv
Work your improv muscles with monthly "workouts" hosted by PopRox. Each month's workout will have a specific focus, with an emphasis on reps over theory. Our "Undisputed Champions" sessions are aimed at highly skilled improvisers with strong performance experience.

If you're not sure which workout is best for you, take our wee quiz linked below or get in touch. We're happy to offer some guidance.
https://opinionstage.com/page/d55e4c73-8faf-4d9c-9910-320b2dd00d6e

OPEN SESSION DATES:
Sunday 25 Jan
Sunday 22 Feb
Sunday 22 March
Sunday 26 April
Sunday 24 May
Sunday 28 June
Sunday 26 July
Sunday 23 August
Note: No September session due to NZIF
Sunday 25 October
Sunday 22 November

SEASON PASS:
Book a season pass to get access to all 10 Undisputed Champion sessions for the whole year at a reduced rate. Please note these are paid out straight away so refunds are not available for season passes. We'll reduce the pricing of these as the year goes on, so feel free to try out a session with a standard pass first.

STAND-BY LIST
PopRox firmly believes that improv is for everyone, especially when it comes to sharing skills and knowledge. So we're offering "the stand-by list" for all our workshops in 2026. We'll giveaway any spots remaining on the Friday before each Workout, on a first-come-first-serve basis. No need to provide a reason, no questions asked. If the entry fee is a barrier for you to come along, then simply email and we'll pop you on the SBL. Everyone on the list will be notified whether there was a place available for them 2 days before the relevant workshop.

events.id: Yoga in the Sanctuary-ZEALANDIA Eco-Sanctuary, Waiapu Road, Karori, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Yoga in the Sanctuary
events.venue: ZEALANDIA Eco-Sanctuary, Waiapu Road, Karori, Wellington
events.long_description:
Find peace and tranquility while participating in our Sanctuary Yoga sessions this summer.

Meet at the Visitor Centre and take a calming hīkoi/walk up Lake Road to Tūī Terrace in the heart of the valley. Lay out your mats and be led in a hatha yoga session that is uniquely facilitated with a te ao Māori kaupapa.

Our Wednesday evening sessions run from 5.30-7.30pm, and our morning sessions on Sundays run from 9.00-11.00am.

This experience is outdoors so make sure to dress appropriately. There will be a gentle 15 min walk up and back from the site along an accessible path. These sessions are designed to suit all levels of ability.

If you have your own yoga mat then bring it along, as while Zealandia does have a few to loan out, supplies are limited.

In the event of bad weather the session may be moved indoors but may have a short walk out in the valley before hand, or else cancelled with credit offered to customers for another session.

Terms and conditions:
Non-member ticket price includes general admission to the sanctuary on the day of the yoga session.
Poor weather conditions may result in the event being moved indoors, or else cancelled with refunds or credit offered to customers for another session.
Photos and video of these sessions may be taken for marketing purposes. If you do not want your photo taken, please advise staff on the day.

events.id: Artisan Craft Market-Te Wharewaka o Poneke, Taranaki St Wharf, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Artisan Craft Market
events.venue: Te Wharewaka o Poneke, Taranaki St Wharf, Wellington
events.long_description:
The Artisan Craft Market is a premium handmade event that takes place across various locations in the broader Wellington region. This high-quality market is designed to foster a welcoming and friendly atmosphere.

Our vision at Artisan Craft Market is to make the market accessible to those who appreciate shopping locally. We aim to provide a platform that supports local artisans, allowing them to showcase their meticulously crafted, high-quality products. By bringing the market directly to the people, we hope to celebrate and promote the unique talents of our community’s skilled artisans.

Come support local at our monthly market in Wellington City on the Waterfront at Wharewaka O Poneke venue.

events.id: Otaki Market - January-Otaki Market, 58 Main Highway, Ōtaki, Kapiti Coast, Ōtaki-Event Finder
events.name: Otaki Market - January
events.venue: Otaki Market, 58 Main Highway, Ōtaki, Kapiti Coast, Ōtaki
events.long_description:
Nau Mai Haere Mai, meet you at the Market.
Discover a vibrant outdoor market nestled on State Highway One in Ōtaki, just across from New World. Join us to greet our regular stallholders and special guests from the community.
---
PARKING
There is plenty of free parking available at the Otaki train station.
Main Highway is a perfect spot for customers to the market
60 Minute Parking zone behind Riverstone Cafe.

CASH / ATM
Some vendors have eftpos, and all take cash. There is an ATM located on the main highway.

FOOD VENDORS
And when hunger strikes, our lineup of food trucks and stalls is ready to tantalize your taste buds. From waffles to hangi, seafood chowder to fry bread, sausage sizzles, and a delectable assortment of rice, noodles, and home baking – a feast awaits.

BUSKER
We often have an awesome busker, who'll be playing chilled out middle of the road tunes.

- Art & Craft
- Native trees, flowers and plants
- Candles, soaps and wax melts
- Antiques and collectables
- Produce, including yummy honey!
- Pre-love clothing, shoes and accessories
- Tools for the home and garden
- Toys and books for tamariki

---
STALL HOLDERS
Would you like to be a stall holder?
Join our market family, fill out the enquiry form: www.otakiwomensclub.org/stall-holder

events.id: Stained Glass Suncatcher Day-Workspace Studios Ltd, 65 Abel Smith St, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Stained Glass Suncatcher Day
events.venue: Workspace Studios Ltd, 65 Abel Smith St, Wellington
events.long_description:
Create gorgeous simple leadlight suncatchers with Lisa Sinclair.

A super fun day-class, ideal as a stand-alone experience, or as a day to get stuck into projects with your tutor at hand.

Beginners choose from a range of achievable patterns and choose their colour palette. They will learn to cut the glass, and prepare it before foiling and soldering each piece, creating a simple elegant colourful glass project.

The aim of this one day class is to leave with a completed small leadlight glass item.
More experienced students may bring existing projects to work on in class - though emphasis will be placed on focusing on the same techniques of flat, nicely soldered simple designs.

This is a warm and friendly class with excellent support and learning for complete beginners and more advanced students. All tools are supplied, though you are welcome to bring your own tools and glass if you have them.

Your materials for your beginner project are supplied as part of your course fee.
Additional materials and tools are available to purchase.

Not suitable for children. Older teenagers (16+) are welcome.

events.id: Rita Angus, Artist, and the Bolton Street Cemetery-Bolton Street Cemetery, Bolton Street, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Rita Angus, Artist, and the Bolton Street Cemetery
events.venue: Bolton Street Cemetery, Bolton Street, Wellington
events.long_description:
RITA ANGUS, ARTIST, AND THE BOLTON STREET CEMETERY
Join this guided tour on the 55th anniversary of Rita Angus's death to find out about her special connection to the Bolton Street Cemetery via her sketches and paintings. The well-known artist, who lived nearby in Thorndon, paid close attention to the upheaval around the construction of the urban motorway, and this tour follows the trail of the headstones she sketched and used in her paintings.

The tour starts at the Seddon Memorial, is 1.5 hours duration and ends at the Bolton Street Cemetery Museum, lower Bolton Street. Cost $10 per person, children aged 12 and under free; good dogs, on leads, are always welcome.

events.id: ❤️Lower Hutt: 21 Day- Free On-line Kundalini Energy Awakening Meditation-Virtual,Link Shared On signup, Lower Hutt, New Zealand-All Events In
events.name: ❤️Lower Hutt: 21 Day- Free On-line Kundalini Energy Awakening Meditation
events.venue: Virtual,Link Shared On signup, Lower Hutt, New Zealand
events.long_description:
❤️Lower Hutt: 21 Day- Free On-line Kundalini Energy Awakening Meditation
✨Seeking new horizons and self-discovery? Try Kundalini energy awakening in 21 Days with- Free Online Guided Meditation- live & recorded

About this Event

Why 21 days of meditation for Kundalini Awakening?
Seeking new horizons and self-discovery? Use the New Year 2026- as an opportunity to challenge ourselves to rise higher with one journey we always missed- 'Journey Inside'. Be a part of the 21-day Kundalini Awakening community on Live & Recorded from 25th January (Sunday) 2026, to 14th February (Saturday) 2026 @ 2:45 PM every day. Link shared after signup.YouTube will have daily recordings in case you are unable to join live meeting at the scheduled time. We will schedule additional workshops on Sundays to enable you to join a live meeting. We cleanse our inner subtle system using the powerful yet gentle techniques of Sahaja Yoga Meditation. This is a spiritual meditation in which we awaken the inner energy called Kundalini that gently brings positive change within us-- making us more balanced, peaceful, and joyful. As you participate in daily classes, you will notice physical, emotional and spiritual healing. With pure desire, you may also feel Kundalini energy movement and its working on your fingertips and other physical manifestations. It will enable you to raise your consciousness to a higher dimension. Sahaja Yoga Meditation is volunteer-run, always free, and practiced in more than 100 countries.
No prior meditation or Kundalini awakening experience is needed.
Are you seeking awakening from the heart?
**********************************************************************************
Who is organizing this course?
A team of Sahaja Yoga meditation volunteers has been practicing and teaching 'Sahaja Yoga' meditation for decades. Sahaja Yoga meditation was invented by 'Shri Mataji Nirmala Devi' in 1970, who, in a very Motherly fashion, helped people to take to true meditation easily. The goal of this meditation is to reconnect us to Divinity and experience the universal consciousness within us. It is practiced in more than 100 countries and is always free. The course page is listed below. You need not register on it again.
https://us.sahajayoga.org/21days2026/

All recordings will be on this playlist
21 Days Mediation Course - January 2026 - YouTube

Please save these.
**********************************************************************************
How to join?

Link displayed and emailed after signup. Check your email for the link and more communications.
Same link from 25th January to 14th February, 2026
Have you joined any kind of Online meditation before?

**********************************************************************************
What if I miss a day here and there?
Don't worry if you miss any class; we will help you make up with one-to-one sessions after class. Also, on the website, daily recordings will be available on website below.
https://us.sahajayoga.org/21days2026/,
Do join our WhatsApp group for resources such as recordings and notifications. WhatsApp group link shared during registration. You can either click on the link to join or share your WhatsApp contact number for us to add you to the WhatsApp community, which will be very handy during the 21 days of course.
Will that be enough to help you out with the missed class?
**********************************************************************************
What happens in these 21 Days?
Week 1 Theme: Awaken the Kundalini energy & Know Thyself, and feel energy movement
Week 2 Theme: Spiritual Ascent & Chakras Energy Centres Cleansing
Week 3 Theme: Nirchivarita (thoughtlessness) through meditation. Feel the silence of the universe within you.
Do you believe you can awaken Kundalini and achieve your self-discovery?
**********************************************************************************
Will I be contacted before the course starts?
You will be added to the WhatsApp group -'21 Days of Meditation' in case you have shared your WhatsApp contact during registration. You may get sporadic reminders via email with some useful meditation tips to keep your attention engaged towards the 21-day meditation challenge.
You mind getting reminder?
*********************************************************************************
Is it really free?
Sahaja Yoga meditation is always free. This course is completely free. The only charge is your dedication and sincerity of purpose for your growth. The only question is-
Do we have sincerity of purpose?
**********************************************************************************
What if I have a question?
Please feel free to email or WhatsApp the following if you have any more questions or encounter difficulties joining the Zoom session. We will try to keep you informed about more meditation events.
Sahaja Yoga is a social meditation, and we love to talk about life, its ups and downs, the purpose of life, health & alternatives, and anything you would like to discuss that could enrich your life.
WhatsApp either of the below when you like to talk or chat, and they will respond with suggested day/time.
(Dallas)
+15132038961
(Miami)
+15618666331
Stay safe, and keep meditating!

Have we shared sufficient information for you to decide to join the free course?
**********************************************************************************
Kundalini Awakening
I bow to All the Seekers of Truth. This is a special time in the History of Creation that so many seekers have been born on this Earth. They have realized that there is something beyond than the mundane life they have to seek. This is not the seeking of one life. It is the seeking of ages which is being prophesied, has to be fulfilled now. There have been prophesies and prophesies about this great time. In India about 14,000 years back, Brigu Muni has written a book called Nadi Grant in which He has described you all saying that a day that will come when all these greater seekers, great seekers will be born on this Earth and that their Kundalini which is the Power of their True Desire will be awakened spontaneously and they’ll find out what they are.

But also there has been prophesies about many fake people coming on this Earth and they will try to delude and take people away from the truth.

There have been also great prophesies all over the world but especially in England about hundred years back a great poet called William Blake was born and He has written so clearly, so clearly about Sahaja Yoga that it is surprising how He has even exactly mentioned the house where I’ll be staying. Also that he has said that the men of God, meaning the seekers, the men of God will become prophets and they will have the power to make others prophets. This is the sign we should take when we are seeking the truth.
- Shri Mataji Nirmala Devi (Founder - Sahaja Yoga Meditation)
Bring in your friends and families too to this course :)

🕑: 02:45 PM - 03:00 PM

Info: If you missed the initial session, you are provided a one-on-one session in a breakout room to get you up to speed

♂️ Guided Meditation
Info: ❄️⛅Water, light, fire, sky, ground and other elements will be used to enhance the power of meditation and internal cleansing

Info: On-demand revision, healing, spiritual talks, technique practice, and more...

Link shared after signup.YouTube will have daily recordings in case you are unable to join live meeting at the scheduled time. We will schedule additional workshops on Sundays to enable you to join a live meeting. We cleanse our inner subtle system using the powerful yet gentle techniques of Sahaja Yoga Meditation. This is a spiritual meditation in which we awaken the inner energy called Kundalini that gently brings positive change within us-- making us more balanced, peaceful, and joyful. As you participate in daily classes, you will notice physical, emotional and spiritual healing. With pure desire, you may also feel Kundalini energy movement and its working on your fingertips and other physical manifestations. It will enable you to raise your consciousness to a higher dimension. Sahaja Yoga Meditation is volunteer-run, always free, and practiced in more than 100 countries.
No prior meditation or Kundalini awakening experience is needed.
Are you seeking awakening from the heart?
**********************************************************************************
Who is organizing this course?
A team of Sahaja Yoga meditation volunteers has been practicing and teaching 'Sahaja Yoga' meditation for decades. Sahaja Yoga meditation was invented by 'Shri Mataji Nirmala Devi' in 1970, who, in a very Motherly fashion, helped people to take to true meditation easily. The goal of this meditation is to reconnect us to Divinity and experience the universal consciousness within us. It is practiced in more than 100 countries and is always free. The course page is listed below. You need not register on it again.
https://us.sahajayoga.org/21days2026/

All recordings will be on this playlist
21 Days Mediation Course - January 2026 - YouTube

Please save these.
**********************************************************************************
How to join?

Link displayed and emailed after signup. Check your email for the link and more communications.
Same link from 25th January to 14th February, 2026
Have you joined any kind of Online meditation before?

**********************************************************************************
What if I miss a day here and there?
Don't worry if you miss any class; we will help you make up with one-to-one sessions after class. Also, on the website, daily recordings will be available on website below.
https://us.sahajayoga.org/21days2026/,
Do join our WhatsApp group for resources such as recordings and notifications. WhatsApp group link shared during registration. You can either click on the link to join or share your WhatsApp contact number for us to add you to the WhatsApp community, which will be very handy during the 21 days of course.
Will that be enough to help you out with the missed class?
**********************************************************************************
What happens in these 21 Days?
Week 1 Theme: Awaken the Kundalini energy & Know Thyself, and feel energy movement
Week 2 Theme: Spiritual Ascent & Chakras Energy Centres Cleansing
Week 3 Theme: Nirchivarita (thoughtlessness) through meditation. Feel the silence of the universe within you.
Do you believe you can awaken Kundalini and achieve your self-discovery?
**********************************************************************************
Will I be contacted before the course starts?
You will be added to the WhatsApp group -'21 Days of Meditation' in case you have shared your WhatsApp contact during registration. You may get sporadic reminders via email with some useful meditation tips to keep your attention engaged towards the 21-day meditation challenge.
You mind getting reminder?
*********************************************************************************
Is it really free?
Sahaja Yoga meditation is always free. This course is completely free. The only charge is your dedication and sincerity of purpose for your growth. The only question is-
Do we have sincerity of purpose?
**********************************************************************************
What if I have a question?
Please feel free to email or WhatsApp the following if you have any more questions or encounter difficulties joining the Zoom session. We will try to keep you informed about more meditation events.
Sahaja Yoga is a social meditation, and we love to talk about life, its ups and downs, the purpose of life, health & alternatives, and anything you would like to discuss that could enrich your life.
WhatsApp either of the below when you like to talk or chat, and they will respond with suggested day/time.
(Dallas)
+15132038961
(Miami)
+15618666331
Stay safe, and keep meditating!

Have we shared sufficient information for you to decide to join the free course?
**********************************************************************************
Kundalini Awakening
I bow to All the Seekers of Truth. This is a special time in the History of Creation that so many seekers have been born on this Earth. They have realized that there is something beyond than the mundane life they have to seek. This is not the seeking of one life. It is the seeking of ages which is being prophesied, has to be fulfilled now. There have been prophesies and prophesies about this great time. In India about 14,000 years back, Brigu Muni has written a book called Nadi Grant in which He has described you all saying that a day that will come when all these greater seekers, great seekers will be born on this Earth and that their Kundalini which is the Power of their True Desire will be awakened spontaneously and they’ll find out what they are.

But also there has been prophesies about many fake people coming on this Earth and they will try to delude and take people away from the truth.

There have been also great prophesies all over the world but especially in England about hundred years back a great poet called William Blake was born and He has written so clearly, so clearly about Sahaja Yoga that it is surprising how He has even exactly mentioned the house where I’ll be staying. Also that he has said that the men of God, meaning the seekers, the men of God will become prophets and they will have the power to make others prophets. This is the sign we should take when we are seeking the truth.
- Shri Mataji Nirmala Devi (Founder - Sahaja Yoga Meditation)
Bring in your friends and families too to this course :)

events.id: Sunday Jazz - Jake Baxendale-The Rogue & Vagabond-Rogue & Vagabond
events.name: Sunday Jazz - Jake Baxendale
events.venue: The Rogue & Vagabond
events.long_description:
The Rogue's regular Sunday afternoon jazz. Funky, jazzy, soulful jazz. Beer, hangs, and jazz, on a Sunday, perfect!

This week featuring local saxophonist Jake Baxendale's 'Gardening Music' project

In Gardening Music each musician is encouraged to explore every aspect of the music in their own time, winding their way organically through the tapestry of the compositions: like flowing water, conjoining, separating and conjoining again. The resulting sounds evoke soft rain, vibrant new growth, and the wonderment of contemplating the natural: sometimes tranquil, sometimes jubilant, always in the moment.

Featuring:

Jake Baxendale - alto saxophone, bass clarinet
Louisa Williamson - tenor saxophone
Duncan Haynes - piano
Seth Boy - double bass
Abey Baillie - drums

Music from 5pm, Free entry, koha gratefully accepted

events.id: Summer Songwriting Retreat 2026-Brackenridge Country Retreat & Spa, White Rock Rd, Martinborough-Event Finder
events.name: Summer Songwriting Retreat 2026
events.venue: Brackenridge Country Retreat & Spa, White Rock Rd, Martinborough
events.long_description:
The Summer Songwriting Retreat is designed for songwriters looking to develop their
songs and their songwriting skills. It will help you map the journey of a song from first
ideas to release.
From getting your songs to connect with an audience to how to best present your
work, you'll get involved in practical writing sessions plus receive plenty of indepth
experienced tuition in a friendly, supportive environment.
You’ll have the opportunity for feedback and to ask questions, while sharing the air
with like-minded people, who are as keen and curious as you are to find out more
about songwriting.
Get you and your songs well and truly cooking in this beautiful setting free from daily
distractions. It really works plus the food is outstanding!
Summer Songwriting Retreat 2026 is presented by singer-songwriter Charlotte Yates.

events.name: Yin Yoga & Live Music
events.venue: Otaki Waikanae Presbyterian Church, 43 Ngaio Rd, Waikanae
events.long_description:
90 minutes of Deep Rest. Soft Sound. Inner Stillness.

Take time for yourself and sink into a soothing Yin Yoga practice supported by beautiful live music by Joseph Jenkins on flute and guitar. This slow, calming session is designed to melt tension, soften the body, and quiet the mind.

What to bring:
Your own yoga mat
A blanket
A cushion or pillow
Comfy, warm clothing

Spaces are limited, so please book in advance through the website or email.

Join us for an evening of stillness, spaciousness, and soul-nourishing sound.

Everyone is welcome.

Please note this Event is in Waikanae (not Otaki).

events.id: Wellington: Friendlyjordies Presents - Alien Hunter-12 Cambridge Terrace, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: Wellington: Friendlyjordies Presents - Alien Hunter
events.venue: 12 Cambridge Terrace, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
WELLINGTON!! COME SEE MY NEW SHOW!
Voted best new show of the 2025 Melbourne Comedy Festival period (about aliens) by The Comic's Lounge.
ALIEN HUNTER
Get ready for a comedy show that’s truly out of this world. Friendlyjordies is diving deep into the UFO phenomenon. Not with the tired "anything unidentified that flies is a UFO" bit, but with actual ALIENS. Yes, he genuinely believes the U.S. government is hiding alien spacecraft, and he’s risking over a decade of hard-earned credibility to convince you. Why? Because if it’s true, it’s the coolest thing ever—and not, at least you’ll have a laugh watching him unravel.
Following the success of his Rome and Byzantine Empire shows, this is his latest hyperfixation, so buckle up for 90 minutes of meticulously researched alien theories delivered with the same obsessive energy he puts into painting every tiny detail on his Warhammer miniatures. Whether you're a sceptic, a believer, or just here for the ride, this show promises to beam you up to comedy gold.
Age: 18+. 
Content warning: swearing, adult themes, mature themes. This show is not for a sensitive audience.
Accessibility: a high portion of this event relies on a PowerPoint presentation.
Companion cards: please email Sandie at friendlyjordiestours@gmail.com

events.id: Labyrinth-The Roxy Cinema, 5 Park Road, Miramar, Wellington-Roxy Cinema
events.name: Labyrinth
events.venue: The Roxy Cinema, 5 Park Road, Miramar, Wellington
events.long_description:
Details
Directed by Jim Henson
Starring Jennifer Connelly, David Bowie
40th Anniversary

--- Sarah is forced by her father and her stepmother to babysit her baby stepbrother, Toby, while they are out. He does not stop crying and she wishes that he would be taken away. Out of the blue, he stops crying and when she looks for him in his crib, she learns that her wish was granted, and the Goblin King Jareth has taken him to his castle in the Goblin City in the middle of a labyrinth. Sarah repents and asks Jareth to give him back, but Jareth tells her that she has to rescue him before midnight. Soon she teams up with some allies. Will they rescue Toby in time? ---

Presented in 4K

events.id: Practice as a Yogi - 6 week beginners course- Daily morning practice-Yoga in Daily Life Centre, 23 Jessie St, Te Aro, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Practice as a Yogi - 6 week beginners course- Daily morning practice
events.venue: Yoga in Daily Life Centre, 23 Jessie St, Te Aro, Wellington
events.long_description:
The challenging opportunity to practice every day as a yogi in the morning and experience how it can change your life. We come to know our body and ourselves better through the regular daily practice, practicing with full awareness and experiencing the effect of yoga on our body, mind and soul.
Going earlier to bed and not eat too much in the evening are the prerequisites to not give up after few days/weeks though
According to the ancient yoga scriptures, yoga needs to be practiced during the period of sunrise, when an immense amount of Prana (cosmic energy) enters our system nourishing our body, mind, intellect, and soul. Daily practice is crucial if we want to master any skill. You will notice an increased level of energy and positive change in your mood as wel as an improvement in your attention span and concentration. You will experience more inspiration, joy, and love in your daily life.

The Beginners Course teaches the “Sarva Hitta Asanas” from Level 1 - postures that are good for everyone. The Course covers all the foundations you need for an ongoing yoga practice. Loosening your body, the joints, and your mind, the exercises are designed for the complete balance and awakening of energy in body, mind and soul. Experience yoga postures, breath techniques, meditation and relaxation, along with knowledge about basic yoga philosophy and a healthy lifestyle. A wonderful course for new beginners and those looking to deepen their practical experience of yoga.
Some of the many benefits of yoga include: improvement in posture and breathing, increased strength and flexibility, a greater ability to cope with stress, and a feeling of peace and calm.

Monday - Friday 6.30 - 7.30am
Starts: 12 January 2026

Cost: 6 weeks| $171
For this course we require booking. 04-801 7012 or info@yogaindailylife.org.nz

There is no discount for this course. Possibility to join the course any time. We will practice each week a different part from the Level 1. If you could make just one or two weeks, you might like to buy a week pass for $54. Or feel free to contact us.

events.name: Yoga in the Park
events.venue: Park Ave, Waikanae 5036
events.long_description:
Yoga in the Park
Join us for the 7th year of Yoga in the Park at Waikanae Park on Park Ave!
Our classes focus on balance and stability, incorporating breathing exercises, longer holds, and plenty of options to modify poses based on your fitness level. We’ve had kids join us in past years, and if you consider yourself "older," you’re more than welcome, too. This is your practice, so if you’d rather spend the hour in Child’s Pose, soaking in the sounds of the birds, that’s perfectly fine!
What to bring: A mat or towel, a hat, and some water. I’ll take care of the rest.

Payment Options:
Cash
Bank transfer (online)

events.id: Dungeons & Dragons: Curse of Strahd Campaign - 26th January 2026-199 Jackson Street, Petone, New Zealand 5012,199 Jackson St, Petone, Lower Hutt 5012, New Zealand, Lower Hutt-All Events In
events.name: Dungeons & Dragons: Curse of Strahd Campaign - 26th January 2026
events.venue: 199 Jackson Street, Petone, New Zealand 5012,199 Jackson St, Petone, Lower Hutt 5012, New Zealand, Lower Hutt
events.long_description:
Dungeons & Dragons: Curse of Strahd Campaign - 26th January 2026
Outside the tavern, a fog lies across the town. The damp, cobbled pavement glistens as the lights of street lanterns dance across the slick stones. The night chills the bones and shivers the soul of anyone outside.

Yet inside these tavern walls the food is hearty, and the ale is warm and frothy. A fire blazes in the hearth, and the tavern is alive with the voices and laughter.

Suddenly, the tavern door swings open, and you all notice it at the same time. Framed by the lamp-lit fog, a form strides through the doorway. His brightly coloured clothes are draped in loose folds about him, and his hat hangs askew, hiding his eyes in shadows. Without hesitation, he walks up to your table and pulls from his tunic a sealed letter, addressed to all of you in beautiful flowing script. He drops the letter on the table and turns and leaves the tavern, vanishing into the fog.

‘Curse of Strahd’ is a D&D5E gothic horror campaign. It has everything you and your party needs to have a grand experience. It will take you to the mysterious village of Barovia, a realm surrounded by deadly fog and ruled by a wizard, the vampire Count Strahd von Zarovich, the master of Castle Ravenloft. ‘Curse of Strahd’ is a rich narrative story you are part of as it’s unfolding. It’s not just about fighting monsters and hunting for treasure in dungeons; there is a compelling story arc and a richly realized antagonist.

A fire blazes in the hearth, and the tavern is alive with the voices and laughter.
Without hesitation, he walks up to your table and pulls from his tunic a sealed letter, addressed to all of you in beautiful flowing script.
‘Curse of Strahd’ is a rich narrative story you are part of as it’s unfolding.

events.long_description:
We invite you to a magical morning: Rodgers and Hammerstein & Friends, celebrating the timeless music of Rodgers & Hammerstein, the legendary duo behind some of Broadway’s most beloved musicals plus songs from some of their contemporaries. This unforgettable concert will feature a dazzling lineup of artists led by Westend star Russell Dixon, performing iconic songs from The Sound of Music, Oklahoma!, South Pacific, Carousel, The King and I, and more.

Experience the sweeping romance of Some Enchanted Evening and People Will Say We’re In Love, the joyful spirit of Oh, What a Beautiful Mornin’ and Oklahoma and the heartfelt power of Climb Every Mountain, all brought to life by these stellar voices. Our concert promises to be a glorious tribute to the golden age of musical theatre.

Featuring:
Russell Dixon
Kate Lineham
Kalauni Pouvalu
Emma Sloman

Grant Winterburn

NZ Tour 14 January 2026 – 17 February 2026
Concerts Start 11am

events.id: Cooking Classes-Sheila's Indian Kitchen, Ashton Fitchett Dr, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Cooking Classes
events.venue: Sheila's Indian Kitchen, Ashton Fitchett Dr, Wellington
events.long_description:
Authentic Indian cooking classes in Wellington with panaromic views over Wellington Harbour.

In each class, you will learn 4-5 recipes like: potato stuff roti, roasted eggplant curry, wholemeal, roti, naan; shahi paneer; dhal, samosa; palak paneer; gourmet chickpeas; vegetable korma; gulab jamun; kheer; mango lassi; masala chai, and many more...

The classes start at 6 pm or 10:30 am on weekends and weekdays with a 2-hour session followed by a dinner or lunch afterwards. The ingredients, copies of recipes, organic karma drink will be provided with a full course meal in a banquet setting. Custom made classes available for gluten free, dairy free and any other food intolerance and dietary requirements.The ingredients, recipes, complimentary organic karma drinks will be provided with a full course meal.

There are 2 to 8 people in each class in purpose built cooking studio. Also a private cooking classes available.

The menu for the class can be:

1) Spicy potato stuffed paratha and roti, rajasthani tomato relish, aalu matter or spicy peas- potato curry, roasted cumin yogurt raita and fresh mint- coriander chutney.

2) Shahi Paneer (cottage cheese cubes with spices and rich tomato-cashew gravy), garlic coriander naan, cumin jeera basmati rice and sweet fragrant rice pudding with cardamom. Also I will teach how to make fresh paneer.

3) Roasted eggplant curry, plain whole wheat chapatti or roti, jeera aaloo or potato curry, Tuar dahl (split yellow lentil) and Basmati rice with homemade pickle.

4) Palak paneer (creamy spinach curry with cubes of paneer), jeera rice (basmati rice with fragrant spices, panjabi chhole or spicy chickpeas curry and mango lassi. Also fresh paneer making.

5) Khadi (chickpeas fritters in yogurt and chickpeas flour soupy gravy), Aloo-Gobhi (cauliflower and potato curry),  savoury wraps with herbs and spices, fresh pickle and basmati rice.

The total cost is $130 per person, this includes ingredient cost. (As an alternative we also sell cooking class gift vouchers.The food options are unlimited and the class provides fresh and best ingredients)
Please contact for booking: indiancooking@xtra.co.nz

So just bring your taste buds! and Enjoy!!

events.name: Paint and Wine Night in Wellington - Cathedral Cove
events.venue: The Arborist Rooftop Bar, 166 Willis St, Te Aro, Wellington
events.long_description:
The concept is simple - take a brush in one hand, a drink in the other and let’s paint a masterpiece!

Join us for a creative night of drinking and painting in the heart of Wellington! No previous painting experience necessary. Get your creative juices flowing and your brush strokes going!

Drinks: No drinks are included in the ticket price, but drinks are available for purchase.

Food: A delicious menu will be available to purchase throughout the event.

What is Paintvine?
It’s a fun social painting class where our artists will run you through step-by-step instructions on how to create your very own masterpiece in a fun and relaxed bar setting. Perfect for dates, catching up with mates or for meeting new friends!

We provide all the materials you need (high-quality canvas, acrylic paint, brushes). All you need to bring is your creative spirit (or find some at the bottom of a glass). At the end of the night you will leave with your own painting ready to hang up on your wall.

For tickets, future events, FAQs and more info head to the Paintvine website.

events.id: Designing exceptional volunteer engagement-level 2/50 The Terrace, Wellington Central, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: Designing exceptional volunteer engagement
events.venue: level 2/50 The Terrace, Wellington Central, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Join international volunteer engagement expert Tobi Johnson in an interactive workshop to design a complete volunteer journey. 
Tobi Johnson is an internationally sought-after expert, consultant, and expert trainer in volunteer engagement. She is known for her modern thought leadership, highly practical evidence-based strategies, and innovative, “big hat” thinking around engaging, supporting, and acknowledging the work of volunteers. 
This workshop, to be held in Wellington on Tuesday 27 January, will guide participants through the complete volunteer journey using the Best Practice Guidelines as a framework for exploration. 
Through graphic facilitation, collaborative exercises, and practical brainstorming, you will develop creative and actionable strategies to design a volunteer experience based on the spirit of community. 
If you are a nonprofit that relies on volunteers – with lots of passion but limited resources – this workshop is specifically tailored for you. As community champions, this is an opportunity to explore, visualize, and co-create practical ways to strengthen volunteer engagement, grounded in the shared values that make volunteering in Aotearoa unique. 
Hear from Tobi herself here:
About your facilitator Tobi Johnson:
Tobi Johnson is an internationally sought-after expert, consultant, and expert trainer in volunteer engagement. She is known for her modern thought leadership, highly practical evidence-based strategies, and innovative, “big hat” thinking around engaging, supporting, and acknowledging the work of volunteers. 
She is the President of Tobi Johnson & Associates, a consulting firm whose mission is to help nonprofit organizations make connections with remarkable volunteers. In 2015, she founded VolunteerPro, an online training and networking community for leaders of volunteers.  She is host of the Volunteer Nation Podcast and co-host of the Time + Talent Podcast with Jennifer Bennett of VolunteerMatch. In addition, she wrote Chapter 1 of Volunteer Engagement 2.0: Ideas and Insights for Transforming Volunteer Programs in a Changing World. She is also currently at work on a book for volunteers who lead to be published in 2026. 
Tobi has over 30 years boots-on-the-ground experience in nonprofit management, program development and start up, team leadership, training design and delivery and change management across a wide range of cause impact areas from arts and culture, youth development, employment and training, senior services, healthcare advocacy, homelessness, and more. 
Where: Wellington, in person. Level 2, 50 The Terrace (the VNZ offices), Wellington.
When: Tuesday 27 January - 9am to 5pm.
Tickets and pricing:
We have priced tickets based on organisation type, and offer a 25% discount to Volunteering NZ member organisations.
Community Organisations $199 +gst
Government or Business tickets $219 +gst
Limited low cost and complimentary tickets are available for those who need additional support to access tickets. These are aimed at organisations with an annual income between $0 to $140k.

Are a Volunteering NZ Member and have not received the discount code of 25%, or
Want to enquire about scholarship or low cost tickets.
Email us on office@volunteeringnz.org.nz or phone us on 04 470 6006. Volunteering NZ member list here.
events.description:
Join international volunteer engagement expert Tobi Johnson in an interactive workshop to design a complete volunteer journey.
Tobi Johnson is an internationally sought-after expert, consultant, and expert trainer in volunteer engagement.
This workshop, to be held in Wellington on Tuesday 27 January, will guide participants through the complete volunteer journey using the Best Practice Guidelines as a framework for exploration.
Tickets and pricing: We have priced tickets based on organisation type, and offer a 25% discount to Volunteering NZ member organisations.
Please contact us directly if you: Are a Volunteering NZ Member and have not received the discount code of 25%, or Want to enquire about scholarship or low cost tickets.

events.venue: Southward Theatre, Otaihanga Rd, Otaihanga, Paraparaumu
events.long_description:
We invite you to a magical morning: Rodgers and Hammerstein & Friends, celebrating the timeless music of Rodgers & Hammerstein, the legendary duo behind some of Broadway’s most beloved musicals plus songs from some of their contemporaries. This unforgettable concert will feature a dazzling lineup of artists led by Westend star Russell Dixon, performing iconic songs from The Sound of Music, Oklahoma!, South Pacific, Carousel, The King and I, and more.

Experience the sweeping romance of Some Enchanted Evening and People Will Say We’re In Love, the joyful spirit of Oh, What a Beautiful Mornin’ and Oklahoma and the heartfelt power of Climb Every Mountain, all brought to life by these stellar voices. Our concert promises to be a glorious tribute to the golden age of musical theatre.

Featuring:
Russell Dixon
Kate Lineham
Kalauni Pouvalu
Emma Sloman
Ravil Atlas
Grant Winterburn

NZ Tour 14 January 2026 – 17 February 2026
Concerts Start 11am
General Admission Seating
Doors Open 10am – Complimentary morning tea included.

Phone: 0508 266 237
Email: bookings@operatunity.co.nz

events.id: TED-Style Talks (27 Jan) — Star Trek themed event-Level 28/100 Willis Street, Wellington Central, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: TED-Style Talks (27 Jan) — Star Trek themed event
events.venue: Level 28/100 Willis Street, Wellington Central, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Presenting a special themed edition of TED-Style Talks... ✨🤩 
These are the voyages of three Starfleet officers addressing us after their mission to seek out new life and new civilisations. Join us on stardate 12601.27 to "boldly go where no one has gone before" 
Speakers
Dr. Lauren Vinnell | To explore strange new worlds, and understand our own: The societal value of sci-fi
Dr. Moiz Penkar | Immanuel Kant, individual free will, and the United Federation of Planets
Dr. Sara Harrison | Good intentions, bad outcomes: What Star Trek teaches us about intervening in complex systems
Each talk will be 10 mins, followed by 10 mins of questions. It's usually beneficial to bring a pen/notepad to take notes 📝🤓 Romulans and Cardassians are more than welcome.
Plan
5:15pm - Doors open
5:20pm - Registration and mingle
5:45pm - Intro and welcome
5:50pm - Talks begin
7:15pm - Conclusion
Tea will be available at the venue. Drinks can also be purchased from the cash bar. Feel free to bring some snacks to share for the post-event networking.
How to find us: Take the "high rise (turbo) lifts" in Majestic Centre to level 28. We'll also put up signs at the lift. Building entrance is from Willis Street (till 6pm) and from Boulcott Street (till 7pm). You may also energise to the top floor of Majestic Centre.
We take pictures to document the events. If you don't want to be photographed, simply let us know on arrival.
(Click "follow" on Humanitix to be notified of future events.)
We're alone. In an uncharted part of the galaxy. We've already made some friends here. And some enemies. We have no idea of the dangers we're going to face. But one thing is clear. We shall meet on the 27th. Make it so!

events.id: Intro to Te Tiriti and history-7 Serlby Place, Porirua City Centre, Porirua 5022, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: Intro to Te Tiriti and history
events.venue: 7 Serlby Place, Porirua City Centre, Porirua 5022, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Te Tiriti o Waitangi - Partnership and Participation

Porirua City Hub
Brought to you by Multicultural Collective and Te Tiriti is Us
For any questions, please email kiaora@multiculturalcollective.nz
Join us for an informal and illustrated kōrero (conversation) looking at how we can live honouring Te Tiriti in Aotearoa New Zealand. We will cover some history of two cultures living together – Tangata whenua and Tangata Tiriti.
What life was like before the treaty
The impact of the treaty from 1840 to the establishment of the Waitangi Tribunal in 1975
Changes from then to today
Discussion about how we can all live as good treaty partners
In collaboration with Te Tiriti is Us, a not-for-profit and non-partisan project encouraging all New Zealanders to consider Te Tiriti o Waitangi and the partnership it created as a crucial part of our history, democracy, and identity.

events.id: Finding Stability in Turbulent Times-Bhakti Lounge Wellington, 1st Floor, 175 Vivian Street, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Finding Stability in Turbulent Times
events.venue: Bhakti Lounge Wellington, 1st Floor, 175 Vivian Street, Wellington
events.long_description:
Tuesday Wellbeing Seminars

Finding stability in turbulent times

Pandemic, war, Inflation. Our only problems? Certainly not.

Crisis after crisis slam us in the face.

In the last century it was climate change and world hunger.

This century we are facing newer problems. With the old ones still unresolved.

How is it possible to find peace and stability in a world such as ours? Is it possible?

Albert Einstein said: ' A problem can never get resolved on the same level it originated.'

To find stability, there's need to rise to a higher platform.


Meet your host, Nava

Nava’s natural interest in studying physics blossomed into metaphysics when she arrived in the land of the long white cloud. Originally from Germany, Nava was travelling on a quest to find purpose and answers to the mysteries of life. Did she find anything on this quest? Yes! After four exciting years of inquiry, practice, and being immersed in the wonders of bhakti yoga, she is still fully inspired by what she has discovered. Mesmerized by the depth and broad-mindedness that a yoga lifestyle offers, Nava is keen to share with you that wisdom and love, along with her experiences on the road of life. Nava is also an expert vegan chef who specializes in European cuisine and baking, and she is busy spreading that kind of love around Bhakti Lounge too!

6.15pm Tuesday 27th January

End the session on a high note with a delicious plant-based dinner, dessert, and good conversation.
events.description:
Tuesday Wellbeing Seminars Finding stability in turbulent times Pandemic, war, Inflation.
This century we are facing newer problems.
How is it possible to find peace and stability in a world such as ours?
Originally from Germany, Nava was travelling on a quest to find purpose and answers to the mysteries of life.
Mesmerized by the depth and broad-mindedness that a yoga lifestyle offers, Nava is keen to share with you that wisdom and love, along with her experiences on the road of life.

Citizens!

We are super-excited to open up the western cities to These fine folks from ForeverGMNZ, finally get some RPGs going around here! Turn up a bit early to get a bit of courage and story in you and these guys will provide everything you need for an adventure!

Make sure you book below so we can keep track of everything and make sure we have enough DMs. If we get enough interest we will be doing this monthly... (and we will sort out an all-ages series starting in March)

From the event:

Every great Dungeons and Dragons adventure begins in a tavern.

Whether you’re a seasoned adventurer or you’ve never rolled a die in your life, this two-hour, beginner-friendly D&D experience is for you!

Turn up solo or with friends and be guided through a fast-paced adventure by a professional Dungeon Master. Choose your hero — a silver-tongued bard, a fire-flinging wizard, a sword-swinging fighter, a sneaky rogue, or something else entirely, with all characters, dice, and rules provided.

Expect laughs, ridiculous moments, and just enough danger to make the beer taste sweeter. Because while you’re swinging swords and slinging spells, the bar will be open with Beer Engine’s excellent selection of craft brews on tap.

No prep. No pressure. Just great beer and a story you’ll still be talking about afterwards.

This is an age 18+ event.

Grab your crew of 4 and join us for a night of trivia, laughs and questionable memories.

At our 90’s Quiz Night, we’re here for one thing: a bloody good time. Think classic Bond Store chaos — big laughs, and questionable knowledge. Chris Barber as the quiz master!

events.id: School Holiday Movies-Embassy of Japan, Level 18, 100 Willis Street, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: School Holiday Movies
events.venue: Embassy of Japan, Level 18, 100 Willis Street, Wellington
events.long_description:
Come and enjoy our free School Holiday Movie Screenings, co-organised with the Japan Foundation, Sydney!

We will be showing two exciting films, ”Porco Rosso” and ” Shin Ultraman”.

Porco Rosso:10am 21 January and 2pm 28 January 2026
Synopsis
World War I has ended, and peace reigns again. Aviators from around the world circle above the Adriatic Sea, keen to recapture the romanticism of flight lost during the war. Many have turned to air piracy, in amongst which a hero emerges: a man with a pig's head, known as Porco Rosso (once an Italian air force pilot called Marco Pagot).

As a mercenary law-enforcer of the skies and oceans, Porco Rosso protects cruise ships from the air pirates above them. When his actions are challenged by Curtis, an American who flies with the pirates, Porco Rosso is forced to defend his honour against this newcomer, which leads him to Fio, a feisty young engineer who rebuilds Porco's plane for the big dogfight.
Director: MIYAZAKI Hayao / Classification: PG / Year: 1992 / Genre: Anime
Language: Japanese with English subtitles
Copyright:© 1992 Studio Ghibli – NN

Shin Ultraman: 2pm 21 January and 10am 28 January 2026
Synopsis
When Japan's SSSP kaiju defence task force finds itself in the midst of a particularly challenging kaiju encounter, a giant silver robot descends from the sky to rescue the country. Dubbed Ultraman, this robot’s identity and purpose are a mystery. As further alien forces arrive on Earth, the task force, led by Kimio Tamura (Hidetoshi Nishijima, Drive My Car), attempts to identify their true intentions.
Director: HIGUCHI Shinji/ Classification:PG / Year: 2022/ Genre: Action and Adventure
Language: Japanese with English subtitles
Copyright:Copyright © 2022 TSUBURAYA PRODUCTIONS CO., LTD. / TOHO CO., LTD. / khara, Inc.

A short Japan Video Topics DVD will be shown from 5:15pm before the start of the film at 5:30pm. Free admission is based on a first-come, first-served basis, with a full theatre capacity of 40 people. No food is permitted in the theatre

events.id: Toitu: Visual Sovereignty film screening-Buckle Street, Mount Cook, Wellington, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: Toitu: Visual Sovereignty film screening
events.venue: Buckle Street, Mount Cook, Wellington, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Toi Tū Toi Ora: Contemporary Māori Art was the largest Māori exhibition in the history of Auckland Art Gallery and attracted attendance levels not seen by the gallery since 1989. Chelsea Winstanley’s documentary follows the journey of curator Nigel Borell as he navigates the constraints between institutional authority and Māori self-determination.
Chelsea Winstanley’s documentary follows the journey of curator Nigel Borell as he navigates the constraints between institutional authority and Māori self-determination. Borell’s curatorial vision is clear – Māori art must be authored, not simply advocated for. For the artists, this represents a chance to be seen on their own terms and is an initiative that ultimately leads some to the global stage of the Venice Biennale. 
But as the scale of the exhibition grows, so does the institutional resistance. The result is a reckoning: whose story is being told, and who holds the pen? With many of the artworks exploring the legacy of colonialism, the making of the exhibition itself becomes a living reflection of that very struggle. Laying bare behind-the-scenes conversations rarely seen on screen, TOITŪ Visual Sovereignty lifts the curtain on the inner workings of an institution and examines the cost of visibility without control – and the quiet power of walking away. — Heperi Mita 
The screening will be followed by a Q and A with Director Chelsea Winstanley.
events.description:
Toi Tū Toi Ora: Contemporary Māori Art was the largest Māori exhibition in the history of Auckland Art Gallery and attracted attendance levels not seen by the gallery since 1989.
Chelsea Winstanley’s documentary follows the journey of curator Nigel Borell as he navigates the constraints between institutional authority and Māori self-determination.
Chelsea Winstanley’s documentary follows the journey of curator Nigel Borell as he navigates the constraints between institutional authority and Māori self-determination.
Borell’s curatorial vision is clear – Māori art must be authored, not simply advocated for.
For the artists, this represents a chance to be seen on their own terms and is an initiative that ultimately leads some to the global stage of the Venice Biennale.

events.id: Wet Bandits - 'Bad Tattoos and Weathermen' Tour - WLG-MOON 1,167 Riddiford St, Newtown, Wellington, New Zealand-All Events In
events.name: Wet Bandits - 'Bad Tattoos and Weathermen' Tour - WLG
events.venue: MOON 1,167 Riddiford St, Newtown, Wellington, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Wet Bandits - 'Bad Tattoos and Weathermen' Tour - WLG
Wet Bandits return to Aotearoa this summer with three shows across Wellington, Hawke’s Bay and Auckland.

Led by songwriter and producer Finn Roberts, the Australian-based indie rock outfit have had a big 2025, releasing a new album, headlining their first Australian tour, and playing a run of notable support slots, including opening for The Butlers, No Cigar, and The Slims on their respective Australian tours.

The band will be taking their self-produced album Bad Tattoos and Weathermen on the road for the first time in NZ. Released in August last year, these new tunes are coming home for an NZ stint. Expect a live set full of familiar hits, new album tracks — including fan favourites The Record Store, It’s No Use, and So Sweet So Sublime — and some you’ve never heard before.

WET BANDITS — NZ TOUR
Thu 29 Jan — Moon Bar, Wellington. Joined by Ben Liley In Circles
Sat 31 Jan — Outfield Festival, Hawke’s Bay
Sat 7 Feb — Dead Witch, Auckland

events.long_description:
Burns Night - A Taste of Scotland
Burns Night - A Taste of Scotland

Raise a glass to Scotland! Join us for a tasting-style Burns Night at Whisky & Wood, where classic flavours meet festive fun. Think haggis with neeps & tatties, Cullen Skink, and Cranachan, paired with whisky flights and themed cocktails.

A modern take on the classic Burns Night - just a relaxed evening of great bites, great drinks, and a bit of Scottish cheer. Expect music, a playful Ode to the Haggis, and all the fun of a modern celebration.

Tickets:
$45 Standard - includes tasting menu
$55 - includes welcome drink (house drink or select themed cocktail)
$70 - includes whisky flight (4 whiskies)

The End is near – come and laugh with us on our NZ tour!

Stand-up comedy featuring comedians who grew up in religious fundamentalist communities, now using humor to process their experiences.

events.name: Fight Club
events.venue: The Fringe Bar,30 Allen St, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand, Wellington
events.long_description:
Fight Club
Four comedians face off in one of the most brutal and radical fighting styles: Structured Debate. Welcome to Fight Club!

A gladiator-style comedy showdown where hot takes replace punches and the audience is judge, jury, and executioner.
Four comics battle across three rounds of ruthless, ridiculous debate. Two rounds in the first half, a desperate losers’ bout for the coveted booby prize, then a final face-off between the victors. The ultimate winner earns a spot in the Grand Final in November and a shot at the Fight Club belt.

They’ll argue life’s most important questions, like “Which comic would be the best date to your ex’s wedding?” and “Who could talk their way out of a speeding ticket?” No facts, no data, no mercy. Expect sharp jokes, fake confidence, real egos, audience voting, and maximum tomfoolery.

This isn’t just comedy debate, it’s trial by charisma.

Tickets here: https://www.eventfinda.co.nz/2026/fight-club/wellington

events.long_description:
Wellington - Empower Her Networking - Community-Led Marketing
Empower Her, female networking group that offers a welcoming and safe environment for women of all business backgrounds and experiences

About this Event

WELLINGTON - The Arborist Rooftop Bar
Monthly Topic: Community-Led Marketing
Hosted by:
The new era of business isn’t built on algorithms -it’s built on connection.
Join us for Community-Led Marketing: The Future of Growth in 2026 and Beyond, where we’ll explore how the smartest brands and entrepreneurs are ditching outdated marketing tactics and building loyal, engaged communities that do the marketing for them.
In this empowering session, we’ll unpack how to future-proof your business by focusing on what truly scales -relationships, collaboration, and authentic human connection. Discover how to turn your audience into advocates, your collaborations into catalysts, and your community into your greatest asset for growth in 2026.
Want to get your ticket for FREE?
Are you a woman in business looking for a supportive community to help you connect, grow, and learn?
As an Inner Circle member, you can attend as many of our networking hubs as you like for FREE! This includes our hubs across Auckland, NZ, Australia and the UK. Enjoy unlimited access to our netwokring events and take full advantage of the community and networking opportunities.
Join the Inner Circle to unlock even more benefits:
Monthly Masterclasses: Learn from industry experts on topics that will elevate your business and mindset.
Accountability Calls: Stay on track with our supportive community and achieve your goals.
Personal Branding Opportunities: Create your own masterclasses and shine as an expert.
Exclusive Discounts: Enjoy special rates on Empower Her events and live workshops.
Vibrant Community: Share your journey, get support, and celebrate your successes with empowering women.
now and become part of a wonderful community of women in business who are ready to build their dream life and business.
Empower Her is a global female networking group, that offers a welcoming and safe environment for women of all business backgrounds and experiences.
Whether you're just starting out with new business ideas or have years of experience under your belt, all are welcome! Empower Her provides a safe space where you can share your business with others, connect with like-minded women in business, and prioritise collaboration over competition.
Our groups value the power of connection, and we believe that together, we can achieve more than we ever could alone. That's why we're committed to fostering a supportive community that empowers each member to reach their full potential. Our groups are focused on connection, inspiring stories, celebrating each other's successes and sharing our vulnerable moments.
Join our free community
The Inner Circle
Follow us on Instagram
Empower Her Co-Founders Victoria and Charlotte are highly passionate and dedicated to empowering female leaders in the business world. By joining Empower Her, you will not only expand your professional network but also gain access to a supportive community of like-minded individuals who are committed to helping each other succeed.Find out more about us and check up our upcoming events on our website.

events.id: Oscar Lavën's Elegant Calamity Orchestra-The Rogue & Vagabond,18 Garrett St, Wellington, New Zealand-All Events In
events.name: Oscar Lavën's Elegant Calamity Orchestra
events.venue: The Rogue & Vagabond,18 Garrett St, Wellington, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Oscar Lavën's Elegant Calamity Orchestra
"You could drop the needle on any spot and find satisfying, thoroughly involving music." - London Jazz News

After releasing their recent album to a sold-out crowd at the Wellington Jazz Festival, the Elegant Calamity Orchestra makes its return to the Rogue and Vagabond! Led by flamboyant saxophonist Oscar Lavën, the Elegant Calamity Orchestra drawing together a vibrant collection of all-star musicians from various backgrounds under one roof, drawing influence from early American swing, blues, classical music, french cinema, spiritual jazz and 50’s bar-walking rock and roll saxophone.
Prepare to be swept into a surreal, cinematic world by the Elegant Calamity Orchestra; strings, woodwinds, brass, virtuosic percussionists and a deep-digging rhythm section, combining kaleidoscopic orchestral colours with the dangerous spontaneity of a small group. A momentous performance not to be missed.

9pm Downbeat. General Admission: $20
Online Tickets:
https://www.undertheradar.co.nz/tour/32260/Oscar-Lavns-Elegant-Calamity-Orchestra.utr

The Ensemble:
Oscar Lavën: tenor saxophone
Bridget Kelly: clarinet
Calvin Scott: oboe
Daniel Yeabsley: alto and bass saxophones
Patrick Hayes: bass clarinet
Michael Taylor: trumpet
Michael Costeloe: trumpet
Kaito Walley: trombone
Tristan Carter: violin
Ana Henderson: violin
Nicholas Denton-Protsack: cello
Rafael Ferrer-Noel: percussion
Mikey Trujillo: percussion
John Rae: drums
Ayrton Foote: piano
Patrick Bleakley: double bass

events.id: Great Big Waterfront Clean-Up-Wellington Museum, 3 Jervois Quay, Queens Wharf, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Great Big Waterfront Clean-Up
events.venue: Wellington Museum, 3 Jervois Quay, Queens Wharf, Wellington
events.long_description:
Help keep our harbour beautiful. 

Roll up your sleeves and join us for the Great Big Waterfront Clean-Up 2026. Help clean up our waterfront and keep trash out of our harbour.

Register your whānau, friends and workmates below to join the cause!

What to bring:
Sturdy footwear
Reusable drink bottle
Sun-smart gear
Raincoat (just in case!)*

What we will provide:
Gloves and rubbish sacks
Health & safety briefing
First aid support
Sunscreen & hand sanitiser
Rubbish removal

After your hard mahi, enjoy a refreshing Almighty drink as a thank you!

As one of the oldest buildings on the waterfront, Te Waka Huia Wellington Museum is an important reminder of our past. We pride ourselves on being involved in activities that enhance the well-being of our land and people.

Plastic and debris threaten sealife and nesting habitats. By pitching in, you’re helping protect the harbour and its wildlife, including kororā little blue penguins, who nest along the waterfront.

He waka eke noa – We are in this together. Register now: https://bit.ly/4rEw39M

Thursday 29 January | 12PM – 2:30PM | Te Waka Huia Wellington Museum

Supported by our friends from Almighty.

*Note: In the event of bad weather, the Clean-Up will be cancelled. Cancellation notifications will be announced the day before the event (Tuesday 21 January) on our social media channels and via email to registered volunteers

events.name: The Lunch Society: New Year, New Connections
events.venue: Hippopotamus Restaurant and Bar, Level 3, 90 Cable Street, Wellington
events.long_description:
The Lunch Society – New Year, New Connections: A 2026 Kick-Off Lunch with Diana Marsh, CEO Experience Wellington

Start your year with purpose, connection and a seriously inspiring conversation.

Join us for the first Lunch Society event of 2026, featuring Diana Marsh, CEO of Experience Wellington, as our keynote speaker. Diana will share her vision for Wellington’s future — from arts, culture and events to the city’s evolving identity and what lies ahead for our capital in the coming year.

This intimate lunch is designed for women who value meaningful connections, great conversation and a beautifully curated dining experience. Expect a warm, welcoming atmosphere, a delicious multi-course lunch, thoughtful spot prizes and plenty of opportunities to connect with like-minded women from across Wellington.

Why you’ll love it:

- Insightful keynote from one of Wellington’s most influential leaders

- Curated lunch in a stunning venue

- Meet inspiring women across business, creative and community sectors

- Spot prizes throughout the afternoon

- Feel-good vibes to kick off 2026 on a high

About Diana Marsh:
Diana Marsh is the CEO of Experience Wellington, the organisation behind many of the city’s most loved cultural institutions, venues and experiences. Passionate about place-making, creativity and community, Diana is a powerful voice shaping Wellington’s cultural heartbeat.

Spaces are limited and our events always sell out — we’d love you at the table.

events.id: Building With AI-Level 4 Waring Taylor Street, Wellington Central, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: Building With AI
events.venue: Level 4 Waring Taylor Street, Wellington Central, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Draw the Rest of the Owl
There’s a lot of buzz around AI right now.
Not many honest conversations about what it actually takes to use it in real products.
Most teams can get a demo working.
The hard part is everything that comes after. Reliability, trust, cost, UX, and fitting AI into how teams actually build and ship software.
This meetup is about that gap.
We’re hosting a relaxed, in-person session for people who are past the hype and want to talk about how AI is really being used day to day. Expect practical examples, candid discussion, and time to ask questions rather than polished slides or buzzwords.
Speakers:
Nik Wakelin, Founder of Sterling
Nik will give a genuine look under the hood of Sterling, showing how they’re using AI both in the product and to build it at speed, including the tooling and workflows that are helping them move fast.
Hirtarth Sharma, Founding Engineer at Grw AI
Hirtarth will talk candidly about how they are using AI today, the trade-offs they’ve made, and what’s surprised them along the way.
No buzzwords. No thought leadership. Just builders talking shop.
Details
📍 Talent Army office (with a bar)
🗓 29 January 2026
⏰ Arrive from 4:30pm, 5pm start
🍕 Snacks provided

events.id: Reels for Meals: The Choral-52 Beach Street, Petone, Lower Hutt 5012, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: Reels for Meals: The Choral
events.venue: 52 Beach Street, Petone, Lower Hutt 5012, New Zealand
events.long_description:
January's Reels for Meals movie fundraiser is The Choral.
The Choral is a 2025 British historical drama film co-produced and directed by Nicholas Hytner and written by Alan Bennett. Set in 1916, during World War I, in the fictional town of Ramsden, Yorkshire, the film follows the members of the local choral society which recruits a group of teenage boys and girls for a performance of Edward Elgar's The Dream of Gerontius, a work chosen because it was not written by a German.
Starring Ralph Fiennes, Roger Allam, Mark Addy, Alun Armstrong, Robert Emms, and Simon Russell Beale.

All profits from this movie fundraiser go to the Lower Hutt Foodbank.
