The Advanced Open Water Diver course helps you increase your confidence and build scuba skills to become safer and more comfortable in the water.
It’s also a great way to get more diving experience under the supervision of a PADI Instructor.
This is the minimum requirement for many of our dive adventures and a prerequisite for the PADI Rescue Diver course.

events.id: D&D Sigil, The City of Doors Campaign with Matt 31st Jan 2026-199 Jackson Street, Petone, New Zealand 5012,199 Jackson St, Petone, Lower Hutt 5012, New Zealand, Lower Hutt-All Events In
events.name: D&D Sigil, The City of Doors Campaign with Matt 31st Jan 2026
events.venue: 199 Jackson Street, Petone, New Zealand 5012,199 Jackson St, Petone, Lower Hutt 5012, New Zealand, Lower Hutt
events.long_description:
D&D Sigil, The City of Doors Campaign with Matt 31st Jan 2026
Sigil, The City of Doors. The axis of the multiverse, where heaven, hell, and everything between collide.

For the first time in untold ages, the Lady of Pain has spoken without words. Across Sigil, portals have ignited, blades have been sharpened, and fear has taken root in the hearts of gods and mortals alike. A tournament has been declared, not for glory, not for gold, but for a prize so profound that the gods dare not name it.

To claim it, your party must endure trials beyond legend.

You will battle nightmare creatures born of forgotten planes, rival champions forged by war and prophecy, and adventurers whose names are curses whispered in taverns across a thousand worlds. The battlefield is ever-changing: shifting mazes, living portals, lethal riddles, and traps designed not just to K*ll, but to break you.

Every door you open reshapes the path ahead.

Every choice echoes across the planes.

Every victory draws the gaze of powers best left unseen.

Only one truth is certain: the Lady of Pain does not offer second chances.

Stand victorious and seize a prize capable of rewriting fate itself. Fall and be unmade—your story erased from every world you ever knew.

The doors are opening.

The multiverse is watching.

Step forward.

Run by Matt, this campaign will span the various events of the Tournament, ranging across not across the city of Sigil, but across various worlds, some known, some unknown.

This campaign will run every second Saturday.

events.id: Padi Advanced Open Water Course-New Zealand Sea Adventures, 9 Marina View, Porirua - Mana-Event Finder
events.name: Padi Advanced Open Water Course
events.venue: New Zealand Sea Adventures, 9 Marina View, Porirua - Mana
events.long_description:
Exploration, excitement and experiences are what the PADI Advanced Open Water (AOW) Diver course is all about.

The AOW course is designed for both new and more experienced Open Water Divers and is best attended as soon after your Open Water Diver course as possible. That way you will increase your confidence and build scuba skills to become safer and more comfortable in the water; all under the supervision of a PADI Instructor.

The AOW course consists of five dives that includes a: Deep and an Underwater Navigation dive. Popular local options for the remaining three dives are: Peak Performance Buoyancy, Naturalist, Wreck, Fish Identification, Imaging, Night, *Enriched Air or *Dive Against Debris (* conditions apply).

You may choose to add the 'Enriched Air' and/or the 'Dive Against Debris' specialty qualifications to your weekend experience. Simply ask to: include these dives as part of your five dives, complete the on-line study and a short practical, pay a small fee – and go diving. These Specialties count towards the prestigious PADI Master Scuba Diver rating.

Pay your deposit and you can begin the AOW theory. Make sure your dive medical is current, then join us for a weekend's fun diving. After everything is completed, you will qualify as a PADI AOW Diver. This is the minimum requirement for our dive adventures and a prerequisite for the PADI Rescue Diver course.
If you have any questions, please call so we can help you.

events.id: Conflict Management and Resolution Workshop-Wellington High School, 249 Taranaki St, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Conflict Management and Resolution Workshop
events.venue: Wellington High School, 249 Taranaki St, Wellington
events.long_description:
Conflict is an inevitable part of life, arising in families, workplaces, and daily interactions.
While many strive to avoid it, suppressing thoughts, feelings, and values to sidestep disagreements can lead to unresolved issues. Learning to manage and resolve conflicts equips you with the tools to navigate these challenges effectively, fostering understanding and collaboration.

Aim of this workshop: To empower you with the skills and confidence needed to effectively manage and resolve conflicts.

Learning Outcomes:

By the end of the workshop, you will:

Recognise how your actions and behaviours influence conflict.
Develop your ability to clarify and manage expectations.
Acquire practical tools for effective conflict management.
Create a sustainable action plan to continuously apply conflict resolution strategies.

events.id: Memory Mastery for Confidence Workshop-Wellington High School, 249 Taranaki St, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Memory Mastery for Confidence Workshop
events.venue: Wellington High School, 249 Taranaki St, Wellington
events.long_description:
Unlock your mind's full potential with "Memory Mastery," led by Neil Thornton, award-winning educator and founder of NZ Comedy School. Drawing on over 30 years of teaching experience and cognitive research, this workshop equips you with powerful, scientifically-proven memory techniques.

Learn to retain names and lists, learn vocabulary, deliver presentations without notes, and boost your professional efficiency. Discover how to create vivid mental imagery, use spatial memory techniques, and leverage the power of association to revolutionise your recall abilities. Whether you're a busy professional, a student, or simply looking to sharpen your mental acuity, this course offers practical, immediately applicable skills for enhanced memory performance in both personal and professional settings.

Bring pen and paper if you wish to take notes.

Tea and coffee provided, please bring your lunch and snacks.

NOTE: This course is subsidised with funding from the Tertiary Education Commission (TEC), and you must provide photo ID when you attend your first session, if applicable.

Note: Courses need a minimum number to go ahead, so if we don't have enough enrolments a few days before the start date, we have to cancel. We'll let you know by email, so please check yours regularly. If you need to cancel your registration, here are our terms and conditions: "What You Need to Know".

events.id: Mental Health First Aid Aotearoa-Wellington High School, 249 Taranaki St, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Mental Health First Aid Aotearoa
events.venue: Wellington High School, 249 Taranaki St, Wellington
events.long_description:
About 1 in 5 New Zealand adults experience a common mental illness each year. Understanding how to talk about mental health and help someone in need are important skills. This certified Mental Health First Aid course will teach you the skills and knowledge to recognise and respond to someone experiencing mental health challenges. Course fees: If you are a NZ citizen/Permanent Resident Visa the course fee is $199 (evidence of eligibility required). Others pay $499.

Description
Mental Health First Aid is an evidence-based workshop which gives people the skills and confidence to have supportive conversations with their whānau, co-workers and community and help guide them to professional help if needed.

You will learn to recognise common mental health challenges, how to provide initial help to someone experiencing a mental health challenge using a practical, evidence-based action plan, and how to respond in a crisis. During the workshop, you will have the opportunity to practice new skills in a safe environment.

You must be a NZ citizen or resident to qualify for the reduced course fee. A condition of enrolment is that you must provide photo ID when you attend.

Mental health challenges covered in the course include:

Depression
Anxiety
Psychosis
Substance use problems
Mental Health Crisis Covered:

Suicidal thoughts and behaviours
Non- Suicidal self-injury
Panic attack
Traumatic events
Severe effects from Alcohol or other substance use
Aggressive behaviours
People who attend Mental Health First Aid training can complete a short online assessment to be accredited as a Mental Health First Aider. You must attend the full two days to be able to do the online assessment for accreditation. The accreditation is valid for three years.

If you choose not to be accredited, you will receive a certificate of participation if you attend the full course. You will also receive a workbook as part of your course fee.

A condition of enrolment is that you must provide photo ID when you attend.

Note: Courses need a minimum number to go ahead, so if we don't have enough enrolments a few days before the start date, we have to cancel. We'll let you know by emai,l so please check yours regularly. If you need to cancel your registration, here are our terms and conditions: "What You Need to Know".

Prerequisites
You must be a NZ citizen or resident to qualify for the reduced course fee.

A condition of enrolment is that you must provide photo ID when you attend.

31 Jan 2026 - 1 Feb 2026
2 days, Sat & Sun 9:30 AM – 4:30 PM
Wellington High School
Presented by Anne Troy

events.id: Alex Seel and Jon Sanders (UK) @ Wellington Bluegrass Society-Abandoned Petone,38 Fitzherbert St, Petone, Lower Hutt 5012, New Zealand, Lower Hutt-All Events In
events.name: Alex Seel and Jon Sanders (UK) @ Wellington Bluegrass Society
events.venue: Abandoned Petone,38 Fitzherbert St, Petone, Lower Hutt 5012, New Zealand, Lower Hutt
events.long_description:
Alex Seel and Jon Sanders (UK) @ Wellington Bluegrass Society
“Make no mistake, the audience raved about the sheer scope of musical interplay and different genres… Sanders with his jazz tinged Irish, Arabesque and world music solos, brought the sonorous experience of compositions from the British song-writer’s new album with almost unbelievable changes in tempo, accompanied masterfully by Seel’s impressive guitar… The audience loved Seel’s folk, pop and blues influenced songs and duos with Sanders”
- RheinZeit, Germany

Music has led Alex Seel from Devon to London to Ireland and back to London again. Through his wanderings, Alex has picked up a finely crafted, rootsy songwriting style with thought provoking lyrics and a flare for acoustic guitar finger picking. His influences range from blues, pop and the British folk revival guitarists, but his sound is all his own. He has a growing reputation as a solo performer, having performed around the UK, Ireland, Italy, Germany and Spain.

Jon Sanders is recognised as a virtuoso bouzouki player, tenor ukulele player, drop D and DADGAD guitarist and an internationally acclaimed composer. His compositions draw on elements of jazz, gypsy, funk, Arabic, Latino and Celtic styles, somewhat reminiscent of Sylvain Luc, Pierre Bensusan, Antonio Forcione and James Hill - yet instantly different.

Both were based in Dingle in Kerry, but in different scenes. But only later on started playing in the UK first at the Didsbury Festival, then did couple of other festivals and it went down really well… the chemistry of the duo, complementing each other with symbiotic dynamism, with sensitivity in each others music. Both are long time professional musicians. Jon has been performing in NZ for 20 years, however this is Alex’es first time in NZ.

DOORS:
7.00pm

SHOW STARTS:
8.00pm

ENTRY:
$30 / $25 members

please bring cash to pay for tickets,
or book prior to the day via email to:


Plenty of tasty treats available at the venue, come for a drink (or two) and dinner before the show starts.

Here is the link for the Petone menu, and to book for dinner:
www.abandonedbrewery.co.nz/taprooms#Petone

events.name: Anna Fält and Ira Hadžić - Night 2
events.venue: Pyramid Club,272 Taranaki Street, Wellington, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Anna Fält and Ira Hadžić - Night 2
Our guest artists Anna Fält (Finland/Sweden) and Ira Hadžić (Germany) in improvised collaborations with local musicians Ritual Heaps, DSLB and Erika Grant.

Ira Hadžić is a Berlin-based sound artist whose musical practice moves at the intersections of improvisation, composition, and introspection. She works with gongs, radiophonic pieces, field recordings, resonances, simple sonic gestures – as well as silence as an expressive form in its own right. Trained as a Deep Listening facilitator at the Center for Deep Listening (Rensselaer Polytechnic Institute), she incorporates these practices into her compositions and sound installations.

https://www.irahadzic.com/
https://ir-a.bandcamp.com/
https://www.instagram.com/irahadzic/

Anna Fält is a versatile voice artist, composer and singing teacher who is passionate about Nordic folk singing. She´s been touring Nordic countries and outside Europe for years with her unique concept of solo vocal concerts. Specialising in singing traditions from her two home countries Finland and Sweden, she combines the bright Scandinavian and dark East-European tones, performing in churches, museums, festivals, clubs and concert halls.

https://annafaltenglish.wordpress.com/

Presale tickets available via UTR

Special thanks to CNZ for supporting Pyramid Club's programme

events.id: Jewellery-making in 6 weeks, Saturday Mornings, Level 2+-Workspace Ōtaki, 6 Hewson Crescent, Ōtaki-Event Finder
events.name: Jewellery-making in 6 weeks, Saturday Mornings, Level 2+
events.venue: Workspace Ōtaki, 6 Hewson Crescent, Ōtaki
events.long_description:
Our popular weekend block classes are the best way for keen makers to get into jewellery making in a lively, warm and friendly environment. It starts on Sat 31 January and runs for 6 weeks till Sat 7 March.

This class is for regular students at Ōtaki who have already completed at least a beginner's 6 week block as a minimum.

Students will be supported by Vaune and the occasional guest tutor to further their jewellery making skills in the areas that interest them.

This class is a Fabrication focus. Students who have already taken a class in enamelling or wax work can continue their work in this class but the format does not allow for beginner lessons in these things.

You can purchase metals and materials for your projects as you go - in the studio.
Advanced students are encouraged to retain their silver scrap and learn to work thriftily with materials, using scrap for future projects.

Our booking system asks for payment to be made via credit card, Afterpay or PayPal on booking. If you do not have access to these payment methods or need to pay your course fee over time please email us to arrange this ;)

events.id: SUMAC - WELLINGTON - VALHALLAH-Valhalla,154 Vivian Street, Wellington, New Zealand-All Events In
events.name: SUMAC - WELLINGTON - VALHALLAH
events.venue: Valhalla,154 Vivian Street, Wellington, New Zealand
events.long_description:
SUMAC - WELLINGTON - VALHALLAH
Banished Music, Whammy Bar, and Valhalla are proud to present the long-awaited New Zealand debut of experimental post-metal trio SUMAC.
Formed in 2014, the powerhouse trio comprised of Aaron Turner (guitar, vocals; Isis, Old Man Gloom), Brian Cook (bass; Russian Circles, Botch), and Nick Yacyshyn (drums; Baptists) are renowned for merging crushing heaviness with improvisational freedom, exploring the boundaries between structure and chaos.

SUMAC have built a reputation as a fearsome live band. Visceral and cathartic shows where crushing riffs & sprawling drones collide with extended bursts of wild improvisation. In 2024, the band released their critically acclaimed album The Healer, a sweeping, transformative work spanning four monumental tracks. The record dives deep into themes of regeneration, suffering, and spiritual reconstruction — a testament to the band’s ability to meld raw power with emotional depth.

The experimental metal trio’s four-song, 76-minute album is the peak of their career. It’s dense and invigorating, highlighting the band’s dexterity, creativity, and clarity of purpose. - Pitchfork

Soon after the release SUMAC teamed up with poet and sound artist Moor Mother to release The Film, a boundary-pushing collaborative album. Released via Thrill Jockey in April 2025, the record unfolds as a cinematic journey across eight “scenes,” merging SUMAC’s heavy, jazz-inflected textures with Moor Mother’s incisive spoken-word commentary.

SUMAC’s work has always been about transition between different states of being. Our sense of normal, and indeed our sense of life, is now being shaken. We don’t know what is coming next. We are looking for pointers towards the future, as well as things to hold onto in the moment.
New Zealanders, don’t miss this rare and powerful journey into uncharted sonic terrain.

events.id: Sandcasting Day - Summer-Workspace Studios Ltd, 65 Abel Smith St, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Sandcasting Day - Summer
events.venue: Workspace Studios Ltd, 65 Abel Smith St, Wellington
events.long_description:
Join us for this wonderful intro to sandcasting - it is a great opportunity to make some gorgeous lasting jewellery gifts for yourself or your loved ones!

Students are shown the ancient technique of sand casting, using a wax to make a simple hard model or found objects such as buttons or simple small forms - create your simple 2-part mould and melt and pour sterling silver or shibuichi (a different mix of silver and copper) to cast into the sand.

The model you have made or found enables you to make multiple pours possible, until you either get the result you are after or to create multiple pieces. This is a fun process for those who just want to try their hand at it, or a very useful low-tech process for those who are making jewellery into a career or creative activity.

Course cost includes 9g silver but students can expect to use extra $50 - $70 worth of silver or $20 - $30 of shibuichi.

This course aims to allow students to all have at least one successful cast, and to learn the finishing techniques for the pieces they cast, allowing you to leave with a gorgeous finished piece of jewellery.

events.id: Tết Cooking Workshop - Celebrate Lunar New Year Through Food-27 Hillary Court, Naenae, Lower Hutt 5011, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: Tết Cooking Workshop - Celebrate Lunar New Year Through Food
events.venue: 27 Hillary Court, Naenae, Lower Hutt 5011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Step into the flavours of Vietnamese Lunar New Year with a special hands-on workshop that brings tradition, community, and storytelling together.
Join us as part of the Lunar New Year Festival 2026 for a delicious cultural experience!
✨ What We’ll Make Together:
🍖 Thịt Kho (Caramelized Braised Pork) - tender pork simmered in coconut water, a dish that brings comfort, warmth and the taste of Tết.
🥗Dưa cải và giá (Pickled mustard green & mung bean sprouts) - crunchy, colourful pickles that balance the richness of New Year dishes
This workshop is designed for all ages - beginners, families, food lovers, and anyone curious about Vietnamese culture. Learn the meaning behind each dish and how they come together on every Vietnamese New Year table.
💛 Why Join?
• Experience authentic Vietnamese Tết traditions
• Learn recipes passed down through generations
• Connect with community through shared stories and food
• Take home what you cook
• Celebrate culture in a warm, hands-on environment
Sponsored & partnered with Pomare Taita Community Trust, E Tū Whānau & Hutt City Council.

events.id: Gallop Into the New Year: Lunar Celebrations in the Hutt-45 Laings Road, Hutt Central, Lower Hutt 5010, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: Gallop Into the New Year: Lunar Celebrations in the Hutt
events.venue: 45 Laings Road, Hutt Central, Lower Hutt 5010, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Gallop Into the New Year: Lunar Celebrations in the Hutt 🐎
Proudly sponsored by Hutt City Council
📍 Dowse Square & Lower Hutt Town Hall
📅 Saturday, 31 January 2026
🕚 11:00 AM – 4:00 PM
Join us for a colourful, family-friendly Lunar New Year Festival in the heart of Lower Hutt!
Organised by Viet Hub NZ and proudly sponsored by Hutt City Council, this outdoor cultural festival celebrates not only Vietnamese Tết but also embraces wider Lunar New Year traditions from diverse communities across Aotearoa.
Let’s gallop into the Year of the Horse together through music, food, stories, and joyful celebration!
🎭 What to Expect:
Outdoor Cultural Market: Featuring authentic street food, handmade crafts, and local community stalls
Live Stage Performances: Lion dance, drumming, cultural dances, and musical acts throughout the day
Cultural Games & Crafts: Hands-on activities like calligraphy, lantern making, and Vietnamese folk games
Storytelling Exhibition: An indoor showcase of migration stories, heritage, and identity from local residents
Traditional Costume Photo Corner: Indoor area to take photos in Vietnamese and cultural New Year outfits
Family Fun: Face painting, interactive workshops, lucky draws, and more.
🎟️ Tickets:
Free General Admission – Register to stay updated and be entered in giveaways
Optional Donation – Help us grow this community-led festival and support ongoing Viet Hub NZ programme
💛 Why You Should Come:
This is Lower Hutt’s largest, most inclusive Lunar New Year celebration, designed for all ages and backgrounds. Whether you’re reconnecting with your heritage or discovering new traditions — everyone is welcome.
📢 Stay Connected:
Follow us on Facebook or visit www.viethubnz.org
📧 Contact us: hello@viethubnz.org
🫶 This event is made possible thanks to the generous support of Hutt City Council and our amazing volunteers, artists, and community partners.

events.id: Scallop Shell Zine Making Workshop: SOLD OUT-National Library of New Zealand, 70 Molesworth Street, Thorndon, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Scallop Shell Zine Making Workshop: SOLD OUT
events.venue: National Library of New Zealand, 70 Molesworth Street, Thorndon, Wellington
events.long_description:
Join artist Cora-Allan (Ngāpuhi, Ngātitumutumu and Niue: Alofi, Liku) for a hands-on zine-making workshop. During a research trip to Massachusetts, Cora-Allan discovered scallop shell books historically used by women to archive seaweed and botanical finds. Drawing on this tradition, participants will create their own zines bound in scallop shells, exploring experimental ways of recording mauri and wairua from the natural world.

All materials are supplied. This is a one-hour session and spaces are limited—book your ticket today to secure your spot!

IMAGE Scallop pukapuka (2025) Photo courtesy of artist

events.id: Black Sheep Animal Sanctuary Open Day 25/26-Black Sheep Animal Sanctuary, Black Sheep Animal Sanctuary, Ōtaki-Event Finder
events.name: Black Sheep Animal Sanctuary Open Day 25/26
events.venue: Black Sheep Animal Sanctuary, Black Sheep Animal Sanctuary, Ōtaki
events.long_description:
Join us for a Tour of the Sanctuary

Open days include a tour of the sanctuary to meet the animals, learn about them, their stories and how we look after them, followed by a vegan afternoon tea. Money raised from ticket sales help us with the ongoing care of our animals. We will also happily accept donations of fruit, veggies, or hay for the animals.

Please note open days are weather dependent and in the event of rain we will normally rearrange to the following saturday.

Please arrive between 12:30 and 1pm- bring strong closed-toe footwear, sunblock, and clothing for all weather. No animal food products are allowed on the sanctuary grounds as we are a human vegan space. Sadly, dogs are not welcome as we have a lot of vulnerable animals on site. Depending on the weather, your clothing and footwear might get muddy, so please wear clothing that isn’t too precious.

If you have questions about accessibility please these questions email us before you arrive. Unfortunately, the sanctuary is not wheelchair accessible.

Make a day of it!- we are 5 mins away from some lovely river spots on the Ōtaki river and 20 mins from Ōtaki town and beach.

events.id: Nature/gesture-211 Left Bank, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: Nature/gesture
events.venue: 211 Left Bank, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
This workshop with artist Sena Park aims to create an open dialogue with participants, who will be led by Sena in sharing experiences with nature before creating their own simple written and visual responses to her prompts. Nature/gesture will be guided by the themes in this exhibition, such as our evolving relationship with nature and the blurry line between natural and artificial environments.
From 1pm—2:30pm you will be encouraged to share kōrero and transform objects from everyday life into simple artistic expressions. Please bring your own small found objects from your garden or home to use during the workshop, though we will also supply paper, pens, and some craft materials.

FREE
REGISTRATION REQUIRED.

events.id: Woody Fruit-fest - Guided Walk-Wellington Botanic Garden, 101 Glenmore St, Kelburn, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Woody Fruit-fest - Guided Walk
events.venue: Wellington Botanic Garden, 101 Glenmore St, Kelburn, Wellington
events.long_description:
In this one-hour downhill walk we will enjoy one of the legacies of Wellington’s past summers, namely the often-ignored ‘smorgasbord’ of woody fruit structures. A close-up look at these structures will reveal a wide variety of mechanisms for fruit formation, protection, and dispersal.

Meet at the Cable Car Entrance Lookout, Upland Road, Kelburn.
Cost: $10 - book now
Free for Friends

This is part of the regular walks run by the Friends of the Wellington Botanic Garden. They run throughout the year with a different topic every time.
Join the Friends for only $30 a year and all the walks will be free, as well as other great benefits.

events.venue: level 3/22 Garrett Street, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Join Coveted Jewellery's exclusive workshop in Wellington.
Workshops dates are limited in 2026. 
Design your own sterling silver ring. In just a couple of hours, you’ll go from inspiration to creation, designing and carving your very own wax ring or pendant model. Our experienced jewellers will be there to guide you through every step, whether you're a first-timer or a seasoned artist. Once your wax design is complete, we’ll take care of casting and finishing it in sterling silver, and courier to your doorstep within 2-4 weeks. 
Quotes to upgrade to gold or add a stone are available on the day.
*We cannot give you an accurate estimate for casting in gold prior to your wax model being finished because we calculate the cost based on weight and gold prices are also subject to change daily. Thank you for your understanding.
Workshop Details:
Dates: One-off session dates usually scheduled monthly.
Time: Saturdays, 2.30-5 pm
Location: Wellington Studio, situated on level 3, 22 Garrett St, Te Aro
Cost: $280 (Includes all materials, tools, and delivery for a piece of jewellery cast in sterling silver weighing up to 12gms)

This workshop is a fantastic way to create a personal piece of jewellery that you can wear and cherish forever. With only 8-10 spots available per session.

We can't wait to see what you create. 
The Coveted Team x

events.id: The Real Love Musical Screening- Wellington-Wellington Central Baptist Church, 46-48 Boulcott Street, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: The Real Love Musical Screening- Wellington
events.venue: Wellington Central Baptist Church, 46-48 Boulcott Street, Wellington
events.long_description:
Free Event!

The Real Love Musical screening is coming to Wellington!!

Join us for a wonderful afternoon as we present this incredible, uplifting story with stellar cast including Joanna Ampil as Thanh (Les Miserables, Miss Saigon, Jesus Christ Superstar, Cats etc) and a beautiful score by Tony, Oscar, Grammy and Emmy award winning composers.

The musical is inspired by the true story of a woman propelled to make a heartrending decision as she embarks on what seems a destined journey travelling through India and the Himalayas, encountering adventure, danger, and surprises along the way.

The unforgettable story is sure to bring tears, laughter, and poignant memories for audiences of all backgrounds.

Light vegan refreshments (snacks and tea/coffee) are complementary and we will have a selection of Supreme Master Ching Hai's books and poetry available for viewing (the songs in the musical are set to this extraordinary poetry).

Don't miss this uplifting FREE event. Alongside Joanna Ampil the musical features an all star cast - Adam Pascal, Robert Torti, Faith Riveira, Shirley Jones, Daisy Eagan, Cady Huffman and more. Music by Oscar & 5-time Emmy winner Bill Conti (“Rocky”), 2-time Oscar winner Al Kasha (“The Poseidon Adventure”), Emmy nominee Doug Katsaros, Tony & Emmy winner Don Pippin (“Oliver!”), and Oscar & 2-time Grammy winner David Shire (“Baby”). The Director is Chris Shelton for this superb musical and the outstanding Choreographer is Mark Knowles.

Reserve your seats today!

The unforgettable story is sure to bring tears, laughter, and poignant memories for audiences of all backgrounds.
Light vegan refreshments (snacks and tea/coffee) are complementary and we will have a selection of Supreme Master Ching Hai's books and poetry available for viewing (the songs in the musical are set to this extraordinary poetry).
Don't miss this uplifting FREE event.

events.id: Nervous System Support-Pump Dance Studio, 302 Taranaki St, Te Aro, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Nervous System Support
events.venue: Pump Dance Studio, 302 Taranaki St, Te Aro, Wellington
events.long_description:
Nervous System Support is a gentle, practical introduction to understanding and working with your body’s stress response.

In this 50-minute experiential workshop, you’ll learn simple, science-informed tools to help your nervous system settle and feel safer in everyday life. Together we’ll explore how stress shows up in the body, why “calming down” isn’t always as easy as it sounds, and what actually helps the nervous system shift.

You’ll be guided through a series of accessible practices, including:

- Orienting to your environment for safety and presence

- Squeeze and release to discharge tension

- Havening touch for self-soothing

- The physiological sigh for rapid calming

- Gentle movement to music

- A guided, body-based meditation

- Time to re-orient and integrate


An optional sharing circle to reflect and connect

This is not about “fixing” yourself. It’s about learning to listen to your body, build capacity, and create small moments of safety that accumulate over time.

You’ll leave with tools you can use at home, at work, or in moments of overwhelm — no special equipment or experience required.

Come as you are. Move as little or as much as feels right. You are always in choice.

It would benefit everyone's experience if you arrive before 4:00 pm so we may start on time.


Please bring:

- A yoga mat or blanket for the meditation (bring any other supports that provide you with comfort or safety)

- A journal and a pen

- Water and a snack for after the workshop


Important note:
This workshop is designed for people who are generally resourced and able to self-ground. It is not suitable for anyone currently experiencing a manic episode, in acute crisis, or with untreated complex PTSD.

Nervous system work can sometimes surface uncomfortable sensations, emotions, or memories. This is a natural part of being human and of working with the body. For this reason, participants need to have the capacity to return to a sense of safety on their own and have support available outside the session if needed.

This event is educational and experiential in nature and is not a substitute for therapy or mental health care.

events.id: Comedy Q&A with Michele A'Court-The Fringe Bar, 26 Allen Street, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Comedy Q&A with Michele A'Court
events.venue: The Fringe Bar, 26 Allen Street, Wellington
events.long_description:
Wellington Comedy's next Comedy Q&A is with Michele A'Court, a casual chat about her career in comedy, writing, film and tv.

Michele has been part of New Zealand’s entertainment industry since she first appeared on television in 1987 as a children’s TV presenter.

In the years since she has worked in radio, theatre and television, and was an original member of the team of comedians who brought the hit TV show, “7 Days” to our screens. She performs live in pubs and clubs everywhere from the Laugh Factory in Las Vegas to the Mangawhai Tavern in Northland. Michele won “NZ Female Comedian of the Decade” in 2010, and was presented with the VAC Reilly Comedy Award for Excellence in 2015.

The bar will be open, so bring some cash, some questions, and we'll be good to go.

All welcome.

events.id: Coven: Butch-Sweet Axe Throwing Co., 60 Kent Terrace, Te Aro, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Coven: Butch
events.venue: Sweet Axe Throwing Co., 60 Kent Terrace, Te Aro, Wellington
events.long_description:
For butches and butch lovers! This night sets to make two things clear:

1. We love butches!
2. Get enough sapphics and queers in a room and anything can become a competition

Join us for axe throwing, games, kai, and as always at our events impeccable vibes. Spot prizes for the best butches, drink on arrival, and a room full of hot babes? Need we say more, so get your fits checked and grab your ticket before they go. This event has limited capacity.

Not a butch? No problem, all butch and butch appreciating Coven members of all flavours welcome.

No dress code! Come as you are, celebrate butch fashion or your queer identity and expect a fun chill night with your community.

More info about Coven:

Coming Solo? You’re Not Alone.
Don’t be nervous if you’re planning to come on your own – Coven is built for connection. Whether it’s your first queer event or your hundredth, you’ll be surrounded by a community that gets it. From the moment you arrive, there’ll be friendly faces, welcoming vibes, and plenty of chances to mingle, and connect. Coven is about belonging – and there’s a place here for you.

Coven Kaupapa
For queer women and gender minorities, spaces like this are rare, vital, and sometimes, life-changing. In a world that constantly centers cishet norms, Coven offers a space where we are the default – where you can fully show up as yourself, be seen, celebrated and surrounded by YOUR community.

For many in our Coven, this is one of the only opportunities we feel comfortable enough to experience nightlife free from the male gaze, tokenism, fear, or the need to shrink ourselves to fit in. It’s a space where sapphic, trans, nonbinary, and gender-diverse people aren’t just welcomed – we are centered. It’s for those who are often pushed to the margins, who rarely feel represented in “inclusive” spaces that still cater to the mainstream.

This night exists because we need it – and because we create it, together.

Accessibility
This event is located on the ground floor. Have specific accessibility needs? Reach out directly to the Whisky & Wood team at hello@whiskyandwood.co.nz

If you made it this far... Good girl / Good they / Good boy / Good YOU!

events.id: Star Sense: Find Your Way by the Stars-Star Safari Observatory, 1169 Ponatahi Road, Carterton-Event Finder
events.name: Star Sense: Find Your Way by the Stars
events.venue: Star Safari Observatory, 1169 Ponatahi Road, Carterton
events.long_description:
Learn the ancient art of celestial navigation under one of the world’s best night skies.

This Summer of Space, Star Safari invites you to rediscover something humanity once knew instinctively — how to read the night sky as a living map.

Under Wairarapa’s internationally celebrated dark skies (featured by Lonely Planet as one of the world’s top stargazing destinations), you’ll learn how explorers, navigators, and storytellers used the stars to orient themselves, travel across oceans, understand seasons, and pass knowledge through generations.

Guided by Hari Mogoșanu — TEDx speaker, former NASA intern, and creator of the planetarium film Ngā Tohunga Whakatere — you’ll gain practical, confidence-building skills in southern-sky star-literacy:

You’ll learn how to:
- Find south using stars and sky geometry
- Identify the key constellations of the summer sky
- Trace the Milky Way and understand its structure
- Read seasonal sky patterns and stellar motion
- Tell planets from stars
- Navigate using asterisms and star-hops
- See the sky through multiple cultural perspectives
- Understand dark-sky ethics and the importance of gentle lighting

This experience focuses on unaided stargazing — learning to understand the sky with your own eyes. By the end of the night, you’ll be able to step outside, recognise what you see, and use the stars to find direction anywhere in the world.

What’s included:
Guided instruction, southern-sky star map, orientation techniques, constellation recognition, navigation principles, cultural stories, dark-sky awareness, Q&A.

Recommended age: 10+
Duration: 2.5 hours

Come and learn the ancient skill of sky navigation — and leave with a deeper sense of place in the cosmos.

Star Sense. Find Your Way by the Stars.

events.id: Juna with The Jays Jays and The Side Charcters-Colombo Street &, Rintoul Street, Newtown, Wellington 6021, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: Juna with The Jays Jays and The Side Charcters
events.venue: Colombo Street &, Rintoul Street, Newtown, Wellington 6021, New Zealand
events.long_description:
HEY WE'RE JUNA AND WE'RE HOSTING AN ALL AGE GIG AT NEW TOWN COMMUNITY CENTRE ON THE 31ST OF JANUARY!!!!
This is an all ages alcohol free event bringing you some of the best up and coming local bands Wellington has to offer. events.id: Alex Seel and Jon Sanders (UK) @ Wellington Bluegrass Society-Abandoned Taproom Petone, 38 Fitzherbert St, Petone, Lower Hutt-Event Finder
events.name: Alex Seel and Jon Sanders (UK) @ Wellington Bluegrass Society
events.venue: Abandoned Taproom Petone, 38 Fitzherbert St, Petone, Lower Hutt
events.long_description:
“Make no mistake, the audience raved about the sheer scope of musical interplay and different genres… Sanders with his jazz tinged Irish, Arabesque and world music solos, brought the sonorous experience of compositions from the British song-writer’s new album with almost unbelievable changes in tempo, accompanied masterfully by Seel’s impressive guitar… The audience loved Seel’s folk, pop and blues influenced songs and duos with Sanders”
- RheinZeit, Germany

Music has led Alex Seel from Devon to London to Ireland and back to London again. Through his wanderings, Alex has picked up a finely crafted, rootsy songwriting style with thought provoking lyrics and a flare for acoustic guitar finger picking. His influences range from blues, pop and the British folk revival guitarists, but his sound is all his own. He has a growing reputation as a solo performer, having performed around the UK, Ireland, Italy, Germany and Spain.

Jon Sanders is recognised as a virtuoso bouzouki player, tenor ukulele player, drop D and DADGAD guitarist and an internationally acclaimed composer. His compositions draw on elements of jazz, gypsy, funk, Arabic, Latino and Celtic styles, somewhat reminiscent of Sylvain Luc, Pierre Bensusan, Antonio Forcione and James Hill - yet instantly different.

Both were based in Dingle in Kerry, but in different scenes. But only later on started playing in the UK first at the Didsbury Festival, then did couple of other festivals and it went down really well… the chemistry of the duo, complementing each other with symbiotic dynamism, with sensitivity in each others music. Both are long time professional musicians. Jon has been performing in NZ for 20 years, however this is Alex’es first time in NZ.

events.id: SUMAC-Valhalla, Wellington-Valhalla
events.name: SUMAC
events.venue: Valhalla, Wellington
events.long_description:
Banished Music, Whammy Bar, and Valhalla are proud to present the long-awaited New Zealand debut of experimental post-metal trio SUMAC.
Formed in 2014, the powerhouse trio comprised of Aaron Turner (guitar, vocals; Isis, Old Man Gloom), Brian Cook (bass; Russian Circles, Botch), and Nick Yacyshyn (drums; Baptists) are renowned for merging crushing heaviness with improvisational freedom, exploring the boundaries between structure and chaos.
SUMAC have built a reputation as a fearsome live band. Visceral and cathartic shows where crushing riffs & sprawling drones collide with extended bursts of wild improvisation. In 2024, the band released their critically acclaimed album The Healer, a sweeping, transformative work spanning four monumental tracks. The record dives deep into themes of regeneration, suffering, and spiritual reconstruction — a testament to the band’s ability to meld raw power with emotional depth.
The experimental metal trio’s four-song, 76-minute album is the peak of their career. It’s dense and invigorating, highlighting the band’s dexterity, creativity, and clarity of purpose. - Pitchfork
Soon after the release SUMAC teamed up with poet and sound artist Moor Mother to release The Film, a boundary-pushing collaborative album. Released via Thrill Jockey in April 2025, the record unfolds as a cinematic journey across eight “scenes,” merging SUMAC’s heavy, jazz-inflected textures with Moor Mother’s incisive spoken-word commentary.
SUMAC’s work has always been about transition between different states of being. Our sense of normal, and indeed our sense of life, is now being shaken. We don’t know what is coming next. We are looking for pointers towards the future, as well as things to hold onto in the moment.
New Zealanders, don’t miss this rare and powerful journey into uncharted sonic terrain.

events.id: River City Express-Paekakariki Railway Station,Paekakariki, Paekakariki , New Zealand-All Events In
events.name: River City Express
events.venue: Paekakariki Railway Station,Paekakariki, Paekakariki , New Zealand
events.long_description:
River City Express
Travel to the beautiful river side town of Whanganui, hauled by both steam locomotive Ab 608 and diesel locomotive Da 1410. Choose between doing your own thing, or jumping on a serene cruise of the Whanganui River onboard the coal fired paddle steamer "PS Waimarie".

Leaving Kapiti as most others are still sound asleep, we quickly escape the coast and delve into the rurality of the Horowhenua. After a stop in Palmerston North we head up the trunk through the townships of Feilding and Marton before turning onto the Marton - New Plymouth railway line for the last stretch into Whanganui. After crossing the 290km long Whanganui River, we proceed slowly down the short 5km branch line taking us to Taupo Quay.

TRAVEL ON THE PADDLE STEAMER WAIMARIE!
Salvaged from the bottom of the Whanganui River where she sat for around 50 years, the Paddle Steamer Waimarie was restored to her former glory and re-launched in 2000. She is now the only one of her kind in operation in New Zealand. Your cruise leaves the Riverboat Centre Wharf and heads upriver taking in the scenery and views of Whanganui which can only be experienced from Te Awa Tupua, the Whanganui River. The commentary shares riverboat history and points of interest along the way. Check out the boiler that powers our paddle steamer, and maybe meet the homing pigeons and send a message with them on their flight back to the Riverboat Centre.

Departing Paekakariki/Paraparaumu/Waikanae/Otaki/Levin
Adult 13+ yrs - $209
Child 2-12yrs - $179

Departing Palmerston North/Feilding
Adult 13+ yrs - $189
Child 2-12yrs - $169

Buses will transport you from your arrival at the station to the Waimarie River Boat Centre.

DO YOUR OWN THING!
There will be a collection of vintage cruiser bikes for hire for a small fee to those keen to take exploring to the next level.

There will be short tours available at the Durie Hill Elevator. It is New Zealand’s only public transport elevator and is still used on a daily basis by locals and visitors.

There are multiple places to go, and things to see on a cruiser bike or on foot. Take a tram ride for a small fee and arrive at the Riverboat museum, be blown away by NZ Glassworks, admire the sculptures and views from the Motua gardens along the river, indulge in local cuisine, or simply shop local.

Departing Paekakariki/Paraparaumu/Waikanae/Otaki/Levin
Adult 13+ yrs - $159
Child 2-12yrs - $139

Departing Palmerston North/Feilding
Adult 13+ yrs - $139
Child 2-12yrs - $119

Book at https://steaminc.org.nz/book-train-trip/river-city-express/

Choose between doing your own thing, or jumping on a serene cruise of the Whanganui River onboard the coal fired paddle steamer "PS Waimarie".
Leaving Kapiti as most others are still sound asleep, we quickly escape the coast and delve into the rurality of the Horowhenua.
She is now the only one of her kind in operation in New Zealand.
There will be a collection of vintage cruiser bikes for hire for a small fee to those keen to take exploring to the next level.

Otaki Market - February
Nau Mai Haere Mai, meet you at the Market. 🌞
Discover a vibrant outdoor market nestled on State Highway One in Ōtaki, just across from New World. Join us to greet our regular stallholders and special guests from the community.
---

PARKING
There is plenty of free parking available at the Otaki train station.
Main Highway is a perfect spot for customers to the market
60 Minute Parking zone behind Riverstone Cafe.

CASH / ATM
Some vendors have eftpos, and all take cash. There is an ATM located on the main highway.

FOOD VENDORS
And when hunger strikes, our lineup of food trucks and stalls is ready to tantalize your taste buds. From waffles to hangi, seafood chowder to fry bread, sausage sizzles, and a delectable assortment of rice, noodles, and home baking – a feast awaits.

BUSKER
We often have an awesome busker, who'll be playing chilled out middle of the road tunes.

🎨 Art & Craft
🌳 Native trees, flowers and plants
🍶 Candles, soaps and wax melts
🕰️ Antiques and collectables
🍯 Produce, including yummy honey!
👚 Pre-love clothing, shoes and accessories
⚒️ Tools for the home and garden
🧸 Toys and books for tamariki

Come for the finds, stay for the flavor.
---

STALL HOLDERS
Would you like to be a stall holder?
Join our market family, fill out the enquiry form: www.otakiwomensclub.org/stall-holder

events.id: Vietnamese Art Exhibition: Những Miền Đất Nhớ | Lands We Remember-Wellington, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: Vietnamese Art Exhibition: Những Miền Đất Nhớ | Lands We Remember
events.venue: Wellington, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Những Miền Đất Nhớ (Lands We Remember) is a Vietnamese contemporary art exhibition by respected artist Đặng Mậu Tựu, proudly presented as part of Viet Hub NZ’s Lunar New Year (Tết) Festival 2026.
This exhibition shares the journey of an artist from another country and culture who immersed himself in life in Aotearoa New Zealand. Through approximately 30 original artworks, he reflects on how two worlds - Vietnam and Aotearoa - meet, overlap, and quietly converse. The works explore cultural memory, identity, belonging, and the emotional experience of living between homelands.
Created during the artist’s stay in New Zealand, these paintings offer an intimate, lived perspective - capturing moments of connection, unfamiliarity, and shared humanity through a deeply Vietnamese artistic lens. This exhibition is both a cultural bridge and a personal story told through art.
This is Viet Hub NZ’s first Vietnamese community art exhibition, created with care, whānau values, and a strong commitment to accessibility and cross-cultural understanding. Whether you love art, culture, storytelling, or simply discovering new perspectives, Những Miền Đất Nhớ invites you to pause, reflect, and connect.
events.description:

This exhibition shares the journey of an artist from another country and culture who immersed himself in life in Aotearoa New Zealand.
Through approximately 30 original artworks, he reflects on how two worlds - Vietnam and Aotearoa - meet, overlap, and quietly converse.
The works explore cultural memory, identity, belonging, and the emotional experience of living between homelands.

events.id: Ludovico Einaudi-Michael Fowler Centre, Wellington, New Zealand-Wellington NZ
events.name: Ludovico Einaudi
events.venue: Michael Fowler Centre, Wellington, New Zealand
events.long_description:
His music has been performed live on an Arctic ice-floe and as soundtracks for Oscar and Golden Globe-winning films. Italian pianist and composer Ludovico Einaudi is returning to Wellington with a new album to explore with audiences. The Michael Fowler Centre will be filled with Ludovico’s special mix of neo-classical, pop, ambient, rock, and experimental styles. His modern soundscapes are renowned for being able to cross artistic and generational boundaries. Because of this, he has become one of the world’s most-streamed classical music artists. 
Ludovico began composing in the 1980s for theatre and ballet. He has since gone on to write for film and television and produce multi-million-selling albums. His most recent is ‘The Summer Portraits’. Written in 2025, it is the result of a cascade of personal memories triggered by sun, summer, and family holidays. Here, he returns to the lush full-band textures of earlier works. You’ll get to hear this first-hand, so don’t miss your chance.

events.id: LAMMAS FULL MOON SONG AND SOUND CEREMONY-Paraparaumu Memorial Hall-All Events In
events.name: LAMMAS FULL MOON SONG AND SOUND CEREMONY
events.venue: Paraparaumu Memorial Hall
events.long_description:
LAMMAS FULL MOON SONG AND SOUND CEREMONY
Come and Sing, Sound and Meditate!

Want to mark the important time of the JANUARY/ fEBRUARY LAMMAS full moon? Lammas is the Celtic festival of the first Harvest.

Come and join with us on Sunday the 1st February for a group ceremonial gathering in Paraparaumu.

We will explore sacred conscious sounding practices to balance and align the energy system, sing healing chants and songs from different traditions, and explore guided vocal improvisation for freedom, upliftment and joy!

Ceremonial cacao will be served with focus and healing intention.

There will be guided journal prompts around the energy of the Solstice and the whole session will finish with a full sound healing.

Everyone is welcome and there is no need for any particular preparation or pre existing skill.

Please get in touch with any questions or to book. Come and enjoy Song, Chant, Sound and Healing!!

So looking forward to gathering for the Lammas Full Moon. Come and join with us to invoke and celebrate the energies of balance, creation, abundance and celebration at this profound time of year.

This session will explore singing, chanting, sounding and conscious voice empowerment practices. We will also explore energy practices like Qigong and meditation. All within a ceremonial framework.

Everyone is welcome. Limited spaces. Get in touch soon

You are warmly invited to book to join this powerful sound and voice ceremony which will work with Spirit, the forces of Nature and Bryony's skill and expertise in creating sound for growth and transformation.

This is a special opportunity to tune into the sacred energies and potentialities of this time: opening us up to balance, healing, nourishment, new growth and positive change.

Bryony will invoke and work with the healing power of the supportive energies of Spirit, ancestors and our highest Selves. Bryony's has an extensive background experience with Spirit, the Earth forces and sacred lands; these forces are central to her practice and Self.

She will lead you firstly in a process of meditation, conscious sounding, toning and singing healing chants.

This use of our voices to co-create a sacred group sound is uplifting and transformative and will support you in your process of healing, releasing and visioning.

There will be time for guided journaling and intention setting.

The second section of the workshop will be a focused and dedicated sound bath which will bring balance and deep relaxation, into a sense of stillness and peace. There can be a sense of gratitude and appreciation.

Both the conscious use of the voice and the sound healing have many benefits, which are verified by science and which can effect us positively on the physical, mental, emotional, energetic and spiritual levels. A document which has more information about these benefits can be provided on request.

All are welcome:
I look forward to sharing with you and supporting you in this ceremony.

Investment for full 2.5 hours

$77 - full price - https://buy.stripe.com/bIY9Ep67A00xdwYcND

$59 - concession - https://buy.stripe.com/8wMaItcvY6oV0Kc7ti

Please contact me if finances are a challenge for you and we can make it work for you to join.

events.name: RSC Sunday Session: Cammy
events.venue: The Raumati Social Club,34 Poplar Ave, Raumati South, Paraparaumu 5032, New Zealand, Paraparaumu
events.long_description:
RSC Sunday Session: Cammy
Join us on July 6th as local muso Cammy takes over the stage at RSC!
Get ready for a cruisy stripped-back set with powerhouse vocals, vibey guitar, and all your favorite hits from across the decades combined with Cammy's original indie tunes.

Cammy is a dynamic pop and R&B performer known for his soulful vocals, smooth guitar work, and magnetic stage presence. Based in Kāpiti, he’s become a favourite across bars, restaurants, and weddings nationwide, delivering cover sets that blend the best pop hits and crowd favourites from every era.
With rich vocal tones, a lush falsetto, and an impressive range, Cammy brings a fresh energy to each performance—whether it’s a chilled afternoon session or a packed night of singalongs. His sets are built around connection, rhythm, and feel-good moments, ensuring every audience leaves with a smile and a song in their head.
Alongside his extensive cover repertoire, Cammy also performs original material, showcasing his artistry and versatility beyond the stage.

events.id: River City Express-Paekakariki Railway Station, Tilley Road, Paekākāriki-Event Finder
events.name: River City Express
events.venue: Paekakariki Railway Station, Tilley Road, Paekākāriki
events.long_description:
Travel to the beautiful riverside town of Whanganui, hauled by both steam locomotive Ab 608 and heritage diesel electric locomotive Da 1410. Choose between doing your own thing or jumping on a serene cruise of the Whanganui River on board the coal-fired paddle steamer "PS Waimarie".

Leaving Kapiti, as most others are still sound asleep, we quickly escape the coast and delve into the rurality of the Horowhenua. After a stop in Palmerston North, we head up the trunk through the townships of Feilding and Marton before turning onto the Marton - New Plymouth railway line for the last stretch into Whanganui. After crossing the 290km long Whanganui River, we proceed slowly down the short 5km branch line taking us to Taupo Quay.

From here, it's up to you what you wish to do!

- Sail On The Queen Of The River - Waimarie
This option includes a river cruise aboard the coal-fired paddle steamer Waimarie, restored after around 50 years submerged. The cruise features commentary on Whanganui’s river history, and you can view the boiler and possibly send a message via homing pigeon. The fare covers return train travel, bus transfers, and the cruise.

Departing Paekakariki/Paraparaumu/Waikanae/Otaki/Levin
Adult 13+ yrs - $209
Child 2-12yrs - $179

Departing Palmerston North/Feilding
Adult 13+ yrs - $189
Child 2-12yrs - $169

An Artisan Lunch for Two - $35 add-on

OR

- Do Your Own Thing & Explore Whanganui
You’ll be transferred by bus to the Riverboat Centre and can explore Whanganui on foot or by hiring a vintage cruiser bike. Attractions include the Durie Hill Elevator, Riverboat Museum, NZ Glassworks, Motua Gardens, and local shops and eateries. A tram ride is also available for a small fee. This option includes train fare and bus transfers.

Fares
Departing Paekakariki/Paraparaumu/Waikanae/Otaki/Levin
Adult 13+ yrs - $159
Child 2-12yrs - $139

Departing Palmerston North/Feilding
Adult 13+ yrs - $139
Child 2-12yrs - $119

-Evening Meal
Sandy and the team at the Station Hotel will be on hand to provide an evening meal at your seat on departure from Marton.
Being served is a tasty chicken salad main, a freshly baked mini baguette, along with a sweet chocolate brownie to cleanse the palate!
Vegans, Vegetarians and gluten-free options available, and if there are any allergies, please let us know when booking!
$30 per person to add this to your booking.

events.id: Gong Bath at Vogelmorn Hall-Vogelmorn Hall,13 Vennell St, Brooklyn, Wellington 6021, New Zealand, Wellington-All Events In
events.name: Gong Bath at Vogelmorn Hall
events.venue: Vogelmorn Hall,13 Vennell St, Brooklyn, Wellington 6021, New Zealand, Wellington
events.long_description:
Gong Bath at Vogelmorn Hall
$20 -tickets via link: https://events.humanitix.com/copy-of-gong-bath-at-vogelmorn-hall/tickets

*Limited door sales for $25*

*Please bring a yoga mat, pillow, eye mask and blanket - or whatever it is you need to feel most warm and comfortable *

Discover the transformative effects of sound therapy with this 1-hour gong bath experience.

During this session, participants will be surrounded by the resonant vibrations of gongs, carefully designed to induce deep states of relaxation and calm. As you settle into the experience, allow the soothing tones to wash over you, releasing tension and promoting a sense of inner peace.

Scientific studies have highlighted the benefits of sound therapy, particularly gong baths, in reducing stress and promoting overall well-being. The rhythmic patterns and overtones of the gongs can help entrain brainwaves, leading to a meditative state and improved mental clarity.

Beyond the immediate effects, many participants report experiencing lasting benefits such as improved sleep, reduced anxiety, and enhanced mood following a gong bath session. By immersing yourself in the healing vibrations of the gongs, you can tap into a deeper sense of relaxation and rejuvenation.

Whether you're looking to unwind after a long day or explore new avenues of self-care, this 1-hour gong bath offers a unique opportunity to reconnect with yourself and find balance amidst the hustle and bustle of daily life. There will be cups of tea available afterwards to help us integrate and ground.

**THIS EVENT IS RESTRICTED TO 40 PEOPLE ONLY**

Disclaimer
Gong baths are safe and supportive for most people. However, please consult your doctor or mental health professional before attending if you:

-have a pacemaker or other implanted medical device
-live with epilepsy or a sound-sensitive condition
-are in the first trimester of pregnancy
-are experiencing severe or unmanaged mental health challenges (such as psychosis, schizophrenia, or PTSD)

If you have recent injuries, surgeries, or other health concerns, let me know so we can make sure you’re comfortable.

Everyone responds differently to sound. If at any point during the session you feel overwhelmed or uncomfortable, you are welcome to sit up, move gently, or step outside. Your wellbeing always comes first.

🔔About Me🔔
Erika is a musician and astrologer based in Te Whanganui-a-Tara. She has 35+ years musical experience. Erika has an interest in the healing properties of sound for mental and physical wellbeing, which she currently explores through her gong bathing practice

events.id: Friends of Karori Cemetery: Introductory Tour (Feb 2026)-76 Old Karori Road, Karori, Wellington 6012, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: Friends of Karori Cemetery: Introductory Tour (Feb 2026)
events.venue: 76 Old Karori Road, Karori, Wellington 6012, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Introductory Tour. 
This tour outlines the development of Karori Cemetery since the first burial in August 1891, traversing the earliest burial areas which contain many interesting memorials and monuments. 
Each tour is $10 per person (plus non-refundable booking fee). Children under 12 are free.
Our tour has a maximum capacity of about 15 persons. If there are insufficient tickets remaining for your party, please email us at info@friendsofkaroricemetery.co.nz to check if we can accommodate you.
Please note:
If we have to cancel a tour due to inclement weather or sickness, we will notify you on the day 1 hour before the tour starts by email and on our Facebook page. The booking fee is non-refundable.
This tour is approximately one hour long.
Please dress appropriately for the conditions. While we do our best to guide you on a safe walking route, during the winter months the ground can become slippery in places.
Some of our walks require a moderate degree of fitness and are not suited for those with limited mobility.
There is only one toilet which is located by the cemetery office at the main entrance.
If you have purchased tickets for other people can you please pass our tour information on to them as well.
Please meet us at the shelter (shown as the Historic Chapel on the map at the main entrance)
We look forward to welcoming you to Karori Cemetery.

events.id: Glass Bead-Making Taster-Workspace Ōtaki, 6 Hewson Crescent, Ōtaki-Event Finder
events.name: Glass Bead-Making Taster
events.venue: Workspace Ōtaki, 6 Hewson Crescent, Ōtaki
events.long_description:
Join us for this fabulous introduction to working with colourful molten glass!

This class is a great way for absolute beginners to get a taste of working with glass to produce beautiful beads that can be used in a myriad of ways, including making a unique gift for your loved one (or yourself!).

As one of the earliest forms of human adornment, beads have long functioned as a way to express individuality, and what better way to do that than to learn to make your own unique beads?

Students are shown correct lampworking techniques to produce several decorative beads in just 3 hours! How many beads you make is up to you, some students make up to 10 while others make fewer using trickier techniques.

Kids over 12 (or so) are welcome to take the class but anyone under 16 must be accompanied by an enrolled parent or caregiver.

events.id: Ludovico Einaudi | Wellington - Michael Fowler Centre-Michael Fowler Centre-All Events In
events.name: Ludovico Einaudi | Wellington - Michael Fowler Centre
events.venue: Michael Fowler Centre
events.long_description:
Ludovico Einaudi | Wellington - Michael Fowler Centre
Ludovico Einaudi
Sunday 1 February 2026
Michael Fowler Centre

The world’s most popular classical music composer, Italian pianist, Ludovico Einaudi, returns to Australia and New Zealand this January with his new album The Summer Portraits.

He has performed on an Arctic ice-floe for Greenpeace and has seen his music become the soundtrack for Oscar and Golden Globe winning films ('Les Intouchables', 'Nomadland', 'The Father') and TikTok phenomena (his 2012 track 'Experience' exploded on the app) alike. From his earliest work composing for theatre and ballet in the 1980s to his multi-million-selling albums like 'In a Time Lapse' and his popular soundtracks across film and television, Einaudi has drawn upon neo-classical, pop, ambient, rock and experimental styles to create a sound that crosses boundaries and generations, becoming the world’s best known – and most streamed – classical music artist in the process.

In January 2025, Einaudi released 'The Summer Portraits'. The record is a lush return to full-band textures and is the result of a cascade of personal memories triggered by sun, summer and family holidays. On his last Australian tour, before a gig at the Sydney Opera House, Einaudi sat down and started composing the single 'Rose Bay', based on his sense impressions of the bay his grandfather made home.

Don’t miss your chance to experience the world’s most popular contemporary classical artist.

He has performed on an Arctic ice-floe for Greenpeace and has seen his music become the soundtrack for Oscar and Golden Globe winning films ('Les Intouchables', 'Nomadland', 'The Father') and TikTok phenomena (his 2012 track 'Experience' exploded on the app) alike.
From his earliest work composing for theatre and ballet in the 1980s to his multi-million-selling albums like 'In a Time Lapse' and his popular soundtracks across film and television, Einaudi has drawn upon neo-classical, pop, ambient, rock and experimental styles to create a sound that crosses boundaries and generations, becoming the world’s best known – and most streamed – classical music artist in the process.

events.id: Spin- A Multiformat Movie Marathon-154 Vivian Street, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: Spin- A Multiformat Movie Marathon
events.venue: 154 Vivian Street, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
What this is:
The event is a mystery movie marathon where each film plays on a different home media format over 12 hours from 10am to 10pm. There are three distinct sections, times are approximate. The event is R18, nothing is overly controversial but one film is a horror movie rated R18 for violence and nudity. The line up is subject to change but here is an indication:
Film:
Standard 8mm film - 10 minutes
Super 8mm film - 20 minutes
16mm film -90 minute urban adventure
Analog Video:
Betamax - 90 minute horror
VHS - 90 minute action
Laserdisc- 100 minute scifi action 

Digital Video:
VCD- 100 minutes comedy
DVD - 100 minutes ???
HD-DVD TBC
The film will be played on film projectors, the analog video on a CRT video projector (all going well) and the digital video on a digital video projector. All in either mono or glorious 2.0 stereo sound. Most projection is on a 2 meter wide screen.
There will be a half hour break between the analog and digital video sections. And smaller breaks during some format changeovers.
Seating provided will largely be camping chairs, if you want to bring your own chair you can- and there is a reduced ticket price option. This is intended for normal sized chairs, a camping chair, an office chair etc, not a huge armchair. There is limited space where you could bring your own beanbag up front, but you may be staring up at a sharp angle.

What this isn’t:
This is not polished professional event, it's a little bit improvised. We’re not screening in a regular cinema, we’re screening at Valhalla who are very kindly giving us a dark versatile space to work in. Technical issues may arise and we will keep on rolling, discarding formats and entire films in the line up if we can’t get them running. Some things have back ups, some don’t. No refunds, your ticket price is directly funding the event, and the event is an experiment. You can leave at any time, but please don’t yo-yo in and out every few minutes.
The presentation of the films is experimental, but the films for the most part are narrative drama films, not overly inaccessible.
Valhalla is a licensed venue so please do not bring in alcohol- If you do I will ask you to leave- with no refund! That would be awkward for both of us!

About this Event

Join us for a relaxed, whānau-friendly cyanotype / printing workshop led by exhibiting artist Claudia Jowitt.
Inspired by her exhibition Uana / Carried by the Waves, this hands-on session invites tamariki and adults to play with light, water, and natural materials while learning the simple, magical process of cyanotype printing.
Cyanotype is a sunlight-based printing technique that produces striking blue images. With Claudia’s guidance, you’ll arrange flowers, leaves and other natural shapes—echoing the motifs that flow through Uana — and watch your prints develop before your eyes
.Open to all ages and experience levels, this workshop is a fun, creative moment for the whole whānau. Claudia will also share insights into her practice and the ideas behind Uana / Carried by the Waves, giving you the chance to learn directly from the artist while making your own take-home artwork.

events.id: Georgina Beyer - Diamonds are Forever Walk Tour-St Peter's on Willis, 211 Willis St, Te Aro, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Georgina Beyer - Diamonds are Forever Walk Tour
events.venue: St Peter's on Willis, 211 Willis St, Te Aro, Wellington
events.long_description:
In 2004, Georgina Beyer, the first openly transgender Member of Parliament in the world, famously confronted members of Destiny Church during the Enough Is Enough rally on the grounds of Parliament.

Never a bystander, Georgina faced down the bigots, telling them straight, “Your hatred is totally intolerable!” This was just one of many significant moments that shaped the life of the extraordinary Georgina Beyer.

Born in Wellington, Georgina went on to have an unprecedented local, national and international impact through her commitment to equality and her desire to give everyone the opportunity to reach their full potential in society.

Join us for this special 90-minute walking tour as we pay tribute to the late Georgina (1957–2023) by visiting locations around central Wellington that shaped her journey. Along the way, we’ll honour some of her heroes and listen to first-hand archival audio clips that showcase her humour and resilience.

Georgina’s story is defiantly optimistic – confronting hardship and using her lived experience to change the world for the better.

Accessibility information: the tour is on flat public footpaths. Tours are limited to approximately 20 walkers.

Time/Date: 1pm, Sunday 1 February 2026
Starts: meet outside St Peters Church, 211 Willis Street
Ends: Vivian Street
Duration: 90 minutes
Cost / Bookings: the tour is free but you do need to register

PLEASE REGISTER AT http://book.walktours.nz/
(if there are no registrations the tour won't go ahead)

Image courtesy of the amazing Kym Strathdee

events.id: Saving the Hutt’s Public Art Heritage-The Dowse Art Museum,45 Laings Road, Lower Hutt, New Zealand-All Events In
events.name: Saving the Hutt’s Public Art Heritage
events.venue: The Dowse Art Museum,45 Laings Road, Lower Hutt, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Saving the Hutt’s Public Art Heritage
Public artworks hold stories of place, identity and change. How do we protect and share our heritage?

About this Event

Public artworks are more than simple decoration. They hold stories of place, identity and change. When the spaces around them shift, those stories can be at risk. Who carries responsibility for protecting heritage works, and how do we ensure they remain part of our shared future?
The early spark for The Wheel of Avalon began when artist Bronwyn Holloway-Smith was invited to Avalon TV Studios in her role as Co-Director of Public Art Heritage Aotearoa New Zealand. There, viewing Bill McCardle’s mosaic mural, she reflected: “The story of the mural feels like a metaphor for the rise and fall of Avalon Studios.”
Join Holloway-Smith for an engaging and thought-provoking talk exploring this work alongside a Guy Ngan mural in Naenae and a piece by E. Mervyn Taylor in Taita. Together, these three recent projects reveal different approaches to safeguarding the Hutt’s public art heritage and open a conversation about what proactive, future-focused care and preservation of public art could look like in the years ahead.

Dr Bronwyn Holloway-Smith (Pākehā) is an award-winning conceptual artist, author, and researcher. Her interdisciplinary practice spans public art, digital media and deep-dive research, often focused on the tangled legacies of cultural memory, Pākehā identity, and the politics of preservation. She lives on Pōneke's rugged south coast with her partner and their three offspring.

events.id: Gong Bath at Vogelmorn Hall-13 Vennell Street, Brooklyn, Wellington 6021, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: Gong Bath at Vogelmorn Hall
events.venue: 13 Vennell Street, Brooklyn, Wellington 6021, New Zealand
events.long_description:
$20
Limited door sales for $25
Please bring a yoga mat, pillow, eye mask and blanket - or whatever it is you need to feel most warm and comfortable
Discover the transformative effects of sound therapy with this 1-hour gong bath experience.
During this session, participants will be surrounded by the resonant vibrations of gongs, carefully designed to induce deep states of relaxation and calm. As you settle into the experience, allow the soothing tones to wash over you, releasing tension and promoting a sense of inner peace.
Scientific studies have highlighted the benefits of sound therapy, particularly gong baths, in reducing stress and promoting overall well-being. The rhythmic patterns and overtones of the gongs can help entrain brainwaves, leading to a meditative state and improved mental clarity.
Beyond the immediate effects, many participants report experiencing lasting benefits such as improved sleep, reduced anxiety, and enhanced mood following a gong bath session. By immersing yourself in the healing vibrations of the gongs, you can tap into a deeper sense of relaxation and rejuvenation.
Whether you're looking to unwind after a long day or explore new avenues of self-care, this 1-hour gong bath offers a unique opportunity to reconnect with yourself and find balance amidst the hustle and bustle of daily life. There will be cups of tea available afterwards to help us integrate and ground.
THIS EVENT IS RESTRICTED TO 40 PEOPLE ONLY
About Me
Erika is a musician and astrologer based in Te Whanganui-a-Tara. She has 35+ years musical experience. Erika has an interest in the healing properties of sound for mental and physical wellbeing, which she currently explores through her gong bathing practice

*Limited door sales for $25*

*Please bring a yoga mat, pillow, eye mask and blanket - or whatever it is you need to feel most warm and comfortable *

Discover the transformative effects of sound therapy with this 1-hour gong bath experience.

During this session, participants will be surrounded by the resonant vibrations of gongs, carefully designed to induce deep states of relaxation and calm. As you settle into the experience, allow the soothing tones to wash over you, releasing tension and promoting a sense of inner peace.

Scientific studies have highlighted the benefits of sound therapy, particularly gong baths, in reducing stress and promoting overall well-being. The rhythmic patterns and overtones of the gongs can help entrain brainwaves, leading to a meditative state and improved mental clarity.

Beyond the immediate effects, many participants report experiencing lasting benefits such as improved sleep, reduced anxiety, and enhanced mood following a gong bath session. By immersing yourself in the healing vibrations of the gongs, you can tap into a deeper sense of relaxation and rejuvenation.

Whether you're looking to unwind after a long day or explore new avenues of self-care, this 1-hour gong bath offers a unique opportunity to reconnect with yourself and find balance amidst the hustle and bustle of daily life. **THIS EVENT IS RESTRICTED TO 40 PEOPLE ONLY**

Disclaimer
Gong baths are safe and supportive for most people. However, please consult your doctor or mental health professional before attending if you:
-have a pacemaker or other implanted medical device
-live with epilepsy or a sound-sensitive condition
-are in the first trimester of pregnancy
-are experiencing severe or unmanaged mental health challenges (such as psychosis, schizophrenia, or PTSD)
If you have recent injuries, surgeries, or other health concerns, let me know so we can make sure you’re comfortable.
Everyone responds differently to sound. If at any point during the session you feel overwhelmed or uncomfortable, you are welcome to sit up, move gently, or step outside. Your wellbeing always comes first.
