events.id: Relating in the Dark Wellington-31 Hobson Crescent, Thorndon, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: Relating in the Dark Wellington
events.venue: 31 Hobson Crescent, Thorndon, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Do you long to explore connection beyond the visuals?
After a wonderful series of events in San Francisco, Portland, Amsterdam, Berlin & Edinburgh, Relating in the Dark is returning to Wellington for a special one-off evening this summer! Grab a blindfold and dive deep into the enriching practices of Authentic Relating, Movement Meditation & Conscious Touch.
By exploring intimacy without sight, we will delve into our intuitive nature, sharpening our capacity for deeper connection. We will use blindfolds to invite you into profound contact with your physical sensations and internal reality, unblocking your inhibition so as to reveal your truest essence.
WHO is this event for?
This event is for anyone who is seeking deeper connection, stronger community, consensual loving touch, or simply a safe space to just be yourself.
If you’re a curious, open, emotional human being and want to enhance your interpersonal relationships and enrich your self love within, this event is for you.
This event is also for you if you’ve been recently feeling blocked, anxious, lacking purpose or direction, and need to reground and remind yourself what's truly important and who you truly are.
My experience includes working with Highly Sensitive People (HSPs); neurodiverse people; people suffering from anxiety and depression; people going through major life shifts; and members of the LGBTQ+ community.
If you have any questions about whether the event would suit you, pop me a message and I’ll get back to you within 24 hours.
WHAT will we explore?
Activities will explore movement, contact and relating, with and without vision and words, by exploring the practices of Authentic Relating, Movement Meditation & Conscious Touch.
Authentic Relating is is a ground breaking social tool that enables you to playfully & courageously dive into open hearted connection, through radical honesty and active listening. The practice invites you to drop deeper into presence, embodied awareness and permission to express whatever is alive within you and the ‘we-space’ between you and other(s).
Movement Meditation is free-form journey of authentic bodily flow. It invites you to surrender to what is arising in your body when deeply in connection with music, inducing a natural state of ecstasy.
Conscious Touch is the practice of bringing full attention and presence into relating physically to another person. In deeper awareness of our desires and boundaries, we will explore the many layers and dimensions of non-sexual touch.
Together, we will create a rich container to explore the many layers of our human experience, to invite loving, consensual touch, and arrive more deeply into present moment awareness.
WHERE will it be?
The event will take place in the beautiful urban sanctuary of Wellington Meditation Centre, 31 Hobson Crescent, Thorndon, Wellington 6011.
The facilitator
Laurie (he/him), is a queer British-Kiwi who’s current home-base is Berlin. His passion is creating spaces that cultivate healthy, thriving human-to-human relationships, helping people take off their masks, feel their sensations and celebrate their aliveness on Earth. Since 2019, he has organised and facilitated hundreds of Authentic Relating, Dating and Embodiment workshops in Oceania and Europe.
His training includes The Embody Lab, Authentic Revolution, Body Electric, World Peace Yoga School and Connection Institute.
He has facilitated at internationally acclaimed festivals such as Stretch and Ignite, and organisations such as ART International and Authentic Bay Area.
His workshops have sparked thousands of nourishing connections, turning many strangers into life-long friends. He looks forward to holding space for you!
For more information, check out itoiauthenticrelating.com.
For his insta, check out: @itoiauthentic.
Here's what others have said about Laurie's workshops (blindfolded & more) :
"This was my absolute favourite authentic relating event. I can't wait for the next one. Removing the clutter and distraction and judgment from my eyes supported me to drop in immediately to my own other senses and hearing and connection with the other. It was incredible."
~ Daniel
"What a wonderful event. The blindfolds encouraged me to stay present and in your body. It was a very sweet and safe space to learn and explore. The connections were very fulfilling. A rejuvenating and enjoyable evening indeed!"
~ Carrie
“It seems funny to say it but I felt so ‘seen’ without being seen”
~ Esther
“I noticed that I was so much more present with myself, and was able to share parts that I would normally find it really hard to share”
~ Elliot
"I love Laurie’s energy, wisdom, execution and light touch. I felt super safe to open up and connect while he was holding the space"
~ Tess
"I live with complex PTSD and anxiety so in the past I have really struggled to open up to people and build meaningful connections. Discovering these workshops has been a life changer and both my therapist and I are thrilled with how my confidence has blossomed in recent months. Laurie's time and generosity really means the world to me"
~ Sarah
HOW MUCH will I invest?
$35 - low income
$45 - medium income
$55 - high income
Why are tickets sold by income?
In order to make the event as accessible as possible, there are three ticket types available. It is up to you to decide which ticket you purchase, depending on your own feelings about your level of disposable income and how much you would like to contribute for the event.
If you would really like to attend but do not have the funds for the lowest ticket option, please get in touch and we can figure something out!
Practicalities:
Location: Wellington Meditation Centre, 31 Hobson Crescent, Thorndon, Wellington 6011.
When: Sunday 1st Feb, 7 - 9.30pm
Dresscode: Comfortable clothing that's easy to move in. Please bring your own blindfold.
Intoxicants: This is a strictly sober space. There will be plenty of tea flowing!
Refund policy: No refunds available, however if you are unable to make it, you may transfer your ticket to someone else or use as credit for a future i to i workshop.

events.id: Jewellery-making in 8 weeks-Workspace Studios Ltd, 65 Abel Smith St, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Jewellery-making in 8 weeks
events.venue: Workspace Studios Ltd, 65 Abel Smith St, Wellington
events.long_description:
This class is for level 2+ and advanced students. It is not open to beginners.

Students must have completed an 8-week block with ring-making and bezel settings or equivalent. If you have not done one of our 8-week beginner’s classes or are unsure of your level because you may have done a few different shorter classes, please contact us, and we can advise you.

This more advanced class is ideal for those who are already competent at soldering simple joins, annealing and basic tool use on their own.

A more advanced set of students means that your tutor can support you and the group to take on more exciting and complex challenges. They will work with the group to find appropriate projects for you and for the class as a whole. Each 8-week block may focus on a particular skill topic, rather than doing loads of different topics with each student over the block. This means the students will benefit from a more in-depth learning experience, supported practice and peer support from fellow students.

Level 2 students learn to solder more competently on their own using chainmaking as a way to develop their fine soldering skills. They may create a simple stone setting or ring alongside this challenge project so they have something to hone their skills that they are familiar with, as well as take on a new skill. Their silver project could be a pendant on a handmade chain, a charm bracelet or a more complex bezel setting.

Level 3 and above students are encouraged to work on their design skills and try new and challenging techniques. They should prepare to have one or two simple projects they can work on self-directed in class: more chains or simple bezel settings are ideal - to help them strengthen their soldering skills - alongside a challenge project that might be a shelf setting (an adaptation of a bezel setting that can take faceted stones), a tube setting or a larger bezel setting for a box or brooch.

This class fee does NOT include materials for any student.

All metals and stones, as well as quality findings and chains, are available for purchase each week in the studio. Students are encouraged to keep their silver scrap and find ways to use it thriftily in future projects!

Our booking system asks for payment to be made via credit card, Afterpay or PayPal on booking. If you do not have access to these payment methods or need to pay your course fee over time please email us to arrange this ;)

Only 6 Students Per Class.

events.venue: 28 Cambridge Terrace, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Join Thomas, Rona, Jack, Lainy, Piper, Ben and Max at the Cambridge Hotel at for a film-themed quiz to help us raise funds for our feature film, 'Paradise Palace'. Just like your familiar pub quiz, this time only featuring everyone's favourite category! Sit back and enjoy the lovely beverage and food selection available at the Cambridge Hotel while you quiz out.
Tickets are $15 (+ a small booking fee), with the option to donate more if you're feeling especially generous! On the night we will also have other optional donation avenues available.
Please purchase one ticket per-person and quiz groups can be formed on the night. We recommend teams of up to 8 and as little as 2 if you're feeling confident! Start time is 7pm.

events.id: Brazilian Zouk Dance Classes - Beginners block A-60 Dixon St, 6011,60 Dixon St, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand, Wellington-All Events In
events.name: Brazilian Zouk Dance Classes - Beginners block A
events.venue: 60 Dixon St, 6011,60 Dixon St, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand, Wellington
events.long_description:
Brazilian Zouk Dance Classes - Beginners block A
Connect with other like minded people that have a love of dance.
Brazilian Zouk was developed in Rio de Janeiro in the mid 90s, and is now becoming more and more popular

..............
This is stunning to watch and even more fun to dance! It is based on the original Lambada dance but adapted to more modern music with a slow-quick-quick beat. It can be danced to a wide variety of music including R&B, Rock and Pop.
In this block of 5 classes you will discover the fundamental techniques, movements and sequences of Brazilian Zouk to get you up and running on the dance floor.
This includes:
Week 1: Passo basico
Week 2: Lateral
Week 3: Viradinha
Week 4: Piao
Week 5: Combination
They are designed so you can start this block as a complete newbie, or you can continue on as an existing student from the last block.
There are 4 blocks of classes (A, B, C, D) in the complete Fundamentals course. Once these are done, you can progress to the Improvers classes.
Prices and payment:
- Prepaid 5 week term cost is $90 waged or $75 for unwaged/students.
- Ad hoc cost is $20 waged or $18 unwaged/students
Online payments can be made to Adam Polaczuk
Acct: 03-0531-0559348-25
Details: Your name and ZoukFunA
Location:
Classes are on the First Floor - FootNote Dance Studio, 60 Dixon Street

events.id: Future Architecture of the Network (FAN) Conference 2026-Kelburn Parade, Kelburn, Wellington 6012, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: Future Architecture of the Network (FAN) Conference 2026
events.venue: Kelburn Parade, Kelburn, Wellington 6012, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Kia ora!
Electricity and electrification are seen as the significant enablers for decarbonisation of our nation. The Future Architecture of the Network (FAN) | Te Whatunga Hiko programme aspires to meet the challenges the electrical power system will face as we journey towards sustainable decarbonisation.
Our vision is to provide an infrastructure paradigm through a hybrid AC/DC transmission and distribution system that meets the needs of tomorrow’s efficient, low-carbon, reliable and resilient electrical power system.
Funded as part of the New Zealand Government’s Strategic Science Investment Fund (SSIF) on Advanced Energy Technology Platform (AETP), the research team is investigating what the future electrical power system might look like.
Hear about the team’s latest achievements as we approach the final phase of the programme.
Attendance is in person at Victoria University Wellington.
Ngā mihi nui,
Prof. Neville Watson,
Science Leader
The detailed programme will be circulated closer to the event.
 More information on the research can be found at https://www.fan.ac.nz/
If you have any questions, please contact futurearchitecturenetwork@canterbury.ac.nz

events.id: Adopt a plant: Begonia House fundraiser-Begonia House, 101 Glenmore Street, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Adopt a plant: Begonia House fundraiser
events.venue: Begonia House, 101 Glenmore Street, Wellington
events.long_description:
Support the Friends of Wellington Botanic Garden and grab yourself a bargain. We’ve kept the plants we need for propagation, but we have many healthy plants left over that we can’t fit into our nursery. That’s where you come in – take home one of our plants and help the Friends fundraise to go beyond the basics with amazing new features like exterior landscaping and internal fixtures for the renewed Begonia House.

These plants are from the display end and thrive in indoor conditions (they are coming from a glasshouse after all). They should do just fine in your house. Have too many house plants? Wrong. You can definitely fit just one more. It’s for charity after all.

We’ll have some available for loose change and others for a minimum donation that won’t break the bank. Payment by cash or bank transfer only (no EFTPOS). All proceeds go to the Friends of Wellington Botanic Garden to put towards the Begonia House enhancements https://givealittle.co.nz/cause/the-begonia-house-the-buildings-and-beyond

Get prepped:
- Share the love! 5 plants max per person.
- Plants come as they are – we practice integrated pest management but you may need to give them a quarantine before joining your other plant pals at home.
- Swap your pot – there will be a station where you’ll swap your plant to a different pot. We need all our A+ pots for our future plants. We’ll be around to help.
- BYOB – bring your own bag or box for transporting your new friend home.
- Early bird gets the plant – no holds.

We’ll post an update in our Wellington Gardens Facebook event page a few days out of what plants will be for sale. Make sure you RSVP to get notified.

A piece of Begonia House is awaiting your adoption; We’ll see you there!

events.id: Jewellery-making in 8 weeks for Beginners-Workspace Studios Ltd, 65 Abel Smith St, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Jewellery-making in 8 weeks for Beginners
events.venue: Workspace Studios Ltd, 65 Abel Smith St, Wellington
events.long_description:
This class is beginner level only, with each student following the class project.

Our popular weeknight classes are the best way for beginners to get into jewellery-making in a lively, warm and friendly environment.

The stone-setting process teaches you many fundamental techniques in one project!

We start with basic ring-making and stone-setting in copper or brass. Students will learn measuring, texturing, shaping, cutting and soldering.

Then we move on to making a practice ring set with a Cabochon stone (a cabochon has a flat bottom and a smooth, domed top) in a Bezel Setting.

As you work through your practice ring and setting, you can move on to working in silver and produce another ring with a cabochon stone that you really love. This way, you will learn the basics as you go on your practice ring, before taking the next step in costly silver.

This class has all materials included in the class fee!

Each student receives a carefully curated materials pack including copper or brass, sterling and fine silver for your ring-making projects, as well as two stones from our supply so you get a good stone for your level of experience.

We have loads of gorgeous stones of a range of colours, and they are all appropriate for beginner settings.

Our booking system asks for payment to be made via credit card, Afterpay or PayPal on booking. If you do not have access to these payment methods or need to pay your course fee over time, please email us to arrange this ;)

events.id: Book Group: The Idiot by Fyodor Dostoevsky-The Library, 1/53 Courtenay Place, Te Aro, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Book Group: The Idiot by Fyodor Dostoevsky
events.venue: The Library, 1/53 Courtenay Place, Te Aro, Wellington
events.long_description:
Do you keep meaning to read more of the great classics of literature? At Wellington Classic Literature Club, we read novels that have stood the test of time, whether they were written in 1780, 1880 or even 1980. We meet on the first Tuesday of the month.

We return to Russia for our long summer read! The group's first-ever summer book was Anna Karenina, and we read Dostoevsky's The Brothers Karamazov over the 2018/19 summer. (We were also due to discuss his novel Crime and Punishment, but that was set down for April 2020 and, well, the world had other plans…)

This year, we read another of Fyodor Dostoevsky's masterworks: The Idiot, which was initially published as a serial in 1868-1869. Dostoevsky scholar Joseph Frank said The Idiot "is the most personal of all his major works, the book in which he embodies his most intimate, cherished, and sacred convictions."

The story revolves around Prince Lef Nicolaievitch Muishkin, a young man returning to Russia after spending several years in a Swiss sanatorium for epilepsy. Dostoevsky had set out to create a protagonist with "a truly beautiful soul" and to trace the fate of such an individual as he comes into contact with the brutal reality of contemporary society.

RSVP
If you use Facebook, you can RSVP to the event on our Facebook page (above) - it really helps us keep track of numbers. Otherwise, just come along...

VENUE
We meet in the ‘Games Room’, The Library bar's private area overlooking Courtenay Place. After you enter the bar, head to your right (up the step) and through a smaller space with booths to the large carpeted space beyond.

ABOUT US
Wellington Classic Literature Club has been running for more than a decade - since the start of 2013 - and we have a great bunch of regulars as well as readers who come along for particular books or simply when it suits. All welcome.

events.id: Below The Worms-BATS Theatre, 1 Kent Tce, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Below The Worms
events.venue: BATS Theatre, 1 Kent Tce, Wellington
events.long_description:
A feijoa. A Witch. A secret. And two children on a mission at midnight in search of magic. With a bloodthirsty hound on their heels, the mysteries of the garden begin to unravel before their eyes.

Below the Worms is an absurdist magic realism tale that follows the story of two families that live in homes that sit in the same house, split in half. The world is full of unexplained magic that slips into the ordinary, such as the garden of singing worms and the witch that lives next door with her blood thirsty hound. Despite its terrors and delights, the homes live in harmony until a kept secret between the families is revealed, and the world is no longer what the children once thought.
Below The Worms is filled with physical theatre, puppetry and live music.

Created by S.L.U.G (Society for Little Ugly Girls) Theatre Company, Below The Worms had it's debut season in NZ Fringe Festival 2025 for which it won the Parkin Development Award and S.L.U.G won Most Promising Emerging Company.

Presented as part of the Parkin Development Award, Below The Worms is back and more exciting than ever with new direction from Alison Bruce and more delightful writing from Te Ata Tu Patelesio and Sugar Rea-Bruce.

events.id: Malcolm Todd tickets-Meow Nui, Wellington, New Zealand-Ticketek
events.name: Malcolm Todd tickets
events.venue: Meow Nui, Wellington, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Presented by: Handsome Tours & Laneway
Handsome Tours and Laneway Presents are proud to present Malcolm Todd!
Los Angeles-born songwriter Malcolm Todd has gone from scooping ice cream to racking up millions of streams in just a few years. After a viral breakthrough with ‘Roommates’ and his mixtape Sweet Boy (2024), Malcolm Todd doubled down with his 2025 self-titled debut album – a record that blends humour, honesty and restless ambition into a singular voice.
Featuring Omar Apollo on the standout single ‘Bleed’ the album captures Todd at his most fearless, pushing his pop instincts into bold new territory. With a devoted fanbase and a reputation for chaotic, heartfelt live shows, Malcolm Todd now makes his Australian and New Zealand debut with headline sideshows in Sydney, Melbourne and Wellington.

events.id: Masterclass - Awaken Your Soul Purpose-Christchurch,73 Eastern Hutt Rd, Taita, Lower Hutt 5019, New Zealand, Lower Hutt-All Events In
events.name: Masterclass - Awaken Your Soul Purpose
events.venue: Christchurch,73 Eastern Hutt Rd, Taita, Lower Hutt 5019, New Zealand, Lower Hutt
events.long_description:
Masterclass - Awaken Your Soul Purpose
When we feel safe in our bodies, everything becomes clearer.
We can finally soften out of survival mode…
We hear our intuition again…
And we reconnect with the quiet, wise voice of our Soul.

So many women are trying to “find their purpose” from a dysregulated nervous system - overthinking, pushing, striving - when what their soul is really asking for is safety, presence, and space.

Because when your nervous system settles, your truth rises.

This masterclass is a gentle nervous system reset designed to help you come home to yourself and open to your Soul’s guidance.

You will be guided through:
✨ Soft, grounding movement to release tension and bring you back into your body
✨ A deeply calming meditation with soul-evoking prompts to invite clarity and insight
✨ A powerful base-chakra somatic practice to create a felt sense of safety and belonging
✨ Space to receive the subtle visions, feelings and knowings that reveal your Soul Purpose

From this place of embodied safety, your inner wisdom can finally speak.

This is not about forcing answers.

It’s about creating the conditions where they naturally arise.

This masterclass will help you connect with what is within you, quietly waiting to be heard - so you can live, choose and create in alignment with who you truly are.

As we step into the Year of the Fire Horse, this is your invitation to release what no longer serves you and move forward with clarity, passion and purposeful alignment 🐎🔥

Your attendance qualifies you for a special offer regarding the life-changing, Soul Purpose Expansion retreat in Ubud, Bali later this year.

This Masterclass is free to attend.

We do request that you indicate you are attending on this event and please click on the ticket link below to submit your contact details, to ensure you receive the link to the live event (and the recording if you can't make the live event).

Susan and I are looking forward to facilitating this masterclass for you.

Namaste

events.id: Lost Wax Casting - 6 Weeks Course-Workspace Studios Ltd, 65 Abel Smith St, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Lost Wax Casting - 6 Weeks Course
events.venue: Workspace Studios Ltd, 65 Abel Smith St, Wellington
events.long_description:
A fantastic course that's full of fun and inspiration!

It starts on Wed 4 February and runs for 6 weeks till Wed 11 March, 5.30pm - 8pm.

Create interesting designs in wax, then send them off to be professionally cast in metal. Once your pieces are back, you will be taught how to cut, file and shape them into wearable pieces.

Level 1 students: Learn to work in both soft and hard jewellers' wax and send your waxes away to be cast. When they return, you will learn how to clean them up into finished jewellery and/or incorporate them into jewellery in multiple ways. We start with rings, but encourage students to think outside the box!

Level 2 students: Advance your carving skills and learn to set stones in your waxes. This can be done either by creating claws and other settings or trying the cast-in-place technique - an organic, exciting process.

Included in the class fee are all your different types of waxes, sandpaper and courier costs.

Not included are the casting and metal costs, which vary from student to student depending on what they want to make. Small castings can cost around $7 - $10, and metals are between $0.35 per gram for bronze - $4 per gram for silver. Please see details on our Regular Classes page.

Our booking system asks for payment to be made via credit card, PayPal or Afterpay on booking. If you do not have access to these payment methods or need to pay your course fee over time, please email us to arrange this ;)

events.id: The Book of Will-Gryphon Theatre, 22 Ghuznee St, Te Aro, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: The Book of Will
events.venue: Gryphon Theatre, 22 Ghuznee St, Te Aro, Wellington
events.long_description:
The Book of Will, by playwright Lauren Gunderson, directed by Janet Noble, is a (mostly) faithful retelling of the true story of how Shakespeare's plays were almost lost to time.

This play opens several years after Shakespeare's death, as the surviving members of the King's Men realise that they are losing more and more of their company - and with them, the memory of all of the plays that made them. While Shakespeare published his sonnets during his lifetime, he never published his plays. Few playwrights did.

Shakespeare had started giving his actors only their lines, not the full play, so that it was harder for other theatre troupes to steal the work. A fire at the Globe Theatre after his death had destroyed many of the original full copies of the scripts. On top of that, unscrupulous printers had sent people to memorise as much of the popular plays as they could, then recount them so the printer could publish the play and claim copyright on it - even if the repeated version bore little resemblance to the actual play.

Two of Shakespeare's dearest friends, John Heminges and Henry Condell, set out to gather and publish all of the plays in their "true and correct" form. The result was the First Folio, without which we would have less than half of Shakespeare's plays in a corrupted version, the rest having been lost completely.

Both hilariously funny and poignant, this play is a love letter to theatre, a meditation on legacy and loss, and a celebration of the friends who ensured Shakespeare's words would survive.

While Shakespeare published his sonnets during his lifetime, he never published his plays.
Shakespeare had started giving his actors only their lines, not the full play, so that it was harder for other theatre troupes to steal the work.

events.id: Nick Cave & The Bad Seeds — Wild God Tour-TSB Arena, Wellington, New Zealand-Wellington NZ
events.name: Nick Cave & The Bad Seeds — Wild God Tour
events.venue: TSB Arena, Wellington, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Their music has long defied classification. For over 40 years, Nick Cave & The Bad Seeds have delivered a sophisticated mix of post-punk, experimental, gospel, and blues to adoring fans. Now, in a New Zealand exclusive, Wellington gets to hear them live at TSB Arena in February. Renowned for their exhilarating and unforgettable performances, the band is regarded as one of the most thrilling to watch on stage. 
In 2024, they released their eighteenth studio album, ‘Wild God’. Now, Nick and the band are circling the globe on the ‘Wild God Tour’. They have finished the North American and European legs, and TSB Arena on Wellington’s waterfront is the next stop off. The band will perform a setlist drawn from the latest album alongside songs spanning the four decades of a storied career.
Brought to you in association with Aotearoa New Zealand Festival of the Arts. 
Tickets will go on sale to the public on Friday, 29 August at 10am.

events.long_description:
Park Hotel Reading Big Band (Nicholas’s farewell gig)
The Park Hotel Reading Band brings the vibrant energy of big band music to the best music venue in town! Formed as a space for musicians to explore and perform classic big band charts, the group has been meeting every second week for the past year to do exactly that — keeping the spirit of live big band music alive and thriving in Pōneke.

Join us for an evening celebrating the rich tradition of big band jazz, featuring music from legends like Thad Jones and Count Basie to modern masters such as Maria Schneider and Jacob Mann.

Come experience the power, swing, and excitement of big band music — past and present — performed by the Park Hotel Reading Band.

This is also a farewell gig for Nicholas who is moving to Europe the following week. Come have a drink and say goodbye before he leaves.

events.id: Men's Circle: Authentic Relating-Bhakti Lounge Wellington, 1st Floor, 175 Vivian Street, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Men's Circle: Authentic Relating
events.venue: Bhakti Lounge Wellington, 1st Floor, 175 Vivian Street, Wellington
events.long_description:
Men's Circle: Authentic Relating

In a world where men are often expected to have everything figured out, this gathering offers a space to be genuine, not perfect.

This is a free event, with an optional plant-based dinner available for $15. While there’s no obligation to stay for dinner, sharing a meal together offers a meaningful way to strengthen connections.

Andre and Sri Jiva co-host this circle with a shared passion for creating authentic, supportive spaces where men can connect deeply—offering this gathering simply because they believe in its importance.

The Men’s Circle provides a safe and nurturing environment where men can share openly, express their feelings, and encourage personal growth—free from societal pressures to be stoic or self-reliant. Through honest sharing and collective support, participants build resilience, deepen self-awareness, and strengthen their sense of identity and purpose.

Structure of the Circle

Gathering in a Circle: Participants sit in a circle to symbolize equality and unity.

A short meditation or moment of silence may be included to help everyone arrive and connect.

Talking Object: A sharing stick or object is placed in the center. Only the person holding the object may speak, ensuring uninterrupted sharing.

Open Sharing: Anyone may choose to share while holding the object. Sharing is optional, and passing is always respected.

Active Listening: While one person shares, others listen attentively without speaking, interrupting, or offering advice. The focus is on witnessing and being present.

No Judgments or Advice: Participants refrain from judging or offering unsolicited advice, creating a safe space for authentic expression.

Closing: The circle may conclude with a group reflection, a moment of gratitude, or a simple acknowledgment of the shared experience.

Circle Agreements

Supportive Environment: We are here to uplift and support one another, fostering trust and brotherhood.

Focus on the Present: Share what's alive for you now, focusing on your emotions and experiences to deepen emotional awareness.

Use "I" Statements: Speak from your personal perspective using "I" statements to promote authenticity and responsibility. Avoid generalizations like "we" or "us."

No Judgment or fixing: Refrain from judging others sharing or offering unsolicited advice, ensuring a safe and non-critical space.

Confidentiality: What is shared in the circle stays in the circle. You may discuss your own experience outside the group, but keep others' details private.

Meet Andre, your host

Andre has been immersed in men’s work since the age of 13, when he first experienced a rite of passage in Golden Bay. That formative experience sparked a lifelong connection to circle work, which he later deepened by returning as a mentor. A multi-instrumental musician, poet, and pranayama (breathwork) facilitator, Andre also brings his passion for ecstatic dance, philosophy, and authentic connection into his offerings. He is deeply inspired by the question of what it means to be human—how we can more fully experience our aliveness, our depth, and reconnecting with the beauty of life together.

events.id: Sound Bath Experience: Reflection & Intention-Bhakti Lounge Wellington, 1st Floor, 175 Vivian Street, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Sound Bath Experience: Reflection & Intention
events.venue: Bhakti Lounge Wellington, 1st Floor, 175 Vivian Street, Wellington
events.long_description:
Sound Bath Experience: Reflection & Intention

Restore your energies with sound healing to support reflection, release, and personal transformation.

Guided by Smita and Alexandra, this sound bath blends the soothing tones of harmonium, crystal bowls, and flute to create a deeply healing environment for body and mind.

Through the vibrations of sound, you can:

*Release physical tension and mental clutter

*Calm the nervous system

*Realign your energy through live frequency healing

*Gain clarity & perspective

Take it as a chance to slow down, reflect, and emerge feeling centered, rebalanced, and renewed.

After the session, enjoy a nourishing plant-based dinner and dessert included in your ticket - a mindful, wholesome way to close the evening in connection.

Meet Smita & Alexandra, your sound healers
From a young age, Smita was drawn to music as a means for reflection and self-expression. During her music studies at university, she was introduced to taonga pūoro, and this sparked a personal journey of reconnection to te ao Māori and her own whakapapa. Following university, she lived in an ashram for several years where she was introduced to the wonderful practice of bhakti yoga. She now lives with her husband in the Wellington region, where they regularly participate in kirtan (mantra music meditation) at Bhakti Lounge.

Alexandra is a sound healing practitioner devoted to nurturing healing in both mind and body. She believes that sound vibration holds the power to expand consciousness and restore harmony and balance in our lives. Her journey into sound healing began with the realization of how deeply sound vibration was affecting her psyche—making her more mindful of the music she listens to and the intention it carries. Along the way, she has drawn inspiration from artists such as Deva Premal, The Flying Mystics, Stevin McNamara, and the Bhakti Lounge Kirtan. Their music has profoundly influenced her own sound healing practice, inspiring her to explore sound as a tool for transformation, connection, and inner peace.

Did a beginners welding course with Tim and it is absolutely worth it. Gives you good base knowledge of what a good weld is and whatba bad one is and why and gives you the confidence to give it a go. Good tips and tricks as well with proper hands on leaning. Thanks Tim and MakeRoom Wellington!

_______________________________________________________________________________

Tim Blair is an excellent tutor. Pace was perfect, content excellently presented, really approachable. Incredible patience and feedback. Really recommend for women especially wanting to learn the art of welding, Tim's a good guy!
I'll be back for advanced lessons.
events.description:
4 Weeks Thu 5th February 7pm-9pm Thu 12th February 7pm-9pm Thu 19th February 7pm-9.30pm Thu 26th February 7pm-9.30pm This class is run by the owner operator of a Wellington based Engineering firm with over 20 years of Welding experience.
Participants will get to learn the theory and safety aspects of welding before gaining experience MIG welding Tee Joints, Lap Joints and But Joints.

events.id: Summer Camp | Sam Fowles and Elly Mae-San Fran, 171 Cuba St, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Summer Camp | Sam Fowles and Elly Mae
events.venue: San Fran, 171 Cuba St, Wellington
events.long_description:
Join us and some of Te Whanganui-a-Tara’s finest artists over five nights across January and February with tickets from $10 or a season pass for $40, featuring drink specials and cocktails thanks to our sponsor Jameson.

Our penultimate night features two of Pōneke’s finest songwriters from two separate sonic worlds… their combination is sure to be a treat!

Sam Fowles makes music that moves the body, speaks to the heart, and touches the soul. Driven by groove and the desire to find meaning in the moments on this journey we call life, the musician, songwriter and producer has a signature sound that stands out and stuns. Fowles would describe his music as psychedelic soul laced with blues and funk. It resonates with deep grooves and driving rhythms created by vintage drum sounds, digital sonics, and electric guitars that build and blaze into billowing soundscapes. At its core is his unique, soulful voice and the punchy, heartfelt lyrics he wears on his sleeve.

Elly Mae crafts songs that encapsulate the bittersweet ache of growth, the quiet unraveling of time, and the soft glow of nostalgia embedded within. Her music is an amalgamation of folk, dreampop, indie, shoegaze, and anything in between. From lullabies that make you feel weightless to being wrapped in a blanket of sound, Elly Mae's folk/country melodic guitar style is accompanied by experimental, spatial bass from Arran Cargill-Brown and textured pocket drumming from Sasha Francis-Murray.

events.name: Richter City Rebels - Blenheim
events.venue: 5 Tenth Lane, Blenheim Central, Blenheim 7201, New Zealand
events.long_description:
The Richter City Rebels have a sound that blends RnB, soul, hip-hop, jazz and funk with the heart and soul of New Orleans brass band music. Trumpets, trombones, saxes, sousaphone, and percussion bring the ultimate Mardi Gras party to any venue or festival. Incorporating stylish original melodies and shouts, funked-up pop tunes and bouncing hip-hop, the Rebels’ sound embodies the musical melting pot of Louisiana.
Energy, entertainment, and musicianship of the highest quality: the Richter City Rebels guarantee a rousing New Orleans experience.

events.id: The Park Hotel Reading Band-The Rogue & Vagabond-Rogue & Vagabond
events.name: The Park Hotel Reading Band
events.venue: The Rogue & Vagabond
events.long_description:
The Park Hotel Reading Band brings the vibrant energy of big band jazz to life! Formed as a space for musicians to explore and perform new big band charts, the group has been meeting every week for the past year to do exactly that — keeping the spirit of live big band music alive and thriving in Pōneke.

Join us for an evening celebrating the rich tradition of big band jazz, featuring music from legends like Thad Jones and Count Basie to modern masters such as Maria Schneider and Jacob Mann.

Come experience the power, swing, and excitement of big band music — past and present — performed by the Park Hotel Reading Band.

Music from 9pm, FREE ENTRY

events.long_description:
FULL TIME SENDERS & JUICED UP PRESENT

WINDOW KID — LIVE AT MEOW

Waitangi Weekend Thursday · February 5

This Waitangi Weekend Thursday, WINDOW KID brings his unmistakable UK bass energy to Meow for a high-pressure night of fast mixing, heavy sound system culture, and elite mic control.

An award-winning UK MC, Window Kid has earned wide recognition for his technical delivery, timing, and ability to elevate a dancefloor. His sound is rooted in drum & bass, jungle, bassline, grime, and UK garage, with sets that move fluidly across tempos while staying locked to the energy of the room.

Expect rolling low-end, sharp transitions, and a set that feels driven, dynamic, and fully engaged with the crowd from start to finish.

It’s a fantastic opportunity for clubs from around the lower North Island to come together and experience the excitement of the races in the heart of sunny Wairarapa!

Here’s what you can look forward to on this fun-filled day:

Book your spot today! $50 without bus or $60 with bus

events.id: Te Tiriti and Me– He Māori by Īhaka Martyn in Tawa-Tawa Community Centre,5 Cambridge St, Tawa, Wellington 5028, New Zealand, Wellington-All Events In
events.name: Te Tiriti and Me– He Māori by Īhaka Martyn in Tawa
events.venue: Tawa Community Centre,5 Cambridge St, Tawa, Wellington 5028, New Zealand, Wellington
events.long_description:
Te Tiriti and Me– He Māori by Īhaka Martyn in Tawa
Te Tiriti and Me – He Māori? by Īhaka Martyn

Nau mai, haere mai! Join us to celebrate Te Rā o Waitangi 2026, with a free travelling Theatre Roadshow, He Māori by Īhaka Martyn.

Alongside our Te Rā o Waitangi event, we are bringing Te Tiriti and Me back to Wellingtonians again. Last year saw a travelling forum series, and this year we welcome the free Theatre Roadshow 'He Māori?' by Īhaka Martyn, which is touring three locations on Waitangi Day:

📍Tawa Community Centre, 10am – 11.30am: https://events.humanitix.com/tawa-te-tiriti-and-me-2026-taki-rua-and-wcc-present-he-maori

📍Khandallah Community Centre, 1.30pm – 3pm: https://events.humanitix.com/khandallah-te-tiriti-and-me-2026-taki-rua-and-wcc-present-he-maori

📍The Hannah Playhouse, 4pm – 5.30pm: https://events.humanitix.com/the-hannah-te-tiriti-and-me-2026-taki-rua-and-wcc-present-he-maori

About He Māori:
Is 1/16th enough? Īhaka Martyn will have you laughing and crying as he weaves elements of stand-up comedy, waiata, and physical performance to explore the confusion, comedy and celebration of reclaiming his Māoritanga from a Pākehā upbringing. A 60 minute journey from total confusion to partial understanding. He aha? He Māori? Is he? Maybe - it depends.

He Māori? by Īhaka Martyn is presented in partnership with Taki Rua Productions and is suitable for all ages. There will be a Q&A session after each performance.

He Māori?

events.long_description:
Waitangi Day - Parent & Child Tournament
🎾 Ready for some Waitangi Day fun?

Our much-loved Parent–Child Tournament is back on Friday 6 February, and we’d love to see you on court! This is one of the happiest days of the year at KTSC — a relaxed, family-friendly tournament where it’s all about teamwork, laughs, and making memories. And when we say “parent–child,” we mean it broadly… parents, grandparents, aunties, uncles, older siblings, caregivers — all welcome! 💙

✨ Entry is just $15 per pair
✨ Please bring a plate to share for our communal morning tea/lunch
✨ All ages and abilities welcome

Grab your favourite little (or big!) person, dust off the racquets, and get your entry in.

Enter now and be part of a special KTSC Waitangi Day tradition! 🎉
🎟️ Don’t miss this unforgettable day—register now!
👉 https://www.ktsc.org.nz/waitangidaytournament

We can’t wait to see you on the courts! 🏅💚

events.id: Waitangi ki Taumanuka 2026-Taumanuka, 29 Health Camp Rd, Ōtaki Beach,29 Health Camp Rd, Otaki Beach, Otaki 5512, New Zealand, Otaki-All Events In
events.name: Waitangi ki Taumanuka 2026
events.venue: Taumanuka, 29 Health Camp Rd, Ōtaki Beach,29 Health Camp Rd, Otaki Beach, Otaki 5512, New Zealand, Otaki
events.long_description:
Waitangi ki Taumanuka 2026
E ngā whānau, hapū, iwi me ngā hāpori, nau mai, tauti mai ki Taumanuka!

Ngā Hapū o Ōtaki, in partnership with Kāpiti Coast District Council, warmly invite you to commemorate Waitangi Day with us.

Āhea: Friday 6 February, 10am – 3pm (Pōwhiri at 9am, all welcome to attend)
Ki hea: Taumanuka, 29 Health Camp Rd, Ōtaki Beach
Utu: FREE

Bring your whānau and enjoy a day filled with activities for tamariki, kaumātua, and everyone in between! Highlights include kai trucks and stalls, kapa haka, and live performances from local artists.

Taumanuka is a site with deep historical significance – mark Waitangi Day in the location where Te Tiriti o Waitangi was signed.

Expressions of interest for food vendors and stallholders is also open, visit the Council website to apply: https://www.kapiticoast.govt.nz/do-it-online/forms/waitangi-day-food-truckstall-expressions-of-interest/

This event is a para-kore zone – please bring reusable drink bottles.

EFTPOS will be limited, so cash is recommended.

events.id: Te Rā o Waitangi--Wellington NZ
events.name: Te Rā o Waitangi
events.long_description:
Te Rā o Waitangi is a free, whānau -friendly event to commemorate the signing of Te Tiriti o Waitangi and Aotearoa New Zealand’s national day. Kicking off at midday in Waitangi Park, you'll find the main stage programme packed with local talent. Enjoy live music, dance, and cultural performances. Dotted around Waitangi Park, you’ll also find a selection of delicious kai , stalls, a Kids’ Zone, a treaty education space, and much more. 
Te Rā o Waitangi 2026 acknowledges tūrangawaewae and whakapapa for all — where is the place you lay down your roots? Where is your family from? In 2026, Waitangi Day celebrates the things that we all share and the things that make us different.
events.description:
Kicking off at midday in Waitangi Park, you'll find the main stage programme packed with local talent.
Enjoy live music, dance, and cultural performances.
Dotted around Waitangi Park, you’ll also find a selection of delicious kai , stalls, a Kids’ Zone, a treaty education space, and much more.
Te Rā o Waitangi 2026 acknowledges tūrangawaewae and whakapapa for all — where is the place you lay down your roots?
In 2026, Waitangi Day celebrates the things that we all share and the things that make us different.

events.id: FREE ENTRY: Waitangi Day in Porirua-Te Rauparaha Park,Porirua, New Zealand-All Events In
events.name: FREE ENTRY: Waitangi Day in Porirua
events.venue: Te Rauparaha Park,Porirua, New Zealand
events.long_description:
FREE ENTRY: Waitangi Day in Porirua
FREE ENTRY:

We are glad to partner with mana whenua Ngāti Toa once again to deliver a fun-filled Waitangi Day event in Porirua, one of the largest Waitangi Day events to take place in New Zealand on our national day.

❤️ Waka tours are on once more!
🎤 Live music at Te Rauparaha Park
🥗 Food trucks will line Norrie Streets
😜 Fun for tamariki and rangatahi

Parking 🚙
Parking will be available on surrounding streets such as Wi Neera Drive or you can leave your car at the railway station and take the short walk to Te Rauparaha Park.

Cash 💳
It’s best to bring cash on the day as not all vendors will have eftpos available, although there are nearby ATMs on Lyttelton Avenue if you wish to top up.

The event will be alcohol-free, smoke/vape-free and there will be no dogs allowed.

events.id: Te Rā o Waitangi 2026-Waitangi Park,24A Herd St, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand, Wellington-All Events In
events.name: Te Rā o Waitangi 2026
events.venue: Waitangi Park,24A Herd St, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand, Wellington
events.long_description:
Te Rā o Waitangi 2026
Nau mai, haere mai! Join us to celebrate Te Rā o Waitangi 2026, Wellington City Council’s free annual Waitangi Day event ❤️🖤

Te Rā o Waitangi 2026 acknowledges tūrangawaewae and whakapapa for all!

Bring your friends and whānau to Waitangi Park from 12 noon to 6pm on Friday 6 February for live music, kai, activities celebrating Māori culture, and the spirit of Te Tiriti o Waitangi.

He aha kei te haere? What to expect:

✨ Live performances showcasing tangata whenua and tangata tiriti talent

✨ Multicultural food stalls and a fundraiser hāngi from midday (get in quick!)

✨ Arts, crafts, and family-friendly activities, including taonga tākaro Māori

✨Pacific Media Networks 531pi audience stage activations

✨ Stunning stage artwork created at the 2024 event by artists Keri-Mei Zagrobelna and Tina Rae Carter

✨ A Treaty Education Tent to learn, reflect, and connect

Gather your whānau and join us to honour our past, celebrate our present, and dream of our future together.

Alongside our Te Rā o Waitangi event, we’re excited to bring the free theatre roadshow ‘He Māori?’ by Īhaka Martyn and Taki Rua Productions, this Waitangi Day. Catch a performance at one of three locations:
🕙 10am–11.30am: Tawa Community Centre
🕜 1.30pm–3pm: Khandallah Community Centre
🕓 4pm–5.30pm: The Hannah Playhouse

All shows are free, but bookings are required.

For more information, the Te Rā o Waitangi Day programme and booking information: https://wellington.govt.nz/news-and-events/events-and-festivals/waitangi-day

Our Te Rā o Waitangi event is made possible by many, and we acknowledge our Tākai Here partners: Te Rūnanga O Toa Rangatira, Taranaki Whānui ki Te Upoko o te Ika and Te Rūnanganui o Te Āti Awa ki te Upoko o Te Ika a Māui.

events.long_description:
Te Tiriti and Me – He Māori? by Īhaka Martyn at The Hannah
Te Tiriti and Me – He Māori by Īhaka Martyn

Nau mai, haere mai! Join us to celebrate Te Rā o Waitangi 2026, with a free travelling Theatre Roadshow, He Māori? by Īhaka Martyn.

Alongside our Te Rā o Waitangi event, we are bringing Te Tiriti and Me back to Wellingtonians again. Last year saw a travelling forum series, and this year we welcome the free Theatre Roadshow 'He Māori?' by Īhaka Martyn, which is touring three locations on Waitangi Day:

📍Tawa Community Centre, 10am – 11.30am: https://events.humanitix.com/tawa-te-tiriti-and-me-2026-taki-rua-and-wcc-present-he-maori

📍Khandallah Community Centre, 1.30pm – 3pm: https://events.humanitix.com/khandallah-te-tiriti-and-me-2026-taki-rua-and-wcc-present-he-maori

📍The Hannah Playhouse, 4pm – 5.30pm: https://events.humanitix.com/the-hannah-te-tiriti-and-me-2026-taki-rua-and-wcc-present-he-maori

About He Māori:
Is 1/16th enough? Īhaka Martyn will have you laughing and crying as he weaves elements of stand-up comedy, waiata, and physical performance to explore the confusion, comedy and celebration of reclaiming his Māoritanga from a Pākehā upbringing. A 60 minute journey from total confusion to partial understanding. He aha? He Māori? Is he? Maybe - it depends.

He Māori? by Īhaka Martyn is presented in partnership with Taki Rua Productions and is suitable for all ages. There will be a Q&A session after each performance.

events.id: Te Rā o Waitangi - Waitangi Day at the National Library-National Library of New Zealand, 70 Molesworth Street, Thorndon, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Te Rā o Waitangi - Waitangi Day at the National Library
events.venue: National Library of New Zealand, 70 Molesworth Street, Thorndon, Wellington
events.long_description:
Join us this Te Rā o Waitangi and learn about the hītori (histories) of the 1840 Te Tiriti o Waitangi.

Can you tell which Te Tiriti sheets are made from animal skin? Can you find Hōne Heke’s signature? Did rangatira (chiefs) in Te-Whanganui-a-Tara sign Te Tiriti?

There will be fun activities for tamariki (children), rangatahi (youth), and pakeke (adults) throughout the day.

Join a reorua (bilingual) tour to learn more about Te Tiriti, brush up your whakahua te reo Māori (pronunciation), sing waiata, or add your own tohu (mark) to the collective tiriti canvas. Watch film footage compiled by Ngā Taonga Sound & Vision or test your Te Tiriti knowledge with a quiz.

From 9am to 4pm we will have taonga that relate to the signing of Te Tiriti o Waitangi on display in the Alexander Turnbull Library.

HOME Café will be open until 2pm, and City Gallery Wellington will be open until 4pm.
events.description:

Can you find Hōne Heke’s signature?
Did rangatira (chiefs) in Te-Whanganui-a-Tara sign Te Tiriti?
There will be fun activities for tamariki (children), rangatahi (youth), and pakeke (adults) throughout the day.
Join a reorua (bilingual) tour to learn more about Te Tiriti, brush up your whakahua te reo Māori (pronunciation), sing waiata, or add your own tohu (mark) to the collective tiriti canvas.

events.id: Paraparaumu, New Zealand-Raumati Social Club with Celia Farran and Melissa Cox-34 Poplar Ave, Raumati South, Paraparaumu 5032-All Events In
events.name: Paraparaumu, New Zealand-Raumati Social Club with Celia Farran and Melissa Cox
events.venue: 34 Poplar Ave, Raumati South, Paraparaumu 5032
events.long_description:
Paraparaumu, New Zealand-Raumati Social Club with Celia Farran and Melissa Cox
Join the Mystic Muses, award-winning singer/songwriters Melissa Cox (NZ/USA) and Celia Farran (USA) for an unforgettable show featuring Celtic music of the past, present, and future - Enya, Sinead O'Connor, The Cranberries, Loreena McKennitt, traditional tunes, lore & legends, sea shanties, and haunting original songs by Melissa and Celia.

-- Meet the Muses --

MELISSA COX: Multi-instrumentalist and award-winning songwriter Melissa Cox conjures a one-woman storm of Celtic tradition, tribal beats, and celestial synths to create an ethereal, danceable Elvish EDM dream. Using her looping pedal, she layers tin whistle, electric mandolin, piano, synths, drum beats, and her haunting voice to create performances reminiscent of Enigma, Enya, and Loreena McKennitt. A seasoned touring artist and classically trained vocalist, she pushes Celtic and World music into the 21st century with raw energy and fearless, honest lyrics. http://www.melcoxmusic.com

CELIA FARRAN: “A cross between an Earthy Enya, Joan Baez, and Tina Fey.” She dishes up the most delicious concoction of the silly and sacred, delighting audiences across the globe. With rusty red locks and twinkling eyes, she casts a spell of enchantment upon her listeners, bringing deep and resonating experiences to audiences across the globe. With powerful, heart-felt vocals and wacky comedic improvisations, the audience never knows what will happen with Celia on stage. http://www.celiafarran.com

events.name: He Māori? Te Tiriti and Me Theatre Roadshow
events.venue: Tawa Community Centre, 5 Cambridge Street, Tawa, Wellington
events.long_description:
Alongside the Wellington City Council Te Rā o Waitangi event, we welcome the free Theatre Roadshow 'He Māori?' by Īhaka Martyn, which is touring three locations on Waitangi Day:

10am – 11.30am: Tawa Community Centre
1.30pm – 3pm: Khandallah Community Centre
4pm – 5.30pm: The Hannah Playhouse

Performances are free, but bookings are required. Book your spot via the Council Te Rā o Waitangi event web page.

About He Māori?
Is 1/16th enough? Īhaka Martyn will have you laughing and crying as he weaves elements of stand-up comedy, waiata, and physical performance to explore the confusion, comedy and celebration of reclaiming his Māoritanga from a Pākehā upbringing. A 60 minute journey from total confusion to partial understanding. He aha? He Māori? Is he? Maybe - it depends.

He Māori? by Īhaka Martyn is presented in partnership with Taki Rua Productions, and is suitable for all ages. There will be a Q&A session after each performance.

events.id: TAWA Te Tiriti and Me 2026 - Taki Rua and WCC Present: He Māori?-5 Cambridge Street, Tawa, Wellington 5028, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: TAWA Te Tiriti and Me 2026 - Taki Rua and WCC Present: He Māori?
events.venue: 5 Cambridge Street, Tawa, Wellington 5028, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Te Tiriti and Me 
Wellingtonians talk about what Whakapapa and The Treaty of Waitangi means to them. 
What is it? 
After the successful delivery of Te Tiriti and Me on Waitangi Day this year, we are bringing the roadshow back! In 2026, we’re changing things up to a touring theatre show which has been designed to be presented in schools and community spaces: 
Taki Rua Productions and Īhaka Martyn present: He Māori? 
Īhaka Martyn will have you laughing and crying as he weaves elements of stand-up comedy, waiata and physical performance to explore the confusion, comedy and celebration of reclaiming his Māoritanga from a Pākehā upbringing. It is a journey from total confusion to partial understanding. 
He aha? He Māori? Is he? Maybe - it depends 
He Māori is a 60 minute performance with a short Q+A session afterwards. Suitable for all ages. 
All sessions are free, but require bookings due to venue capacities.
When is it? 
Thursday 6 February 2025 – Waitangi Day. You are warmly invited to join us for a free presentation of He Māori? Followed by a short Q+A. 
Te Tiriti and Me is part of WCC’s Te Rā o Waitangi celebrations.  Full community centre timetable below: 
10.00 - 11.30am  
SESSION #1 - Tawa Community Centre  
  1.30 - 3.00pm  
SESSION #2 - Khandallah Community Centre  
  4.00 - 5.30pm  
SESSION #3 – The Hannah Playhouse

You are warmly invited to join us for a free presentation of He Māori?

events.id: Wrights Hill Fortress - Waitangi Day-Wrights Hill Fortress, 50 Wrights Hill Rd, Karori, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Wrights Hill Fortress - Waitangi Day
events.venue: Wrights Hill Fortress, 50 Wrights Hill Rd, Karori, Wellington
events.long_description:
Visit the Wrights Hill Fortress with family and friends for our first Open Day for the year.

Self-guided tours last about one hour. Free history pamphlet and map.

See history from World War two and inspect weapons from that era.

Limited car parking at the top of the hill. Walk up the roadway or take the track to the top.

Refreshments for sale.

Strong footwear advised and no jandals please.

No bookings required. Sorry, no EFTPOS

All proceeds go to the continuing restoration project.

events.name: Te Rā o Waitangi
events.venue: Waitangi Park, 107 Cable St, Wellington
events.long_description:
Te Rā o Waitangi is a free, whānau-friendly event to commemorate the signing of Te Tiriti o Waitangi (The Treaty of Waitangi) and Aotearoa New Zealand’s national day. It's about coming together to celebrate our country and to acknowledge our treaty obligations and partnerships.

Join us for a main stage programme packed with local talent from both tangata whenua and tangata te tiriti performers. Enjoy live music, dance, cultural performances, stalls, a Kids’ Zone, a treaty education space, kai, and more.

Alongside our Te Rā o Waitangi event, we are bringing Te Tiriti and Me back to Wellingtonians. Last year saw a travelling forum series, and this year we welcome the free Theatre Roadshow 'He Māori?' by Īhaka Martyn, which is touring three locations on Waitangi Day:

10am – 11.30am: Tawa Community Centre
1.30pm – 3pm: Khandallah Community Centre
4pm – 5.30pm: The Hannah Playhouse

Book on the Council web page from January.

He Māori is a 60 minute performance with a short Q+A session afterwards. Suitable for all ages. 
All sessions are free, but require bookings due to venue capacities.
When is it? 
Thursday 6 February 2025 – Waitangi Day. You are warmly invited to join us for a free presentation of He Māori? Followed by a short Q+A. 
Te Tiriti and Me is part of WCC’s Te Rā o Waitangi celebrations.  Full community centre timetable below: 
10.00 - 11.30am  
SESSION #1 - Tawa Community Centre  
  1.30 - 3.00pm  
SESSION #2 - Khandallah Community Centre  
  4.00 - 5.30pm  
SESSION #3 – The Hannah Playhouse

events.id: DESSERT FIRST - petit dessert degustation-Le Ciel Bakery, 100 Tory Street, Te Aro, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: DESSERT FIRST - petit dessert degustation
events.venue: Le Ciel Bakery, 100 Tory Street, Te Aro, Wellington
events.long_description:
DESSERT FIRST
A Valentine’s Petit Dessert Degustation

A refined five-course dessert experience exploring balance, texture, and emotion — designed to be indulged and savoured.

The Tease

Strawberry · rose · lychee · almond tuile taco
A crisp almond tuile shell filled with strawberry and rose crémeux, layered with fresh lychee. Light, fragrant, and delicately structured.

The Crush

Chocolate lava cake · molten centre · vanilla cream
A warm petite chocolate lava cake with a flowing dark chocolate centre, balanced with soft vanilla cream.

The Slow Burn

Chai-spiced custard tart · brûléed sugar
A refined tart with silky chai-infused custard and a thin crack of caramelised sugar.

The Chaos

Raspberry · mandarin · white chocolate mille-feuille
Crisp pastry layers with white chocolate cream, sharp raspberry, and bright mandarin — structured, vibrant, and playful.

The Afterglow

Petite madeleine · honey butter · milk chocolate
A warm madeleine served with whipped honey butter and smooth milk chocolate. Soft, comforting, and nostalgic.

Optional Pairings
3-course dessert wine pairing — $28
3-course tea pairing — $15

events.name: Brazza!
events.venue: The Rogue & Vagabond
events.long_description:
Brazza is Brazilian goodness on the dance floor at our favourite Wellington venue.

Join us at Rouge and Vagabundo to incinerate the darkness and boogie the night away.

A fusion of Brazilian Funk, famous classic tunes and original music that is sure to raise up the cold winter vibes.

Check out Abe the Babe in the kitchen, Blyn Blan Bliet and (Santo) Nicolau on wind, Frechie Fe on guitar, Pedro on bass, Fab directing traffic and Marcel keeping the pace up.

But let’s be honest, the beer is also stellar! We love Rogue!

Music from 9:30

FREE ENTRY

events.long_description:
75th Middlesex County Wavell Wakefield Cup NZ National Club 7s Tournament
75th Middlesex County Wavell Wakefield Cup
NZ National Club 7s Tournament
Ngāti Toa Domain
7th February 2026

🎉 FRIDAY 6 FEBRUARY – OFFICIAL TOURNAMENT OPENING
We welcome Sir Gordon Tietjens to Ngāti Toa Domain for a Q&A Evening, accompanied by Tamati Ellison

⭐ Sir Gordon Tietjens – Career Highlights
Widely regarded as one of the greatest rugby coaches of all time:

• Member of the 1st NZ Hong Kong 7s Team (1983)
• NZ Sevens Head Coach (1994–2016)
• 12× IRB Sevens World Series Champion
• 2× Rugby World Cup Sevens Champion
• 4× Commonwealth Games Gold Medallist
• NPC Coach of the Year (2000)
• NZRU Coach of the Year (2010)
• IRB Hall of Fame Member
• Knight Companion of the NZ Order of Merit

⭐ Tamati Ellison – Career Highlights
Current All Blacks Assistant Coach

• All Black #1099 (Debut 2009 vs Italy)
• 45 appearances for Wellington Lions
• Ranfurly Shield Winner (2008)
• 100+ Super Rugby appearances
(Blues, Hurricanes, Highlanders, Rebels)
• NZ Sevens – Commonwealth Gold Medallist (2006)
• NZ Māori All Blacks
• Junior All Blacks

ℹ️ More details on the Friday evening to follow
_____________________________________________________________________
🏉 SATURDAY 7 FEBRUARY – TOURNAMENT DAY
One-Day Sevens Tournament
⏰ First Game: 9:00am
🎥 Livestream Coverage: Details coming soon

🍔 FOOD, DRINKS & ENTERTAINMENT
• Food Trucks onsite from 9:00am
• Clubrooms Bar open from 12:00pm

🎭 FANCY DRESS COMPETITION (R18) sponsored by the Supply Room
Get creative and dress to impress!
Prizes:
🏆 Best Group (min. 6 people): $500 meal & drink voucher courtesy of the Supply Room
🏆 Best Individual: $100 meal & drink voucher courtesy of the Supply Room

🚗 PARKING & ACCESS
• Limited parking available onsite
• Traffic management will be in place
• Please follow signage and instructions

📌 More tournament, draw, and livestream details to follow

👉 Hit Going or Interested and invite your mates!

events.long_description:
BULLS | Meditation, Breath & Sound Healing Workshops - Foundations
⏰ Session:
🌿 ReConnected Foundations Workshop (10:00am - 2:00pm): Meditation, breathwork, and sound healing.
.
.
𝗛𝗮𝘃𝗲 𝗹𝗶𝗳𝗲'𝘀 𝘂𝗻𝗲𝘅𝗽𝗲𝗰𝘁𝗲𝗱 𝘁𝘂𝗿𝗻𝘀 𝘁𝗮𝗸𝗲𝗻 𝘆𝗼𝘂 𝗼𝗳𝗳 𝘆𝗼𝘂𝗿 𝗶𝗻𝘁𝗲𝗻𝗱𝗲𝗱 𝗽𝗮𝘁𝗵?
𝗔𝗿𝗲 𝘆𝗼𝘂 𝗳𝗲𝗲𝗹𝗶𝗻𝗴 𝗹𝗼𝘀𝘁 𝗮𝗻𝗱 𝘂𝗻𝘀𝘂𝗿𝗲 𝗼𝗳 𝘄𝗵𝗼 𝘁𝗼 𝘁𝘂𝗿𝗻 𝘁𝗼 𝗳𝗼𝗿 𝗵𝗲𝗹𝗽?

Life throws us surprises - big or small. You're not alone. We've been there too.
That's why we created this one-day experience - a chance for us all to reconnect with the paths that matter most to us!

Get ready for an inspiring experience with like-minded friends as we lead you toward discovering new clarity about yourself and your direction moving forward.

Don't wait any longer; start taking control now by saying yes to this extraordinary opportunity!

We’re bringing a one-day immersion of profound inner work to BULLS.

On Saturday, February 7th, at Te Matapihi Town Hall, 4 Criterion Street, Bulls 4818, New Zealand, we invite you to experience a powerful session designed to awaken, clear, and elevate your energy. Choose to embrace a deeper, more transformative journey. ❤️

This is a Foundations Workshop, a session designed to clear mental fog, restore balance, and ignite your inner spark through breathwork, meditation, and sound healing. 🧘‍♀️

All our previous events have sold out, so be sure to secure your spot early.

Love and gratitude,
Matt & Guy

events.long_description:
Hoe Down
Two massive days of historic cars at Harrisville!
While you are in town for the Teams Champs make sure you head out to NZ's best privately owned track!
Watch the historic cars and bikes hit the dirt and do some laps!
ALL Vintage open wheel - Saloon cars, sprint cars, Stock cars, TQs, Midgets, Modifieds, side cars and solo bikes.
Saturday and Sunday racing starts from 11:000am and finishes about 3:00pm. Prize giving to follow on Sunday.
Harrisville Speedway merchandise will be for sale, food trucks, coffee and cold drinks on site.
Spectators are welcome, entry is a gold coin per person.
To enter your car PM Harrisville Speedway with your name, class, car number and cell phone number.
$100 per car to enter for both days, extra drivers $30.00 per day.
Camping available $10 per person per night. You must register at the Saloon prior to setting up or you may be asked to move.
NO DOGS

events.long_description:
Johnsonville Divine Connections Expo
Experience the uplifting atmosphere of the Holistic Wellbeing & Spiritual Expo while connecting with our talented collective of lightworkers

Psychic Readings l Divination l Energy Healing l Hands-on Healing l Spiritual + Wellbeing Supplies l Crafts l Giftware

We are delighted to present the

Johnsonville Divine Connections Expo!
Holistic Wellbeing & Spiritual Expo
Johnsonville Community Hall
3 Frankmoore Ave
Johnsonville
7th February 2026
10:00am – 4:00pm


Divine Connections is a holistic wellbeing and spiritualism event that offers psychic readings, spiritual + wellbeing supplies, handcrafted creations, giftware and various energetic and hands-on healing modalities.

Our events are about community, connection and wellness. They facilitate a space for like-minded lightworkers to connect with the public and offer their amazing gifts. Hauora is addressed on all four dimensions through our stallholders' many offerings; the physical, the mental, the spiritual and of course family. We are a family friendly event, so you can take this opportunity to connect with yourself or your loved ones on this plane as well as the next!

So come along, support a good cause and bask in the awesome atmosphere and aroha created by our collective of talented lightworkers!


Entry: Koha (digital donation available via Eventbrite)
Please bring cash, sorry No EFTPOS onsite.
Each stallholder has there own methods of payment and prices


We love welcoming new faces to our stallholder community, not only does it raise the vibration of the collective, it means that no two expos are ever the same. We also love to support our regular stallholders and their upcoming ventures. If anyone is interested in participating as a stallholder please message Divine Connections Expo on Facebook.

SEE YOU THERE!


Visit us at: Facebook.com/DivineConnectionsExpo


Keep an eye out for us in an area near you!

events.id: UNLEASH THE VOICES OF YOUR SUN AND MOON-Paraparaumu Memorial Hall-All Events In
events.name: UNLEASH THE VOICES OF YOUR SUN AND MOON
events.venue: Paraparaumu Memorial Hall
events.long_description:
UNLEASH THE VOICES OF YOUR SUN AND MOON
Book Soon for this special day workshop and explore and unleash the power of your Voice and Astrological Archetypes!!

We are blessed that Alignment Coach and Healer, Clare Babbage is visiting the Wellington Region from Napier, and collaborating with Voice Empowerment Coach and Healer, Bryony Rogers from Heartsong Healing, in this exciting, unique offering.

This workshop is a specially designed, transformative full day experience of Embodied Astrological Archetypes and Conscious Sound and Voice Practices.

BOOK HERE - https://buy.stripe.com/aEU3g1gMecNj2SkbJI

On the date of the full moon, the energies of the sun and the moon stand face to face — illuminating both our outer expression and our inner world.

In astrology, the sun represents our fullest expression, our vitality, and the way we are here to shine. The moon reveals our emotional landscape, our inner rhythms, and often the fears that arise when we dare to live that full expression. Together, they form a powerful dialogue between structure and flow, logic and emotion, masculine and feminine.

In this workshop, Clare will guide you into an embodied exploration of your own sun and moon, inviting you to feel these two archetypes within your body and notice where they support, resist, or balance each other.

Bryony will lead you into vocal practices that bring these energies into sound and voice — giving expression to what is often left unspoken. Through voice, you’ll release what holds you back and discover new harmony between your inner and outer selves.

This full moon is the perfect moment to unleash the voices of your sun and moon — and to step more fully into clarity, balance, and authentic expression.

The timing of this workshop gives you a unique opportunity to tune into these planets and benefit from their placement in the collective astrology.

The workshop will begin with the opportunity to explore powerful, enjoyable, accessible Voice Practices which open, align and strengthen your expression - and create physiological changes in your energy field.

We will then directly, bodily experience the energies of each of the Celestial Bodies through Embodied Astrology, guided by Clare.

We will integrate these energies, through further Voice Practices, including improvisation, healing chants and songs.

These two modalities will be carefully interwoven in an enjoyable, rich day's workshop that will benefit all participants.

There will be guided space in the workshop to integrate the energetic shifts and discoveries of both the Voice Practices and the Astrology.

This special workshop takes place on Saturday February 7th, 10am-4.30pm - we hope you can join us

At the Paraparaumu Memorial Hall, Paraparaumu.

INVESTMENT:

Your investment for this day is $233. Shared lunch.
Some concessions are available - please contact us by email .

Payment by card here - https://buy.stripe.com/aEU3g1gMecNj2SkbJI

Please contact us with any questions at all.

events.id: Danny Bhoy-The Opera House, Wellington, New Zealand-Wellington NZ
events.name: Danny Bhoy
events.venue: The Opera House, Wellington, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Danny Bhoy, New Zealand’s favourite Scottish comedian, is returning to The Opera House with his new show ‘Dear World’. His easy-going and intimate style of comedy brings banter and anecdotes that are sure to make you cackle. In ‘Dear World,’ Danny brings a thespian flair to the stage. “This is the sequel to my 2015 show ‘Dear Epson…’ My favourite ever show. It’s a hybrid of stand-up and theatre, but really that just means I get to sit down for bits of it.” 
Danny has been honing his craft and touring the world for over 25 years. Having built an impressive following in Australia, Canada and New Zealand, he knows his audience well and never shies away from playfully picking them apart. Described by The Montreal Gazette as “One of the most sparkling wits in the world,” and by The Age as having “unsurpassed storytelling”. This one-night-only show is sure to be one to remember.

events.id: Wellington Pasifika Festival--Wellington NZ
events.name: Wellington Pasifika Festival
events.long_description:
Experience the sights, sounds, and flavours of the Pacific. With over 15,000 people attending each year, the Wellington Pasifika Festival is a standout event for the regional and national calendar. This free, family-friendly festival celebrates the unique Pacific communities here in Wellington. There will be a special opening ceremony at midday, followed by live music and performances. Dotted around Waitangi Park, you’ll find stalls, a Kids’ Zone, stone carving, workshops, and plenty of delicious food. 
The younger ones can pick up a festival passport from the Kids’ Zone and collect stamps to win special prizes. Enjoy a festival experience based on the card game ‘Lalaga’, designed by Torisse Lalau, which uses Pasifika wisdom (talanoa) to foster empathy and connection through sharing stories. 
The theme for 2026 is ‘Arrival’ — a celebration of and a welcome to the Pasifika communities who have made New Zealand their home. Grab your friends and whanau and come along to soak up the island vibes and cultural celebrations.

events.id: Wellington Pasifika Festival 2026 🌺-Waitangi Park,24A Herd St, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand, Wellington-All Events In
events.name: Wellington Pasifika Festival 2026 🌺
events.venue: Waitangi Park,24A Herd St, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand, Wellington
events.long_description:
Wellington Pasifika Festival 2026 🌺
Experience the sights, sounds, and flavours of the Pacific at Wellington Pasifika Festival 2026 🌸🌴🥥

Come along to this free, whānau-friendly festival and join us to celebrate our unique Pacific communities. From art and language to performances and food, the Pasifika Festival is all about acknowledging the richness of our Pacific brothers and sisters.

📅Saturday 7 February 2026, at Waitangi Park, Wellington
⌚12pm-6pm for the main event. Come from 1:30am for the opening ceremony.
📍Waitangi Park, Wellington Waterfront

The 2026 event theme is ‘Arrival’, which will be represented through explorations of migration stories and is a celebration of and a welcome to the Pasifika communities who have made New Zealand their home. You can also view the carving has been taking shape since the 2024 festival and talk to artist Leo Semau about the artwork.

Plus... The popular Pasifika Cuisine Cook-Off competition is back for another year, with food stalls submitting their best dish for judging by a celebrity panel.

The festival will open with a blessing followed by stage performances from various Pacific Island groups. There will be food stalls, craft, and sponsor stalls, a Kids’ Zone, and Pacific Media Network 531pi FM and Āti Awa Toa radio activations.

You can also take part in a festival wide activation based on the card game ‘Lalaga’, designed by Torisse Lalau, which uses Pasifika wisdom (talanoa) to foster empathy and connection through sharing stories.

We’d like to thank the Pasifika Patrol who will be helping out on the day. Gather your friends and family for a fun day out–be transported to the Pacific Islands for the day! ❣️

To see the full programme, head to 👉 https://wellington.govt.nz/news-and-events/events-and-festivals/pasifika-festival

🏮🌿 SAVE THE DATE:A Celebration of Unity & New Beginnings! 🐎✨
Upper Hutt, get ready for a spectacular afternoon of culture, rhythm, and community! The Upper Hutt Multicultural Council (UHMCC) invites you to join us as we celebrate the Lunar New Year and Waitangi Day in one festive event.

Whether you’re here to honor the foundations of Aotearoa or to welcome the luck of the Lunar New Year, there is a place for everyone in this celebration. Let’s come together to make 2026 a year of strength and unity.

events.name: Martinborough Fair
events.venue: Martinborough Square, Martinborough Square, Martinborough
events.long_description:
The much-loved Martinborough Fair is back in 2026 on Saturday 7 February and Saturday 7 March. This year’s Fairs promise to be bigger and better than ever! Nearly five hundred stalls and tents displaying an eclectic mix of handmade goods, produce, food and more will be sprawled under the trees in the picturesque Martinborough Square and surrounding streets. Whether you are looking for one-of-a-kind gifts, home décor, fashion or art, there is something for everyone at the Martinborough Fair.

Martinborough Fair highlights include:

- A large number of stalls offering jewellery and clothing, pottery, woodwork, metalwork, candles, plants, dried flowers, pet accessories and so much more.

- Fresh produce including fruits, vegetables, herbs, honey, and other foodie delights.
- Food stalls and local vendors offering delicious food, snacks, and beverages to satisfy every craving.

- Live entertainment from local musicians.

- Family-friendly fun activities including big bubbles and face painting.

Mark your calendars and bring your friends and family for a fun day out or make going to the Fair part of a weekend stay. For the latest Martinborough Fair updates and sneak peeks, follow us on social media.
The Martinborough Fair is owned by South Wairarapa Rotary and all proceeds from the fairs are distributed to charities and organisations especially those in South Wairarapa.

events.name: Colourful Enamel Jewellery Day
events.venue: Workspace Studios Ltd, 65 Abel Smith St, Wellington
events.long_description:
Learn to create beautiful enamels with Lisa Sinclair!

This exciting full-day workshop uses the Enamel technique to focus on beautiful enamels on copper and silver. It is a wonderful way to add colour to your work!

Create a simple yet beautifully textured pendant or earrings in metal, and learn how to add a pop of colour to your piece!

Beginners to metalwork can use pre-formed shapes, so they can focus on creating bright funky patterns. Those with some metalwork experience can take on a more advanced textured piece.

This is an ideal class to take if you love creating with colour!

Kids aged 12 (or so) are welcome to attend the class, but an enrolled parent or caregiver must accompany any person under the age of 16.

All basic materials provided and extra materials, sterling silver chains etc can be purchased.

For health and safety reasons students must wear sturdy closed-toe shoes.

events.id: Fazed on a Pony - 'swan' Tour - Te Whanganui-a-Tara w/ Welcomer & Tessa de Lyon-167 Riddiford St, Newtown, Wellington 6021-All Events In
events.name: Fazed on a Pony - 'swan' Tour - Te Whanganui-a-Tara w/ Welcomer & Tessa de Lyon
events.venue: 167 Riddiford St, Newtown, Wellington 6021
events.long_description:
Fazed on a Pony - 'swan' Tour - Te Whanganui-a-Tara w/ Welcomer & Tessa de Lyon
Fazed on a Pony is embarking on a nationwide tour to celebrate the release of their new album swan, out January 23 2026 on Melted Ice Cream and Meritorio Records.

Joining FOAP on the night will be Welcomer and Tessa de Lyon.

Tickets at: https://www.undertheradar.co.nz/gig/100103/Fazed-On-A-Pony---Swan---Album-Release-w/-Welcomer-and-Tessa-De-Lyon.utr
_

Fazed on a Pony is the recording project of Tāmaki-based songwriter Peter McCall. Featuring elements of indie rock, alt-country and emo, McCall’s songs address the uncertainties of life with warmth, wit, and emotional immediacy.

swan follows FOAP’s 2022 debut album, it’ll all work out, which featured “nuggets of genius lyricism” (RNZ). This new body of work will see McCall, with bandmates Rassani Tolovaa (Office Dog), Hamish Morgan (Marlin’s Dreaming, School Fair), and Shaun Malloch (Mim Jensen), expand from the Pavement-esque tuneful indie rock of previous releases to include pedal steel, fiddle, drum machines, and synthesisers. While there is a diversity of style, the album is rooted in the hallmarks of McCall’s music: uplifting and catchy guitar lines that serve the song, paired with arrangements that feel both comfortable and surprising. Where the lyrics tell a sad story, the music betrays that it might just be okay in the end.
