Featuring elements of indie rock, alt-country and emo, McCall’s songs address the uncertainties of life with warmth, wit, and emotional immediacy.
swan follows FOAP’s 2022 debut album, it’ll all work out, which featured “nuggets of genius lyricism” (RNZ).
This new body of work will see McCall, with bandmates Rassani Tolovaa (Office Dog), Hamish Morgan (Marlin’s Dreaming, School Fair), and Shaun Malloch (Mim Jensen), expand from the Pavement-esque tuneful indie rock of previous releases to include pedal steel, fiddle, drum machines, and synthesisers.
While there is a diversity of style, the album is rooted in the hallmarks of McCall’s music: uplifting and catchy guitar lines that serve the song, paired with arrangements that feel both comfortable and surprising.

events.id: Nevers (France/Australia) / Jean-Philippe Gross (solo) / Oghum-Pyramid Club,272 Taranaki Street, Wellington, New Zealand-All Events In
events.name: Nevers (France/Australia) / Jean-Philippe Gross (solo) / Oghum
events.venue: Pyramid Club,272 Taranaki Street, Wellington, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Nevers (France/Australia) / Jean-Philippe Gross (solo) / Oghum
Nevers
Featuring Clare Cooper (Australia) on guhzeng and Jean-Philippe Gross (France) on electro-acoustic devices, Nevers sometimes sounds like a fire in an electronic flea market, other times like the amplification of an insect funeral march. The duo finds common ground between Clare Cooper’s Chinese guhzeng and Jean-Philippe Gross’ lo-fi microphones, electroacoustic devices and localized speaker system.



Strasbourg’s Jean-Philippe Gross will also perform a solo set, of electronic music using a dedicated feedback system.
https://jeanphilippegross.com/

Clare Cooper is a musician and Design Lecturer from Sydney. Her work in creative community projects includes collaborative composition, speculative design, and critical listening. She co-founded the NOW now (2001), Splinter Orchestra (Sydney 2000), Splitter Orchester (Berlin 2009), and Frontyard Projects (2016).

Jean-Philippe Gross (Strasbourg – France) is a composer and improviser, performing with a dedicated feedback system often utilising multiple small speakers positioned around the performance space. In the studio, he continues his research with a “Serge modular system”. He has composed music for dance and performance, as well as for contemporary ensembles such as Ensemble Dedalus.

Nevers is presented with the support of Rise / La Muse en Circuit - Musica.

---

Oghum is the interstellar duo of Nell Thomas (Orchestra of Spheres, Cookie Brooklyn and the Crumbs) and Jonny Marks (All Seeing Hand, Mean Bones), performing on Synthi AKS, theremin and other assorted items. Oghum blends electronic sounds from times past with an array of acoustic and found sounds, using nuanced improvisation to create detailed and tangible sonic environments, invoking memory and transporting the listener through narrow gaps into wide open otherworldly spaces.

$20 presale tickets via UTR

Special thanks to CNZ for supporting Pyramid Club's programme

events.long_description:
THE UPTAKES w/ Louis TM
There's something funky in the water in Pōneke these days, and we suspect the good reverend of R&B and soothsayer of soul LOUIS TM has something to do with it.

Having lit up stages for years as both a keys master and modern soul man, and recently with Aotearoa legends Fly My Pretties, get ready as he hits the Rogue stage with his band for an irresistible mix of timeless soul classics and bold modern interpretations that’ll have everyone up and dancing!!

events.name: Ata Rangi Summer Sessions - Waitangi Weekend
events.venue: Ata Rangi Winery, 14 Puruatanga Rd, Martinborough
events.long_description:
Celebrate Waitangi weekend with a little soul-jazz, boogaloo with old-school charm, in the stunning grounds of Ata Rangi Vineyard in Martinborough.

Beloved in the Wairarapa, Rose & Smith return with a menu built for hungry summer afternoons. Offerings of Paella — Chicken, Chorizo & Prawn or Smashed Burgers — Smashed Cheese Burger & Fries or the Double Trouble Burger & Fries, whatever palate pleaser you choose, it will be a perfect pairing for a glass of Ata Rangi rosé, Pinot Gris, or your favourite summer pour.

What to expect: A relaxed and welcoming afternoon of:
• Ata Rangi wines served across the day
• Shade, sunshine, and plenty of space to unwind
• Soulful live music with room to dance
• Comfort food with local flavour
• An atmosphere that feels looked after and unhurried

Ticket includes entry, live music and a glass of Ata Rangi bubbles on arrival. Pay on consumption for all other food and beverages. It is perfectly timed for the long weekend, held on the same day as the renowned Martinborough Fair. Make a weekend of it.

This is part of a series of four Ata Rangi Summer Sessions, taking place on 17 Jan, 24 Jan, 7 Feb and 21 Feb. See the full series at www.atarangi.com/ata-rangi-events

events.id: Wellington Pasifika Festival-Waitangi Park, 107 Cable St, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Wellington Pasifika Festival
events.venue: Waitangi Park, 107 Cable St, Wellington
events.long_description:
Experience the sights, sounds, and flavours of the Pacific. This free whānau-friendly festival celebrates our unique Pacific communities. From art and language to performance and food – the Pasifika Festival is all about acknowledging the richness of our Pacific cultures.

Bring your friends and whānau, and enjoy a line-up of Pacific community performances, a stage activation by Pacific Media Network 531pi FM, food, stalls, and workshops.

In our Kids’ Zone, pick up your festival passport and collect stamps to win special prizes.

Enjoy a festival experience based on the card game ‘Lalaga’, designed by Torisse Lalau, which uses Pasifika wisdom (talanoa) to foster empathy and connection through sharing stories.

Come and see the final Pasifika stone carving that is being unveiled at the event. The carving has been taking shape since the 2024 festival. Talk to artist Leo Semau about the artwork.

We look forward to seeing you there!

events.id: Respecting Papatūānuku as Tangata Tiriti - Waitangi weekend workshop-Kaicycle Urban Farm and Composting, 5 Hospital Road, Newtown, Wellington 6021, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Respecting Papatūānuku as Tangata Tiriti - Waitangi weekend workshop
events.venue: Kaicycle Urban Farm and Composting, 5 Hospital Road, Newtown, Wellington 6021, Wellington
events.long_description:
Join Kaicycle Urban Farm for this Waitangi Weekend koha workshop on how to respect Papatūānuku, as Tangata Tiriti / treaty partners, through learning about Kaicycle's Hua Parakore journey.

Hua Parakore is a Māori led organic growing verification system, open to home gardeners and commercial growers! Kaicycle has been on the Hua Parakore waka for 3 years, learning about growing and composting on this Māori whenua in a way that respects Papatūānuku and tino rangatiratanga.

Come along to this workshop whether or not you're interested in joining the Hua Parakore waka; explore the pillars of Hua Parakore, built around te ao Māori; hear about Kaicycle's experiences; and get tips for running your own māra and composting in a whenua respectful way.

Read more about Hua Parakore here: www.tewakakaiora.co.nz/whatishuaparakore

This is part of our Pēpuere / February Community Open Day: www.facebook.com/events/1246402707334114

REGISTRATIONS ESSENTIAL - Register for this koha workshop by emailing community@kaicycle.org.nz

events.id: Discover Te Muna - Explore the Wines-Craggy Range Te Muna Vineyard, 275 Te Muna Rd, Martinborough-Event Finder
events.name: Discover Te Muna - Explore the Wines
events.venue: Craggy Range Te Muna Vineyard, 275 Te Muna Rd, Martinborough
events.long_description:
Te Muna means secret place in Maori. We want to let you into the secret of the Te Muna Valley wines.

Te Muna valley, just east of Martinborough, is not the easiest place to grow grapes. The winds and the temperatures test us.  But the micro climate and the unique soil structure help us produce exceptional wines with a distinctive style.

Join us for a small group, interactive tasting led by wine writer and educator Joelle Thomson, as we explore a curated selection of Te Muna wines from a variety of producers. Craggy Range, Escarpment, Big Sky, Blue Earth Estate and more.

You will be picked up from the Square in Martinborough and driven to the stunning Craggy Range Te Muna Estate vineyard where Joelle will guide you through a tasting of twelve of Te Muna wines. The experience concludes with a relaxed opportunity to revisit some of your favourites from the tasting while meeting several of the producers, before being transported back to the Square.

events.id: Steffanie Holmes' Wellington Book Launch: A Grave Mistake-Entry via doors between Platypus Shoes and Stirling Sports, Level 1/55 Cuba Street, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: Steffanie Holmes' Wellington Book Launch: A Grave Mistake
events.venue: Entry via doors between Platypus Shoes and Stirling Sports, Level 1/55 Cuba Street, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Steffanie Holmes' Book Launch of 'A Grave Mistake'.
The second book in The Nevermore Murder Club & Smutty Book Coven series.

Interconnected standalone series about the members of a supernatural book club finding their happily-ever-afters in a small town infested with vampires. Set in the same world as the Nevermore Bookshop, but eight years after.
Steffanie Holmes is a USA TODAY bestselling author of paranormal romance, urban fantasy, and supernatural mysteries. Her books feature clever, witty heroines, dark and gothy settings, cunning witches, and a dash of sadistic humour.
A Grave Mistake is the second book in The Nevermore Murder Club & Smutty Book Coven series, following Fangs for Nothing. This cosy paranormal romance blends enemy vampires who were once lovers, a meddling book club, a murder mystery, and more tea than should be legal, all with darkly witty, vampy charm.
Arabella Lestrange was once the most notorious dancer in Paris’ underground vampire cabaret, until she fell for a human, Gideon Blake, and he ruined her afterlife. She fled certain he wouldn’t survive long… only to encounter him 150 years later, newly undead and just as infuriatingly charming. It’s a story of revenge, romance, immortality, and meddling friends - all with a darkly witty twist.
This is a second-chance romance with the first romance happening in 18th-century Belle Epoque Paris, where the heroine is a pole dancer at a vampire cabaret (Le Petite Mort). Which means the launch needs a stage worthy of vampires and pole dancers alike...
Event Details
Date: Saturday 7 February
Time: 6–8 PM
Location: Pole Electric, Cuba Street
Hosted by: The Grimoire - NZ's Special and Limited Edition Bookstore

On the Night
Hosted by The Grimoire
Live reading by Steffanie Holmes
Audience Q&A (submit questions in advance to hello@thegrimoire.co.nz)
Two pole performances by Vixen Temple and Foxy Cleotopatra!
Drinks (alcoholic and non-alcoholic) and nibbles provided in ticket price
Photo ops and time to chat with Steff
Character artwork - Gifted by Steff
Purchase your SIGNED sprayed edge trade paperbacks of both books on the night

Steffanie Holmes' Book Launch of 'A Grave Mistake'.
The second book in The Nevermore Murder Club & Smutty Book Coven series.
Set in the same world as the Nevermore Bookshop, but eight years after.
Her books feature clever, witty heroines, dark and gothy settings, cunning witches, and a dash of sadistic humour.
This is a second-chance romance with the first romance happening in 18th-century Belle Epoque Paris, where the heroine is a pole dancer at a vampire cabaret (Le Petite Mort).

events.id: Estère – NZ Tour!-San Fran, Wellington-Ticket Master
events.name: Estère – NZ Tour!
events.venue: San Fran, Wellington
events.long_description:
Estère is a Cameroonian Kiwi artist, producer and DJ known for her self-coined genre electric blue witch-hop, a vivid fusion of electronic production, vintage textures, afro-fusion and folk. A self-taught beat-maker, multi-instrumentalist and vocalist, she creates immersive sonic worlds shaped by elastic harmonies, intricate rhythms and playful found-sounds. Her soulful, expressive voice anchors her storytelling, exploring personal, mythical and political themes. 
With three acclaimed albums and an ASMR inspired EP, Estère has earned praise from Elle Magazine France, Afropunk, RNZ, The Guardian and more. Her production credits include collaborations with Jordan Rakei, Deva Mahal and Oddisee, and she placed Top 10 in the global Stonesthrow Records beat-making competition. In 2023 she released “Finer” with Nightmares on Wax on Warp Records. 
A magnetic live performer, Estère has opened for Grace Jones, Erykah Badu, Peaches and Hiatus Kaiyote, and performed at festivals worldwide including Glastonbury, Afropunk Paris, WOMAD, Bushfire and Sori Arts Festival. She has headlined sold-out shows across the UK, France and New Zealand, and was twice nominated for the Aotearoa Music Awards 
Her creative range extends into conceptual performance, including her 2020 show Into the Belly of Capricorn and her role as the first-ever headline artist for the World of Wearable Art Awards Show in 2022. 
Now based in London, Estère is entering a new chapter inspired by reconnecting with her Cameroonian heritage. She has begun weaving her tribal language Bassa and other African languages into her songwriting, themes that shape her forthcoming 2026 album Diaspora Baby. She also founded DiaxXpora, a London-based community and event series celebrating creatives from diaspora backgrounds
events.description:
Estère is a Cameroonian Kiwi artist, producer and DJ known for her self-coined genre electric blue witch-hop, a vivid fusion of electronic production, vintage textures, afro-fusion and folk.
A self-taught beat-maker, multi-instrumentalist and vocalist, she creates immersive sonic worlds shaped by elastic harmonies, intricate rhythms and playful found-sounds.
Her soulful, expressive voice anchors her storytelling, exploring personal, mythical and political themes.
With three acclaimed albums and an ASMR inspired EP, Estère has earned praise from Elle Magazine France, Afropunk, RNZ, The Guardian and more.
Her production credits include collaborations with Jordan Rakei, Deva Mahal and Oddisee, and she placed Top 10 in the global Stonesthrow Records beat-making competition.

events.id: Pasifika Festival's Shooting Star Programme presents: Taula-12 Cambridge Terrace, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: Pasifika Festival's Shooting Star Programme presents: Taula
events.venue: 12 Cambridge Terrace, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Show title: "Taula (Anchor)"
Wellington City Council's Shooting Star Programme proudly presents an original theatre production, which debuts at the Hannah Playhouse on Saturday 7 Febrary 2026! This production centres themes of identity, belonging, the passing down of cultural traditions and the importance of family, both present and past. The story follows young people navigating their identity whilst figuring out their place in Educational spaces. Taula is performed by Māori, Pasifika and Asian rangatahi who are emerging and aspiring actors. Join us for a 50-minute show followed by a short talanoa/chat afterwards.
Bookings required due to venue seating capacity - all tickets are free.
More about The Shooting Star Programme:
Following on from a successful pilot programme in 2025 Étū rere pā‘ata - The Shooting Star Programme is back. Part of the Wellington Pasifika Festival, this programme sees a group of young Pasifika actors create a show which tells Pasifika stories. This performance is their theatre debut. The Shooting Star programme brings new artforms and performers to the Pasifika Festival, upskills a new cohort of Pasifika and Māori performers and celebrates Pasifika art. Created by Karl Kite Rangi with support from WCC City Events and with assistant directors Meilani Payne and Maddy Vai-Little.

events.long_description:
"So take it like a taker, cos baby, I'm a giver!"

Baby, why don't you come over, throw on the white face paint and glitter, and get ready to strut your way to the Pink Pony Club... The Giver: A Chappell Roan Drag Show is coming in hot!

With Chappell Roan making her Aotearoa debut at Laneway, why not turn your whole week into a Chappell celebration by joining us at The Giver?

Join us at Ivy on 7 February 2026, where the boys and the girls can all be queens every single day. Expect a night bursting with the greatest hits from your favourite artist’s favourite artist, served with high drag, high glamour, and higher camp.

Whether you're a taker or a giver, you're in for an unforgettable night. Featuring some of Wellington’s premier drag and burlesque talent, this is a show you absolutely won’t want to miss. Our last three Chappell Roan drag nights sold out fast, so don’t wait.

Get your tickets now!

R18 Event.
Please contact Ivy Bar and Cabaret if you use a mobility aid and stair-free access is required.

Please arrive early to guarantee a seat for the show.
GA tickets are the same for seating and standing. Venue seating is essentially first in, first served. No VIPs.

Doors open at 8:30 pm, show starts at 9:30 pm.

For any questions, please email steven@ivybar.co.nz

events.name: Amitayus Retreat - free event
events.venue: 174 Albert Street, New Zealand 4410,174 Albert St, Hokowhitu, Palmerston North 4410, New Zealand, Palmerston North
events.long_description:
Amitayus Retreat - free event
Long life, merit and wisdom.
In this special retreat we have the opportunity to increase our lifespan, merit and wisdom through the special meditation practice of Buddha Amitayus.

Our human life is our most precious possession because it gives us the opportunity to improve ourselves and attain the supreme happiness of enlightenment.
We therefore need a long and healthy life. To engage successfully in spiritual practice we also need wisdom, as well as the merit or good fortune that gives our mind the strength to support the growth of inner realisations. Amitayus is the Buddha of long life, merit and wisdom.

By engaging in Amitayus practice, we can develop these qualities and eventually attain the deathless state of enlightenment.
We can also use this practice to help remove obstacles endangering the lives of others, especially our close friends and family.

SESSION TIMES
10 – 11.15am
12 – 1.15pm
3 – 4.15pm

DETAILS
There is no cost and you can attend as many sessions as you like.
Coffee, tea and snacks are provided. Please bring your own vegetarian lunch if you are staying for the whole day.

events.long_description:
Artisan Craft Market (08/02/25 Wellington)
The Artisan Craft Market is a premium handmade event that takes place across various locations in the broader Wellington region. This high-quality market is designed to foster a welcoming and friendly atmosphere.

Our vision at Artisan Craft Market is to make the market accessible to those who appreciate shopping locally. We aim to provide a platform that supports local artisans, allowing them to showcase their meticulously crafted, high-quality products. By bringing the market directly to the people, we hope to celebrate and promote the unique talents of our community’s skilled artisans.

COME SUPPORT LOCAL CREATORS IN WELLINGTON CITY

events.id: Greytown Heritage House & Garden Tour-Greytown Village,Greytown, Parkvale, New Zealand, Clareville-All Events In
events.name: Greytown Heritage House & Garden Tour
events.venue: Greytown Village,Greytown, Parkvale, New Zealand, Clareville
events.long_description:
Greytown Heritage House & Garden Tour
Greytown is renowned for charming settler houses and lush gardens that thrive on rich alluvial soil.
The 2026 Greytown Heritage House and Garden Tour offers an opportunity to explore some of the town’s most remarkable properties.

Greytown Heritage Trust’s self-guided tour takes you through the gate and over the threshold – some of these houses will be opening publicly for the very first time.

So, spend an indulgent summer day weaving through the picturesque town’s streets, exploring our evident history. In joining us, you will be actively supporting the conservation of our heritage.

events.id: The Italians of Island Bay Second Edition 2026-Shorland Park,17 Reef St, Wellington, New Zealand-All Events In
events.name: The Italians of Island Bay Second Edition 2026
events.venue: Shorland Park,17 Reef St, Wellington, New Zealand
events.long_description:
The Italians of Island Bay Second Edition 2026
Details to follow closer to time, but already got a few new ideas for the 2026 edition.

***

Description from Inaugural 2025 Edition FYI:

I would like to acknowledge the support of The Island Bay Festival, which will be celebrating its 40th year of bringing the community together this year, and thank them for giving me a space in The Park this Sunday at The Day in The Bay to showcase and celebrate The Italians of Island Bay, their history and their contributiion to the community, business and culture.

#supportlocal
#celebratelocal
#celebratecommunity
#islandbayfestival

The majority of Island Bay Italians are Neapolitan from the hill top town of Massa Lubrense and surrounds on the Sorrentine Peninsula, followed by Sicilians from the small volcanic island of Stromboli in the Aeolean sea.

When you think of The Italians of Island Bay you might think of their involvement and contribution to the Fishing and Food (and related) Industries, but it goes much wider than that..

In alphabetic order as to not to offend. NB: list a work in progress.

- academics
- accountants
- artists
- authors
- builders
- cinema
- electricians
- exporters
- film makers
- financial advisors
- fishermen
- footballers
- hairdressers
- hoteliers
- importers
- journalists
- lawyers
- lecturers
- lawn bowlers
- management consultants
- martial arts instructors
- mozzarella makers
- musicians
- olympic medalist
- opera singers
- photographers
- plumbers
- poets
- property developers
- public servants
- publishers
- quantity surveyors
- realaters
- restauranteurs
- scholars
- seamstresses
- secretaries
- retailers
- tailors
- teachers
- tomatoe growers
- volunteers
- wine makers
- wholesalers

Books that will on display:

- Alle Fine del Mondo by Paul Elenio
- Le Famiglie Strombolani by
- Food & Family by
- Family Business by Vincent Moleta
- Angelina by Gerard Hindmarsh
- Unsheltered by Clare Moleta
- Umberto Saba : poetry & prose selected & translated, with notes by Vincent Moleta

Just a few days to go till the big Day in the Bay on Sunday. I'm unexpectedly in Perth for family reasons, so have had to piece this together organically long distance, with the help and contribution of my mum's childhood girlfriends from The Bay, for which I'm extremely greatfull.

My Back-Story:

On my mother's side I'm double 4th generation Strombolana-Kiwi and 2nd generation Dutch-Kiwi on my father's side (RIP).. thus my long and unusual name..

Rosina Maria Giuseppina van der Aa.

All 4 of my biz-nonni (great grandparents) bravely sailed to the ends of the earth (alle fine del mondo) in search of a better future.

My maternal great grandfather (Bartolo Barnao) and his elder brother(Giuseppe) initially fished and slept under their fishing boat in Makara, before returning with their Strombolane wives who were also siblings (Giuseppina and Maria Concetta Pirera) to set up shop literally (a fish shop) in Palmerston North before then moving to No 64 The Parade Island Bay when my Nonna Rosina was 17 circa 1934.

My paternal great grandparents (Angelina Criscillo and Vincenzo Moleta) along with Vincenzo's brother (Antonino) and Angelina's cousin (Rosa) settled and tamed D'urville. My Nonno (Leslie George Moleta) spotted my Nonna (Rosina Elvira Barnao) at the Zino-Toscano wedding where she was a bridesmaid. They had two children, both named after their grandparents as was the tradition. My uncle Vincent Bartolo and my mother Maria Josephine The rest as they say is Family Business..

Life throws us surprises - big or small. You're not alone. We've been there too.
That's why we created this one-day experience - a chance for us all to reconnect with the paths that matter most to us!

Get ready for an inspiring experience with like-minded friends as we lead you toward discovering new clarity about yourself and your direction moving forward.

Don't wait any longer; start taking control now by saying yes to this extraordinary opportunity!

We’re bringing a full-day immersion of profound inner work to WELLINGTON.

On Sunday, February 8th, at The West Plaza - Meeting Room 1, 110 Wakefield Street, Te Aro, Wellington 6142, New Zealand, we invite you to experience 2 powerful sessions designed to awaken, clear, and elevate your energy. Choose one or embrace both for a deeper, more transformative journey. ❤️

The morning begins with Foundations (10:00am-1:45pm), a session designed to clear mental fog, restore balance, and ignite your inner spark through breathwork, meditation, and sound healing. 🧘‍♀️

As the day progresses, the Advanced session (2:30-6:00pm) will take you even deeper, offering chakra clearing, advanced sound healing, and group energy work, guiding you toward profound energetic shifts.

If you’ve attended a past retreat or workshop, or if you choose to experience both sessions, this journey is yours to take. 💫

All our previous events have sold out, so be sure to secure your spot early.

Love and gratitude,
Matt & Guy

events.long_description:
☕🚨Coffee & Cars 🚨🚘
🚗☕ FREE EVENT - Coffee & Cars is back for Season 8! 🚗☕

We’re rolling into our eighth season of Coffee & Cars at Southward Car Museum!

Bring your pride and joy, check out an incredible mix of classics, customs, hot rods, and modern favourites - or just come along to enjoy the atmosphere.

📅 Upcoming Dates (weather dependent):

- Sunday 16 November 2025
- Sunday 14 December 2025
- Sunday 11 January 2026
- Sunday 8 February 2026
- Sunday 8 March 2026

🍔 Food & Drinks:
The Southward Coffee Stop is open for drinks & snacks (check out the new Milkshakes & Icies!)
We’ll also have the Coffee Cruisers + Food Trucks on-site plus the ever-popular BBQ Fundraiser - each month run by a different local sports club or organisation, so bring some change to support them.

💙 Look out for our Gulf GT40-inspired donation box near the museum entry!
Coffee & Cars is a FREE event and we love keeping it that way so everyone can come along and enjoy it. But, as you can imagine, it does cost a lot to run each season. If you’d like to help us keep the wheels turning, we’d be so grateful for any contribution - big or small. Every bit of support helps us keep Coffee & Cars running strong for the whole community. Thank you for helping us make this event possible 🙌

🚙 All Cars Welcome – classics, performance, JDM, vintage, muscle, daily drivers… if you love it, bring it.
🚗 Spectator Parking is also available on-site.

⚠️ Please note: There will be no October event this year as the last few October events have been rained off, so we’re looking forward to a dry & sunny start in November!

Coffee & Cars is a FREE event and we love keeping it that way so everyone can come along and enjoy it.
But, as you can imagine, it does cost a lot to run each season.
Thank you for helping us make this event possible 🙌 🚙 All Cars Welcome – classics, performance, JDM, vintage, muscle, daily drivers… if you love it, bring it.

events.id: Bailamos Bachata! Latin Dance Party (with free lesson)-Southern Cross Garden Bar Restaurant,39 Abel Smith St, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand, Wellington-All Events In
events.name: Bailamos Bachata! Latin Dance Party (with free lesson)
events.venue: Southern Cross Garden Bar Restaurant,39 Abel Smith St, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand, Wellington
events.long_description:
Bailamos Bachata! Latin Dance Party (with free lesson)
🔥 Please note: the event is free but it can only continue if we support the Southern Cross by buying food or drinks 🔥


🌟 Wellington’s favourite monthly Bachata Latin dance party 🌟


Join us for an awesome mix of bachata, focusing on the best sensual tracks and remixes, along with salsa and a smattering of kizomba and zouk. We welcome everyone, from the absolute beginner to the most experienced dancer. We’re all about the joy of social dancing together.

And what makes a free party with great people even better? A free beginners’ bachata lesson with some of Wellington‘s best Latin dance teachers. If you’ve never danced bachata, Latin dance or even any other dance style before then this is the perfect lesson for you. We will have you dancing like a pro in no time!

Bailamos Bachata is hosted free of charge by the Southern Cross. They love the atmosphere we bring but we also need to support them in return. We’re asking everyone attending to purchase soft drinks, food or alcohol from the bar. It’s vital we show our gratitude.

1800-1830 social
1830-1900 free lesson
1900-2100 social

Q&A
Q. What is bachata?
A. Bachata is a popular and fun Latin couples dance. It started in the Dominican Republic, then travelled to Europe and the rest of the world. It now includes a wide range of music styles and dance influences and is still changing and evolving.

Q. I haven’t danced before, is that a problem?
A. Not at all! That’s exactly what the lesson is for – everyone has to start somewhere and we’re a very welcoming crowd for beginners.

Q. Is bachata a difficult dance to learn?
A. Its origins as a party/community dance mean the basics can be learnt quite quickly, so you’ll be enjoying yourself in no time.

Q. Who are the capital bachata collective?
A. We are the combined Wellington dance schools and people teaching bachata and we really want to share this dance with everyone. We love bachata, we love our community and we want to share it with you
￼

events.id: Scott Cook & Pamela Mae (CAN) at Abandoned Petone-154 Jackson St, Petone, Lower Hutt 5012-All Events In
events.name: Scott Cook & Pamela Mae (CAN) at Abandoned Petone
events.venue: 154 Jackson St, Petone, Lower Hutt 5012
events.long_description:
Scott Cook & Pamela Mae (CAN) at Abandoned Petone
Scott Cook and Pamela Mae - www.scottcook.net

Born in West Virginia and raised on the Canadian prairies, Scott Cook quit a job teaching kindergarten in Taiwan in 2007 to embark on the life of a full-time troubadour. He’s toured nearly nonstop across Canada, the US, Europe, Asia, Australia, New Zealand and elsewhere ever since, living out of backpacks and campervans, averaging over a hundred shows and a dozen summer festivals a year, and distilling his experiences into empathetic, keenly observant verse. Since 2022 he’s been joined full-time by his sweetheart Pamela Mae on upright bass and vocals, crisscrossing 45 US States and 8 Canadian provinces in their campervan Roadetta, and covering a fair bit of Australia in their HiAce Hector. In 2026 they’re bringing the duo project to New Zealand for the first time with an extensive tour of the North and South Islands in support of Cook's eighth album Troubadourly Yours. Fresh from the open road, these are sturdy, straight-talking songs that see the good in you.

“Whip-smart, bone-achingly lovely, socially committed songs presented with a bold, elegant directness evoking the very best of the folk music tradition. Last night's performance in Notional Space was a thing of rare beauty.” —Mark Jacobs, presenter, Notional Space

“He sings his heart and soul, and in doing so lets light flood into your own... He has a good eye for imagery, a gentle human touch, a wry sense of humour, a whole lot of integrity, a warm, rugged voice and a bunch of memorable lines... Truly one of Woody Guthrie's children.” –RnR Magazine

events.id: Greytown Heritage Trust House and Garden Tour 2026-Kouka Cottage, 113 Main Street, Greytown, Greytown-Event Finder
events.name: Greytown Heritage Trust House and Garden Tour 2026
events.venue: Kouka Cottage, 113 Main Street, Greytown, Greytown
events.long_description:
This is another opportunity to explore charming Greytown houses and gardens where the owners have valued and enhanced the integrity of the building and its environment, and so nurtured Greytown's heritage.

Greytown Heritage Trust offers this self-guided tour, unveiling nine remarkable properties along with three destination events. A newly opened countryside café, spoiling with on-site baking, offers a pause looking out towards the Tararua range. A barbecue in a bucolic Waiohine setting. A fête, nostalgically redolent of yesteryear, selling perennials, crafts and home produce. There will be Devonshire cream teas and Wairarapa Rosé and bubbly, bunting, adventure and indulgence. How could you resist?
The houses are further flung than the previous tour and we listened hard to feedback – fewer destinations but greater distances will mean you’ll more comfortably explore this charming town and it’s houses and gardens.
You’re invited to spend a summer’s day exploring remarkable houses and gardens in this attractive town. In so doing you will contribute to a fundraiser for the refurbishment of Greytown's colonial-settler Kōuka Cottage (c1860) at Stella Bull Park, 113 Main Street, Greytown. This cottage and its maintenance are important in fostering Greytown's architectural heritage.
Receive with your ticket:
Access to 9 of Greytown’s significant private homes & gardens. Access to a fête, a café and a countryside barbecue.
A quality keepsake folding map & information poster. These will be posted to you nearer to the date.

General information & conditions
Properties are open from 10.00am until 4.30pm. This tour is self-guided; you can visit the properties in any order you wish.
Each ticket holder will be sent a map and wristbands for entry, by post. It is absolutely critical that you include your address on your Eventfinda registration and purchase of tickets.
At each venue you’re asked to present your wristband to the volunteers at the entrance to gain access. Please ensure that you are wearing your wristband during the tour as this will ensure your entry at each address. The wristband isn't transferable to other people during the tour events.
The houses, of course, are private homes. Photographs are available on the Greytown Heritage Trust’s media sites and we ask that you don’t take your own photographs inside houses, nor touch furnishings or items. Some areas will be inaccessible and signed accordingly. Some gardens may also be off limits for photography but this will be indicated at the venue.
Keeping people and property safe is important, this tour is reserved for those aged over 15. We’re also asking that no animals are brought to the visits unless they are mobility-trained and certified. Accessibility is compromised variously in houses and some gardens.
Greytown public toilets will be marked on the map.
The tour will proceed regardless of rain or other moderately poor weather but there may be a cancellation in the event of Met Office amber or red warnings. In this, what we hope is unlikely, event we will communicate with you by email and on social media sites.
Cash sales and some eftpos facilities will be available at some properties. The proceeds or proportions of these sales will also contribute to the fundraiser.
The Trust is grateful for your support, and wish you a wonderful day exploring and enjoying Greytown’s heritage properties.
Links
Website (for more heritage info):
https://www.greytownheritagetrust.co.nz/
Social Media (for sneak peaks of the tour):
https://www.instagram.com/greytownheritagetrust/
https://www.facebook.com/greytownheritagetrust

events.id: Friends of Karori Cemetery: National Monuments (Feb 2026)-76 Old Karori Road, Karori, Wellington 6012, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: Friends of Karori Cemetery: National Monuments (Feb 2026)
events.venue: 76 Old Karori Road, Karori, Wellington 6012, New Zealand
events.long_description:
The two main stops on the tour are the Cemetery's two national Monuments – the Tangiwai disaster and Prime Minister Peter Fraser.  We will review what happened at Tangiwai and especially the bravery of the trains crew and in addition, what the court of inquiry found about the safety of the bridge. 
Peter Fraser is generally regarded as one of NZ’s best Prime Ministers of the 20th century, and we explore his initiatives in public health and education and also his leadership during WW2.
These are just two of the several stops we will make.
Each tour is $10 per person (plus non-refundable booking fee). Children under 12 are free.
Our tour has a maximum capacity of about 15 persons. If there are insufficient tickets remaining for your party, please email us at info@friendsofkaroricemetery.co.nz to check if we can accommodate you.
Please note:
If we have to cancel a tour due to inclement weather or sickness, we will notify you on the day 1 hour before the tour starts by email and on our Facebook page. The booking fee is non-refundable.
This tour is approximately 1.5 hours long.
Please dress appropriately for the conditions.
While we do our best to guide you on a safe walking route, during the winter months the ground can become slippery in places.
Some of our walks require a moderate degree of fitness and are not suited for those with limited mobility.
There is only one toilet which is located by the cemetery office at the main entrance.
If you have purchased tickets for other people can you please pass our tour information on to them as well.
Please meet us at the shelter (shown as the Historic Chapel on the map at the main entrance)
We look forward to welcoming you to Karori Cemetery.

events.id: Friends of Karori Cemetery: SS Penguin Tour (Feb 2026)-76 Old Karori Road, Karori, Wellington 6012, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: Friends of Karori Cemetery: SS Penguin Tour (Feb 2026)
events.venue: 76 Old Karori Road, Karori, Wellington 6012, New Zealand
events.long_description:
On the 12 February 1909, the SS Penguin sank in Cook Strait in a raging southerly storm with the loss of 72 lives, one of the worst maritime disasters in NZ history.  Many of those who died were woman and children, as their lifeboats capsized in the wild sea. 
Although the Captain was heavily criticised, it is still not clear what the ship hit nor where, as the wreck of the Penguin has never been located. 
The tragedy stunned Wellington and a day of mourning was called for 16 February.  The city came to a standstill as many of those who died were brought up to Karori Cemetery for burial in a long procession of cabs and lorries.
To commemorate this tragedy the Friends will be undertaking a guided tour of most of the Penguin graves on Sunday 8th February. 
The tour duration is approximately 2 hours long.
This tour is suitable for people with moderate fitness. The route mostly follows paved surfaces but there are some areas of unevenness. Surefootedness is required.

Each tour is $10 per person (plus non-refundable booking fee). Children under 12 are free.
Our tour has a maximum capacity of about 15 persons. If there are insufficient tickets remaining for your party, please email us at info@friendsofkaroricemetery.co.nz to check if we can accommodate you.
Note:
If we have to cancel a tour due to inclement weather or sickness, we will notify you one hour before the tour start time by email and on our Facebook page. The booking fee is non-refundable.
Please dress appropriately for the conditions. While we do our best to guide you on a safe walking route, during the winter months the ground can become slippery in places.
Some of our walks require a moderate degree of fitness and are not suited for those with limited mobility. Please read the tour descriptions carefully to check that they will be suitable for you.
There is only one toilet which is located by the cemetery office at the main entrance.
Please meet us at the shelter (shown as the Historic Chapel on the map at the main entrance)
We look forward to welcoming you to Karori Cemetery.

events.id: Hickety Pips & Others - Aspects of Military Matters in Colonial Welli-Bolton Street Cemetery, Bolton Street, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Hickety Pips & Others - Aspects of Military Matters in Colonial Welli
events.venue: Bolton Street Cemetery, Bolton Street, Wellington
events.long_description:
This walking tour covers a wide range of aspects of military service of early settlers, of soldiers serving in Wellington, and of their wives and children, and the contributions those with military experience made to the development of the city, to society and to economic development.
It traverses the lower part of the cemetery, includes some of the earliest burials, and is easy walking. Tour duration 1.5 hours, starting and ending at the Bolton Street Cemetery Museum, lower Bolton Street. Cost $10 per person, children under 12 free, and good dogs on leads always welcome.

events.id: Natural Textured Rings-Workspace Studios Ltd, 65 Abel Smith St, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Natural Textured Rings
events.venue: Workspace Studios Ltd, 65 Abel Smith St, Wellington
events.long_description:
Make your own personalised ring - a gift for yourself or someone special! :-)

Learn the basic technique first in copper or brass, and then craft your final piece in silver!

Over this taster class, you’ll be guided through the process of heating and texturing metal, cutting and shaping with traditional jewellery tools. Use feathers, leaves, or fabrics to create a unique texture for a beautiful ring!

Learn to measure your finger, cut metal to length and texture it without rolling mill, hammers and punches. Then use a jewellers torch, sandpaper and polishing, and your beautiful new ring will be ready to wear.

This 3-hour class is ideal for beginners, groups of friends and visitors to the city.

Included in the class fee are copper and brass for practising on, a sterling silver ring strip and all consumables such as sandpaper, solder and chemicals. Extra metals are available for purchase in the studio.

Kids aged 12 (or so) are welcome to attend the class, but any person under the age of 16 must be accompanied by adults.

events.id: Improv for Life-280 Church Street, New Zealand 4410,280 Church St, Palmerston North 4410, New Zealand, Palmerston North-All Events In
events.name: Improv for Life
events.venue: 280 Church Street, New Zealand 4410,280 Church St, Palmerston North 4410, New Zealand, Palmerston North
events.long_description:
Improv for Life
This term-length programme is perfect for those who wish to grow confidence and creativity in a positive and safe learning space. Through the basics rules of improv learn to work with others, trust yourself, not be afraid to fail, develop public speaking skills, increase your listening prowess or all of the above!

The workshops are weekly, 90 minute sessions, designed to provide useful skills for everyday life through improv and fun!

No prerequisites are required, just bring your enthusiasm and a willingness to dive into the world of improvisation.

Improv for Life is designed to deliver both the goodies and the giggles for 18+ (exceptions may be made on a case-by-case basis).

Not intended for experienced improvisors.

events.id: Adult Class - LED Neon Sign-Evans Bay Intermediate School, 14A Kemp St, Kilbirnie, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Adult Class - LED Neon Sign
events.venue: Evans Bay Intermediate School, 14A Kemp St, Kilbirnie, Wellington
events.long_description:
4 Weeks
Mon 9th February 7pm-9pm
Mon 16th February 7pm-9pm
Mon 23rd February 7pm-9pm
Mon 2nd March 7pm-9pm

During this course everyone will get to design and build their own awesome LED Neon Sign. The sign can be up to 50cm x 40cm and there are a range of colours available.

The design for the sign will be completed using the open source program 'Inkscape'. The frame will then be cut out of clear acrylic using our laser cutter.

The neon strip can be cut and soldered together to make sharp corners or bent into reasonably tight curves as shown in the images. Once all the neon pieces are positioned they will be glued then soldered together and powered by a standard 12 Volt wall adaptor (which is provided). There is also the option of incorporating a small dimmer circuit that allows you to control the brightness of your sign.

Only 6 Students Per Class.

Some prior soldering experience would be beneficial.

The design for the sign will be completed using the open source program 'Inkscape'.

events.id: Paint Your Mate with Paintvine!-The Arborist Rooftop Bar, 166 Willis St, Te Aro, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Paint Your Mate with Paintvine!
events.venue: The Arborist Rooftop Bar, 166 Willis St, Te Aro, Wellington
events.long_description:
Paint Your Mate is a fun-filled painting session in the heart of Wellington, where you and your favourite human sit face-to-face and paint a portrait of each other on canvas. No skills required, 100% judgement-free, and abstract, exaggerated masterpieces are very much encouraged!

You’ll be seated opposite your mate while our Paintvine artist guides you with tips, encouragement, and lots of laughs! This event is perfect for couples, dates, best mates, siblings, or anyone who wants a socially acceptable excuse to stare at their mate.

This ticket is a double pass (two people, two canvases) and includes one free Love Potion cocktail (or mocktail) per person, all the painting materials you will need, and a final portrait reveal that will absolutely end in laughter.

What’s included

- Around two hours of painting, laughs, and creative chaos, guided by our Paintvine artist and assistant.
- All painting materials for you and your mate – acrylic paint, brushes, palettes, aprons, the lot.
- Two high-quality stretched canvases (one each!).
- One free Love Potion cocktail (or mocktail) per person to keep the creative juices flowing.
- Photos snapped throughout the session and uploaded to our Facebook page.
- Heaps of laughs while you unleash your chaotic, creative sides.
- Two one-of-a-kind masterpieces to take home.
- and best of all - we clean up!

What is Paintvine?
It’s a fun social painting class where our artists will run you through step-by-step instructions on how to create your very own masterpiece in a fun and relaxed bar setting. Perfect for dates, catching up with mates or meeting new friends!

We provide all the materials you need (high-quality canvas, acrylic paint, brushes). All you need to bring is your creative spirit (or find some at the bottom of a glass). At the end of the night, you will leave with your own painting ready to hang on your wall.

For tickets, future events, FAQs and more info, head to [[https://paintvine.co.nz/]

events.id: Lagwagon 30th Anniversary of HOSS-San Fran, 171 Cuba St, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Lagwagon 30th Anniversary of HOSS
events.venue: San Fran, 171 Cuba St, Wellington
events.long_description:
California punk legends Lagwagon are heading back to Aotearoa in early 2026 to celebrate 30 years of their iconic album HOSS. This tour is all about reliving the raw energy and spirit of the '90s punk scene that HOSS helped define.

Fans can look forward to hearing HOSS performed live in full - every track, start to finish - plus a bunch of fan favourites from their extensive catalogue. From the punchy riffs of "Violins" to the heartfelt "Razor Burn," it's a rare chance to experience the album that solidified Lagwagon's place in punk history.

Known for their high-energy, no-frills live shows, Lagwagon delivers the kind of performances that get the crowd moving and singing along. Whether you've been a fan since the '90s or just discovered them, this tour promises a night of pure punk rock.

events.id: The Best of Bill Bryson — Live on Stage-The Opera House, Wellington, New Zealand-Wellington NZ
events.name: The Best of Bill Bryson — Live on Stage
events.venue: The Opera House, Wellington, New Zealand
events.long_description:
With 21 published nonfiction books, you’ll likely have come across Bill Bryson’s work. One of his most famous books, ‘A Short History of Nearly Everything’, has been given a major rewrite. He takes to the stage at The Opera House to talk about his new findings. 
In ‘A Short History of Nearly Everything 2.0’, Bill updates the book with the latest scientific research on the Earth and the universe. In the live show, you’ll hear about planetology, astronomy, particle physics, the Big Bang, quantum mechanics, and evolution. Throughout his career, the journalist and author has covered a wide range of subjects, including travel, the English language, and the human body. This rare chance to see him live promises forays into many of these areas. All conducted with his usual theatrical flair. 
Bill Bryson has a quest to understand everything that has happened from the Big Bang to the rise of civilisation and what humans are today. Join him as he shares the latest major advances in science.

events.id: Assertiveness - Stand Up For Yourself-Wellington High School, 249 Taranaki St, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Assertiveness - Stand Up For Yourself
events.venue: Wellington High School, 249 Taranaki St, Wellington
events.long_description:
Gain practical skills to help you get what you want out of life and improve your self-esteem.

An opportunity to learn practical skills to assist you in communicating in an assertive, healthy manner, as well as improving your self-esteem. We'll work both individually and as a group using this environment to help us grow as we learn.

By the end of the course, you'll be able to:
- Speak in a language that commands respect and learn how to say “no”
- Use strategies to allow you not to be manipulated by other people
- Affirm yourself and others
- Express increased self-esteem
- Deal assertively with angry feelings and understand your own and others’ anger
- Interact more effectively in your personal relationships and the workplace


Duration 4 weeks, Tue 5:30 PM – 8:00 PM
10 Feb 2026 - 3 Mar 2026
Wellington High School
Presented by Lesli Mancktelow
$149.00 incl. GST
NZ citizens and residents: $79.00 incl. GST

events.id: The Best of Bill Bryson Live on Stage-The Opera House, 111 - 113 Manners Street, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: The Best of Bill Bryson Live on Stage
events.venue: The Opera House, 111 - 113 Manners Street, Wellington
events.long_description:
Join Bill Bryson as he shares the major advances of science uncovered in his complete rewrite of the biggest-selling popular science book of the 21st century explaining the Earth, the universe, and everything in-between - A Short History of Nearly Everything 2.0 - plus Bill’s hilarious travel, forays into the Body and Bill being Bill.

Planetology, astronomy, particle physics, the Big Bang, quantum mechanics, evolution and the show is just getting started. A Short History of Nearly Everything 2.0 is the result of Bill’s quest to understand everything that has happened from the Big Bang to the rise of civilisation – how we got from being nothing at all to what we are today. Bill will share the stories of the lives and times of the scientists behind the research and discoveries, highlighting their sometimes eccentric behaviours.

In this theatrical light hearted and fun live performance, Bill makes complex subjects fascinating and accessible to everyone with an interest in the world around them.

An evening with Bill would not be complete without delving into his travel experiences and the human body itself.

events.id: A Place To Bury Strangers NZ Tour-Meow,9 Edward Street, Wellington, New Zealand-All Events In
events.name: A Place To Bury Strangers NZ Tour
events.venue: Meow,9 Edward Street, Wellington, New Zealand
events.long_description:
A Place To Bury Strangers NZ Tour
UTR and Meow Touring presents:

A Place To Bury Strangers return to Aotearoa with their explosive new album Synthesizer — a record built on chaos, colour, and pure DIY spirit. Synthesizer isn’t just the title of their seventh album; it’s also a custom-built instrument created specifically for it. “It’s pretty messed up, chaotic… but it feels really human,” says frontman Oliver Ackermann. The album celebrates spontaneity, collaboration, and the kind of raw noise that can only come from a band locked in together.

Written in the band’s Queens studio after a refreshed lineup — Ackermann with John and Sandra Fedowitz — Synthesizer cracks open and reimagines the signature APTBS sound in vivid new ways. It’s romantic, raw, unsteady, and built for the stage, where the band’s legendary walls of sound hit with full force.

With Support from: Grecco Romank
events.description:
A Place To Bury Strangers NZ Tour UTR and Meow Touring presents: A Place To Bury Strangers return to Aotearoa with their explosive new album Synthesizer — a record built on chaos, colour, and pure DIY spirit.
Synthesizer isn’t just the title of their seventh album; it’s also a custom-built instrument created specifically for it.
“It’s pretty messed up, chaotic… but it feels really human,” says frontman Oliver Ackermann.
The album celebrates spontaneity, collaboration, and the kind of raw noise that can only come from a band locked in together.
Written in the band’s Queens studio after a refreshed lineup — Ackermann with John and Sandra Fedowitz — Synthesizer cracks open and reimagines the signature APTBS sound in vivid new ways.

events.id: Christoph Gallio / Phil Durrant-Pyramid Club,272 Taranaki Street, Wellington, New Zealand-All Events In
events.name: Christoph Gallio / Phil Durrant
events.venue: Pyramid Club,272 Taranaki Street, Wellington, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Christoph Gallio / Phil Durrant
Phil Durrant (electric mandolin and electronics) and Christoph Gallio (saxophones) are veterans of the international free improvisation scene. Their individual and collaborative projects have helped shape the development of improvised music. They first worked together over 40 years ago, but it wasn’t until 2022 that they started performing as a duo. It is rare that improvisors of their calibre make it out to NZ, so we’re very happy to host them at Pyramid Club for a duo concert plus collaborative sets with local musicians.

Phil Durrant (London, UK) is a multi-instrumentalist improviser, composer and sound artist. As a violinist he was one of the key exponents of the ‘group voice approach’ style of improvised music, performing as a member of the Butcher/Russell/Durrant trio, News From The Shed and the Chris Burn Ensemble. In the late 90s, his influential trio with Radu Malfatti and Thomas Lehn represented a shift to a more reductionist approach. As a synthesiser player, Durrant performs with Bertrand Denzler and Burkhard Beins in Trio Sowari. He is also a member of the international electronic ensemble MIMEO with Keith Rowe, Kaffe Matthews, Thomas Lehn and Rafael Toral. He has performed all over Europe and Canada and released CDs and records on Acta and Emanem Records.

Swiss saxophonist and composer Christoph Gallio studied classical saxophone with Iwan Roth at the Basel Music Conservator and then with Steve Lacy in Paris. He has collaborated with many of the world’s leading voices in improvisation including Irene Schweizer, Urs Blöchlinger, Mani Neumeier, Peter Kowald, Fred Frith, Haco, Tetsu Saitoh, Phil Minton, Pablo Diaz, Marcelo von Schultz, Olie Brice, Andrew Lisle, Cath Roberts, Irene Aebi, William Parker, Rashied Ali, Matthew Ostrowski, Gerry Hemingway, Sven-Åke Johansson, Olaf Rupp, Jan Roder, Oli Steidle, Andrea Neumann, Ernst Thoma, Julian Sartorius, Nicolas Stocker, Paula Shocron, Sergio Merce, Alistair Zaldua, Phil Durrant, Roger Turner, Dominic Lash, Mark Sanders and many more. Gallio has been running his own label PERCASO since 1986.

www.gallio.ch

Durrant and Gallio will perform a duo set, and then be joined by local improvising musicians Tom Callwood (bass), Jake Baxendale (sax) and Daniel Beban (guitar/tapes).

Their tour is sponsored by Swiss Arts Council, Aargauer Kuratorium, City of Baden, SIS (Schweizerische Interpreten Stiftung) and Fondation SUISA.


$20 presale tickets via UTR
$35 donation tickets
$15 unwaged door sales

Special thanks to CNZ for supporting Pyramid Club's programme

events.name: TechWomen and AWS - Career Mindset Workshop: Own Your Energy
events.venue: Multiple locations and online
events.long_description:
Kick off 2026 with a transformative mindset experience that will enable you to set and execute the right intentions for your career throughout 2026 and beyond.
The TechWomen and AWS teams invite you to begin the year with a special mindset workshop designed for women in tech, hosted by Candice Murray, a leading NZ based career mindset coach. In this interactive session, you'll choose a positive emotional state you want to strengthen - whether it's calm, confidence, self-belief, or focus - and learn practical, evidence-based techniques to access it whenever you need it most.
As the session is best experienced in person, we've arranged remote hubs around the country with Candice presenting live from Auckland. Discover how to harness your emotional power and elevate your professional performance through simple, science-backed tools that will equip you with lasting skills to thrive in your career.
Spaces are limited, so register early to secure your spot at this highly anticipated event.

Date: Wednesday, 11 February 2026

Auckland: AWS, Commercial Bay Level 13/15 Customs Street West, Auckland Central
Wellington: AWS, 21/157 Lambton Quay, Wellington Central
Hamilton: Tuatahi First Fibre, 11 Ken Browne Drive, Te Rapa, Hamilton

events.long_description:
UPDATE. We have just finished our sessions for
2025. We intend to start again on 11 February 2026.

Queries - text 021 02510112.

We are usually on the top floor in the room at the end of the foyer. There is an electronic noticeboard showing the location of groups.

Weekly untutored life drawing from a model. Please note you will need to bring your own art materials.

Meet up with others who have an interest in art. We meet each Wednesday evening in a room on the top floor of the St Andrews on the Terrace conference centre.

The conference centre rooms are rented by a range of organisations - we are not affiliated to the church. Our group has been meeting for many, many years - it started at Turnbull House. Some people attend regularly, while others come occasionally as their schedule permits. There is no need to book in advance.

Our group is untutored; please bring your own art materials.
The starting time is 5.30 pm, but if you are delayed, don't worry if you are a few minutes late. We are a small, informal group. Afterwards, some of us usually go to the Old Bailey on Lambton Quay for drinks and dinner. See some of our work on Facebook: St Andrews Wellington Life Drawing Group. We also now have an Instagram page @wgtn_life_art

events.venue: Hotel Bristol, 131 - 133 Cuba St, Te Aro, Wellington
events.long_description:
The concept is simple - take a brush in one hand, a drink in the other and let’s paint a masterpiece!

Join us for a creative night of drinking and painting in the heart of Wellington! No previous painting experience necessary. Get your creative juices flowing and your brush strokes going!

Drinks: No drinks are included in the ticket price, but drinks are available for purchase.

Food: A delicious menu will be available to purchase throughout the event.

What is Paintvine?
It’s a fun social painting class where our artists will run you through step-by-step instructions on how to create your very own masterpiece in a fun and relaxed bar setting. Perfect for dates, catching up with mates or for meeting new friends!

We provide all the materials you need (high-quality canvas, acrylic paint, brushes). All you need to bring is your creative spirit (or find some at the bottom of a glass). At the end of the night you will leave with your own painting ready to hang up on your wall.

For tickets, future events, FAQs and more info head to the Paintvine website.

Royal Wellington is inviting the public to witness the golf stars of tomorrow and enjoy hospitality and entertainment in a dedicated social zone called the Royal Village.

The Women’s Amateur Asia-Pacific championship brings together over 80 of the region’s top emerging amateur golfers for four days of world-class championship golf.

American indie-folk artist Gregory Alan Isakov is a Grammy-nominated singer and songwriter. He’s bringing his intimate and lyric-driven show to Wellington in February. Audiences will be given a special opportunity to experience stripped-down acoustic arrangements. He’ll delve into favourites from six of his full-length studio albums, including his most recent ‘Appaloosa Bones’.

events.name: Breakfast with the Mayor
events.venue: BNZ Partners Centre Wellington,1 Whitmore Street, Wellington, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Breakfast with the Mayor
Breakfast with the Mayor Hon. Andrew Little

About this Event

Wellington is gearing up for a milestone year.

With new leadership in place and major projects like Te Ngākau Civic Square, the Wellington Town Hall, and Te Matapihi Central Library reopening soon, the Capital is entering a period of renewal and momentum, with Mayor Hon Andrew Little at the helm.

To kick off the new year, join the Wellington Chamber of Commerce and host BNZ for an exclusive Mayor’s breakfast to hear directly from the Mayor about his priorities, and the opportunities ahead for the capital.

2026 marks a pivotal reset for Wellington’s economic outlook. This breakfast provides a rare opportunity for leaders, policy makers, and Wellingtonians alike to gain insight on the factors shaping our city’s future.

Agenda:
7:15am- Standing breakfast, networking
7:45am- Address
8:10am- Q&A
8:30am- Event concludes

events.id: Cultivating a Positive Workplace Culture for High-Performance Teams-Wellington Chamber Of Commerce,NTT Tower Level 13, Wellington, New Zealand-All Events In
events.name: Cultivating a Positive Workplace Culture for High-Performance Teams
events.venue: Wellington Chamber Of Commerce,NTT Tower Level 13, Wellington, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Cultivating a Positive Workplace Culture for High-Performance Teams
Learn to build a positive, high-performing workplace culture through trust, inclusivity, and collaboration.

About this Event

This course is designed for leaders, managers, and organisational change agents who want to foster a positive workplace culture that drives high performance, collaboration, and employee wellbeing. Participants will explore the essential principles of creating an environment that nurtures trust, accountability, inclusivity, and engagement. Through practical strategies, case studies, and interactive discussions, participants will learn how to develop a culture that motivates teams to excel, encourages open communication, and supports professional growth.


Key Topics Include:
• Building a culture of trust and psychological safety
• Fostering open communication and feedback loops
• Aligning values and purpose with organisational goals
• Promoting inclusivity, diversity, and belonging
• Recognising and celebrating achievements
• Encouraging work-life balance and wellbeing
• Developing strategies for conflict resolution and collaboration

By the end of the course, participants will have the tools and insights needed to create a workplace environment that not only supports but accelerates the success of high-performing teams, driving both individual and collective achievement.


Key audience:
This course is designed for leaders, managers, and anyone responsible for shaping the culture within their teams and organisations.


Learning outcomes:
Implement strategies to cultivate trust, psychological safety, and high performance within their teams.
Lead teams that foster open communication, collaboration, and inclusivity.
Align team goals with organisational values and objectives, ensuring a shared sense of purpose.
Develop effective strategies for conflict resolution and team cohesion.
Create a workplace culture that encourages growth, well-being, and work-life balance.

If you would like to register with Business Central directly and receive an invoice for payment, please contact our training team via .


Course details:
Duration: Full day, in person.
Time: 9am – 4pm


Course includes
Workbook, arrival tea or coffee, morning tea, lunch, afternoon tea.
To view our Terms and Conditions click here.

events.long_description:
Royal Wellington Golf Club will host the eighth edition of the Women's Amateur Asia-Pacific Golf Championship and is inviting the public to come witness the golf stars of tomorrow and enjoy hospitality and entertainment in our Royal Village.

This championship brings together the Asia- Pacific region's elite amateur women golfers who will complete for starts in three major championships. The goal of the championship is to build a long-term pathway for women's golf across the Asia Pacific region.

Free to spectators, this event is ideal for families and sports enthusiasts of all ages. There will be opportunities for people to get to know more about the game of golf. If you've wanted to give golf a go, you will want to check out the hugely popular "She Loves Golf programme" (developed by New Zealand Golf).

Please consider using public transport. If you catch the train, Heretaunga Railway Station is about a 5-minute walk to the Club. The number 110 bus from Petone to Emerald Hill (both ways) stops near Golf Road. If you're driving, parking is available in the Heretaunga area. Please note that there is no parking available at the Club.

Save the date (February 12 to 15) and we’ll see you there!

events.id: Early Childhood Centre Emergency Planning Workshop - Wellington-Johnsonville Community Centre Hall, 3 Frankmoore Ave, Johnsonville, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Early Childhood Centre Emergency Planning Workshop - Wellington
events.venue: Johnsonville Community Centre Hall, 3 Frankmoore Ave, Johnsonville, Wellington
events.long_description:
Would you and your staff be confident in an emergency? Do you have a plan, and more importantly have you practiced it recently?

We are holding a free workshop for Early Childhood Education Centres in Wellington to come together to discuss your emergency plans.

This workshop is an opportunity for ECEs to share challenges and solutions and get advice from our Emergency Management Advisors.

It aims to help ECEs plan for significant events such as earthquake, tsunami, armed intruders and to share ideas and network around emergency planning.

This is an opportunity for Centre Managers, Directors, Health & Safety Representatives or Leads to:

- Share solutions, practical advice and learnings from recent events.
- Discuss your current plans with emergency management professionals.
- Learn more about our local hazards and important planning information including lessons learnt from the Christchurch Earthquake, Christchurch Mosque Attack and Cyclone Gabrielle.

events.long_description:
Explore Government House gardens with the BARK garden team (90 minute tour)

Government House was opened in Newtown in 1910, and its extensive gardens have been in continuous development since then. As part of the Spring Festival, the Government House garden team is offering guided walks through our gardens. Tours will go ahead regardless of weather. Tours will not enter the main house.

Bookings are essential for the free tour. Places are limited: https://gg.govt.nz/government-house/government-house-wellington/government-house-tours/upcoming

Some parts of our grounds are not mobility friendly. Please contact the Visitor Centre direct if you have any questions regarding accessibility.

Groups wanting to organise a garden tour or house tour can email our Visitor Centre team direct: bookings@govthouse.govt.nz

If you have any questions or need more information, please email us at bookings@govthouse.govt.nz, or call us at 04-382-0837. You will receive a reminder email 24 hours before your tour.

Packed with stories, humour, and practical lessons, it helps new managers prepare, gives experienced leaders reassurance, and offers all attendees tips to navigate the tricky parts of leadership.

events.id: From Freeze to Flow: Somatic Tools to Move Through Emotional Paralysis-Bhakti Lounge Wellington, 1st Floor, 175 Vivian Street, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: From Freeze to Flow: Somatic Tools to Move Through Emotional Paralysis
events.venue: Bhakti Lounge Wellington, 1st Floor, 175 Vivian Street, Wellington
events.long_description:
From Freeze to Flow: Somatic Tools to Move Through Emotional Paralysis

This will be a gentle Somatic Breathwork workshop designed to help you regulate your nervous system, decompress emotionally, and find embodied clarity. Using nose-dominant breathing techniques, optional mouth exhales, and gentle somatic movements, this session will support you in releasing tension and building to a potential cathartic experience.

Who this is for
This workshop is perfect for:
•⁠ ⁠Those feeling stressed or overwhelmed
•⁠ ⁠Individuals experiencing wired-and-tired fatigue
•⁠ ⁠Anyone struggling with overthinking or racing thoughts
•⁠ ⁠People facing sleep disruptions or insomnia
•⁠ ⁠Those with a heaviness in the chest
•⁠ ⁠Creatives facing blocks in inspiration
•⁠ ⁠Caring parents in need of self-care
•⁠ ⁠Welcome to beginners!

What to expect
•⁠ ⁠Arrival ritual and consent check
•⁠ ⁠Breath demo to guide your experience
•⁠ ⁠Progressive breath arcs using Elebreath 5-Arc
•⁠ ⁠Conservative tracks available throughout
•⁠ ⁠Micro-shakes and unwinding to release tension
•⁠ ⁠Optional arm swings and body sways
•⁠ ⁠Integration rest to reflect on your journey
•⁠ ⁠Journaling to capture insights
•⁠ ⁠Live sound with bowls and curated music

Benefits you may notice
•⁠ ⁠A deeper sense of calm
•⁠ ⁠Softer jaw and shoulders
•⁠ ⁠A steadier baseline of emotional regulation
•⁠ ⁠A clearer mind
•⁠ ⁠Improved sleep quality
•⁠ ⁠A lifted mood
•⁠ ⁠Greater emotional range without feeling overwhelmed

Yoga mats are provided but you are most welcome to bring:
•⁠ ⁠Additional yoga mat
•⁠ ⁠Warm layers and socks
•⁠ ⁠Water bottle
•⁠ ⁠Small towel
•⁠ ⁠Optional eye mask or light scarf
•⁠ ⁠Journal and pen
•⁠ ⁠If you tend to feel cold, consider bringing a blanket

Pre-class prep
•⁠ ⁠Eat a light meal 2 hours before class.
•⁠ ⁠Hydrate well throughout the day.
•⁠ ⁠Avoid alcohol and recreational substances for 24 hours.
•⁠ ⁠Limit caffeine intake 4 hours prior.
•⁠ ⁠Arrive 10 minutes early for intake.
•⁠ ⁠If you have health conditions, check with your provider.
•⁠ ⁠Feel free to share any concerns with Lynn before the session at {{hi@lynofuro.co.nz}}.

Contraindications and safety
Breathwork can alter your breath rate and surface emotions. It may not be suitable for those who are pregnant, have serious cardiovascular issues, uncontrolled blood pressure, or a history of seizures. This practice is not medical care. We offer a conservative track with nasal-only breathing and smaller ranges of motion, along with breaks as needed.

Aftercare
Post-workshop, we encourage you to drink water, eat nourishing food, engage in simple movements or a short walk, and journal any insights. Emotional waves can continue for 24 to 48 hours, so reach out if you need support.

Facilitator
Lynn Tiang is an Integrative Somatic Coach specializing in breathwork and Reiki, focusing on corporate burnout, chronic pain, and stress. Her approach is nurturing and gentle, ensuring a supportive environment for all participants.

events.id: Rethinking Career: Find the Work You’re Meant For-Bhakti Lounge Wellington, 1st Floor, 175 Vivian Street, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Rethinking Career: Find the Work You’re Meant For
events.venue: Bhakti Lounge Wellington, 1st Floor, 175 Vivian Street, Wellington
events.long_description:
Rethinking Career: Find the Work You’re Meant For

For many people, work feels heavy.
Something to get through. Something that drains more than it gives.

You might feel bored, frustrated, stuck, or quietly miserable — but also unsure what to do about it. Changing jobs can feel overwhelming. Will it actually make things better? Will it be worth the risk? Will I still feel financially safe?

This evening is not about rushing into big decisions.
It’s about understanding yourself first.

Drawing on the Career Dharma framework, this event offers a different way of looking at work - one based on human nature, psychology, and timeless wisdom. It starts from a simple but often overlooked idea: we are not all nourished by the same things.

In Career Dharma, enrichment is understood as wealth - not only financial, but emotional, creative, intellectual, relational, and spiritual. Each of us is sustained by different kinds of wealth. These are known as our prosperity types.

When our work provides the kinds of prosperity our body and mind actually need, work feels lighter, more meaningful, and more sustainable. When it doesn’t, even a “good” or stable job can slowly drain us.

Through guided reflection and practical exercises, you’ll begin to uncover:

What genuinely makes you feel fulfilled and energized at work

The types of prosperity that matter most to you

Why certain work environments exhaust you - and others don’t

How greater self-understanding can help you adjust your current role or make wiser choices about future work

This session isn’t about job titles or quick fixes. It’s about awareness - and how knowing what truly nourishes you can change the way you relate to work, without needing to have all the answers yet.

Please note this is one of two careers workshops this month. While they complement each other, each session is designed to be meaningful on its own.

A plant-based dinner and dessert are included in your ticket.
Both hosts are available to support those who wish to continue exploring their career path.

Meet your hosts, Sri Jiva & Chanchala
Since childhood, Sri Jiva has been fascinated by meaning, purpose, and authentic life fulfilment. This, among other things, led him to join a monastery at the age of 19. After years of monastic training, he chose to marry and pursue a career. He felt called to use his monastic experience to help others understand themselves, and to find wisdom, meaning, and purpose in their own lives. Inspired by this calling, he went to university to study counselling. Now, Sri Jiva and his wife live near Wellington, where he works with a small team of counsellors, supporting clients individually and in groups.

Chanchala studied psychology and education and brings a coaching-based approach to career exploration. She supports people to uncover work they love by helping them understand what truly nourishes their nature and psychology. Chanchala’s work is grounded in curiosity, self-trust, and creating careers that feel sustainable and life-giving.

events.id: The Pearl Fishers-Day's Bay Opera Canna House, 24 Moana Road, Lower Hutt-Event Finder
events.name: The Pearl Fishers
events.venue: Day's Bay Opera Canna House, 24 Moana Road, Lower Hutt
events.long_description:
Come and enjoy Bizet's famous opera The Pearl Fishers with New Zealand star opera singers, Madison Nonoa, Zachary McCulloch and Kieran Rayner. Staged in Days Bay with a real orchestra and a backdrop of beech forest, experience this exotic masterpiece in the most exotic of settings. Pack a picnic and spread out in this lovely old Days Bay garden, and then take your seat on the lawn and take in the opera in a truly intimate and unique way.

Howard Moody is our guest conductor from the UK, well known for his opera conducting, opera creating and for being a musical polymath. He will conduct our fabulous soloists and the excellent Days Bay Opera Chorus and Orchestra.

Producer Rhona Fraser will fully stage the opera on the terraces of Canna House using the entrances from the bush, from the garden and up from the beach.

If you haven't been to an opera in Days Bay before, this is your chance.

events.id: Summer Camp Closing Party! | Dillon Jo, Miles Calder & Keira Batten Co-San Fran, 171 Cuba St, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Summer Camp Closing Party! | Dillon Jo, Miles Calder & Keira Batten Co
events.venue: San Fran, 171 Cuba St, Wellington
events.long_description:
Join us and some of Te Whanganui-a-Tara’s finest artists over five nights across January and February with tickets from $10 or a season pass for $40, featuring drink specials and cocktails thanks to our sponsor Jameson.

Here it is… our final night! Featuring not one, not two, but THREE of Pōneke’s premier acts to close our 2026 series out.

Dillon Jo is the genre defying project of Wellington Based artists Betty Smith and Georgie Levien. Dillon Jo built paths between the elements of dream pop, shoegaze, folk, alt rock, and indie pop to create their genre defying sound. Having recently recruited Kahu Sanson-Burnett and Ruadh Munro, Dillon Jo has transformed their live sets into an unbridled big-sound shoegaze experience.

Miles Calder released his solo debut album Autopilot Life in 2021, a self-reflective delve into waking up from an unexamined life, dressed in a psychedelic folk-rock palette that evoked late-era Beatles as much as contemporaries like Kevin Morby and Father John Misty. The album won over new fans and critics alike & led to a nomination for a prestigious Aotearoa Music Award (Te Kaipuoro Taketake Toa | Best Folk Artist 2022).

Keira Batten Coogan writes raw and messy music for alien listeners. Joined onstage by some familiar Pōneke talent, his earnest earworms pack more punch than ever. Themes of queerness, growing pains, love, and nostalgia shine through his lyricism and captivates audiences.
