events.name: Summer Camp Closing Party! | Dillon Jo, Miles Calder & Keira Batten Coogan
events.venue: San Fran, Wellington
events.long_description:
San Fran Summer Camp is back for 2026!

Join us and some of Te Whanganui-a-Tara’s finest artists over five nights across January and February with tickets from $10 or a season pass for $40, featuring drink specials and cocktails thanks to our sponsor Jameson.

Here it is… our final night! Featuring not one, not two, but THREE of Pōneke’s premier acts to close our 2026 series out.

Dillon Jo is the genre defying project of Wellington Based artists Betty Smith and Georgie Levien. Dillon Jo built paths between the elements of dream pop, shoegaze, folk, alt rock, and indie pop to create their genre defying sound. Having recently recruited Kahu Sanson-Burnett and Ruadh Munro, Dillon Jo has transformed their live sets into an unbridled big-sound shoegaze experience.
Miles Calder released his solo debut album Autopilot Life in 2021, a self-reflective delve into waking up from an unexamined life, dressed in a psychedelic folk-rock palette that evoked late-era Beatles as much as contemporaries like Kevin Morby and Father John Misty. The album won over new fans and critics alike & led to a nomination for a prestigious Aotearoa Music Award (Te Kaipuoro Taketake Toa | Best Folk Artist 2022). 

Keira Batten Coogan writes raw and messy music for alien listeners. Joined onstage by some familiar Pōneke talent, his earnest earworms pack more punch than ever. Themes of queerness, growing pains, love, and nostalgia shine through his lyricism and captivates audiences. 


San Fran holds a Supervised License, meaning minors are welcome to attend events at San Fran so long as they are accompanied by a legal guardian at all times whilst at the venue. Minors are of course not allowed to purchase alcohol under any circumstance.

events.venue: The Arborist Rooftop Bar,166 Willis Street, Wellington, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Wellington Speed Dating For Ages 26-44 by Cheeky Events New Zealand
Get ready for a night of fun and connection at Wellington's hottest speed dating event!

About this Event

Let’s ditch the apps together and embrace real connections. Say goodbye to the dating apps and hello to your very own Cheeky Love Story! 💖
🍸 What’s included: Your first drink is on us—let’s toast to great company!
👇How It Works:
Before the event:Make sure to download the Cheeky Events App (free on Google Play & the App Store) to set up your profile and upload a photo.
P.S. Don’t worry—it’s not a dating app! We’ve skipped the chat feature because we’re all about real, in-person connections.
During the event:
Check in to grab your name tag and free drink token. 🍻
Arrive on time to enjoy 15 minutes of casual pre-mingling.
Ladies stay seated while men rotate every 5 minutes—don’t forget to rate your matches in the app! 👍👎
Take a quick 15-minute break before the next round.
After the rotations, feel free to stick around for some extra socializing!
After the event: Stay for extra mingling and check the app for your cheeky matches 12 hours later! 📱💖
For more details, check out our blog: What to expect
Who knows? You might just find your next spark! ✨ Our IRL singles events (single mixers and speed dating events) are happening across Australia, New Zealand, London, and NYC! 🌏

About Cheeky Events
We host fun, inclusive singles events across Australia, New Zealand, London, and NYC! Whether you’re in your 20s, over 40, looking for love, or just looking to meet new people, our events are designed to bring people together. Whether you’re seeking romance, new friendships, or even networking, we’ve got something for everyone!
👉 Follow us on Instagram:@cheekyeventsaustralia @cheekyeventsukandireland @cheekyeventsnewzealand @cheekyeventsukandireland @cheekeventsus
Visit our website: www.cheekyevents.net or download the Cheeky Events app to get started.
We can’t wait to see you at one of our events soon! 🕺💃

All Tickets are Mobile Ticket Only. 
Mobile Tickets are like Print-at-Home tickets but instead of having to print off the tickets yourself, you can just show the barcode on your mobile phone. It is the easiest way to access tickets to your events. For more information visit Ticketmaster.co.nz/mobileticket

events.id: RADAR ANGEL - APOTHEOSIS LP PRE-RELEASE PARTY-Valhalla, Wellington-Valhalla
events.name: RADAR ANGEL - APOTHEOSIS LP PRE-RELEASE PARTY
events.venue: Valhalla, Wellington
events.long_description:
After toiling long and deep in the psychic forges of the astral plane, Radar Angel are poised to deliver their debut full-length album APOTHEOSIS, here performed for your aural satisfaction in its ambrosian entirety.
Radar Angel are a four-piece synthfoolery ensemble who blend industrial grit with lush nostalgic sounds from the dawn of the digital age, all with a lavish theatricality and pop sensibility that is guaranteed to get your limbs thrashing.
Joining them are The Blue Summer, a five-piece surrounding themselves with wisps of funk, post punk, alternative rock, and pop. Like a wave crashing upon the rocks, chaotic and multi-faceted, only to pull back exposing the calm of the depths below. Gracefully twisting and changing shape from ballads to bangers.
Tickets: $10 + booking fee through UTR
$15 on door

events.name: Richter City Rebels
events.venue: The Rogue and Vagabond, 18 Garrett St, Wellington
events.long_description:
It’s time to move, the Rebels are back! Wellington’s own Richter City Rebels are bringing the brass heat back to blow the roof off the Rogue! Channelling the spirit of New Orleans straight into the heart of Te Aro for a night of booty-shaking brass, big grooves, and bold energy. We’re in for a special one this time as we’ll be farewelling our glorious drummer, Shaun!

Known for their infectious blend of New Orleans funk, soul, and second-line swagger, the Rebels are here to party!
Bring your mates, grab a brew, and get ready to dance — it’s going to be loud, loose, and full of funk.

Music from 9:00
Tickets $15 online from Humanitix or $20 on the door

https://events.humanitix.com/richter-city-rebels-wellington
Students $10 on the door with ID

UHRLC 65th Anniversary – 2026 🐅

events.id: Jet tickets-Meow Nui, Wellington, New Zealand-Ticketek
events.name: Jet tickets
events.venue: Meow Nui, Wellington, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Presented by: Live Nation
Originally hailing from Dingley in Melbourne, Jet quickly conquered the world after forming in 2001, selling more than 6.5 million albums globally and securing almost 10 x Platinum certification in Australia and Platinum in the USA and UK for their 2003 debut album “Get Born”. The album produced a string of classic singles in “Are You Gonna Be My Girl”, “Rollover DJ”, and “Look What You've Done” and netted the band 6 x 2004 ARIA awards. Both “Are You Gonna Be My Girl” and “Cold Hard Bitch” peaked at number 1 on the US Modern Rock singles charts and propelled the band to the top of festival bills and charts around the world.

Jet’s follow up album “Shine On” followed in 2006 and was rammed full of another collection of melodic rockers including, “Put Your Money Where Your Mouth Is”, “Bring It On Back” and “Rip It Up”, and achieved platinum status in Australia on the back of stand-out headline shows around the world, and an unforgettable Big Day Out run in 2007.

In 2023, JET celebrated the 20th anniversary of Get Born by returning to the stage after a five-year hiatus, performing the album in full and reminding the world why their songs still pack the same punch two decades on. Reflecting on that era, Nic Cester said, “Get Born was a rare and unique moment of total planetary alignment where we somehow managed to capture lightning in a bottle.”

Their enduring legacy was officially recognised in November 2023, when they were inducted into the ARIA Hall of Fame.

This February see Jet live – raw, loud, and full of the spirit that made them international rock legends.

An eve of sacred sin and stage, with Fringe's finest on parade. Some bards may sing, our FOOLS shall play - and THE GODS alone shall light your way.

We welcome you to Pōneke’s hottest new venue: THE GODS.

Celebrate the opening with a rooftop party of foolish delights: clown craft corners, film camera stations, adult-friendly balloon making, and confessions with a very sexy priest.

Doors open from 6pm.

Then keep the night going from 9pm with global superstar and Glastonbury DJ Chris Arnold of Beatles Dub Club — dancing to the gods of music until sunrise. Bundle tickets or individual tickets must be purchased.

🎟 Tickets
THE FOOLS: $5 koha entry
Beatles Dub Club: $10–$20

A collaboration by Fringe at The Gods and Inconceivable Productions.

events.id: Authentic Dating Wellington-31 Hobson Cres, Thorndon, Wellington 6011-All Events In
events.name: Authentic Dating Wellington
events.venue: 31 Hobson Cres, Thorndon, Wellington 6011
events.long_description:
Authentic Dating Wellington
“Thank you so much for creating a space in which such well-aligned people could come together. I can't think of the last time I met so many wonderful, open-minded people in one go like that. It was a real pleasure” - John


Tired of endless scrolling?


Over the superficiality of app culture?


Ready to connect with real people and talk about what truly matters?


Here’s your chance take a break from the apps and connect more openly and authentically with those both like-minded and different. After a long break, it's returning to Wellington this February for Valentine's weekend!


You’ll have several encounters throughout the night. Each will be carefully guided, inviting you to be yourself, to communicate openly, and and explore multiples layers and flavours of connection. Come spark a new summer flame! 🔥


Authentic Dating welcomes all men, women & non-binary people aged 18+, both monogamous & non-monogamous. We will aim to pair you with a gender different from your own.


Is this event for me?

If you are seeking....

✨ Deep & meaningful conversations without small talky chit-chat

✨ Exciting new connections, both romantic & platonic

✨ An opportunity to explore & challenge your assumptions

✨ A substance-free environment

✨ Playful & sincere communication activities

✨ Skills you can apply to your dating life beyond the event

✨ A space to simply be yourself

....then this event is for you!


What will actually happen? 🥰

You will be invited to explore four unique interactions, some of which are randomised and some of which you can choose. Each will involve a new set of instructions to help you communicate about topics that really matter to you.

Each interaction will last 10-15 minutes. At the end of each interaction, you will have the opportunity to share a contact detail on a piece of paper in a way that is both cute and discrete ~ please bring your own pen!

Consent is important: you always have the agency to choose how deep you go. You will never be forced to share information that you don't want to.


Why are tickets sold by gender? 👫

To ensure that the gender balance is as even as possible, it is important to keep track of how many men/women/non-binary people are signing up. If a particular gender is over-represented in the run-up to the event, we do our best to ensure that under-represented gender(s) also sign up.

While we aim to achieve an even balance of genders (and ages), this is not always possible. However, what is guaranteed are skills that you can apply to any connection. Simply come with an open mind and ready to connect.


The facilitator 💁‍♂️

Laurie King

I'm Laurie (he/him), a queer British-Kiwi who’s current home-base is Berlin. My passion is creating spaces that cultivate healthy, thriving human-to-human relationships, helping people take off their masks, feel their sensations and celebrate their aliveness on Earth. Since 2019, I have organised and facilitated hundreds of Authentic Relating, Dating and Embodiment workshops in Oceania and Europe.

My training includes The Embody Lab, Authentic Revolution, Body Electric, Connection Institute and World Peace Yoga School. I have facilitated at internationally acclaimed festivals such as Stretch and Ignite, and organisations such as ART International and Authentic Bay Area.

My workshops have sparked thousands of nourishing connections, turning many strangers into life-long friends. I look forward to holding space for you!

I also offer online Holistic Coaching sessions, inspired by Authentic Relating, Positive Intelligence and Somatic Experiencing techniques.


For more information, check out itoiauthenticrelating.com.


For my Instagram, check out @itoiauthentic.


i to i Authentic Dating has already been a big hit in Wellington, as well as Auckland, Christchurch, Berlin, Amsterdam, Melbourne, Sydney, Vienna, Copenhagen, London, Bristol, Edinburgh, Glasgow, Montreal.


Here’s what others have said:


"This has been the most positive experience I've had in meeting genuine souls with the intention of finding love/romance for over 6 years" - Luca


"Laurie led us through a series of games and exercises that allowed us to open up and create very real bonds with others and with our own selves. Many emotions were felt in the safest, most welcoming environment" - Jason


“What a wonderful workshop you ran last night. I walked away with a sense of renewed self worth and also questioned why I don’t articulate comfortably what I want. It’s the perfect antidote to app culture.” - Imogen


“Laurie created a beautiful, safe space in no time, making it an ideal environment to be present and engage meaningfully with the activities. Even though all participants were strangers to me, I felt a deep sense of belonging developing over the evening.” - Tim


“Thank you so much for creating a space in which such well-aligned people could come together. I can't think of the last time I met so many wonderful, open-minded people in one go like that. It was a real pleasure” - John


"I love Laurie’s energy, wisdom, execution and light touch. I felt super safe to open up and connect while he was holding the space" - Tess


"Authentic Dating re-opened an old window for me in a new way. Heaps of fun too! And I did meet a very special person. Highly recommend for anyone curious and keen to connect with depth & joy" - Samantha


Practicalities:

Cost:

$35 for Low income

$45 for Regular income

$55 for High income

*

Location: Wellington Meditation Centre, 31 Hobson Crescent, Thorndon, Wellington 6011, New Zealand.

When: Friday 13th February, 7.30 - 10pm. Please be on time as you may not be let in if not.

Dress code: Whatever you're comfortable in. The venue is shoes off and (mainly) seating on the floor.

Intoxicants: This is an alcohol and drug free event. There will however be plenty of tea available.

Refund policy: No refunds available. If you cannot make it you may transfer your ticket to a friend or use it as credit for a future i to i event.


* Why are tickets sold by income? 💰

In order to make the event as accessible as possible, there are three ticket types available, depending on the level of income you feel you have. It is up to you to decide how much you would like to contribute to the event.

If you would really like to attend but do not have the funds for the lowest ticket option, please get in touch and we can figure something out!

Limited spaces available through Humanitix. Book early to secure your place!

events.id: D'Things N Such-1 Taranaki Street, New Zealand 6011,1A Taranaki St, Wellington Central, Wellington 6011, New Zealand, Wellington-All Events In
events.name: D'Things N Such
events.venue: 1 Taranaki Street, New Zealand 6011,1A Taranaki St, Wellington Central, Wellington 6011, New Zealand, Wellington
events.long_description:
D'Things N Such
“D’ Things N Such” is Wellington’s freshest, wildest and most unhinged theatrical experience since someone slapped corned beef and Nutella on toast. This absurd, high-energy, non-linear show is a chaotic collision of physical theatre, nonsense comedy and emotional whiplash. Five fearless FOB clowns with a broken compass lead audiences through a never-ending game of theatrical tag, where intense moments are created and then gleefully abandoned.

Born from a desire to rewire how we experience theatre, DTNS blends live theatre with the rhythm of TikToks and reels, bringing the energy of your screen to the streets and stages of Pōneke.

This is a disaster on purpose. Get lost with us and maybe leave with abs.

events.id: The Beatles Dub Club @ The NZ Fringe 2026-The Gods - Paramount,29 Courtenay Place, Wellington, New Zealand-All Events In
events.name: The Beatles Dub Club @ The NZ Fringe 2026
events.venue: The Gods - Paramount,29 Courtenay Place, Wellington, New Zealand
events.long_description:
The Beatles Dub Club @ The NZ Fringe 2026
Coming to the NZ Fringe for its debut show - The Beatles Dub Club!

A special DJ set showcasing The Fab Four like you've never heard before!

DJ Chris Arnold takes you on a magical mystery tour of his collection of covers, remixes and tracks that sampled arguably the greatest band that ever existed - The Beatles. Expect to hear plenty of reggae, ska, latin, hip hop, dub, funk, house and even drum & bass takes on the wonderful music created by John, Paul, George & Ringo.

Since its explosive debut in 2021, The Beatles Dub Club has packed out stages at Glastonbury, Boomtown, Latitude, Isle of Wight, Camp Bestival, Green Man and far beyond.

The show has been championed by Fatboy Slim, who personally invited Chris to perform with him, and was tipped by Far Out Magazine as one of Glastonbury's "Top 20 Alternative Acts to Watch".

The Beatles Dub Club has since gone truly international, with acclaimed tours across Europe, Australia, New Zealand and Bali, while continuing to light up festivals all over the UK & Ireland - including standout sets supporting UB40, Craig Charles and The Wailers.

"If Sergeant Pepper had been a DJ, this would have been his set..." - Fatboy Slim

"Far from pure novelty, it is a wonderful way to celebrate music in all of its connective guises" - Far Out Magazine

"Loving it!" - Mary McCartney

"Something so effective, and seemingly obvious, that it feels as if it should have existed for much longer than its inception just a few years ago" - The Fix Magazine

$10-20 tickets from the NZ Fringe website

events.id: Pizza Night at Longbush Cottage-Longbush Cottage, 1023 Longbush Road, Carterton-Event Finder
events.name: Pizza Night at Longbush Cottage
events.venue: Longbush Cottage, 1023 Longbush Road, Carterton
events.long_description:
Authentic wood-fired Napoletana pizzas by Roving Pizza, a garden bar, and golden-hour vibes — join us for Pizza Night at Longbush Cottage!

Roving Pizza with their mobile wood-fired oven will be serving up authentic Napoletana pizzas — soft, crunchy, and unforgettable. Pair your pizza with a glass from our licensed garden bar, offering local wines, beers, and low/no alcohol options.

Relax in the gardens, grab a seat at a picnic table, or throw down a rug and enjoy golden-hour views. Kids are welcome (with supervision).

What to expect:
- Hand-made wood-fired Napoletana pizzas
- Licensed bar with wine, beer & non-alcoholic drinks
- A relaxed outdoor garden setting
- Our Emporium may be open for a spot of gift shopping

Good to know:
- No BYO alcohol
- No pre-booking or takeaway orders in advance
- Card facilities available

Tickets: Free entry — just pay for food & drinks.

events.id: Lost Wax in Three - Hard Wax - Fridays!-Workspace Studios Ltd, 65 Abel Smith St, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Lost Wax in Three - Hard Wax - Fridays!
events.venue: Workspace Studios Ltd, 65 Abel Smith St, Wellington
events.long_description:
Over three sessions, create stunning jewellery using the age-old lost wax technique. This is an excellent opportunity to treat yourself to some creative fun on a Friday night!

In weeks one and two, you will learn how to work with jeweller's hard wax to create beautiful textures in metal that can be used to create amazing rings or objects. Your waxes will be sent away for casting in the metal of your choice.

Then there will be a week's break before the third session, to allow time for everyone's waxes to be cast. The third session covers how to trim, clean and finish your casts, turning them into original jewellery ready to wear!

More advanced students can use these sessions to complete projects in a class setting.

Included in the class fee are all your different types of waxes, sandpaper and courier costs.

Not included are the casting and metal costs which vary from student to student depending on what sized ring they want to make and the type of metal you choose. Small castings can cost around $6.65 - $12 and might cost between $7 to $30 in metals depending on if you use red bronze, white bronze or silver.

This class is great for teens and kids over 12 or so. Anyone under 16 must be accompanied by an enrolled parent or caregiver.

More advanced students can use these sessions to complete projects in a class setting.

events.id: D'Things N Such-Circa Theatre, 1 Taranaki St, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: D'Things N Such
events.venue: Circa Theatre, 1 Taranaki St, Wellington
events.long_description:
“D’ Things N Such” is Wellington’s freshest, wildest and most unhinged theatrical experience since someone slapped corned beef and Nutella on toast. This absurd, high-energy, non-linear show is a chaotic collision of physical theatre, nonsense comedy and emotional whiplash. Five fearless FOB clowns with a broken compass lead audiences through a never-ending game of theatrical tag, where intense moments are created and then gleefully abandoned.

Born from a desire to rewire how we experience theatre, DTNS blends live theatre with the rhythm of TikToks and reels, bringing the energy of your screen to the streets and stages of Pōneke.

This is a disaster on purpose. Get lost with us and maybe leave with abs.

Presented by Gentle Boys

Reviews
“You just got to watch it, it’s crack up, it’s so f*cking crack up”
“A Child’s imagination on steroids, multiplied, and evolved into a masterclass of absurdism, funniness and playfulness”

Friday 13 – Saturday 28 Feb
Tues – Sat 7,30pm, Sunday 4.30pm
CIRCA TWO
$25 – $35
Support the Artist $45

Audience Care: Mild Coarse Language and Heavy Audience Participation. Haze and strobe lighting will be used.
Duration: 60 minutes no interval

events.id: Driving me crazy - A comedy show-The Fringe Bar, 26 Allen Street, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Driving me crazy - A comedy show
events.venue: The Fringe Bar, 26 Allen Street, Wellington
events.long_description:
Driving me crazy is a no-brakes comedy collision starring real-life married comedy couple Mo Munn and Q Potts -- and yes, they're still together... somehow.

This fast-paced, unfiltered blend of stand-up and sketch dives head-on into the chaos of co-piloting a life -- and a car -- with your partner. From white-knuckled driving lessons to petty habits that spark full-blown meltdowns, nothing is sacred. Refusing to drive a manual? Refusing to wipe the bench properly? Buckle up, because it's all going under the microscope.

With razor-sharp wit, undeniable chemistry, and just the right amount of road rage, Driving Me Crazy swerves through the hilarious potholes of modern relationships -- where love, frustration, and GPS miscommunications collide.

Expect rapid-fire banter, brutally relatable stories, and sketches that hit a little too close to home. Mo and Q are living proof that marriage is messy, weird, and completely worth mocking on stage.

Perfect for date night, mate night, or when you just need to laugh at someone else's dysfunction for once -- Driving Me Crazy is a comedic car crash you'll be glad you didn't miss this Valentine's weekend!

Mo Munn is a multi-award-winning comedian, recently named Best Newcomer at the 2025 NZ International Comedy Festival. Q Potts is a rising star on the scene, and a 2025 Wellington Raw Comedy Quest Finalist.

Relationships don't come with a manual. But this show? It's the next best thing.

This show is part of the 2026 NZ Fringe Festival

events.long_description:
Greenwolve | Alpaka x Jungle Juice
Red Square, 13th February in Wellington, NZ

Greenwolve together with the record label Alpaka MuziK, bringing their raw dark minimal underground energy to the final New Zealand stop!
Led by the vision of Jeff Coz, KOZY founder, Manager and dj at Alpaka MuziK

@greenwolve_music, aka Baptiste Petit is a French-born Psy Techno Dj and producer based in Switzerland.
Known for his hypnotic, groove and driven sound that blends deep techno rhythms with psychedelic energy.

A leading force in the psychedelic techno scene, Greenwolve delivers a powerful sonic journey inspired by cosmic progressions, dark atmospheres, and psychedelic flair into each performance and release.
His sound has ignited dancefloors worldwide, with standout performances at Son Libre (France), Dragon Dreaming (Australia), Suti (Portugal), Okami (France), Groove & Bass (Canada), headline shows across Norway, the UK, Switzerland and New Zealand (2024)

His music has been supported by some of the biggest names in electronic music, including Joris Voorn on the TOMORROWLAND main stage.
A central artist on Alpaka MuziK, Greenwolve keeps evolving his sound through collaborations with Alula, Kosmos, Digital Structures, Music4Aliens, and PifMizik.

Joined by local DJs

Catch Greenwolve live on Friday 13th at Red Square, Wellington.
From 10pm till late

Early birds OUT NOW in BIO
Don’t miss out

soundcloud.com/greenwolve
Instagram: @greenwolve_music

Alpaka IG
Important Information
This event is R18. Valid photo ID will be required for entry.
Respect each other and the venue.
We will not tolerate any form of discrimination.
Look out for each other and please report any antisocial behaviour.
Consent is key – always.
Lighting & Visual Effects: Please be aware that strobe lights, lasers and other flashing
visuals may be in use throughout the night. These effects may not be suitable for everyone.
Photos & Video: Our crew will be capturing the energy of the night through photos and videos. By being here, you’re part of that magic and may appear in content we share to celebrate and promote future events.
Have fun and please find the crew if you have any issues.

events.name: Wellington Gypsy Fair
events.venue: Frank Kitts Park,68 Jervois Quay, Wellington, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Wellington Gypsy Fair
The Gypsy Fair is a nationwide travelling event, bringing family fun, live music and an unbeatable vibe to each town we visit.🌞💜

Having been on the road for over 45 years, it’s safe to say our roots run deep. Our people are incredible, and house trucks/buses are pretty cool too! So don’t forget to check out our unique way of living while you’re here 🫶🌿🌻💜

Whether you’re just having a browse, letting the kids loose on our rides, parking up with some food or coffee, or checking out some funky handmade crafts, we would love to see you! Come and hang out for the day, we’re sure to bring smiles to your faces, and create lifelong memories💜

🌞Free entry for everyone🌞 We pride ourselves on being an affordable event for every family. With free entertainment all day, plenty of chill out zones, and loads of life size games laying around, we truely love to see the community getting amongst it all! Can’t wait to see you there🌞👣🐝🌿🌊

Follow us on Facebook – ‘Gypsy Fair’ for updates on our travels and creations! We’re always open to anyone who wants to come and live the dream, so please email us if this sounds like a bit of you. –

events.id: Community Snorkel: Taputeranga Marine Reserve-Island Bay Beach, Taputeranga Marine Reserve,300 The Esplanade, Island Bay, Wellington 6023, New Zealand, Wellington-All Events In
events.name: Community Snorkel: Taputeranga Marine Reserve
events.venue: Island Bay Beach, Taputeranga Marine Reserve,300 The Esplanade, Island Bay, Wellington 6023, New Zealand, Wellington
events.long_description:
Community Snorkel: Taputeranga Marine Reserve
Dive into Taputeranga Marine Reserve and take part in a free snorkelling event this summer!

Beginners welcome! We provide all the necessary gear and experienced guides to ensure your safety and enjoyment in the water. Participants just need to be at least eight years old and confident swimmers. Those under sixteen must be accompanied by an adult.

Registrations open at 9.45am. Come down to book a snorkel time for the day, as spots may fill up quickly. Bring your togs, towel, refreshments and make a day of it exploring the activities and environment at Taputeranga Marine Reserve.

This free event is brought to you in partnership with Greater Wellington Regional Council.

Cancellations/Postponements

Events are weather dependent. Stay updated by checking the Mountains to Sea Wellington Facebook event listings for any cancellations, postponements, or location changes.

To get to Taputeranga Marine Reserve

We encourage attendees to leave cars at home and use alternative transport where possible. Locals- please come on foot or bring along your bikes/scooters! For those further afield, the number 1 bus drops you right to the event from the Wellington Train Station.

Accessibility

Island Bay Beach is accessible by beach wheelchair. The nearest accessible toilets are in Shorland Park. There are two accessible parks in front of the Island Bay Surf Club, additional vehicles can be accommodated if required, near to our MTSW trailers. Please see a staff member on arrival if the Surf Club parks are full. We have a variety of options to enable a more comfortable experience in the water, including flotation aids and 1:1 support from our trained guides. Please get in touch with us at in advance of the event to discuss your accessibility requirements, including to enquire about beach wheelchair assistance. We love helping people to experience our marine environment!

The snorkelling in this event is run under the Health and Safety of the Mountains to Sea Conservation Trust programme Experiencing Marine Reserves. Adventure Activity Certified - AA0534.

‍
Photos: Kristine Zipfel

events.id: Enchanted Park-Wainuiomata Recreation Area,10 Whitcher Grove, Lower Hutt, New Zealand-All Events In
events.name: Enchanted Park
events.venue: Wainuiomata Recreation Area,10 Whitcher Grove, Lower Hutt, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Enchanted Park
Free fairy fun in the forest!

Bring the whānau for an enchanting afternoon in the Gums Loop Meadow at Wainuiomata Regional Park. This special summer event invites tamariki to explore nature, get creative, and learn about the native wildlife that calls this forest home.

Help us build a fairy garden in the forest where North Island brown kiwi live. Kids can paint rocks or create their own fairy doors. There will be facepainting and outdoor games. You're encouraged to bring fairy costumes and picnic lunches to enjoy in the meadow.

Our knowledgeable park ranger will be there (with fairy wings on) to answer questions and share stories about the park’s natural heritage.

The Remutaka Conservation Trust and Forest & Bird be on hand to teach tamariki about the kiwi who live in this park and the conservation work happening in the area.

Event Details:

Aimed at: Children aged 4–10

Accessibility: Tracks suitable for prams

Dogs: Allowed on a lead

What to bring: Picnic, costumes, and creativity!


Get the whānau involved in Summer Events

Discover the magic of our regional parks. For 25 years, Greater Wellington has been hosting recreational events that help people connect with nature, get active outdoors, and enjoy time together.

Wainuiomata Regional Park is a special place for conservation. Greater Wellington’s work here protects freshwater sources, preserves ancient native forests, looks after historic sites, and helps build resilience to climate change. Our partners and volunteers, like the Remutaka Conservation Trust, play a vital role in making this park a special place for everyone.

events.long_description:
Scottish pop-rock icons Deacon Blue are heading to The Opera House in 2026. The visit coincides with the band’s 40 anniversary and the release of its eleventh studio album, ‘The Great Western Road’. New Zealand fans can expect a curated setlist blending arena-sized classic anthems and intimate surprises.
Deacon Blue is known for emotionally-charged performances and enduring hits like Dignity, Real Gone Kid, I’ll Never Fall In Love Again, and Fergus Sings the Blues. Audiences are sure to have a dynamic live experience in a concert spanning the band’s full career. Songs will range from the soulful grit of acclaimed debut album ‘Raintown’ to newer releases. ‘The Great Western Road’ reflects the band’s journey across four decades of music making with honesty, warmth, and a renewed sense of adventure.
With a reputation for crafting unforgettable live moments,
Deacon Blue’s 2026 tour will be 40 years strong, and more poignant and potent than ever.

events.id: As You Like It!-Aro Park,Aro St, Wellington, New Zealand-All Events In
events.name: As You Like It!
events.venue: Aro Park,Aro St, Wellington, New Zealand
events.long_description:
As You Like It!
‘’All the world’s a stage, and all the men and women merely players’’

The forest is calling! This summer, a new company of players, The Midsummer Botanicals, invite audiences to step beneath the trees and into the wild, wondrous world of As You Like It - a sun-soaked celebration of laughter and community blooming in one of Wellington’s gorgeous parks for the first week of the Wellington Fringe Festival.

In 1983, A Midsummer Night’s Dream lit up the Victoria University Quad and sparked a beloved tradition of outdoor Shakespeare in Wellington - a festival of artistry, friendship, and open-air delight that ran for over forty years. After its sudden end in 2023, a vital chapter of our city’s cultural story seemed to close. But this February, the Botanicals are bringing it gloriously back to life.

Set in a vibrant reimagining of Shakespeare’s Forest of Arden, this production draws on courtyard and marketplace traditions of performance, transforming Wellington’s Aro Valley gem into a living, breathing garden of music, colour, and character. Audiences are invited to arrive early, explore the space, and meet the motley cast of lovers and fools before the story even begins. Expect song, sun, silliness, and the scent of summer roses.

events.id: HED P.E. | San Fran, Wellington | with NONPOINT | Still 'Broke' New Zealand Tour 2026-San Fran,Edilsons Building, 171 Cuba St, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand, Wellington-All Events In
events.name: HED P.E. | San Fran, Wellington | with NONPOINT | Still 'Broke' New Zealand Tour 2026
events.venue: San Fran,Edilsons Building, 171 Cuba St, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand, Wellington
events.long_description:
HED P.E. | San Fran, Wellington | with NONPOINT | Still 'Broke' New Zealand Tour 2026
HED P.E.
Still ‘Broke’ Australian Tour 2026
with NONPOINT

📆 Live at San Fran, Wellington on Saturday 14 February

— 𝐎𝐧 𝐒𝐚𝐥𝐞 𝐍𝐨𝐰 —
➥ bit.ly/hednon26well
__________________________________________

(HED) P.E. return to shake New Zealand to its very foundations and they are bringing NONPOINT with them

Celebrating the 25th anniversary of their landmark album Broke, the band will deliver a full-throttle set packed with fan favourites like Bartender, Killing Time, and Feel Good; which featured none other than Serj Tankian (System of a Down) and Morgan Lander (Kittie) on the album.

Critics hailed Broke as a “magnum opus of rap, funk, hip hop, and metal” (UnEarthed), while Sputnikmusic praised its “excellent” RATM meets hip-hop genre fusion and raw emotional punch. Whilst RateYourMusic users described the album as “hedonistic, energetic, vulgar, rhythmic, urban, and heavy,” capturing the raw essence of its sound and attitude. With over 450,000 copies sold worldwide, Broke remains a defining moment in the nu-metal era and this tour is your chance to relive it live.

Expect pounding riffs, funk-infused grooves, and the unmistakable flow of frontman Jahred Gomes, whose stage presence turns every show into a riotous celebration of rebellion and rhythm. From their self-titled debut in 1997 to their latest release New and Improved, (HED) P.E. continues to evolve while staying true to their anti-establishment roots.

Debuting in New Zealand for the first time and with an incredible career spanning nearly three decades, Nonpoint has long been a force to be reckoned with in the nu-metal/rap-rock genre. Known for legendary live performances and explosive tracks such as Bullet with a Name, What a Day, Ruthless, and more, the band has consistently captivated audiences with infectious riffs, compelling lyrics, and an uncompromising raw energy. Their discography and stagecraft have made them staples at rock radio and fixtures on festival lineups, earning them a dedicated international following.

This is not nostalgia, it’s a full-blown sonic nu-metal assault. Don’t miss (HED) P.E. and NONPOINT as they rip through Australia with setlists that traverse decades, defy genres, and unleash pure, unfiltered chaos!

events.id: Creative Problem-Solving Workshop-Wellington High School, 249 Taranaki St, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Creative Problem-Solving Workshop
events.venue: Wellington High School, 249 Taranaki St, Wellington
events.long_description:
Stuck in a rut at work or at home? Need fresh ideas? Facing tough decisions? Join Neil Thornton for this hands-on, fun-filled workshop on Creative Problem Solving and Decision Making.

Creative Problem-Solving Workshop

Course is free for NZ citizens and residents (please bring photo ID when attending workshop). If you are not a NZ citizen or resident a fee of $109 will apply, please phone the office on 04 385 8919 to register.

Through engaging puzzles, group activities, and proven creativity techniques, you'll discover how to tackle challenges from new angles and find solutions you might never have considered. Learn to break through mental blocks, generate innovative ideas, and lead groups to make better decisions together. This workshop draws on Neil's background in teaching, test-preparation, and creative thinking to help you unlock your natural problem-solving abilities in a supportive environment.

What You'll Get From This Workshop:

· Simple techniques to generate ideas individually or in a group: brainstorming, mind-mapping, and more

· Practice solving puzzles that sharpen your lateral thinking skills

· Learn how to overcome blocks and restrictive thinking patterns

· Experience effective group leading methods you can use with your own teams

· Discover how to identify root causes of problems instead of just treating symptoms

· Take home specific tools for approaching problems differently

· Build confidence in leading problem-solving sessions with others

Who This Workshop Is For: This workshop is for anyone who faces challenges at work, leads meetings or teams, manages projects, or simply wants to become a better problem solver. Perfect for team leaders, community organizers, and anyone who's ever been stuck in an unproductive meeting wondering "there must be a better way!" No special background needed—just bring your curiosity and willingness to try new approaches.

What to Expect: A day filled with interactive activities, problem-solving challenges, and practical techniques you can use right away. You'll learn proven steps and while practicing facilitation skills to help groups make decisions more effectively. Neil creates a relaxed atmosphere where everyone feels comfortable contributing ideas and experimenting with new approaches. You'll leave with specific tools you can apply to your own challenges, plus handouts to help you remember what you've learned.

Neil's unique skill as an educator is his rare ability to blend evidence-based teaching techniques with the perfect dash of humor and storytelling, creating a learning environment where complex concepts become accessible and new skills feel immediately applicable to your real-world challenges.



Courses need a minimum number to go ahead so if we don't have enough enrolments a few days before the start date, we have to cancel. We'll let you know by email so please check yours regularly. If you need to cancel your registration, here are our terms and conditions: "What You Need to Know".

events.id: From Rags to Reuse - Up-cycling and Sustainability Workshop-Wellington High School, 249 Taranaki St, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: From Rags to Reuse - Up-cycling and Sustainability Workshop
events.venue: Wellington High School, 249 Taranaki St, Wellington
events.long_description:
Join craft artist and eco lifestylist Stella Carruthers for a day of practical textile upcycling and learning about sustainability in the context of low-waste living. Gain practical skills in rag rug techniques and engage with ideas around textile waste, green washing and actions you can take to make a difference in your daily life and the wider world.

Stella Carruthers, textile artist and eco lifestylist, will guide you on this one-day workshop to learn about sustainable living from a reduce and reuse perspective. Learn about textile waste as a global issue and explore rag rug-making techniques - you will leave the workshop with the skills to finish a project at home. Investigate the 8 pillars of the zero-waste movement and how they can inform low-waste living. Identify the key components of greenwashing so you can make informed purchases as a conscious consumer. Finally, leave the workshop feeling empowered to explore wider social and political actions as they apply to waste issues in contemporary society.

Most materials provided, but please bring a pair of small sewing scissors and sewing shears if you have them, a pen and paper, and your lunch.

By the end of the course, you’ll be able to:
- Talk confidently about textile waste as a global issue and be empowered with the skills and ideas to reduce your personal textile waste footprint through recycling and upcycling practices
- have the beginnings of a cushion cover made using the rag rug stitching technique of couching, and the skills and knowledge to finish the project at home.
-Identify and describe the 8 pillars of the zero-waste movement and how they apply to recycling practices in contemporary Aotearoa New Zealand society.
- Understand what greenwashing is and have debunked some common greenwashing myths prevalent in society.
- Have learned some practical tips for living low waste in the city.
- Feel empowered to explore wider social and political action as it applies to waste issues in the modern world.

A condition of enrolment is that you must provide photo ID when you attend.

Note: Courses need a minimum number to go ahead, so if we don't have enough enrolments a few days before the start date, we have to cancel. We'll let you know by email, so please check yours regularly. If you need to cancel your registration, here are our terms and conditions: "What You Need to Know".
events.description:
Join craft artist and eco lifestylist Stella Carruthers for a day of practical textile upcycling and learning about sustainability in the context of low-waste living.
Learn about textile waste as a global issue and explore rag rug-making techniques - you will leave the workshop with the skills to finish a project at home.
Finally, leave the workshop feeling empowered to explore wider social and political actions as they apply to waste issues in contemporary society.
- Understand what greenwashing is and have debunked some common greenwashing myths prevalent in society.
Note: Courses need a minimum number to go ahead, so if we don't have enough enrolments a few days before the start date, we have to cancel.

events.id: Get The Job - CV And Cover Letters-Wellington High School, 249 Taranaki St, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Get The Job - CV And Cover Letters
events.venue: Wellington High School, 249 Taranaki St, Wellington
events.long_description:
Are you looking to polish your CV and cover letter writing skills to nail your next job application? This course provides you with the tools to create a strong and updated CV and cover letter writing, using skills that are personalised to you.

Description
Explore how to appropriately structure and polish your CV and cover letter in order to achieve optimum results. This course prioritises you. Identify your key skills and weave these into your CV and cover letter to land you your next job interview.

Whatever job you are going for, there are key characteristics that should not be missed in your CV and cover letter. The focus of this course is to provide you with the same lens as a recruiter. By learning how your job application is reviewed by a recruiter, you will gain skills to streamline your CV and improve your cover letter writing. This will increase your chances of being a successful candidate and set you up to land an interview for your ideal job.

It doesn’t matter what previous experience you have - everyone has a range of skills that they can offer to their future employer. Fortunately, a strong and realistic CV and cover letter will showcase these skills and increase your chances for job success.

By the end of the course, you’ll be able to:
- Recognise the features of an effective, well-crafted CV and cover letter and apply these to your own job applications;
- Apply different approaches, styles and techniques while writing your CV and cover letter depending on the context and job;
- Help others with their CV and cover letter writing (friends and whānau).

[Note: You must be a NZ citizen or resident to qualify for the free course fee option. A condition of enrolment is that you must provide photo ID when you attend.

Courses need a minimum number to go ahead, so if we don't have enough enrolments a few days before the start date, we have to cancel. We'll let you know by email, so please check yours regularly. If you need to cancel your registration, here are our terms and conditions: "What You Need to Know".

Prerequisites
There is no prior knowledge or experience required. This course applies to all levels of candidate experience - it doesn’t matter if the participant is applying for their first ever job, or they are well-experienced in the job market. I tailor my content to empower everybody, regardless of their previous experience or job experience.

events.id: Men's Health and Aging-Wellington High School, 249 Taranaki St, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Men's Health and Aging
events.venue: Wellington High School, 249 Taranaki St, Wellington
events.long_description:
Men's Health & Aging: Take Charge of Your Future

Join us for a no-nonsense, straight-talking session on men’s health and aging. Discover how to stay strong, sharp, and in control as the years go by. It's time to break the silence and tackle the issues that matter most—your energy, vitality, and longevity. Don’t let aging slow you down. Step up, connect with other men, and take charge of your health. (Free for NZ Citizens/Residents, others pay fee of $120)

Aging is inevitable, but how you age is up to you. This essential course offers men a rare opportunity to confront the physical, mental, and social changes that come with age, with a holistic approach to staying strong and engaged.

What We’ll Cover:

Physical Health:

Stay Ahead: Preventive care strategies to keep you at your best.
Fuel & Fitness: Nutrition and exercise tips tailored for men over 40.
Managing Chronic Conditions: Tackle issues like hypertension and diabetes head-on.
Mental Health:

Stay Sharp: Techniques to manage stress, anxiety, and maintain cognitive health.
Mind & Mood: Discover mindfulness and relaxation for a balanced mind.
Movement & Activity:

Keep Moving: Boost flexibility, balance, and strength to stay active.
Strength Training: Simple routines to maintain muscle and vitality.
Your Role in the World:

Purpose & Identity: Redefine your role and find fulfilment in later life.
Community & Connections: Build lasting relationships and a strong support network.
Balance: Master the art of balancing work, life, and leisure.
Fact vs. Fiction:

Media Myths: Challenge aging stereotypes and embrace a positive outlook.
Real Talk: Get the facts about aging and ditch the myths.
Why Join?
This course isn’t offered everywhere, and it’s more important than ever. Take charge of your health, your life, and your future. It’s time to embrace aging with confidence and resilience.

Take charge of your health, your life, and your future.

events.id: Retirement Reinvented-Wellington High School, 249 Taranaki St, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Retirement Reinvented
events.venue: Wellington High School, 249 Taranaki St, Wellington
events.long_description:
Whether you’re already retired, or planning ahead, this practical workshop will help you to reflect, re-envision and re-vitalise your life and develop a plan for your future, on your own terms. (NZ citizen and residents free with ID, all others pay $109).

In your middle years, working, retired or somewhere in between? What’s next? Life is about much more than work or leisure, but most of us have given little thought to what “retirement” might mean.

It’s difficult to speculate what may happen in the future – but we can be proactive and take control.
This course offers insights into how to make the most of our time once we’re less focused on career and/or childrearing. It covers many of the issues people face when considering a move from current employment to a different lifestyle that includes more time to do the things we’ve always promised ourselves we’d do – “when we retire”.

After the workshop, you’ll be able to identify a number of common issues and potential ways to manage them when considering and planning your “rejuvenation”, rather than a retirement. We won’t cover financial planning, but will focus on some of the personal growth opportunities for living and making a conscious contribution to your community.

By the end of the day, you’ll have:
- Developed your own perspective on ageing and retirement in the 21st Century and identified what’s important to you
- Completed a personal life audit exercise and considered your strengths
- Explored possibilities in the major aspects of your life and identified potential challenges and strategies for overcoming them
- Developed a blueprint to maximise the best years of your life and developed a “future proofing” downsizing plan
- Considered options to include a sense of purpose and explored and implemented choices that provide you with that sense of purpose
Bring a pen and paper.

1 day, Sat 9:30 AM – 4:00 PM
Wellington High School
Presented by Angela Robertson

events.id: Community Snorkel: Taputeranga Marine Reserve-Taputeranga Marine Reserve, 61 The Esplanade, Houghton Bay, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Community Snorkel: Taputeranga Marine Reserve
events.venue: Taputeranga Marine Reserve, 61 The Esplanade, Houghton Bay, Wellington
events.long_description:
Dive into Taputeranga Marine Reserve and take part in a free snorkeling event this summer!

Beginners welcome! We provide all the necessary gear and experienced guides to ensure your safety and enjoyment in the water. Participants just need to be at least eight years old and confident swimmers. Those under sixteen must be accompanied by an adult.

Registrations open at 9.45am. Come down to book a snorkel time for the day, as spots may fill up quickly. Bring your togs, towel, refreshments and make a day of it exploring the activities and environment at Taputeranga Marine Reserve.

This free event is brought to you in partnership with Greater Wellington Regional Council.

Cancellations/Postponements:

Events are weather dependent. Stay updated by checking the Mountains to Sea Wellington Facebook event listings for any cancellations, postponements, or location changes.

To get to Taputeranga Marine Reserve:

We encourage attendees to leave cars at home and use alternative transport where possible. Locals- please come on foot or bring along your bikes/scooters! For those further afield, the number 1 bus drops you right to the event from the Wellington Train Station. Map your journey here

Accessibility:

Island Bay Beach is accessible by beach wheelchair. The nearest accessible toilets are in Shorland Park. There are two accessible parks in front of the Island Bay Surf Club, additional vehicles can be accommodated if required, near to our MTSW trailers. Please see a staff member on arrival if the Surf Club parks are full. We have a variety of options to enable a more comfortable experience in the water,including flotation aids and 1:1 support from our trained guides. Please get in touch with us at events@mtsw.org.nz in advance of the event to discuss your accessibility requirements, including to enquire about beach wheelchair assistance. We love helping people to experience our marine environment!

The snorkelling in this event is run under the Health and Safety of the Mountains to Sea Conservation Trust programme Experiencing Marine Reserves. Adventure Activity Certified - AA0534.

Photos: Kristine Zipfel

events.id: Enchanted Park-Wainuiomata Regional Park, 10 Whitcher Grove, Wainuiomata, Lower Hutt-Event Finder
events.name: Enchanted Park
events.venue: Wainuiomata Regional Park, 10 Whitcher Grove, Wainuiomata, Lower Hutt
events.long_description:
airy fun in the forest!
Bring the whānau for an enchanting afternoon in the Gums Loop Meadow at Wainuiomata Regional Park. This special summer event invites tamariki to explore nature, get creative, and learn about the native wildlife that calls this forest home.

Help us build a fairy garden in the forest where North Island brown kiwi live. Kids can paint rocks or create their own fairy doors. There will be facepainting and outdoor games. You're encouraged to bring fairy costumes and picnic lunches to enjoy in the meadow.

Our knowledgeable park ranger will be there (with fairy wings on) to answer questions and share stories about the park’s natural heritage.

The Remutaka Conservation Trust and Forest & Bird be on hand to teach tamariki about the kiwi who live in this park and the conservation work happening in the area.

Event Details:

Aimed at: Children aged 4–10

Accessibility: Tracks suitable for prams

Dogs: Allowed on a lead

What to bring: Picnic, costumes, and creativity!

Get the whānau involved in Summer Events

Discover the magic of our regional parks. For 25 years, Greater Wellington has been hosting recreational events that help people connect with nature, get active outdoors, and enjoy time together.

Wainuiomata Regional Park is a special place for conservation. Greater Wellington’s work here protects freshwater sources, preserves ancient native forests, looks after historic sites, and helps build resilience to climate change. Our partners and volunteers, like the Remutaka Conservation Trust, play a vital role in making this park a special place for everyone.

events.id: Somatic Sanctuary: Exploring self-care through movement, touch & listening-31 Hobson Crescent, Thorndon, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: Somatic Sanctuary: Exploring self-care through movement, touch & listening
events.venue: 31 Hobson Crescent, Thorndon, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
"The experience and the venue were very restorative for my nervous system. Connectivity through a delicious winding path of interactive games and movement expression experiences lead me to a very open and receptive creative space. Highly recommend. Amazing facilitation." - Lily
“Thanks to this workshop, I was able to let go more than ever before, and really let in touch that was non-sexual, loving, and supportive. Thank you so much for offering another step up the mountain of growth & healing” - Amanda
*****
Imagine a day where you can drop deeply into embodied awareness, show up authentically with other heart-centred humans, and get straight to the core of what truly matters, through connective somatic practices designed to nourish your body & replenish your spirit.
Welcome to Somatic Sanctuary, a full-day experience where you are invited to self-regulate & co-regulate through a range of complementary modalities: Yin Yoga, Authentic Relating & Contact Improvisation.
This February, you are invited to The Wellington Meditation Centre, a beautiful & cosy urban sanctuary complete with a tranquil garden. Come explore the many layers of yourself and others through a journey of deep yet playful communication and contact games.
After taking this precious day for yourself, you are likely to step into the week ahead with a profound sense of well-being, a remarkable connection to your body and an experiential toolkit that you can use right away to make your everyday life even better.
WHO is this day for?
In essence, Somatic Sanctuary is for you if you want to connect on a deeper level with your body, your desires, your boundaries, your emotional reality, your empathy skills and your ability to feel compassion for yourself. This day will enhance your interpersonal relationships and enrich your self love within.
Whether you are a seasoned workshop/retreat goer or it’s your first time ever exploring the bespoke practices, you are sure to get something valuable out of this workshop.
You are also most welcome if you’ve been recently feeling blocked, anxious, lacking purpose or direction, and need to reground and remind yourself what's truly important and who you truly are.
Our experience includes working with Highly Sensitive People (HSPs); neurodiverse people; people suffering from anxiety and depression; people going through major life shifts; and members of the LGBTQ+ community.
If you have any questions about whether the event would suit you, pop us a message and we’ll get back to you within 24 hours.
WHAT will actually happen?
Activities will explore movement, conversation and physical contact, through the modalities of Yin Yoga, Authentic Relating & Contact Improvisation.
Yin Yoga focuses on deeply relaxing the nervous system, by bringing fresh life force (prana) to your connective tissue and vital organs. Through deep stretches, long holds, and mindful breathing, your body is given permission to fully release any tension that has accumulated over time.
Authentic Relating is a ground breaking social tool that invites you to courageously step into open hearted connection, through radical honesty and active listening. The practice invites you to drop deeper into presence, embodied awareness and permission to express whatever is alive within you and the ‘we-space’ between you and other(s), as well as any boundaries that emerge within the connection field.
Contact Improvisation is a dance form that emphasises both self-regulation and co-regulation, through spontaneous movement and physical connection between people, as well as the non-human physical space (such as the floor). It encourages exploration of balance, weight-sharing, and communication through touch, inducing a deeply aware state of surrendered fluidity.
Consent will be emphasised throughout the weekend. You will continually be reminded to listen to your body and only do what is within your personal boundaries. While you will be encouraged to stretch yourself and widen your window of tolerance, you will practice identifying your stress zone and will learn tools to help you self-regulate if you push yourself too far.
There will also be a support team on hand if you need to co-regulate at any point.
WHERE will it be?
The workshop will take place at Wellington Meditation Centre, 31 Hobson Crescent, Thorndon, Wellington 6011, New Zealand.
The FACILITATORS
Laurie King
Laurie (he/him), is a queer British-Kiwi who’s current home-base is Wellington, NZ. His passion is creating spaces that cultivate healthy, thriving human-to-human relationships, helping people take off their masks, feel their sensations and celebrate their aliveness on Earth. Since 2019, he has organised and facilitated hundreds of Authentic Relating, Dating and Embodiment workshops in Oceania and Europe.
His training includes The Embody Lab, Authentic Revolution, Connection Institute, Body Electric and World Peace Yoga School. He has facilitated at internationally acclaimed festivals such as Stretch and Ignite, and organisations such as ART International and Authentic Bay Area.
His workshops have sparked thousands of nourishing connections, turning many strangers into life-long friends. He looks forward to holding space for you!
For more information, check out itoiauthenticrelating.com.
Laurie’s workshops have already touched & impacted many lives. Here's what others have shared:
“This was a game changer for me. I'm blown away on a daily basis as to how easy communicating and relating has been since doing Laurie's incredible workshop" - Andy
"I live with complex PTSD and anxiety so in the past I have really struggled to open up to people and build meaningful connections. Discovering these workshops has been a life changer and both my therapist and I are thrilled with how my confidence has blossomed in recent months. Laurie's time and generosity really means the world to me" - Sarah
“Laurie created a beautiful, safe space in no time! making it an ideal environment to be present and engage meaningfully with the activities. Even though all participants were strangers to me, I felt a deep sense of belonging developing over the day.” - Julie
“The exercises allowed me to center myself in heartspace - free to be held by others in love and in my own experience while also able to hold them in their experience. As such, it’s a perfect space for co-regulating.” Justin
“I am still digesting the ripples from this profoundly moving workshop, and am beyond grateful for the aligned new connections that have come out of it” - Rachel
“I love Laurie’s energy, wisdom, execution and light touch” - Tess
Sam Baker (she/her)
Sam is an experienced facilitator and has seven years of experience with somatic modalities, including contact improvisation and somatic experiencing. She previously ran ‘Embodied Empowerment’ with Laurie and wrote the ‘Hierarchy of Physical Needs’ (which the workshop was inspired by) based on observations and conversations around “Why does Contact Improv feel so safe & satisfying?”
Here’s what others have shared about Sam’s work:
“Learning about the Hierarchy of Physical Needs really made sense to me. I realise how I’ve impulsively entered into relationships or romantic encounters when really I was just craving playfulness, or connection, or touch” - James
“I really enjoyed the exercises as an opportunity to get out of my mind and into my body. To feel, not just to think” - Meaghan
HOW MUCH will I invest?
$109 - Low income ticket
$139 - Medium income ticket
$159 - High income ticket
In order to make the event as accessible as possible, there are three ticket types available. It is up to you to decide which ticket you purchase, depending on your own feelings about your level of disposable income and how much you would like to contribute for the event.
If you would really like to attend but do not have the above funds available, please get in touch and we can figure something out!
Practicalities:
Where: 31 Hobson Crescent, Thorndon, Wellington 6011, New Zealand.
When: Saturday 14th February (10am to 5pm)
Dresscode: Comfortable clothing that's easy to move in.
Food: Tea, coffee & snacks are provided. Lunch will be potluck style so bring something to share!
Refunds: Full refund if cancelled three weeks or more before event. 50% refund if cancelled up to one week before event. If you need to cancel within the week before, you can transfer your ticket to a friend.

events.id: Dilby (Berlin) presented by Mi Casa Su Casa-Meow,17 Edward St, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand, Wellington-All Events In
events.name: Dilby (Berlin) presented by Mi Casa Su Casa
events.venue: Meow,17 Edward St, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand, Wellington
events.long_description:
Dilby (Berlin) presented by Mi Casa Su Casa
We are excited to present an absolute favourite - Dilby returns after a decade in Berlin. Join us for a special evening of world-class house and techno on the dancefloor. His last three Wellington gigs were superb and Sold Out in advance.

Secure your ticket here: https://meow.flicket.co.nz/events/46777ce5-bdc8-468a-a2bc-8ba86f4d4800

Dilby is taking the world by storm with his unique take on underground music. Crafted from a classic house and techno palette but presented with a fresh modern twist. His sound is rich, warm and musical, but aimed squarely at the dance floor. His is a mainstay at the top of the charts where he’s consistently amongst the highest selling artists in House, thanks in part to his No.1 smash hit ‘Remember Me’. In 2022 Beatport named Dilby one of the top trending artists.

Dilby’s passion and talent for electronic music is evident in the creative and innovative sound coming from his studio. A sound that sees him featured on some of the scene’s most iconic and respected labels and as an in-demand remixer, having worked his magic for artists including Mihai Popoviciu, Oliver Schories, Collective Machine, Tom & Collins amongst others. A firm favourite amongst tastemaker DJ’s his music is regularly championed by top-tier artists from Hot Since 82 to Diplo, Hernan Catteneo to Carl Cox, Guy-J to Nicole Madouber.

After making the move to Berlin in 2012 he quickly rose through the ranks to become a regular favourite in the mecca’s top clubs and festivals. In recent years Dilby’s global recognition has seen him develop a global schedule, touring across Europe, Russia, South and Central America and Australasia.

Labels: Saved, 8bit, Crosstown Rebels/Rebellion, Bondage Music, Deeperfect, Toolroom, Glasgow Underground, Bar25 Music, Terms & Conditions, Poker Flat Records.

Tickets $25 + booking fee: https://meow.flicket.co.nz/events/46777ce5-bdc8-468a-a2bc-8ba86f4d4800

Venue: Meow, 9 Edward Street, Wellington

Support from: Vernon x Bastian + More TBA

Vernon x Bastian: These two scallywags have the Welly wind in their sails and a groove in their hearts. They're the duo behind the capital's much loved club night, Mi Casa Su Casa, now rockin' for over 15 years. They've also had the pleasure of playing some of NZ's most legendary shindigs like Shipwrecked, Off The Radar, Kiwiburn, CubaDupa, Taniwha's Den, The Forest and Rhythm & Vines. With the people on the dancefloor their inspiration, they'll share a bounty of underground house to lift you up and bring you on a journey.

events.id: Basejump Comedy & LFC | Improv Essentials: Unified Chaos!-Toi Pōneke Arts Centre,69 Abel Smith Street, Wellington, New Zealand-All Events In
events.name: Basejump Comedy & LFC | Improv Essentials: Unified Chaos!
events.venue: Toi Pōneke Arts Centre,69 Abel Smith Street, Wellington, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Basejump Comedy & LFC | Improv Essentials: Unified Chaos!
Learn improv in a ridiculous group course

About this Event

Welcome to the most structured mess you'll ever love. In this 8-week, beginner-friendly course, we'll dive into the essential building blocks of improv—then flip them, twist them, and turn them into glorious chaos.
You'll learn how to play as a group, build ideas together, and spark wild scenes from the tiniest suggestions. It's all about teamwork, bold choices, and finding the funny in the unexpected.
Expect maximum stage time, supportive vibes, and a whole lot of laughter. Whether you're trying something new, eyeing the world of character work, sketch comedy, or something totally experimental, this course is your gateway.
Unleash your weird. Support your team. Start the riot.


Details
Start Date: 14th February
Teacher: Ralph Hilaga
Where: Toi Poneke Arts Center
Classes run for 8 sessions, Saturdays 12 - 3 pm
Inquiries:
Class Show: TBD


Policy
Registration is Non-Refundable & Non-Transferable.
Your enrollment HOLDS A SPACE in a class that we are no longer able to offer someone else. Please review dates and be sure about your schedule before registering.




DATES
February
Sat 14th
Sat 21st
Sat 28th
March
Sat 7th
Sat 14th
Sat 21st
Sat 28th
April
Sat 11th
Class Show
TBD



Ralph is an improviser, stand up, and sketch comedian based in Wellington. Formerly a dramatic actor, he transitioned into comedy in 2019 and has since trained at The iO Theater in Chicago, The Improv Conspiracy in Melbourne, and Basejump Comedy in Wellington. He was a Wellington finalist at the Raw Comedy Quest 2025 competition, and is a founding member of the comedy group Catfish Trifecta (Nominee for Best Regular Show and Best innovation at the Wellies 2025), and is one half of the chaotic comedy duo “Mo and Ralph” with Mo Munn.

events.id: Taste & Create - A Painting with Sugar Valentine Affair-Inverlochy Art School, 3 Inverlochy Place, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Taste & Create - A Painting with Sugar Valentine Affair
events.venue: Inverlochy Art School, 3 Inverlochy Place, Wellington
events.long_description:
Taste and Create a palette of passion at the historic Inverlochy house. Join us in indulging in hand-crafted pastries by the renowned Maxine Schecter of Sugar Flour while working with Inverlochy's skilled tutors to create a piece of art in your choice of medium (drawing, printmaking, pastel painting, ceramics). Pastries are paired with refined tea and non-alcoholic bubbles.

The exact pastries are going to be a surprise (we'll drop hints along the way in the lead up to the event)! So pastries pictured are not what you'll get. The pastries will be incredibly seasonal and fruit focused (if anyone has any fruit allergies they’re unsure of you can can contact Maxine directly before booking). Maxine can also offer gluten free and gelatine free options for the dietaries too.

About the team:

Maxine Schecter is a French trained pastry chef who has worked in restaurants and patisseries in Wellington (Logan Brown), Paris (Gâteaux Thoumieux), London (The Fat Duck and Sketch) and is the author of Patisserie Made Simple: The Art of Petits Gateau.

Inverlochy Art School offers a broad range of high quality art classes and workshops, taught by a community of enthusiastic and talented practicing artists all year round. We believe in art for art's sake and allow students to find freedom in creative exploration.

events.long_description:
Basejump Comedy & LFC | Creating Solo Characters!
WRITING AND PERFORMING SOLO COMEDY

About this Event


One of our favourite classes, Creating Solo Characters! is a course that gets you designing unique characters for the stage, all while building your comedy skills through writing, performing, and receiving individually tailored feedback.
In this class you'll learn different strategies to develop characters, as well as how to cut through the noise and get the most comedy from them. It all culminates in a solo character showcase of students best work!
Great as an addition for sketch writers or people looking to get into sketch; stand-ups or improvisers looking to try a new skill; artists building a Fringe show; or writers looking to work on their character performance. This course has it and it's all for YOU - you write the character, you perform the character!
(Class size is limited, so book early)
Note: Students will be expected to write and prepare characters outside of class each week.

events.id: Valentine's Night at Te Nukuao Wellington Zoo-Wellington Zoo, 200 Daniell St, Newtown, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Valentine's Night at Te Nukuao Wellington Zoo
events.venue: Wellington Zoo, 200 Daniell St, Newtown, Wellington
events.long_description:
Te Nukuao Wellington Zoo is the place to be this Valentine’s Day! Get your date, your mate, your pals or your gals ready for a wild night out.

We’re staying open until 8.30pm for an adults-only night of cheeky fun – live music, an outdoor bar, delicious food, and love-themed animal talks that spill all the secrets of the animal kingdom.

Grab your favourite human(s), and treat yourselves to a wild, romantic night out!

Adults only. R18. Wild vibes only.

Buy tickets now >>> https://www.wellingtonzoo.com/visit/plan-your-day/things-to-do/valentines-night-2

*Event information*

- Adults only: Strictly R18
- Date: Saturday 14 February
- Time: 5pm–8.30pm (last entry 7.45pm)
- Location: Te Nukuao Wellington Zoo, 200 Daniell Street, Newtown, Wellington
- Note: The Zoo is not BYO licensed. ID and bag checks on arrival

*Prices*

- $24 online entry (save by booking ahead!)
- $26 standard entry on the night
- $109 package for two: 2x Zoo Entry + pre-booked picnic basket with food (no alcohol)
- For Zoo Crew members: $69 for just the pre-booked picnic basket (entry is included as part of your Zoo Crew membership)

*Add-ons*

- $10 for Wild Explorer ($8 for Zoo Crew)
- $29 per person for Giraffe Feed
- $79 per couple for Creatures of Attraction Tour
- Close Encounters – details coming soon!

*Music & Entertainment*

Enjoy the evening with live music from one of Wellington’s most colourful and fun bands Crash Bandihoot!
- Two 45-minute sets of New Orleans-style brass tunes
- Times: 6pm & 7pm
- Location: He Tuku Aroha Meet the Locals

Plus, Wild Explorer VR will be open throughout the evening! Choose from The Great Migration, Dolphins of the Reef, or everyone’s favourite: Dinosaur Evolution! Tickets are $10 ($8 for Zoo Crew) and can be purchased on the night. There are limited slots, so make sure you get in quick!

Love-themed animal talks will be scheduled throughout the evening too!

*Food & Drinks*

Pre-book to enjoy a delicious picnic basket for two from REX Tremendous Events Catering.
- The picnic basket includes cold sliced meats, and sausage rolls for carnivores OR roast vegetables for herbivores; roasted nuts, cheeses, homemade corn chips with a selection of dips and salsa, home-made focaccia, pasta salad and a duo of sweet tartlets
- Dietary options available (no swap-outs): Gluten Free or Vegetarian
- Picnic basket bookings close Wednesday 11th February at 5pm
- Pick up your basket at the Zoo Entrance between 5pm-7pm
- Return your basket to the Zoo Entrance or to He Tuku Aroha Meet the Locals Barn, baskets are not to be taken off the Zoo premises

Treat yourselves to tasty food and drinks all evening long – pay as you go! On the night we will have:
- BBQ and hot food available at He Tuku Aroha Meet the Locals Barn (vegan options included)
- Outdoor bar open at He Tuku Aroha Meet the Locals Barn (cash & EFTPOS)
- Banana Bar open for cold drinks, hot chips & ice creams
- Note: The Zoo is not BYO licensed. ID and bag checks on arrival

events.id: As You Like It - Summer Shakespeare-Aro Park, Aro Street, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: As You Like It - Summer Shakespeare
events.venue: Aro Park, Aro Street, Wellington
events.long_description:
The forest is calling! This summer, a new company of players, The Midsummer Botanicals, invite audiences to step beneath the trees and into the wild, wondrous world of As You Like It - a sun-soaked celebration of laughter and community blooming in one of Wellington’s gorgeous parks for the first week of the Wellington Fringe Festival.

In 1983, A Midsummer Night’s Dream lit up the Victoria University Quad and sparked a beloved tradition of outdoor Shakespeare in Wellington - a festival of artistry, friendship, and open-air delight that ran for over forty years. After its sudden end in 2023, a vital chapter of our city’s cultural story seemed to close. But this February, the Botanicals are bringing it gloriously back to life.

Helmed by director Eli Hancock (he/they) and produced by Shakespeare’s North Productions, As You Like It promises a riotous return to form; where the music is live, the language sparkles, and the forest is very much alive.

“As You Like It is Shakespeare at his most joyous,” says Hancock. “It’s about finding yourself in unexpected places - through love, disguise, friendship, and the wilderness. After years of loss and uncertainty in the arts, this feels like a healing; a reminder of why we make theatre in the first place.”

Set in a vibrant reimagining of Shakespeare’s Forest of Arden, this production draws on courtyard and marketplace traditions of performance, transforming Wellington’s Aro Valley Park into a living, breathing garden of music, colour, and character. Audiences are invited to arrive early, explore the space, and meet the motley cast of lovers and fools before the story even begins. Expect song, sun, silliness, and the scent of summer roses.

events.id: HED PE | Still ‘Broke’ New Zealand Tour | with Nonpoint-San Fran, Wellington-Ticket Master
events.name: HED PE | Still ‘Broke’ New Zealand Tour | with Nonpoint
events.venue: San Fran, Wellington
events.long_description:
Celebrating the 25th anniversary of their landmark album Broke, the band will deliver a full-throttle set packed with fan favourites like Bartender, Killing Time, and Feel Good;  which featured none other than Serj Tankian (System of a Down) and Morgan Lander (Kittie) on the album.
Critics hailed Broke as a “magnum opus of rap, funk, hip hop, and metal” (UnEarthed), while Sputnikmusic praised its “excellent”RATM meets hip-hop genre fusion and raw emotional punch. Whilst RateYourMusic users described the album as “hedonistic, energetic, vulgar, rhythmic, urban, and heavy,” capturing the raw essence of its sound and attitude. With over 450,000 copies sold worldwide, Broke remains a defining moment in the nu-metal era and this tour is your chance to relive it live.
Expect pounding riffs, funk-infused grooves, and the unmistakable flow of frontman Jahred Gomes, whose stage presence turns every show into a riotous celebration of rebellion and rhythm. From their self-titled debut in 1997 to their latest release New and Improved, (HED) P.E. continues to evolve while staying true to their anti-establishment roots.
With an incredible career spanning nearly three decades, Nonpoint has long been a force to be reckoned with in the nu-metal/rap-rock genre. Known for legendary live performances and explosive tracks such as Bullet with a Name, What a Day, Ruthless, and more, the band has consistently captivated audiences with infectious riffs, compelling lyrics, and an uncompromising raw energy. Their discography and stagecraft have made them staples at rock radio and fixtures on festival lineups, earning them a dedicated international following.
This is not nostalgia, it’s a full-blown sonic nu-metal assault. Don’t miss (HED) P.E. and NONPOINT as they rip through New Zealand with setlists that traverse decades, defy genres, and unleash pure, unfiltered chaos!

events.id: Hayden Chisholm and Unwind-St Peters Village Hall, Cnr Beach Rd and Ames St, Paekākāriki-Event Finder
events.name: Hayden Chisholm and Unwind
events.venue: St Peters Village Hall, Cnr Beach Rd and Ames St, Paekākāriki
events.long_description:
Hayden Chisholm's saxophone playing is a miracle - and in St. Peter's Hall he sounds just beautiful. Performing music that knows a lot about jazz as well as folk and chamber music traditions, his group Unwind play melodic, contrapuntal music with a beautiful group sound and a great deal of space. Hayden – originally from Taranaki but resident in Europe for more than 30 years – leads Unwind with local musicians Paul Dyne (bass) and Norman Meehan (piano).
Door sales: $30.00
