events.id: Dare to Lead™ | Wellington | 25-27 February-Museum of New Zealand Te Papa Tongarewa,55 Cable Street, Wellington, New Zealand-All Events In
events.name: Dare to Lead™ | Wellington | 25-27 February
events.venue: Museum of New Zealand Te Papa Tongarewa,55 Cable Street, Wellington, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Dare to Lead™ | Wellington | 25-27 February
Dare to Lead is the ultimate starting point for brave leaders, courageous cultures, and organisational change.

About this Event


The ultimate starting point for brave leaders, courageous cultures and organisational change.


"Highly recommend."
"Inspiring."
"An amazing experience."
"One 'aha moment' after the other."

Founded on the research of Dr. Brené Brown, Dare to Lead™ is an empirically based courage-building programme, delivered by Boma New Zealand CEO and Certified Dare to Lead™ Facilitator Kaila Colbin.
Brené has spent two decades studying shame and more than seven years specifically looking at leadership. During her research, she interviewed leaders from all over the world — from Fortune 100 companies, non-profits, public sector entities, and more — and asked one question: what is the future of leadership?
Remarkably, their answers pointed to one thing: we need braver leaders.


We need more courage.

The most significant finding from Brené’s latest research, and the foundation of Dare to Lead™, is that courage is a collection of four skill sets that are teachable, measurable, and observable.


After completing the three-day Dare to Lead™ programme you'll understand how to:
Effectively navigate vulnerability and unlock change
Turn values from fluffy language into tangible, practical behaviours
Build a common culture of trust in your team
Cultivate the skills to rise from setbacks and be more resilient


This curriculum is essential for teams who want to:
Be better equipped to deal with difficult conversations
Reduce unhealthy and unproductive behaviour
Be more creative and innovative
Build resilience and improve alignment
Foster a culture of accountability and trust


This experience is for you if:
You're in a position of leadership within your organisation
You see the potential in people and processes, and are willing to take responsibility for achieving that potential
You’re passionate about accelerating performance in yourself and others
You have to navigate organisational change as part of your role



Need help with the cost?
If you are an Educator or at a Not-for-Profit, you can automatically access a special price of $1,995 + GST when you register.
We also have partial scholarships available to attend the programme. Apply here and we’ll be in touch.
Boma is a Regional Business Network Provider. Your organisation may be eligible for funding support to attend this programme. Find out more at regionalbusinesspartners.co.nz


Our Health and Safety Plan
Boma is committed to delivering safe events. We follow best practices suggested by the New Zealand health authorities and work closely with our suppliers to prioritise health and wellbeing.
Our comprehensive health and safety plans ensure you can book with certainty and attend with confidence.



Our refund policy
For details on event refunds and transfers, please see our refund policy.


Contact us
Please email with any questions.

events.venue: Hannah Playhouse,12 Cambridge Terrace, Wellington, New Zealand
events.long_description:
SKWERT: The Reunion - NZ Fringe Festival
The best show about the worst boy band is back!

After the tragic death of their leader, Scott, SKWERT is reuniting for one massive memorial tour. However, not is all as it seems as the show is taken over by a mysterious force that exposes the band's secret: one of them killed him. Can the band pull themselves together and solve the mystery before SKWERT is destroyed forever?

Starring Elliott Lam, Mo Munn, Q Potts, Lily Catastrophe, Keegan Thomas and Aaron James Douglas.

Music and Lyrics by Elliott Lam and Finn McKinlay

events.id: Smartphone Video Workshop with Bazzacam: Wellington-100 Willis Street, Wellington Central, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: Smartphone Video Workshop with Bazzacam: Wellington
events.venue: 100 Willis Street, Wellington Central, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
This event is for SBN Impact Investors only.
Join us for a free, hands-on workshop with the brilliant Baz Caitcheon (Bazzacam). Baz has helped organisations across the country transform the way they create content, and now he’s here to help you do the same.
In just half a day, you’ll learn how to shoot, edit and publish polished, professional-quality videos directly from your phone or tablet. Think of it as a year of film school condensed into one powerful, practical session. Perfect for anyone who wants to create better, faster, more engaging video content.
You’ll discover:
Smart techniques for capturing great footage on your device
Easy editing workflows using CapCut and iMovie
How to publish content that cuts through the noise
Third-party gear that makes a big difference (mics, stabilisers, lighting)
Plus, you’ll walk away with post-workshop notes, links to tutorial videos, and recommendations for the best gear to buy.
What to bring
Your smartphone or tablet, and a pair of headphones
Ensure your device is fully charged, and if your battery life is weak please bring your charger/powerbank
1–2GB free storage on your device
Apps: Download CapCut (free, Apple + Android) and iMovie (free, Apple users only)
Please arrive a few minutes early so we can do a quick device check before we begin.

events.name: Downstairs at the Manor (Austen role playing)
events.venue: 25 Victoria Street, Wellington Central, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Play Good Society (a Jane Austen role playing game) with your Facilitator, Johnny Bowtie.
As part of this year's diversity theme, we will explore one of Austen's manors from the perspective of the servants, with their own secrets and ambitions.
This session gives us a glimpse below stairs into the lives of the servants as they deal with dramas of their own. In it, you will explore stories in a harsh world that genteel society could never understand. Each servant not only possesses a desire, relationship, and position within the manor, but also a secret burden, vice, or ambition.
Ticket includes game play and table snacks. Drinks & further food is additional.
We aim to provide an accessible and safe environment. Discounts are available for nonwaged members, early birds, volunteers and people buying multiple tickets. Please let us know how we can ensure you're included.

Hellenic Music Ensemble
Marking their Aotearoa debut, the Hellenic Music Ensemble brings Greece's unforgettable soundscape to life in a landmark global tour.

DAVID LYNCH | USA & FRANCE | 1992 | 135mins | R18+| 4K DCP PROVIDED BY JANUS FILMS DISTRIBUTION
Join us for this very special community fundraiser screening of the prequel to the critically acclaimed series, "Twin Peaks".
ABC cancelled the original series after season 2 but a month later, Lynch announced he was "not yet finished with the material" and principal photography for the full length prequel film, began on September 5th 1991 at a caravan site in Snoqualmie Washington. Which became the "Fat Trout Trailer Park" where the story of the last 7 days of Laura Palmer begins.
Since its showing at the 1992 Festival De Cannes, no other Lynch film had polarized audiences to such an extent. Fans that wanted more "Cherry Pie" and "Donuts" from the TV show were served a much darker, unflinching and unforgiving work - in Lynch's own words, a movie about "the loneliness, shame, guilt, confusion and devastation of the victim". Derided by critics and many fans at the time it was a commercial box office flop.
Yet in the years since the initial reaction, a gradual wave of reappraisal and appreciation began. With time it's brilliance came into focus with growing acknowledgment, that the film is a more accurate, complex and powerful account of trauma. Combining the dramatic ferocity of Sherly Lee's tour de force and the beauty of Angelo Badalamenti's score, Lynch reclaimed full ownership of the material creating a harrowing, compassionate and enigmatic hymn to Laura Palmer.
As we approach the films 34 year anniversary and since Lynch's passing in 2025, it is now regarded by critics and fans worldwide, as a revered epilogue, essential predecessor to "The Return", and Lynch's most chilling, terrifying, and yet empathetic and humane cinematic masterpiece.
WHERE: The Roxy Cinema. 5 Park Road. Miramar. Wellington.
Cinema 1 - The big cinema upstairs with the massive screen, red italian leather sofas, and of course those red curtains!
WHEN: Wed 25th Feb 2026. Seating is unreserved so arrive early to check-in at the table upstairs, enter the raffle and get seated.
8:15pm - Doors close and the film starts. (no trailers)

COST: Tickets are $20 per person. (plus booking fee). This is a not for profit community screening put on for the pure love of Twin Peaks and the fans. All proceeds go to help pay for the cinema hire and licensing the film with any extras donated to charity. So spread the word and come celebrate "Twin Peaks Day 2026"!
TWIN PEAKS RAFFLE: Check-in at the desk upstairs and get a complimentary raffle ticket, to enter into the draw for 1 of these companion books.
The Secret Diary of Laura Palmer - By Jennifer Lynch with foreword by Mark Frost & David Lynch (paperback, 2012 edition)
Fire Walk With Me: Your Laura Disappeared - By Scott Ryan with foreword by Jeff Jensen (paperback, 2022 edition)
Laura's Ghost: Women Speak about Twin Peaks - By Courtney Stallings with foreword by Sheryl Lee (paperback, 2020 edition)
Cutoff to enter is 8:10pm and prizes drawn just before the start of the film.
RULES:
1. Tickets are per person. There will be NO door sales at the Roxy, so DO purchase it beforehand please. 
2. The film is classified R18+. All attendees MUST be 18yo + and have ID
4. The Roxy have strict no BYO food/drinks. Only Food/drinks purchased at the Roxy can be taken into the screening.
3. This is a safe, friendly, INCLUSIVE place. There is ZERO tolerance for discrimination, disrespect or creepy gross behavior of any kind. By attending you agree to the Code of Conduct.
4. Arrive early to enter the raffle before the cutoff if you want to be in it to win it. Good Luck!
Thank you and Happy Twin Peaks Day!
Join us for more Twin Peaks community screenings at:
www.facebook.com/fishinthepercolator
www.instagram.com/fishinthe.percolator

events.id: Wellington Education Law and Leadership Conference 2026: Navigating Change in Aotearoa Schools-Rydges Wellington,75A Featherston St, Pipitea, Wellington 6011, New Zealand, Wellington-All Events In
events.name: Wellington Education Law and Leadership Conference 2026: Navigating Change in Aotearoa Schools
events.venue: Rydges Wellington,75A Featherston St, Pipitea, Wellington 6011, New Zealand, Wellington
events.long_description:
Wellington Education Law and Leadership Conference 2026: Navigating Change in Aotearoa Schools
This comprehensive full-day conference brings together leaders in education governance, employment, and inclusive practice to explore the evolving legal and cultural landscape of Aotearoa’s schools. Unpack key developments in education law and policy, from recent legislative changes under the Education and Training Act to updates on collective agreements, employment law and best practices in workplace investigations. Focus on creating culturally grounded and future-focused school leadership, with insights into kaupapa Māori practices, strategic planning and governance and policy issues surrounding the introduction of AI. Designed for principals, board members and education professionals, this conference offers both legal clarity and practical inspiration for navigating today’s complex education environment.



Session 1: Navigating Change: Governance, Employment and Investigations

Chair: Maria McKenzie, Cluster Manager, Remutaka Resource Teacher and Learning and Behaviour, Masterton Primary School


> Unlocking Excellence: A Framework for Effective School Governance
Presented by Belinda Weber, Chief Advisor Governance, Te Whakaroputanga Kaitiaki Kura o Aotearoa New Zealand School Boards Association


> Collective Bargaining Outcomes: An Update for School HR Leaders
Presented by Maynard Scott, National Employment Relations Advisor, Te Whakarōputanga Kaitiaki Kura o Aotearoa, New Zealand School Boards Association


> Employment Law Update: The Evolving Landscape in New Zealand/Aotearoa’s Employment Law
Presented by Murray Grant, Special Counsel, Wotton Kearney and Alex Sclater, Solicitor, Wotton Kearney


> Workplace Investigations in the School Environment
Presented by Andrew Scott-Howman, Barrister and Workplace Investigator, Port Nicholson Chambers



Session 2: Empowering School Communities: Kaupapa Māori, Strategic Planning and AI

Chair: Simon Kenny, Principal, Fergusson Intermediate School


> Culturally Empowering Practices in Aotearoa Schools
Presented by Nathan Mahikai Riki, Director , Riki Consultancy


> Strategic Planning: Empowering Schools to Design and Own Their Strategic Direction
Presented by Bruce Kearney, Principal, Rangiora High School


> AI in Schools: Governance, Risk and Implementation Challenges
Presented by Dr Rod Lane, Director, Learning and Innovation, Te Whakarōputanga Kaitiaki Kura o Aotearoa, New Zealand School Boards Association

events.name: The Rock Orchestra by Candlelight
events.venue: Michael Fowler Centre, Wellington, New Zealand
events.long_description:
When you think of hard rock and metal, you might not naturally connect them to the refined sounds of classical music. The Rock Orchestra by Candlelight has done just that. After entertaining 700,000 people across the UK, USA and Europe, it’s coming to Wellington. 
Prepare for a spellbinding 90-minute spectacle infusing rock and metal anthems with beautiful orchestral energy. A band of 13 classical musicians will accompany the fiery tunes. Through a wall of distortion, you’ll witness the unexpected union of classical and metal music. 
In an ethereal candlelit setting, you’ll experience the music of famous bands. Hear Metallica, AC/DC, Rage Against the Machine, My Chemical Romance, Linkin' Park, SOAD, Guns N’ Roses, Evanescence, Aerosmith, The Cranberries, and more.

events.long_description:
Jundas Capone - Hokitika is the new Berlin @ NZ Fringe.
One hour of Jundas Capone Stand Up Comedy in the New Zealand Fringe Festival 2026. 'Hokitika is the new Berlin'. Thursday 26th of February 2026 at 7pm and 8.30pm.

Tickets here -
https://tickets.fringe.co.nz/event/446:8341

Hastings Born, Wellingtonian, Jundas Capone, was a staple of the Berlin comedy scene for a number of years. Within a month of starting stand up, he won Wellingtons last comic standing competition, then went on to be a raw quest finalist. His style is alternative, going from one-liners, observations, and storytelling, to left-field surrealism. Accessibly random, surfing the awkwardness, which turns into waves of memorable and uncontrollable laughter.

events.name: Ferry Replacement Update - the Cook Strait Connection
events.venue: Marlborough Events Centre,42A Alfred Street, Blenheim, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Ferry Replacement Update - the Cook Strait Connection
Get the latest news on the Cook Strait ferry replacements - join us in person (or online) for all the details at Marlborough Events Centre!

About this Event


Ferry Replacement Update

Join us for an in-person (and online) industry update where we'll dive into all the latest on the Interislander ferry replacement programme. It's your chance to hear from Ferry Holdings - the entity leading the procurement and delivery of the new ferries and associated port infrastructure.
Representatives from Interislander, Bluebridge, and Port Marlborough will also be attending to provide an update on managing demand with only four vessels.
Get the latest updates, ask questions, and see how the Cook Strait connection will operate through to 2029 and beyond.
Whether you're a transport operator, freight customer, or an affected local, this event's for you!
The 12pm-1pm presentation will be followed by a light lunch and refreshments.
Register today to secure your place.

🖤 2026 TOUR 🖤

After entertaining 700,000 guests across the UK, USA and Europe, The Rock Orchestra by Candlelight is kicking off the first ever tour of Australia. Prepare for a spellbinding 90-minute spectacle that infuses iconic Rock & Metal anthems with a hauntingly beautiful energy.

In ethereal candlelit settings, this band of 13 classical musicians unleash effortlessly enchanting melodies alongside powerful walls of distortion. Witness the unexpected union of Classical music and Metal. The Rock Orchestra is a rotating collective of classical musicians, featuring some of the world's greatest instrumentalists and vocalists.

Performing the music of iconic bands including:
Metallica, AC/DC, Rage Against The Machine, My Chemical Romance, Linkin' Park, SOAD, Guns N Roses, Evanescence, Aerosmith, The Cranberries & MORE!

events.id: Women of Pōneke February 2026 Event-70 Molesworth Street, Thorndon, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: Women of Pōneke February 2026 Event
events.venue: 70 Molesworth Street, Thorndon, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Women of Pōneke : Big dreams for a cool Capital
26 February |5-7.30 | Te Ahumairangi Foyer
National Library 70 Molesworth St
We begin the year by inviting you to Dream Big!
We love Wellington for its quirk, culture, connection to nature and its infectious energy. In your wildest dreams what would our future capital feel and be like? How would you live in it and what would you want it to stand for on a world stage? — How can we create a city future generations will love to live in?
As Eleanor Roosevelt once said  “ The future belongs to those who believe in the beauty of their dreams”
Who better to dream than the Women of Pōneke!
We are delighted to have the team behind Dear Wellington – Claire Sharpe and Sophie Jacques from Warren & Mahoney and Helen Milner associate at Think Place — to share their dreams for our city in inspired visual imaginings and letters from a future Wellington. They will invite you to join in re-imagining our cool little capital, express your hopes and think about how we can turn ideas into action. 
This is an event where you can surround yourself with great company, enjoy delicious food and wine - unleash your imagination, connect and spark action.  We can’t wait to see you there! 
Tickets are limited to 180 guests.
Get your tickets now! 
Numbers are limited due to space, so we recommend you get in and quick! We are limited to 180 only. 
We will be serving wine, beer and amazing non-alcoholic drinks, inclusive in the ticket price. Platters will also be shared throughout the evening. 
So grab your ticket now and share with at least one amazing woman (and/or ally) in your life.
To cover our costs, we are charging for this event. We know that things are tough at the moment for many, so if this is a barrier for you to attend, please contact us and we will do everything to support you to attend. 
Help a woman in need
If you wish to support someone else who may have a financial barrier, please buy one of the "Buy-One, Give-One" tickets, so we can support more of the amazing women of Pōneke to attend.
Get in quick!
Tickets for previous events have sold out fast. For this event we are capped at 180 people attending and we will be updating our social media channels on the progress of the ticket sales, so get your tickets quick.  
Accessibility
The Te Ahumairangi Foyer, National Library is fully accessible. If you are not able to use the steps on Molesworth Street, you will be able to access the venue via the lift off Aitken Street. There will be staff at the door to be able to support and guide you to the venue space.
A bit about us 
Me.We.Pōneke is our signature quarterly event designed to inspire, connect and raise the voices of our wonderful community of Wellington women, and people who identify as women. 
We believe that magic happens when women come together. We’ve seen it. We’ve felt it. And we want to create more of it with regular events that are open, welcoming, supportive and empowering for the women of Wellington.
Come along, bring a friend and join us as we continue to raise the voices of Wellington women and invite you all to be part of Me We Pōneke.
You can join our mailing list from our brand new website, thanks to our amazing partner Springload. Check it out here and make sure you sign up to our mailing list: https://www.womenofponeke.org....
We are also on Insta! Follow us here: https://www.instagram.com/wome…

events.id: Unity Book Club February 2025 | Service-57 Willis Street, Wellington Central, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: Unity Book Club February 2025 | Service
events.venue: 57 Willis Street, Wellington Central, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
About the book: 
What's this book about? Is there a restroom? Do you have gluten-free bagels? Do you work here? Do you have a restroom? Do I buy books or rent books or what?
The worst thing about a bookshop is the customers. Then there's the gift-wrapping, the invoicing, the stock takes. The Yelp reviews that inevitably contribute to self-loathing.

In his late forties, Sean is still a frustrated bookseller who should have written his novel already. Instead, he spends his days drowning in his overwhelming sense of contempt -for LA, for its readers, for its casual disdain for service. And what, or whom, is he serving anyway?

Biting, hilarious and self-aware, John Tottenham's debut novel is a razor-sharp dissection of the modern scourges of gentrification, male vanity, jealousy and the worth of literature in a digital age.

Melissa and Eden will be hosting our monthly book club to discuss some of the excellent recently released books.

In February we will be discussing Service by John Tottenham.

We have limited tickets available so grab a ticket sooner rather then later and tell your friends and whānau.

Drinks and snacks provided. If you have any specific allergies, let us know and send an email.

If you have any further queries send us an email to wellington@unitybooks.co.nz and address it to Melissa.

events.name: Yoga Nidra: Moon Bathing
events.venue: Bhakti Lounge Wellington,175 Vivian Street, Wellington, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Yoga Nidra: Moon Bathing
Slow down, settle in, and let the soft glow of the moon guide you inward.

About this Event


Yoga Nidra: Moon Bathing

Slow down, settle in, and let the soft glow of the moon guide you inward.
This calming evening will centre around the deeply restorative practice of Yoga Nidra—a guided meditation designed to bring your body into a state of deep rest while your awareness gently drifts between waking and dreaming. Known to activate the parasympathetic nervous system and reduce stress, Yoga Nidra supports emotional balance, mental clarity, and a profound sense of ease.
This moon-themed session invites you to tune into the gentle, reflective energy of the lunar cycle—a time for slowing down, softening, and simply being.





After the practice, we’ll be sharing a nourishing plant-based dinner together. It’s included in your ticket and is a lovely way to gently transition back, connect, and enjoy wholesome food in good company.




Agenda


🕑: 06:00 PM - 06:15 PM
Arrive to Bhakti Lounge

🕑: 06:15 PM - 07:15 PM
Yoga Nidra: Moon Bathing

🕑: 07:15 PM - 08:15 PM
Plant-based dinner and dessert!

This calming evening will centre around the deeply restorative practice of Yoga Nidra—a guided meditation designed to bring your body into a state of deep rest while your awareness gently drifts between waking and dreaming.
Known to activate the parasympathetic nervous system and reduce stress, Yoga Nidra supports emotional balance, mental clarity, and a profound sense of ease.
After the practice, we’ll be sharing a nourishing plant-based dinner together.

events.id: The Miracle Tone | A Handpan Concert with Taylor Sol | Wellington-257 Riddiford Street, Newtown, Wellington 6021, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: The Miracle Tone | A Handpan Concert with Taylor Sol | Wellington
events.venue: 257 Riddiford Street, Newtown, Wellington 6021, New Zealand
events.long_description:
A live, seated handpan concert with Taylor Sol
Join Taylor Sol for a 90-minute handpan concert in 432 Hz, offering a deeply immersive listening experience through rhythm, melody, and resonance.
This is a concert-style event where guests are invited to sit comfortably and witness the music as it unfolds. The evening includes a brief spoken opening, one hour of live handpan music, and a gentle closing reflection to complete the journey. The handpan’s warm, organic tones create an ambient soundscape that supports relaxation, nervous system balance, and a sense of connection, both to nature and to the inner listening space. This offering is intentionally simple and inclusive. No participation, movement, or prior experience is required. Just arrive as you are and allow the music to carry you.
WHEN & WHERE
Date: Thursday 26 February 2026
Time: 6:30pm – 8:00pm
Venue: The Polish Association In NZ Inc - 257 Riddiford Street, Newtown, Wellington 6021, New Zealand
WHAT TO EXPECT
• A 90-minute seated concert experience
• One full hour of live handpan music in 432 Hz
• Opening and closing reflections & storytelling
• Ambient, immersive soundscapes
• A calm, grounded atmosphere
• Space to rest, listen, and receive
WHO IS THIS FOR?
This concert is open to everyone, all ages and walks of life are welcome.
Perfect for those seeking:
• Deep listening and presence
• Calm and nervous system renewal
• Musical beauty and inspiration
• A unique live concert experience
No prior experience with sound journeys or meditation is needed.
Children, families, elders, and first-time listeners are warmly welcome.
WHAT TO BRING / SEATING
• Seating will be provided as well as a floor seated option (optional - bring chair cushion, shawl)
• Water bottle
• An open mind
See you there!
Taylor Sol

events.id: 2026 Wellington POCUS Fundamentals Course / EGLS Course-24 Hawkestone Street, Thorndon, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: 2026 Wellington POCUS Fundamentals Course / EGLS Course
events.venue: 24 Hawkestone Street, Thorndon, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
POCUS Fundamentals + EGLS
2 Days of Comprehensive POCUS education for Acute Care Clinicians
Take part in a flexible learning experience designed for real-world acute care:
Day 1: POCUS Fundamentals
Master the essentials – focus on AAA & eFAST.
Day 2: EGLS (Echo Guided Life Support)
Confidently assess and manage the shocked patient using focused cardiac and lung ultrasound.
Attend either day independently, or combine both for a complete acute care ultrasound experience.

Day 1 – POCUS Fundamentals
Focus on essential diagnostic ultrasound skills with Abdominal Aortic Aneurysm (AAA) & eFAST (extended Focused Assessment with Sonography in Trauma) modules. This is ideal for clinicians seeking to build confidence and competence in core applications that can be immediately applied in clinical practice.
https://www.emugs.org/pocusfundamentals
Day 2 – EGLS (Echo-Guided Life Support)
Take your resuscitation skills to the next level with EGLS. Learn a structured, protocolised approach to using cardiac and lung ultrasound in the assessment and management of shock and respiratory failure. This course is designed to empower acute care clinicians with the practical skills to make rapid, life-saving decisions.
https://www.emugs.org/egls
Combo of Fundamentals + EGLS - Whether you're new to ultrasound or looking to enhance your skills, this comprehensive two-day course  is ideal for acute care clinicians aiming to integrate POCUS into daily practice.
You'll cover the core emergency medicine ultrasound modules: FELS, eFAST, AAA, and lung. The course aligns with ACEM and ASUM credentialing requirements for core ultrasound modalities.
By the end, you'll be proficient in four essential techniques: focused echo in life support (FELS), extended FAST, aortic scanning, and lung/thoracic ultrasound.
The program includes online pre-course work, brief lectures, image review, hands-on scanning, and networking opportunities—all within a supportive learning environment.
Suitable for all experience levels:
ACEM trainees beginning their ultrasound journey
Acute care doctors looking to upskill
Clinicians in critical care, rural, and urgent care settings
Beginners will build a solid foundation; experienced users can refine skills with expert feedback

events.id: JOURNEY TO SERENITY Yin Yoga and Sound Healing Special Series # 5-Paraparaumu Memorial Hall-All Events In
events.name: JOURNEY TO SERENITY Yin Yoga and Sound Healing Special Series # 5
events.venue: Paraparaumu Memorial Hall
events.long_description:
JOURNEY TO SERENITY Yin Yoga and Sound Healing Special Series # 5
Welcome to the Journey to Serenity Yin Yoga and Sound Healing twice monthly session!!!

These beautiful, nourishing Yin and Sound Sessions are on the second and Fourth Friday of each month (between November 28th and March 28th 2026) and are held in the Meeting / Supper Room of the Paraparaumu Memorial Hall on Tutanekai Street.

It would be lovely to share this healing, nourishing restorative practice in the special energy and support you to give your life a boost of wellbeing and good feeling!!

INTRODUCING - SPECIAL WELCOME OFFER - TWO PEOPLE FOR $90 (You don't have to be a couple) - Book through bank transfer or message me directly

Unique Yin Yoga, Sound Healing, breathwork and meditation come together to create this specially guided, deeply relaxing and healing experience, held within a unique holistic framework that encourages reflection and self-care.

Take the time and space that this session offers, for yourself, and give yourself a gift of true nourishment.

Bryony Shanti from Heartsong Healing will use a wide range of special healing sound instruments along with her voice to guide you into peace, relaxation and stillness. The healing vibration of the specially chosen sounds will wash over you bringing deep clearing, balance and alignment. There is a experience of gratitude and blessing.

Bryony's sound works to strengthen and deepen the powerful work of Yin yoga teacher Bianca who will guide you through 90-minutes of restorative and uplifting poses that are intended for you relax, heal and to open more to receive the healing vibration of sound.

Bianca's Yin Yoga focuses on easily accessible and effective poses
which work into the deeper connective tissues of the body. These poses are held for anywhere between 90 seconds to 5 minutes to allow for an opening in the body, the perfect way to receive the sound vibrations.

Yin yoga invites us into stillness and gives space for both the mind and body to relax and release tension and stress.

OPEN TO ALL: Whether you have experience in either Yin Yoga and Sound Healing or are looking to try something completely new, you are very welcome to join in the journey into a sense of serenity. Beginners and experienced practitioners alike will find something nourishing for themselves in this session.

Booking Details
Investment: $55

Sesssion - 7pm -8.30pm on Fridays
in 2025 - 28/11, 12/12,
in 2026 - 30/1, 13/2, 27/2, 14/3, 28/3

Bookings can be made by bank transfer
to account in name of Heartsong Healing (via Hnry), 12-3245-0322503-37. Reference 'YIN . MONTH' and 'YOUR NAME'

OR PAY FOR ONE OR MORE PLACE BY CARD HERE - https://buy.stripe.com/14k3g1fIa3cJboQdRI

OR BUY THREE TICKETS FOR $150 HERE -

https://buy.stripe.com/00gg2N8fI6oV3Wo9Bt

and please confirm your payment by email to . Thank you.

depending on booking numbers, if you need to cancel your place you may be able to transfer ticket to the next month once. We reserve the right to refuse transfer or refund if cancelled within 48 hours

events.id: Interpretation 101 - INNZ Workshop Wellington-200 Daniell Street, Newtown, Wellington 6021, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: Interpretation 101 - INNZ Workshop Wellington
events.venue: 200 Daniell Street, Newtown, Wellington 6021, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Are you looking to enhance your story-sharing skills and visitor engagement?

This workshop is a foundational step towards mastering interpretation and transforming visits into unforgettable experiences. Perfect for those working in museums, galleries, parks, zoos, heritage sites and tourist attractions.
Designed and presented by Lynda Burns this workshop offers a full day of immersive learning. With decades of experience as a practitioner, trainer, and mentor across Aotearoa and abroad, Lynda brings a wealth of knowledge and expertise and is a leader in the field of interpretation.
Throughout the day, you will: 
Experiment with new ideas and skills.
Share your existing knowledge with like-minded professionals. 
Explore the role of place interpretation in visitor experience. 
Learn how to reach the hearts and minds of visitors through meaningful story-sharing. 
Take a closer look at visitor demographics and behaviours. 
Discover the steps to start your interpretation projects, including research, goal setting, media choices, budgeting, and collection analysis. 
Gain basic project management tips to get things done efficiently. 
Explore how to work alongside iwi, stakeholders and managers. 
Please bring actual project ideas or content research to trial what you have learned throughout the day. This hands-on approach ensures that you get to test your new skills and leave with actionable insights. 
"Lynda recently facilitated a workshop on guiding for our team at Cornwall Park. Her amazing, tailored response to our programme has vastly improved the visitor experience and how we interpret this place. Our guides love the new skills they have learnt and are enjoying updating the entire programme of park-led walks.”
- Charlotte Taylor Visitor Experience 2IC Cornwall Park
Join us for this incredible opportunity to enhance your professional skills and elevate your visitor experience. 
Friday 27 February
9.30am-5pm
Wellington Zoo, 200 Daniell Street, Newtown, Wellington 6021
Tickets:
Non member $250
INNZ Member $215
Student/unwaged $190

Morning tea, lunch and afternoon tea will be provided, and all dietary requirements will be accommodated. Please let us know if you have any accessibility requirements.

Discover highlights from our Auckland Interpretation 101 workshop

events.venue: 92 Vivian St, Te Aro, Wellington 6011
events.long_description:
Transvision Vamp - Meow Nui, Wellington, NZ
UK pop rockers Transvision Vamp are bringing those glorious hits to NZ in February - their first tour here since 1991!

Formed in 1986, Transvision Vamp quickly rose to fame. Their songs Baby I Don’t Care, Revolution Baby, I Want Your Love, The Only One, and If Looks Could K*ll, were all NZ chart hits.

Joining original Transvision Vamp's Wendy James and Dave Parsons onstage are guitarist Alex Ward (The Thurston Moore Group) and James Sclavunos (Nick Cave and The Bad Seeds) on drums.

Says Wendy James: "I am so very excited to be coming back to New Zealand to play the songs which started my whole musical journey! I remember vividly so many incredible moments gigging in New Zealand, moments of enormous success, enormous love and enormous fun."

events.name: Blenheim Gypsy Fair
events.venue: Pollard Park,Mayfield, Blenheim 7201, Blenheim, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Blenheim Gypsy Fair
The Gypsy Fair is a nationwide travelling event, bringing family fun, live music and an unbeatable vibe to each town we visit.🌞💜

Having been on the road for over 45 years, it’s safe to say our roots run deep. Our people are incredible, and house trucks/buses are pretty cool too! So don’t forget to check out our unique way of living while you’re here 🫶🌿🌻💜

Whether you’re just having a browse, letting the kids loose on our rides, parking up with some food or coffee, or checking out some funky handmade crafts, we would love to see you! Come and hang out for the day, we’re sure to bring smiles to your faces, and create lifelong memories💜

🌞Free entry for everyone🌞 We pride ourselves on being an affordable event for every family. With free entertainment all day, plenty of chill out zones, and loads of life size games laying around, we truely love to see the community getting amongst it all! Can’t wait to see you there🌞👣🐝🌿🌊

Follow us on Facebook – ‘Gypsy Fair’ for updates on our travels and creations! We’re always open to anyone who wants to come and live the dream, so please email us if this sounds like a bit of you. –

You may also like the following events from The GypsyFair:
Next Friday, 26th September, 11:00 pm, Papamoa Gypsy Fair in Tauranga
Next month, 3rd October, 11:00 pm, Gisborne Gypsy Fair in Gisborne
Next month, 10th October, 11:00 pm, Havelock North Gypsy Fair in Havelock North
Also check out other Music events in Blenheim, Entertainment events in Blenheim.

events.id: Sound Healing Experience with Claudio at Pause Yoga 28th of Febraury 2026-Pause Yoga,28 Moana Rd, Days Bay, Lower Hutt 5013, New Zealand, Lower Hutt-All Events In
events.name: Sound Healing Experience with Claudio at Pause Yoga 28th of Febraury 2026
events.venue: Pause Yoga,28 Moana Rd, Days Bay, Lower Hutt 5013, New Zealand, Lower Hutt
events.long_description:
Sound Healing Experience with Claudio at Pause Yoga 28th of Febraury 2026
Join us for this special evening of harmonising pure sounds, inspiring music and relaxation in the beautiful Pause Yoga studio in Eastbourne.
Give yourself a peaceful moment and space of quiet awareness. Discover the power of your own voice, mantra and silence working to find inner peace and contentment. Bring an intention, get comfortable and let the sound waves take over. Invite the sound to take you into a journey within, into your heart, to rest, to release physical, mental and emotional tension.

Surrender to the sound of Gong, Tibetan and Crystal Bowls, Native American flutes, Harmonium, Sitar ,Esraj, Bells etc..Claudio brings high quality amplification so you can feel the sound in your body and take into a immersive experience.

Feel free to bring a pillow and blanket to assure comfort.


About Claudio: Claudio is a 3rd generation Multinstrumentalist Musician from Mexico City now based in Wellington. Claudio comes from a musicians family he started playing music since very early years. When he finished music school as a classical guitarist he moved to Montreal, Canada and explored new genres such a Jazz, World Music, and Spiritual Music. Traveling he discovered Indian Music and the Yoga Tradition and they became a very important influence on his career and lifestyle, and allowed him to study Music and Yoga with teachers in Europe and Asia. He learnt to play the Tibetan Singing Bowls in Kathmandu Nepal and Varanasi India.He explored many instruments and music styles such as Classical Guitar, Sitar, Esraj, Bansuri, Harmonium, Flutes, Gongs and Voice.Claudio is an active Sound Healing practitioner and performer. He has been playing the Tibetan bowls for more than 10 years now.

-Website:

www.claudioescutia.com

-SoundCloud

https://soundcloud.com/claudioescutiasounds

-Instagram

https://www.instagram.com/claudio_yoga_sound_healing

-Facebook

https://www.facebook.com/soundhealingyogamusicclaudio

events.id: NZTrio “Groove Café”-Te Raukura ki Kapiti, Coastlands Theatre, 34a Raumati Road, Raumati, New Zealand 5032,34 Raumati Rd, Raumati Beach, Paraparaumu 5032, New Zealand, Paraparaumu-All Events In
events.name: NZTrio “Groove Café”
events.venue: Te Raukura ki Kapiti, Coastlands Theatre, 34a Raumati Road, Raumati, New Zealand 5032,34 Raumati Rd, Raumati Beach, Paraparaumu 5032, New Zealand, Paraparaumu
events.long_description:
NZTrio “Groove Café”
NZTrio He Taonga Wairere in association with Aotearoa New Zealand Festival of the Arts presents "Groove Café"

Welcome to Groove Café, where the music is strong and the vibe is even stronger. John Psathas’ Island Songs bring sun, surf, and a dash of Kiwi cool - no sunscreen required. Then you’re kept guessing with Eliodoro Sollima’s Tre movimenti, leaping from atonal intrigue to melodic surprises faster than you can say “cin cin”. Vivian Fung’s Ominous Machine whirs, glitches, and grooves like your favourite gadget on a caffeine rush. And it all ends with Nikolai Kapustin’s Divertissement, the ultimate musical cocktail: equal parts classical poise and jazz swagger, shaken (not stirred) into four sparkling movements.

Described as a “national treasure” (NZ Herald), NZTrio He Taonga Wairere is renowned for its eclectic repertoire, outstanding talent and warm kiwi stage presence. Bringing together three incredibly accomplished artists: Amalia Hall (violin), Matthias Balzat (cello) & Stephen De Pledge (guest piano), every NZTrio performance powerfully reaffirms the importance and cathartic nature of a live musical experience in today’s digital world.

John Psathas (NZ) - Island Songs
Eliodoro Sollima - Tre movimenti
Vivian Fung - Ominous Machine
Nikolai Kapustin - Divertissement in 4 Movements

Duration approx 60mins, no interval.

events.name: Matt Joe Gow at Hilltop Private House Concerts, Wellington
events.venue: Hilltop Private House Concerts,104B Upland Rd, Kelburn, Wellington 6012, New Zealand, Wellington
events.long_description:
Matt Joe Gow at Hilltop Private House Concerts, Wellington
Irresistible. Captivating. Unforgettable.

When Matt Joe Gow sings, everything else stops, such is the power of his voice and his songs. Those songs have won awards, from Music Victoria Country Album of the Year (twice) to a New Zealand Country Music Award, with nominations such as an Aotearoa Music Award and various chart positions along the way.

Matt’s voice has been heard in festivals in the United Kingdom and the United States; in venues small and large across Australia and New Zealand; on radio and playlists, and supporting artists such as Chris Isaak and Justin Townes Earle. And every time, he wins new fans, drawn to his amazing vocal tone and his way of bringing the listener closer, telling them stories they will carry with them.

Few artists have that combination of indelible songwriting and an extraordinary voice, along with the commitment to create better art each time and bring it to the audience so they have a transformative live experience. Matt Joe Gow is one of those few. Having recently stepped back from the stage to focus on writing his new album whilst producing other artists, Matt’s upcoming Summer 2026 shows mark a unique and special opportunity to reconnect and see him perform live once again in his home town where it all started.

715PM DOORS
730PM PERFORMANCE

Info tickets email:

Mobile: 027 245 7887 – Anna


TOUR DATES NZ
Sat Jan 31st Ophir Peace Memorial Hall, Ophir
Sat Feb 7th Niagara Falls Bluegrass & Roots Festival, Catlins*
Sat Feb 21st Moons, Dunedin*
Sat Feb 28th Hilltop House Concerts, Wellington
Fri Mar 13th Wanaka A&P Show, Wanaka

* W/ Trio

Further info at: https://mattjoegowmusic.com

events.id: Slow Burn — photography symposium-55 Cable Street, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: Slow Burn — photography symposium
events.venue: 55 Cable Street, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
To celebrate the upcoming Te Papa exhibition Slow Burn | Ahi Tāmau, we're hosting a day of collegial conversation about contemporary photography in Aotearoa. Slow Burn highlights the contribution of women and non-binary photographers, drawing on over a decade of research and collecting.
Held on opening day, this symposium begins with a special opportunity to view the exhibition before the museum opens to the public, followed by a keynote presentation from Natalie Robertson — a leading photographer, moving-image artist, and Associate Professor at Auckland University of Technology. Her practice centres her ancestral river, Waiapu, exploring how "lens-based practice can contribute to iwi-based aspirations for environmental reinvigoration".
Across a series of discussions with Aotearoa photographers, we will explore key threads in contemporary practice — including collaboration, process, and evolving photographic culture — offering insights into the ideas and relationships that shape photography today. We'll close the day in the galleries, with a new performance work by Ann Shelton from the physical garden series.
Open to photographers, curators, researchers, students, and anyone with an interest in photography, this event invites participants to connect, reflect, and share.
Tickets $60 (waged) / $40 (unwaged) with lunch included.
Assisted listening
An assisted listening system is available for this event. This allows you to stream the audio from the event directly to your hearing aid or smartphone headphones using the free WaveCAST app. More information can be found on our website, including how to set this up ahead of your visit. Feel free to email us at publicprogrammes@tepapa.govt.nz if you need assistance.
Image: Tia Ranginui, The tangi of Rūaumoko, 2023. Purchased 2024. Te Papa (O.052215)

events.id: The Stories of Our Bodies Wellington [LGBTQIA+ cohort]-Colombo St & Rintoul St, Newtown, Wellington 6021, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: The Stories of Our Bodies Wellington [LGBTQIA+ cohort]
events.venue: Colombo St & Rintoul St, Newtown, Wellington 6021, New Zealand
events.long_description:
We often believe we can know something about other people based on what we see of their bodies. Before we’re even conscious of it, we label, compartmentalise or judge - and it can be a real struggle to relish our own bodies when this judgment happens in front of a mirror. 
The Stories of Our Bodies is an affirming and liberating circle, firmly
held in dignity, that redirects this judgement towards positive body image and bodily autonomy. This workshop builds on the living lineage of Australian Radical Faerie elder Uncle Teacosy. It is shaped from gay men’s survival of the 90’s AIDS epidemic, evolved to uplift queer&trans communities and has been offered internationally by only one facilitator.
Each participant is invited into deep connection with their body and then in turn, we share the stories of our bodies from birth til now, removing as many articles of clothing as we choose. Stories often include histories of illness, injury, gender affirmation, addiction, aging, intentional modification, shape, ability or size
What stories can the marks and folds of a body tell when witnessed in belonging and respect? How can we uplift each story and every storyteller?
This circle is for participants from the Takatāpui, MVPFAFF+, LGBTQIA+ communities, active in engaged consent and includes partial or full nudity in a non-sexual atmosphere.
Your Facilitators: Eleven Greenstones and val smith
Eleven Greenstones (she/they, Pakeha) is a cultural worker, community educator, researcher, gardener and facilitator who seeks deep and fertile justice by cultivating rich soil and robust, adaptive communities. For three decades, Eleven has informed and performed behind a radio desk, on stage, in community centres and cultural hubs. Her work spans the Pacific Ocean including in Aotearoa, Australia, Timor Leste, China, Korea, Mongolia and the US: educating in high schools, AOD rehabs, hospitals, police stations, co-housing cooperatives, squatted warehouses, international language schools and mentoring in arts workshops and community gardens.
Eleven is a life-long student, recently in decolonial Fieldwork with Leah Manaema Avene and with Héctor Aristizábal, founder of ImaginAction. They’ve studied post-activism with fugitive philosopher Bayo Akomolafe, Generative Somatics and Undoing Racism® (People’s Institute for Survival and Beyond). They’ve been mentored by First Nations ecologists to work for a living planet, Undoing White Supremacy Austin (Texas) to design and deliver anti-racism ‘unlearning circles’ and by Radial Faerie elders to facilitate liberating spaces for the LGBTQIA+ community.
val smith (Pākehā, they/them) is a choreographic artist-researcher and educator based in Tāmaki Makaurau, Aotearoa. Their practice engages critical somatics and friendship-based collaboration to explore the socio-political dimensions of whiteness, queerness, and transness within the cultural context of Aotearoa. Recent performance work investigates more-than-human kinship, queer intimacies, and temporalities in relationship with marginal urban places.
val’s teaching and facilitation engages with community, secondary and tertiary learning environments. They have a Postgraduate Diploma in Dance and Drama Secondary Teaching, and have worked with kids, young people with disabilities, the Disability dance sector, older folks, as well as queer and trans communities. They teach somatic practices, improvisation, performance skills, critical dance, yoga, creative practice and research methodologies.
A recipient of the Arts Foundation Laureate Award (2019), val was also the 2016 Caroline Plummer Fellow at Te Whare Wānanga o Ōtākou, University of Otago, where they undertook a community dance project with the local queer community.

events.venue: The Fringe Bar,30 Allen St, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand, Wellington
events.long_description:
Comedians Getting Tattooed and Doing Stand-Up While Sitting Down in a Sterile Environment
Get ready for chaos, courage, and comedy under the needle! Presented by Drug of Choice and Flash of Jeanius, this one-night-only Fringe spectacle brings together powerhouse comedians, one of whom has never been tattooed before, for a show that is part stand-up, part endurance test, and all entertainment.
As the buzz of the tattoo gun hums, these comedians will deliver fresh, fearless stand-up sets while real tattoos, that are chosen by the audience, are etched in real time. Expect the perfect mix of adrenaline, laughter, and slightly questionable life choices.
Each performer is bearing skin and soul, proving that the line between pain and pun is thinner than you think. With live tattoo artistry unfolding on stage, audience banter flying, and sterling performances this is not your average comedy show.

events.name: Songwriters Speaks – Free Talk Featuring MĀ, MAJIC and Chris Tamwoy.
events.venue: 11 Hutchison Road, Newtown, Wellington 6021, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Aotearoa New Zealand Festival of the Arts proudly partners with APRA AMCOS NZ (Australasian Performing Right Association NZ) to present Songwriters Speaks 
Featuring acclaimed songwriters as they share the stories behind their waiata and compositions, offering personal insights into where the words come from. 
Hosted by Festival Co-Director Tama Waipara MNZM, this event brings the abundance of their musical kete for all to enjoy. 
Soulful singer-songwriter MAJIC and Torres Strait “guitar virtuoso” Chris Tamwoy unite for their Aotearoa debut. Prolific as individual artists, they collaborated through APRA AMCOS NZ SongHubs, resulting in the recent release of their bilingual waiata “Malu Tangata”.
One of Aotearoa’s most exciting new artists, rapper and singer-songwriter MĀ brings her genre-blending sound to Tāwhiri Warehouse. Seamlessly fusing neo-soul, jazz, and hip hop, you can catch her performance at 10pm on Saturday 28th Feb - buy tickets here
Don't miss MAJIC and Chris Tamwoy's debut performance at Māoriland on Saturday 7th March - buy tickets here
and you can catch MĀ back at Tāwhiri Warehouse at 10pm - buy tickets here

events.id: Charlotte Yates and Show Pony Play The Shed-46a Victoria Street, Alicetown, Lower Hutt 5010, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: Charlotte Yates and Show Pony Play The Shed
events.venue: 46a Victoria Street, Alicetown, Lower Hutt 5010, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Two of our favourites are back after a sold out show in 2025 at The Shed!
Charlotte Yates and trusted musical ally Show Pony look forward to performing a two-set show featuring all songs from critically acclaimed release Winter’s Eye and more.
Hailing from Wellington, singer-songwriter Charlotte Yates wields acoustic guitar while multi-instrumentalist Show Pony aka the ‘Swiss Army Knife of NZ music’ plays trumpet, violin, percussion and backing vocals… but not all at the same time!
“This show was so good I wanted to share this post. Charlotte Yates is surely one of NZ's most talented singer/songwriters. Her show on Saturday night with fiddler/trumpeter Show Pony was outstanding.” Peter Revell, Mayor, Thames-Coromandel
Winter’s Eye was co-produced with fellow Wellington-based artist, Brooke Singer (French for Rabbits), who contributed synthesiser, piano and backing vocal performances on the seven-track release. Winter's Eye is available on Bandcamp and all online platforms. Physical copies will be available for sale at their shows.
Doors Open 7PM for a 7.30PM Start.
The Shed is an unlicensed seated venue.

events.id: King Lear - Bard in the Yard Summer Shakespeare-166 Muritai Road, Eastbourne, Lower Hutt 5013, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: King Lear - Bard in the Yard Summer Shakespeare
events.venue: 166 Muritai Road, Eastbourne, Lower Hutt 5013, New Zealand
events.long_description:
This summer, Eastbourne’s prize-winning Butterfly Creek Theatre Troupe proudly celebrates its 30th year of Shakespeare with a strikingly contemporary production of King Lear. In this two-hour adaptation the tragedy is sharpened to its core: the fraught family dynamics of Lear and Gloucester, two parents whose misguided choices unleash betrayal and heartbreak. Lear’s reckless division of his kingdom and Gloucester’s misplaced trust in her children reveal how pride and blindness can devastate generations. Performed as the sun sets on a summer evening—with the adjacent school hall ready should the weather turn—this production offers a fresh perspective on parental folly, loyalty, and love, making Shakespeare’s timeless themes resonate anew.
The show will be presented to a seated audience in the school courtyard. It can get chilly so wrap warmly but it will move indoors in poor weather. There is a bar (cash or Eftpos). Parking in the school grounds accessible from Oroua Street.
Warning: The play contains graphic violence.

events.long_description:
Big Mac Slabs learn to coil build a honey pot or bowl
This workshop is in Paraparaumu
When: 1st of March 2026
Time: 1.00pm
Where: 289 Mazengarb Road, Paraparaumu 5032

Coil building is a classic way to make both sculptural and functional ware. In this class you will be taught how to make coils of clay and join then together to create a honey pot or bowl. This is a fun class the can often take a twist of you not leaving with the intended creation but you will leave with something you are happy with in the end. come with a friend or make new ones in this class and enjoy the journey of making with with clay.
tea, coffee and biscuits will be offered.
After the class Fiona will take the items home to dry and be fired and the colour you choose.
The class is held in Paraparaumu NOT Whanganui.

events.id: Friends of Karori Cemetery: Off the Beaten Track Tour (March 2026)-76 Old Karori Road, Karori, Wellington 6012, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: Friends of Karori Cemetery: Off the Beaten Track Tour (March 2026)
events.venue: 76 Old Karori Road, Karori, Wellington 6012, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Off the Beaten Track Tour. 
Stretch your legs on this tour! Off the Beaten Track takes you off the main road, exploring a bit further into the older sections of Karori Cemetery. We walk up and down the hills, through the gullies and alongside the creek to discover some interesting characters and some of the history of the cemetery as well.
Each tour is $10 per person (plus non-refundable booking fee). Children under 12 are free.
Our tour has a maximum capacity of about 15 persons. If there are insufficient tickets remaining for your party, please email us at info@friendsofkaroricemetery.co.nz to check if we can accommodate you.
Please note:
If we have to cancel a tour due to inclement weather or sickness, we will notify you on the day 1 hour before the tour starts by email and on our Facebook page. The booking fee is non-refundable.
This tour is approximately 2 hours long.
Please dress appropriately for the conditions. While we do our best to guide you on a safe walking route, during the winter months the ground can become slippery in places.
Some of our walks require a moderate degree of fitness and are not suited for those with limited mobility.
There is only one toilet which is located by the cemetery office at the main entrance.
If you have purchased tickets for other people can you please pass our tour information on to them as well.
Please meet us at the shelter (shown as the Historic Chapel on the map at the main entrance)
We look forward to welcoming you to Karori Cemetery.

events.id: Friends of Karori Cemetery: Hangman's Noose Tour (March 2026)-76 Old Karori Road, Karori, Wellington 6012, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: Friends of Karori Cemetery: Hangman's Noose Tour (March 2026)
events.venue: 76 Old Karori Road, Karori, Wellington 6012, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Hangman's Noose Tour
In total, 85 people have been executed for crime in New Zealand with the first in 1842 and the last in 1957. Seventeen of those men were executed in Wellington and 11 are buried in Karori Cemetery.  This walking tour will visit some of their graves to account their crimes, trials and convictions. It will also visit the plots of some of the victims.

The graves are unmarked and placed in remote and disparate locations making this a tour about 2.5 hours long. The route is 2.5km and requires reasonable physical fitness due to the steep terrain and unsealed paths in places.
The tour contains a number of adult themes and some graphic descriptions and so is not suitable for everyone.
Each tour is $10 per person (plus non-refundable booking fee). Children under 12 are free.
Our tour has a maximum capacity of about 15 persons. If there are insufficient tickets remaining for your party, please email us at info@friendsofkaroricemetery.co.nz to check if we can accommodate you.
Please note:
If we have to cancel a tour due to inclement weather or sickness, we will notify you on the day 1 hour before the tour starts by email and on our Facebook page. The booking fee is non-refundable.
Please dress appropriately for the conditions. While we do our best to guide you on a safe walking route, the ground can become slippery in places.
Some of our walks require a moderate degree of fitness and are not suited for those with limited mobility.
There is only one toilet which is located by the cemetery office at the main entrance.
If you have purchased tickets for other people can you please pass our tour information on to them as well.
Please meet us at the shelter (shown as the Historic Chapel on the map at the main entrance)
We look forward to welcoming you to Karori Cemetery.

events.id: Leftfield-Shed 6, Wellington, New Zealand-Wellington NZ
events.name: Leftfield
events.venue: Shed 6, Wellington, New Zealand
events.long_description:
UK electronic pioneers Leftfield will celebrate 36 years of music-making when they play Wellington in March. Their influence helped define progressive house and experimental electronic music. Leftfield is expected to bring huge energy to Shed 6. For the tour concerts, they will delve into back catalogue hits as well as their most recent remix collection ‘Full Way Round’. 
The group, made up of duo Neil Barnes and Paul Daley, emerged from London’s club scene in 1989. They were among the first to bring fully live electronic music production into large-scale venues and festivals. Their 1995 Mercury Prize-winning debut album ‘Leftism’, and its 1999 follow-up ‘Rhythm and Stealth’, placed them alongside electronica acts like the Chemical Brothers and The Prodigy.

events.id: Leftfield tickets-Meow Nui, Wellington, New Zealand-Ticketek
events.name: Leftfield tickets
events.venue: Meow Nui, Wellington, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Presented by: MG Live & Frontier Touring
MG Live and Frontier Touring proudly announce Leftfield – one of electronic music’s all-time greatest acts – with very special headline shows for 2026 as they continue their celebration of their 35th anniversary (36 at the time of writing).
Speaking on the shows, Neil Barnes shared, “It will be 36 years since I released the first Leftfield track, ‘Not Forgotten’, and 31 years now of Leftism. It feels like the perfect time to celebrate and I’m so pleased that finally we get to come back to New Zealand and Australia. Let’s make it unforgettable. Can’t wait to see you there!”
Leftfield’s most recent release was a collection of remixes of ‘Full Way Round (Ft Grian Chatten)’, and they have also been touring across the UK and Europe throughout 2025 to bring their 2022 album This Is What We Do to life.
“Pure Genius? It wasn’t far off.” — The Times (live review in 2025)

events.id: Review Revue - NZ Fringe 2026-The Gods - Paramount,29 Courtenay Pl, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand, Wellington-All Events In
events.name: Review Revue - NZ Fringe 2026
events.venue: The Gods - Paramount,29 Courtenay Pl, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand, Wellington
events.long_description:
Review Revue - NZ Fringe 2026
What if the review was the show?

For NZ Fringe 2026, an election year that couldn't come any sooner, musical comedy duo Bethany Miller and Logan Hunt imagine a best-of-all-possible-worlds-Aotearoa.

That's a tall order, so we've invited some friends (foes?) for feedback...

Each night we're bringing in a local theatre reviewer to critique us live onstage, and you'll get to witness the results, over and over again.

______

Presented as part of NZ Fringe 2026
3-6 March, 5.30pm
@ The Gods, Paramount

TICKETS AVALABLE NOW FROM NZ FRINGE https://tickets.fringe.co.nz/event/446:8283/

______


CREATIVE TEAM:

Logan Hunt - Co-Creator & Performer, Composer
Bethany Miller - Co-Creator & Performer, Producer

Finn McKinlay - keyboardist
Beans Wright - violinist
Chloe Marshall - lighting designer, tech operator
Austin Harrison - Dramaturg
Em Maguire - Publicist

Reviewers? - We are SO excited about who we have onboard, and will announce the who & when soon!

______


ABOUT THE DUO:

Nominated for "MOMENTOUS MUSIC" (NZ Fringe), Logan and Bethany have made a new musical comedy each year since 2023, complete with crunchy social commentary, witty lyrics, and loveable/hateable characters. Logan loves to write, Bethany loves to improvise. This time, they've agreed to do both, at the mercy of live reviewers.

Their previous shows have been described as:

"Supremely relevant social satire cleverly written and gorgeously portrayed" - Theatreview

"heartwarming, wholesome and features a wickedly talented cast showcasing the best of their abilities." - Wellyott

"It’s incredible how quickly Miller is able to get the audience calling out lyrics to a song they’ve never heard before. She is a consistently strong vocalist, as anyone who’s ever seen her perform will attest to." - Wellyott

"[Logan Hunt's] Tim Minchin-esque lyrics are brilliant and Miller’s performance of them a delight as she parodies the breathy, pouting sincerity of so many young popsters." - Regional News

"Delightfully ‘Fringey’, frenetic and buoyant with glorious energy and musicality" - Theatreview

events.id: REDEMPTION || NZ Fringe || Ginge & Minge-BATS Theatre,1 Kent Ter, Mount Victoria, Wellington 6011, New Zealand, Wellington-All Events In
events.name: REDEMPTION || NZ Fringe || Ginge & Minge
events.venue: BATS Theatre,1 Kent Ter, Mount Victoria, Wellington 6011, New Zealand, Wellington
events.long_description:
REDEMPTION || NZ Fringe || Ginge & Minge
2025 winners of ‘Most Spectacular Organised Chaos’, Ginge & Minge (Nina Hogg and Megan Connolly) are at it again, taking rejected comedy pitches and turning them into comedy gold!!!

REDEMPTION offers three hopeful ‘redeemables’ a chance to direct their dream sketches, improvised formats, scenes or comedic characters that haven’t worked, been rejected, or just didn’t receive the love they deserve.

With a cast of talented funny people (Lesa Macleod-Whiting, Ralph Hilaga, Mo Munn and Matt Hutton), prepare for epic flops and surprising superstar successes during this 50 minute special that combines Ginge & Minge’s love of sketch and improv comedy.

BUT THE POWER IS IN YOUR HANDS.

Only YOU, the audience, gets to decide what will be REDEEMED and what will be REDUMBED.

If you love witnessing magic moments being made right before your eyes, commitment to big stupid ideas, gambling, or just a good spectacle, this show is for you.

3-7 March, 6.30PM
Bats Theatre, 1 Kent Tce
TICKETS: www.bats.co.nz/whats-on/redemption-fringe
events.description:
REDEMPTION || NZ Fringe || Ginge & Minge 2025 winners of ‘Most Spectacular Organised Chaos’, Ginge & Minge (Nina Hogg and Megan Connolly) are at it again, taking rejected comedy pitches and turning them into comedy gold!!!
REDEMPTION offers three hopeful ‘redeemables’ a chance to direct their dream sketches, improvised formats, scenes or comedic characters that haven’t worked, been rejected, or just didn’t receive the love they deserve.
With a cast of talented funny people (Lesa Macleod-Whiting, Ralph Hilaga, Mo Munn and Matt Hutton), prepare for epic flops and surprising superstar successes during this 50 minute special that combines Ginge & Minge’s love of sketch and improv comedy.
Only YOU, the audience, gets to decide what will be REDEEMED and what will be REDUMBED.
If you love witnessing magic moments being made right before your eyes, commitment to big stupid ideas, gambling, or just a good spectacle, this show is for you.

events.id: SwapRox | NZ Fringe-BATS Theatre,1 Kent Terrace, Wellington, New Zealand-All Events In
events.name: SwapRox | NZ Fringe
events.venue: BATS Theatre,1 Kent Terrace, Wellington, New Zealand
events.long_description:
SwapRox | NZ Fringe
Some people are tops, some are bottoms but here at PopRox we're all switches. In the age of Tik Tok and Reels, our average attention span has maxed out at 7 minutes so PopRox has crafted a show where everything swaps on a buzzer. The cast, the musician and even the tech operator swap roles with each other after just 7 minutes. It's a character based, high-speed romp pushing top improv comedians to the brink of their skills and their sanity. If you don't like what you see, you'll have the chance to change it up and swap it around.

Expect huge characters, heaps of laughs, stitch-ups and people so far out of their skill zone it'll remind you of the coalition government. No night is the same. Not even every quarter hour is the same.

PopRox is a professional improv theatre company entering its 5th year of operation. Having dazzled audiences across Te-Whanganui-A-Tara, the motu and even the world, PopRox's slick and stylish improvisation has received critical acclaim and delighted sold out audiences.

PopRox is:

Tara McEntee
Austin Harrison
Dylan Hutton
Jed Davies
Lesa Macleod-Whiting
Lia Kelly
Mamaeroa Munn
Millie Osborne
Nina Hogg

events.id: Tolerance | NZ Fringe-BATS Theatre,1 Kent Terrace, Wellington, New Zealand-All Events In
events.name: Tolerance | NZ Fringe
events.venue: BATS Theatre,1 Kent Terrace, Wellington, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Tolerance | NZ Fringe
Eight of Te Whanganui-a-Tara's most acclaimed emerging playwrights (Rachel Atlas, Rachel McLean, Campbell Wright, Zachary Klein, Viki Moananu, Amy Wright, Sophie Maree, and Matt Loveranes) tolerated one another, as they paired up to create four short plays on the theme of Tolerance. Come witness the result, an eclectic work about the ways we should (and shouldn't) put up with those around us, as the world burns down.

"Compromise was something special; I'm genuinely grateful that I got to witness this nexus of talent. Varied and out-there, yet restrained and expertly-crafted, it had it all. " - Salient

Tolerance is the continuation of a project started last year with Compromise (Nominee, Best Organised Chaos NZ Fringe 2025) focused on bringing together playwrights to collaborate, build community amongst writers and supply a little bit of creative chaos. It is once again directed by Lia Kelly (Most Original Production Wellington Theatre Awards, One Night Band), and features a cast of vibrant local talent.


Featuring plays about self care at the end of the world, the power games of celebrity power couples, office politics, and interventions gone awry, Tolerance is bursting at the seams with ideas, laughs, and fluids of all varieties. Make sure to "witness this nexus of talent" (Salient), only in NZ Fringe.

events.id: Wellington - Building Science Summit New Zealand 2026-Museum of New Zealand Te Papa Tongarewa,55 Cable Street, Wellington, New Zealand-All Events In
events.name: Wellington - Building Science Summit New Zealand 2026
events.venue: Museum of New Zealand Te Papa Tongarewa,55 Cable Street, Wellington, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Wellington - Building Science Summit New Zealand 2026
Leading industry experts share practical insights and proven principles for advancing building envelope design and construction practices.

About this Event

Welcome to the Building Science Summit New Zealand 2026 in Wellington!
Join us on Wednesday 4 March 2026 at Te Papa, Wellington for a day filled with insightful discussions and networking opportunities. Bringing together leading industry experts from Aotearoa, Australia, Germany, and Canada to share practical insights and proven principles for advancing building envelope design and construction practices. Don't miss out on this exciting opportunity to connect with like-minded individuals and expand your knowledge.

Key Highlights:
Insights from international and local experts
In-depth discussions on building performance and durability
Case studies showcasing real-world solutions
Networking with industry leaders and peers

We are excited to welcome leading building science experts from New Zealand, Australia, Germany, and Canada. Including Brian Hubbs, Hartwig Künzel, Jess Clarke, Stijn Van den Eeden and Bernard Farrington.
Valid for 60 NZIA CPD Points.

We look forward to seeing you there!

Sponsors:
Nuralite, Oculus Building Science & Façades, Pro Clima, Outright Continuous Insulation, ROCKWOOL


Agenda


🕑: 07:50 AM - 08:20 AM
Registration

🕑: 08:20 AM - 08:30 AM
Opening message
Host: Peter Raimondo

🕑: 08:30 AM - 09:30 AM
TBA
Host: Bernard Farringon
Info: Bernard Farrington is a Laboratory Manager at Shelby Wright Test Labs while also working as a Senior Specialist at Oculus Architectural Engineering. He specialises in building enclosure performance, testing, and practical detailing, combining hands-on technical experience with consulting expertise to support high-performance construction and improved building outcomes.


🕑: 09:30 AM - 10:30 AM
TBA
Host: Stijn Van den Eeden
Info: Stijn has 25 years of experience in external envelopes and was involved in the design and construction of projects on 5 continents, before settling in New Zealand 15 years ago. His expertise includes building materials, façade system development, project delivery and remedial work.


🕑: 10:30 AM - 11:00 AM
Morning Tea Break

🕑: 11:00 AM - 12:00 PM
TBA
Host: Jess Clarke
Info: Jesse Clarke holds more than 15 years of experience in the construction industry. He holds the technical lead role of the Innovation and R&D Manager, servicing pro clima in New Zealand and Australia. Jesse is an active advocate for a holistic approach to the development of industry guidance, standards and codes.


🕑: 12:00 PM - 01:00 PM
Lunch Break + Networking

🕑: 01:00 PM - 02:00 PM
TBA
Host: Hartwig M. Künzel
Info: Prof. Hartwig M. Künzel is Head of the Hygrothermics Department at the Fraunhofer Institute for Building Physics (IBP) in Germany and an Honorary Professor at the University of Stuttgart. With a PhD in Civil Engineering, he has led pioneering research on heat and moisture transport in building envelopes for over three decades. Prof. Künzel is the creator of the internationally recognised WUFI hygrothermal simulation model and has contributed extensively to building standards and best practices for moisture control, energy efficiency, and indoor comfort. He has authored hundreds of publications and is a sought-after speaker at international conferences, sharing expertise that bridges scientific research and practical application in building physics.


🕑: 02:00 PM - 03:00 PM
TBA
Host: Brian Hubbs
Info: Brian Hubbs is a Founder, Principal, and Senior Building Science Specialist at RDH Building Science. With over 30 years of experience as a consultant practicing exclusively in the field of building science, he is a practical façade engineer and researcher. He has broad experience with a variety of building enclosure systems, delivering consistent innovative solutions. Brian brings a unique blend of theoretical and hands-on knowledge gained from designing façades for new buildings, as well as completing hundreds of forensic investigations, rehabilitation, and research projects. He has extensive experience with high-rise and iconic façade systems, components, and materials, designing new and innovative facade systems for high-rise wood and Passive House projects.


🕑: 03:00 PM - 04:00 PM
TBA
Info: TBA


🕑: 04:00 PM - 04:15 PM
Closing Notes and Comments
Host: Peter Raimando

events.id: Unlocking Accessibility in Microsoft Office - Wellington-11/15 Willeston Street, Wellington Central, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: Unlocking Accessibility in Microsoft Office - Wellington
events.venue: 11/15 Willeston Street, Wellington Central, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Hosted by Amanda Mace & Dr Ann Knettler - this practical, hands-on session will teach participants how to create accessible content using Microsoft Office tools. Ideal for communications teams, educators, government staff, and business professionals who need to ensure their content reaches and supports the human rights of all users - including users with disabilities. This session will cover:
Understanding accessibility fundamentals in digital documents
Applying accessibility best practices in Word, PowerPoint, and Excel
Using built-in accessibility checkers and tools effectively
Structuring content for screen reader compatibility
Managing images, charts, and tables for inclusive access
Exporting to accessible PDF formats
Increasing your SEO through accessibility practices

Participants will leave with confidence and practical templates to apply accessibility immediately in their daily work.

events.id: Black Country, New Road | Meow Nui, Wellington-92 Vivian St, Te Aro, Wellington 6011-All Events In
events.name: Black Country, New Road | Meow Nui, Wellington
events.venue: 92 Vivian St, Te Aro, Wellington 6011
events.long_description:
Black Country, New Road | Meow Nui, Wellington
Handsome Tours are pleased to present the return of Black Country, New Road to Australia + New Zealand in 2026!

Critically acclaimed British collective Black Country, New Road are thrilled to announce their forthcoming Australia + New Zealand tour, set to take place this summer. The announcement arrives in the wake of the band’s most recent studio album, Forever Howlong, which has attracted widespread praise for its recent harmonious reinvention- and recorder solos.

Released earlier this year via Ninja Tune, Forever Howlong marks a bold transformation for the group. Songwriting and vocal duties now shared amongst band members, give rise to a richly collaborative sound and warm communal spirit. ‘Triumph in the face of adversity’ goes some way to explaining the resulting joy.

Described by The Guardian as “a gentler, more bucolic direction” Forever Howlong has made notable chart inroads for the band, revealing new audiences and a revived sense of self.

Now Black Country, New Road are ready to share their evolving sound with Australian and New Zealand audiences. These theatrical live performances are a ‘mustn’t miss’ kind of situation.

events.name: Sir El Tom
events.venue: The Opera House, Wellington, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Here’s a chance to hear Sir Elton John’s music performed live by someone who cares about authenticity. Tom Cridland is an Anglo-Portuguese musician from London. The Opera House hosts his alter ego, Sir El Tom, in homage to one of the great living musicians. Sir El Tom performs Sir Elton John’s music in an exhilarating concert full of famous hits. You’ll hear songs like Can You Feel the Love Tonight, Don’t Go Breaking My Heart, I’m Still Standing, Goodbye Yellow Brick Road, Crocodile Rock, and many more. 
Whether it’s singing at a grand piano or with a full band, you’ll hear as authentic a performance as possible. Sir El Tom is known for extraordinary attention to detail, where the music always comes first and everything is live and natural.
