events.id: THE BETHS ★ AOTEAROA TOUR – MEOW NUI #2-92 Vivian St, Te Aro, Wellington 6011-All Events In
events.name: THE BETHS ★ AOTEAROA TOUR – MEOW NUI #2
events.venue: 92 Vivian St, Te Aro, Wellington 6011
events.long_description:
THE BETHS ★ AOTEAROA TOUR – MEOW NUI #2
Globetrotting local four piece, The Beths are thrilled to announce their return home playing seven shows throughout Aotearoa next March in celebration of their recently released fourth album Straight Line Was A Lie.

Released in August this year, Straight Line Was A Lie is the first album released via American label ANTI- , debuting at #1 on the Aotearoa Album Chart and receiving glowing reviews from press around the world.

Last night, The Beths made their late night television debut on Jimmy Kimmel Live! performing Straight Line Was A Lie’s standout opening title track, praised by Stereogum as a “total slam dunk of an opener.”

This performance gives a taste of what to expect on the band’s homecoming tour which kicks off at Meow Nui in Wellington with two nights on Friday 13 and Saturday 14 of March 2026. The band then head south to Dunedin playing Glenroy Auditorium on Friday 20 March, James Hay in Christchurch on Sunday 22 March and Theatre Royal in Nelson on Monday 23 March. The tour wraps up at the iconic Powerstation in Auckland with two shows on Thursday 26 and Friday 27 March. Tickets for all shows go on presale Monday 3 November at 8am and general sale Wednesday 5 November at 8am NZDT.

These shows come on the back of three solid months of touring the world, which kicked off last month in Europe. The North American leg begins this week and includes some of their biggest venues to date in the U.S., including The Wiltern in Los Angeles, The Fillmore in San Francisco, The Salt Shed in Chicago, Brooklyn Paramount in New York City, Union Transfer in Philadelphia, 9:30 Club in Washington, DC and more.

events.id: UPCHUCK: Australia & New Zealand 2026-San Fran, Wellington-Ticket Master
events.name: UPCHUCK: Australia & New Zealand 2026
events.venue: San Fran, Wellington
events.long_description:
If you’ve been waiting for a band that hits hard, means it and leaves nothing behind, this is it. I OH YOU and MG Live are pumped to announce provocative punk powerhouse Upchuck are bringing their explosive live show down under. The ferocious five-piece from Atlanta will make their Australian and New Zealand debut next March, with shows in Brisbane, Sydney, Melbourne, Auckland and Wellington, as well as a featured set at Victoria’s Golden Plains festival.
The tour follows the release of their blistering third album – and Domino debut – I’m Nice Now, out now here. Produced and mixed by Ty Segall, the album is a bold evolution of their sound – a raw, urgent and emotionally charged statement of survival and resistance. Formed in 2018 by a crew of Atlanta skaters in their early 20s – KT (vocals), Mikey Durham (guitar), Hoff (guitar), Ausar Ward (bass) and Chris Salado (vocals/drums) – they quickly became hometown legends. Their debut Sense Yourself (2022) and Ty Segall-produced follow-up Bite The Hand That Feeds (2023) cemented their fearless reputation. Early singles Freaky and Facecard earned praise from punk icons Iggy Pop and Henry Rollins, who both played tracks on their radio shows, while support slots for Faye Webster (who calls Upchuck “her favourite band”), Amyl and the Sniffers, Soul Glo, Osees, King Gizzard & the Lizard Wizard and a breakout Coachella 2024 performance further solidified their status.
A fierce lineup of local acts will join Upchuck around Australia and New Zealand. Captivating fourpiece Blue Diner kick things off in Brisbane on Wednesday 4 March; Post-punk rockers Xiao Xiao open in Sydney on Friday 6 March with secret guests in tow! Punk Naarm trio CLAMM bring their raw and visceral sound to Melbourne on Wednesday 11 March, while Aotearoa rockers DARTZ take over Auckland on Friday 13 March and Wellington on Saturday 14 March with their signature fiery live set! Like your punk loud, honest and unfiltered? This is the tour you’ve been waiting for. Don’t miss Upchuck’s debut down under.


MG LIVE TERMS OF SALE

https://mg.live/termsofsale

Produced and mixed by Ty Segall, the album is a bold evolution of their sound – a raw, urgent and emotionally charged statement of survival and resistance.
Punk Naarm trio CLAMM bring their raw and visceral sound to Melbourne on Wednesday 11 March, while Aotearoa rockers DARTZ take over Auckland on Friday 13 March and Wellington on Saturday 14 March with their signature fiery live set!
This is the tour you’ve been waiting for.

events.long_description:
Baa Baa Chew
Baa Baa Chew
He kai. He kōrero. He whanaungatanga.
Food. Conversation. Connection.

Baa Baa Chew is a grassroots community BBQ where we come together to share kai, kōrero, and time with one another. It’s about pulling up a seat at a welcoming table — building connection, care, and belonging through manaakitanga and shared food.

If you’re able, please bring a can as koha. Any cash koha will go towards a freezer to support future community events, and donated canned or long-life kai will be added to the Kai Basket to support whānau in need.

Everyone is welcome — come as you are, bring a friend, and share in the joy of community

#seedstofeeds
#mmcc
#wethrivetogether
#baabaachew

events.name: Tunnel Gully Kids Mountain Bike Day
events.venue: Tunnel Gully,Plateau Road, Upper Hutt, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Tunnel Gully Kids Mountain Bike Day
Have a go at mountain biking in Tunnel Gully, Pākuratahi Forest
Bring the whānau for a day of fun on wheels in the stunning Pākuratahi Forest, just north of Upper Hutt.

Tamariki aged 7 and up can join guided rides and skills sessions designed especially for those new to mountain biking.

Don’t have a bike? EkeRua ReBicycle will be there with kids bikes to borrow.

Riders will explore trails in the pine forests and native bush of the Tunnel Gully Recreation Area. New riders can stick to easy trails and build their skills and fitness riding in the forest.

Our adventure basecamp will have a sausage sizzle, games for the whānau, bike safety checks, and places to chill out for a picnic.

This free summer event is delivered in partnership with NtrailZ (trailbuilders), WORD (youth mountain biking), and EkeRua ReBicycle (bicycle charity).

Register for this FREE event via the link below:

events.id: Iron & Wine tickets-Meow, Te Aro, Wellington-Ticketek
events.name: Iron & Wine tickets
events.venue: Meow, Te Aro, Wellington
events.long_description:
Presented by: Handsome Tours
Handsome Tours is proud to present the return of Iron & Wine!
Iron & Wine, the moniker of singer/songwriter and film studies lecturer Sam Beam, returns to Australia for the first time since 2018 – this time as soloist in a captivating run of shows in capital cities and festival appearances, drawing from his transcendent and illuminating folk sounds.
Known for his deeply burnished vocals, keen melodic sensibility, and introspective, free-flowing lyrical point of view, Iron & Wine is one of the preeminent artists and collaborators of the first wave of indie folk. Following his most recent EP release of covers, Making Good Time – a collaboration with Ben Bridwell (Band of Horses), and his 2024 full length album Light Verse, Iron & Wine come to Australia off the back of a huge US tour with award-winning trio I’m With Her and Seattle favourites Band of Horses.
For more than a decade, Iron & Wine has crafted a body of work spanning seven studio albums, numerous EPs and singles, each marked by atmospheric arrangements, poetic storytelling, and Sam Beam’s singular voice. From modest beginnings with The Creek Drank the Cradle, through the rustic beauty of The Shepherd’s Dog, the bold explorations of Kiss Each Other Clean and Ghost on Ghost, to the reflective resonance of Beast Epic and the orchestral sweep of Light Verse, Iron & Wine has earned acclaim for its capacity to move between the hushed and the grand with elegance and emotional clarity.
Iron & Wine will perform solo, playing stripped back music from his expansive catalogue including songs from latest album Light Verse, fan favourites from his collaborations with Calexico and I’m With Her, and the cinematic gems such as the slow dance soundtrack from Twilight.

For more than a decade, Iron & Wine has crafted a body of work spanning seven studio albums, numerous EPs and singles, each marked by atmospheric arrangements, poetic storytelling, and Sam Beam’s singular voice.

events.id: Voices New Zealand presents: Ara Hura — A Visionary Journey-Michael Fowler Centre, Wellington, New Zealand-Wellington NZ
events.name: Voices New Zealand presents: Ara Hura — A Visionary Journey
events.venue: Michael Fowler Centre, Wellington, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Aotearoa’s most influential choral conductor has made her mark across multiple choirs in New Zealand and beyond. The huge contribution of Dr Karen Grylls is celebrated in ‘Ara Hura — A Visionary Journey’. 
It’s fitting that this Aotearoa Festival of the Arts concert involves the choir Dr Grylls founded 28 years ago. Voices New Zealand debuted with a concert at the same festival in 1998. It has gone on to build a reputation for excellence in the music world. For this celebratory concert, the choir is joined by taonga pūoro artist Horomona Horo, leading instrumentalists, and a chamber ensemble from the New Zealand Symphony Orchestra. 
The concert centrepiece is Robert Wiremu’s Re-imagined Mozart: Erebus. The programme also features a new commission from Takerei Komene, as well as waiata by Ngāpō and Pimia Wehi. This highlights Dr Grylls’ pioneering collaborations that reshaped Aotearoa’s choral landscape. Her expertise as a choral clinician is sought internationally, and she regularly conducts masterclasses and workshops in Wales, England, North America, Canada and Australia. 
This marks Dr Grylls’ final appearance as Music Director of Voices New Zealand. It’s a rare opportunity to celebrate her vision, artistry, and legacy.

Voices New Zealand, the ensemble she founded and debuted at this Festival in 1998, leads the celebration, joined by taonga puoro artist Horomona Horo, leading instrumentalists, and a chamber ensemble from the New Zealand Symphony Orchestra.

One weekend every March, CubaDupa takes over some of Wellington’s central city streets for an epic party.
The free annual festival brings a carnival vibe to the end of the summer.
It offers live music, street theatre, dance, parades, and other cultural experiences.
CubaDupa is New Zealand’s largest outdoor arts and music festival.

events.id: Grace Petrie-San Fran, Wellington-Ticket Master
events.name: Grace Petrie
events.venue: San Fran, Wellington
events.long_description:
UK protest singer Grace Petrie has become a force on the international folk scene, known for her razor-sharp lyrics, fierce politics and laugh-out-loud wit on stage. Often compared to Billy Bragg, she writes songs that rally, comfort and cut straight to the bone, tackling themes of feminism, queer identity and social justice with passion and bite. 
Since touring New Zealand in 2020 with The Guilty Feminist, Grace has won a loyal following here, drawn to both her firebrand politics and her disarming charm. Her breakout single Black Tie became a queer anthem, streaming over 1.2 million times and drawing praise from MOJO, The Observer and The New Yorker.
Her latest album Build Something Better, produced by Frank Turner, topped the UK folk charts and confirmed what fans already knew: Grace Petrie is one of Britain’s most vital, uncompromising and entertaining songwriters.

events.id: Menopause The Musical-The Opera House, Wellington, New Zealand-Wellington NZ
events.name: Menopause The Musical
events.venue: The Opera House, Wellington, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Described as the ultimate ladies’ night out, Menopause the Musical has been delivering laughs across the globe for 10 years. Now the fun-filled musical about ‘the change’ returns to Wellington for one night.  
Set in a department store, four women meet by chance while shopping for a black lace bra. Though they couldn’t be more different, they quickly discover a shared bond over memory loss, hot flushes, night sweats, and mood swings. What follows is a hilarious, heartwarming musical told with love, laughter, and the greatest hits of the 60s, 70s, and 80s. The laughter-filled 90-minute production gets audiences out of their seats dancing and singing along to clever parodies of beloved pop classics. 
Winner of over 40 Tony Awards, Menopause the Musical has entertained more than 17 million fans worldwide. It’s been translated into nine languages and performed in more than 500 cities. The show’s enduring appeal lies in its honesty, hilarity and heart. It celebrates women everywhere and turns shared experiences into shared joy.

events.id: The Rocky Horror Show-St James Theatre, Wellington, New Zealand-Wellington NZ
events.name: The Rocky Horror Show
events.venue: St James Theatre, Wellington, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Dust off your corset, strap on your heels, and get ready to Time Warp like it’s 1973. After a 15-year hiatus, The Rocky Horror Show is back. The musical, written 50 years ago by New Zealand national treasure Richard O’Brien, stars a phenomenal West End cast. This high-energy stage spectacular features all the catchy songs you know and love: Sweet Transvestite, Dammit Janet, and the pelvic-thrusting, showstopper Time Warp. 
The show follows two squeaky-clean college kids, Brad and Janet. The couple find themselves stranded outside a mysterious mansion. Inside awaits the fabulous and flamboyant Dr Frank’n’Furter, and a wild adventure full of fun, frolics, frocks, and frivolity. 
The Rocky Horror Show is the longest continuously running contemporary musical in the world. It has thrilled over 35 million theatregoers, been staged in 30 countries, and translated into 20 languages. Get dressed up, let loose, and be your fabulous self at the biggest glitter-soaked party in town.

events.id: Soiree at the Zoo; A Night for our Whanau and Animals-200 Daniell Street, Newtown, New Zealand 6021,Wellington Zoo - Manchester Street, Newtown, Wellington 6021, New Zealand, Wellington-All Events In
events.name: Soiree at the Zoo; A Night for our Whanau and Animals
events.venue: 200 Daniell Street, Newtown, New Zealand 6021,Wellington Zoo - Manchester Street, Newtown, Wellington 6021, New Zealand, Wellington
events.long_description:
Soiree at the Zoo; A Night for our Whanau and Animals
Are you ready to take a walk on the wild side? Be a rebel with a cause?

Join Ronald McDonald House Charities® New Zealand (RMHC® NZ) and Te Nukuao Wellington Zoo for our joint fundraiser, 'Soirée at the Zoo: A night for our families and animals.’ RMHC NZ and Wellington Zoo have a long history of working together in the community. We wanted to secure the future of the work we do by hosting this fundraiser, as we approach nearly a decade of partnership.

We are excited to bring you an epic night of glitz, good vibes and an action-packed live auction with some fabulous prizes, all to raise much-needed funds for RMHC NZ and Wellington Zoo. 🌟✨

📅 Date: 22 November 2025
🕕 Time: 6.30pm – 11.00pm
📍 Location: Wellington Zoo, 200 Daniell Street, Newtown, Wellington 6021

🎟️ BUY TICKETS NOW to secure your spot and get ready to:
• Explore the zoo after hours
• Enjoy delicious canapés with a complimentary welcome drink
• Feel the electric excitement of the live auction and raffle
• Let your hair down and hit the dance floor with some choice local music
• Mix and mingle with your friends and some familiar Wellingtonian faces
• Be captivated by the journey of a local RMHC NZ whānau and Wellington Zoo
• And much more!
By attending our Soirée, you'll be making a real difference as all proceeds raised will be shared equally between RMHC NZ and Wellington Zoo.

🏡 Every day, RMHC NZ provides families with a child in hospital a ‘home-away-from-home'. RMHC NZ supports over 4,400 Kiwi families every year, keeping them together during their toughest times.

Te Nukuao Wellington Zoo welcomes families using RMHC NZ services to the Zoo for free, through our community partnership. Each year, over 400 adults and kids come to spend time with animals in nature. The zoo is a place of healing for over 250,000 people each year, including whānau from RMHC NZ.

Get ready for an unforgettable evening that makes a real impact! With only 150 tickets available, make sure you seize the day and secure yours!

We can’t wait to see you there!

events.id: Soirée at the Zoo - A Night for our Whānau and Animals-200 Daniell Street, Newtown, Wellington 6021, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: Soirée at the Zoo - A Night for our Whānau and Animals
events.venue: 200 Daniell Street, Newtown, Wellington 6021, New Zealand
events.long_description:
An evening of connection & purpose 
Te Nukuao Wellington Zoo and Ronald McDonald House Charities® (RMHC®) New Zealand invite you to an exclusive fundraising event — Soirée at the Zoo: A Night for our Whānau and Animals. 
Join us for a refined evening of celebration and generosity, where compassion for people and care for wildlife come together in a truly unique setting. 
Guests will experience the Zoo after hours, enjoy elegant hospitality, and take part in an inspiring night of entertainment and giving — all in support of Wellington families and animals. 
Thursday 19 March 2026 
6.30pm – 11.00pm 
Te Nukuao Wellington Zoo, 200 Daniell Street, Newtown, Wellington 
 What to expect 
A rare opportunity to explore the Zoo after hours! Join an exclusive Zoo tour and discover the Zoo from a whole new perspective. 
A complimentary welcome drink and delicious canapés throughout the evening 
An engaging live auction and raffle with exceptional prizes 
An entertaining MC, live local music and a chance to dance the night away 
Opportunities to connect with friends, colleagues, and familiar Wellington faces 
The moving story of a local RMHC® NZ whānau 
An insight into Te Nukuao Wellington Zoo’s vital conservation mahi in Aotearoa and around the world
Ticket options 
Soirée Admission ($165) 
Secure entry to the Soiree, a welcome drink on arrival, and canapés throughout the evening. Plus, every visitor will enjoy an exclusive after-hours Zoo tour! 
Soirée Giraffe View Bar Leaner ($1,000) 
For an elevated event option, the Giraffe View Bar Leaner option includes entry for four people at a reserved seated bar leaner, a welcome drink on arrival, and canapés throughout the evening – plus the exclusive after-hours Zoo tour!
Soirée Lions Lounge ($3,500) 
For the most premium experience of the night, opt for the Lions Lounge package, featuring tickets for six people in an exclusive seated couch area, an antipasto platter and a bottle of wine at your table when you arrive, and delicious canapés throughout the evening. Plus, skip the queues at the bar and enjoy dedicated table service all night long! And of course, you’ll get the opportunity to explore Te Nukuao Wellington Zoo after hours on a tour. 
Where the proceeds will go  
This fundraising event will make a tangible difference to Wellington families and animals. All proceeds from Soirée at the Zoo will be shared equally between Ronald McDonald House Charities® New Zealand and Te Nukuao Wellington Zoo. 
Every day, RMHC® NZ provides a home-away-from-home for more than 100 families, offering comfort, care, and stability during difficult times. Your attendance — and your generosity on the night — will directly support families with essential accommodation and meals. 
Through our community partnership, Te Nukuao Wellington Zoo welcomes RMHC® NZ families to the Zoo at no cost. Each year, over 400 adults and tamariki visit the Zoo to reconnect with nature and the restorative power of wildlife, joining the 250,000 people annually who experience the Zoo as a place of wellbeing and inspiration. 
Secure your ticket now 
With only 150 seats available, this will be an unforgettable evening of purpose and celebration. 
Secure your place today and be part of a night that supports whānau, wildlife, and the community that connects us all. 
Invoicing options are also available; please email venues@wellingtonzoo.com for more information.
Please note: Event data will be shared with both RMHC® NZ and Te Nukuao Wellington Zoo.

events.id: NMHNZ CONFERENCE '26-147 The Terrace, Wellington Central, Wellington 6011-All Events In
events.name: NMHNZ CONFERENCE '26
events.venue: 147 The Terrace, Wellington Central, Wellington 6011
events.long_description:
NMHNZ CONFERENCE '26
Catalysts for Change : Naturopathy as Primary Care
Transforming lives and Redefining community healthcare
NMHNZ is proud to be at the forefront of Naturopathy as the leading Professional Organisation for Naturopaths and Medical Herbalists in Aotearoa New Zealand. This year our focus is on HOW we can position Naturopaths and Medical Herbalists at the forefront of health care in Aotearoa New Zealand, and beyond.
Our "Catalysts for Change" themed conference is all about putting our profession front and centre.We delved into our rich international heritage and explored the connections between the two, in 2024. We discussed how at the heart of Naturopathic and Herbal Medicine lies a profound respect for the wisdom of the past with a commitment to researching the benefits for our lives today.
2026 sees us looking outside the box at HOW we can be more active and visible.Our next step is to learn about integrating this knowledge and connection into primary health care.
Preventative health is at the forefront of everything we do, along with lifestyle, nutrition, and science. We want to redefine Community Healthcare using Naturopathic principles, Science & Research, and of course Nature.
This event will inspire and motivate you to get out & be a Catalyst for Change in your community.Our International speakers are renowned for delivering relevant and useable content, enabling our delegates to make use of every piece of information gathered.
Over two very full days, we will welcome speakers from around the globe. Along with delegates from Naturopathy, Herbal Medicine, and other Allied Health communities.

events.id: The Datsuns-San Fran, Wellington-Ticket Master
events.name: The Datsuns
events.venue: San Fran, Wellington
events.long_description:
Time has rolled on, and so has the clan DATSUN. After years of wrangling riffs across distant lands, marinating in sonic experiments, and rebuilding the clan’s percussive backbone, they return to their homeland with fire in their strings, fury in their rhythms, and rock & roll coursing through every vein.
 This tour marks the clan’s first full assault across Aotearoa since 2018, kicks off in March 2026, promising joyous savagery, riffs honed to perfection, and the raw energy that only The DATSUNS can deliver. The tour sees the clan’s Scandinavian drummer Adam Lindmark (Dead Lord) taking up the thundering seat, joining lead string wrangler Christian, Phil on the rhythmic weavings, and Dolf conjuring hooks across hemispheres, bringing a lifetime of Datsun lessons to the stage.
 Audiences can expect the full sweep of The Datsuns’ catalogue, from the anthems that scorched their early path to the first sparks of their eighth studio album, set to arrive in 2026. The first taste, ‘Ugly Leather’ – accompanied by a blistering video, old fire, new fuel, same unrelenting inferno.

events.id: Central & Districts Field Days Flyer-Plimmerton Railway Station,Plimmerton, New Zealand, Porirua-All Events In
events.name: Central & Districts Field Days Flyer
events.venue: Plimmerton Railway Station,Plimmerton, New Zealand, Porirua
events.long_description:
Central & Districts Field Days Flyer
Departing Plimmerton and traveling by heritage steam train to the Central Districts Field Days, enjoy a relaxed, hassle-free day out. This special Mainline Steam excursion takes you direct to Feilding, with shuttle transfers to Manfeild Park included in your ticket.

Travel in comfort behind a heritage steam locomotive in our beautifully restored carriages featuring large viewing windows, air-conditioning, comfortable seating, onboard café, and toilets. For fresh-air lovers and photographers, our observation carriage provides open-air viewing of the scenic journey.

Arrival into Feilding is approximately 10:45am, with departure back south at 4:15pm, giving you a full day at Field Days.

🚐 Shuttle Transfers Included
Shuttle buses operate between Feilding Railway Station and Manfeild Park, timed to connect with our train arrival and departure. Shuttle transfers are included with your excursion ticket.

🕒 Indicative Timetable

Outbound
Plimmerton – 07:20
Paraparaumu – 07:55
Ōtaki – 08:45
Levin – 09:35
Shannon – 09:50
Palmerston North – 10:15
Feilding – 10:45

Return
Feilding – 16:15
Palmerston North – 16:55
Shannon – 17:15
Levin – 17:25
Ōtaki – 17:50
Paraparaumu – 18:15
Plimmerton – 18:40

ℹ️ Please note: large Field Days purchases cannot be loaded onto the train

📸 A Great Day Out
Make the journey part of the experience and travel to Field Days in comfort by steam train. Relax, enjoy the scenery, and arrive ready to explore one of the country’s biggest agricultural events.

events.id: Mangaroa Farms Open Day 2025-98 Whitemans Valley Road,133 Whitemans Valley Rd, Whitemans Valley, Upper Hutt 5371, New Zealand, Upper Hutt-All Events In
events.name: Mangaroa Farms Open Day 2025
events.venue: 98 Whitemans Valley Road,133 Whitemans Valley Rd, Whitemans Valley, Upper Hutt 5371, New Zealand, Upper Hutt
events.long_description:
Mangaroa Farms Open Day 2025
Join us on Saturday 21st March from 10am–3pm for our Harvest Festival - a special launch event in partnership with Upper Hutt Food Week.

It’ll be a little different from our usual Open Days: more stalls, more food, and more of our community involved. Expect fresh local produce, regenerative farm tours, kai tastings, nature play for tamariki, a Pumpkin Competition, and more.

🎟️ Tickets are FREE - Please register at https://store.mangaroa.org/products/mangaroa-farms-harvest-festival-sat-21st-march-2026-10am-3pm


HARVEST FESTIVAL ACTIVITIES INCLUDE:
- Local Mangaroa Lunch / BBQ
- Live music & good vibes with Carlos Riegel & Casual Healing
- Garden tours (Very Limited Spaces — Sign Up Now)
- Permaculture Orchard Tours
- Kids Zone with face paint & craft activities
- Local vendors & marketplace
- Coffee cart
- Sheep dog demos
- Sheep shearing
- Farm Trail Loop


ABOUT FOOD WEEK

Upper Hutt Food Week is coming to life for the first time, 21st–29th March 2026 - a celebration of local food, culture, and community. Think of it like the Upper Hutt Arts Trail, but with kai.

All across the region, organisations, cafés, foodbanks, schools, community groups and marae will be putting on a rich spread of workshops, shared meals, foraging walks and events. We’re proud to be kicking it all off at Mangaroa Farms.

It’s a moment to mark the changing of the seasons, celebrate the harvest, and deepen our connection to kai grown here in Upper Hutt. Whether you’re a grower, a cook, a food lover or just curious, this is your chance to meet others who care about where our food comes from and where it could go next.

Then from 22nd–29th March, Mangaroa will continue to host a range of food-focused workshops and experiences across the week - with some wonderful guest facilitators. Details to come.

Come be part of this growing movement toward local food resilience, shared learning and community connection. Nau mai, haere mai. Let’s get amongst it.

📍 Hosted at the Mangaroa Farm Shop / Kete Kai 98 Whitemans Valley Road

Watch this video from our 2024 Open Day: https://vimeo.com/1014588536


GARDEN TOUR TIMES (book a $20 ticket at the link above)
- Garden Tour 1: 10AM - 10:45AM
- Garden Tour 2: 11AM - 11:45AM
- Garden Tour 3: 1PM - 1:45PM
- Garden Tour 4: 2PM - 2:45PM


PERMACULTURE ORCHARD TOUR TIMES
- Permaculture Orchard Tour 1: 11AM - 11:45AM
- Permaculture Orchard Tour 2: 1PM - 1:45PM

TICKETS
- General Admission - FREE (no garden tour included)
- Garden Tour - $20 for a timeslot of your choice. Limited spots available! Kids are free with adults

We look forward to sharing the Mangaroa Farms gardens, kai, community & trails with you. Please get in touch with if you would like to be involved.

Four international DJs are heading to Wellington to serve up some serious dance music to local fans. Delta Heavy Presents APEX promises to be a unique drum & bass adventure. Shed 6 on Wellington’s waterfront will resound to the talented English drum & bass production duo Ben Hall and Simon James. Together, they are Delta Heavy and found fame with their 2012 single Get By. 
Joining them are DJs T & Sugah and Krakota. Along with an impressive production team, they’ll transform Shed 6 into an otherworldly experience. Expect a kaleidoscope of colours, lighting effects, and projections to dance to.

events.id: EC-MENz Summit 2026-189 Ohariu Valley Road, Ohariu, Wellington 6037, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: EC-MENz Summit 2026
events.venue: 189 Ohariu Valley Road, Ohariu, Wellington 6037, New Zealand
events.long_description:
EC-MENz vision is for men fully participating at all levels of Early Childhood Education to represent the diversity of our society in Aotearoa.
The EC-MENz Summit 2026 is kindly being hosted and supported by Childspace.

Tāne, wāhine, and irawhiti are warmly invited to participate in a special day of high quality, affordable professional learning. This celebration of gender diversity in ECE will be held in a safe and supportive environment and is a fantastic opportunity to meet others in the profession, share your own story, and be inspired.
Gender Steretoypes in ECE - Mike Collin and Max Christie
What can gender stereotypes teach us about teaching and learning?
Early childhood education relies on diversity within teaching teams. Yet, gender stereotypes often shape how we see ourselves and each other as kaiako. This interactive session invites educators to explore the hidden assumptions that influence teaching roles and team dynamics. In this session, Max and Mike will unpack how stereotypes impact collaboration and how every kaiako adds unique value to teaching teams. Participants will leave with practical strategies to challenge bias, strengthen team culture, and celebrate the richness of varied approaches in ECE settings.
Mike Collin (B. Ed)
Being a new grad, Mike harnesses a fresh perspective underpinned by recent research and hands on learning. Mike is currently a kaiako within Heretaunga Kindergarten Association, nurturing the lives of our future generations to come.
Mike changed career paths having found his passion for teaching young tamariki. He believes in kaiako being the best versions of themselves to enhance positive and
meaningful learning environments for tamariki, advocating for the professionalism which early childhood kaiako achieve everyday. Mike strives for excellence in his approach to teaching and learning, seeking out the best outcomes for tamariki.
Max Christie (M. Ed)
Max brings over a decade of experience in early childhood education, blending academic expertise with hands-on leadership. Max currently lectures at EIT Te Aho a Māui, where he inspires future educators through a commitment to quality ECE for tamariki and whānau.
He began his teaching journey at Childspace Northland, where he also gained leadership experience and has facilitated PLD internationally and across Aotearoa. Max is deeply passionate about nature-based education, play, te ao Māori, leadership, innovative and affirming the mana of tamariki and kaiako.
Autism NZ - Thecla Moffat
Men can change the dynamics of play in ECE benefiting autistic tamariki
Male kaiako often bring more energy in the ECE setting with an emphasis on more physical activity, outdoor play, "rough and tumble" play, and positive risk-taking, which appeals to both boys and girls and provides a different dimension to play than may be beneficial to most autistic tamariki. We now know that through fun and engaging interactions kaiako help enhance the autistic tamariki pivotal capacities for later learning. In this talk kaiako will get to know how men in ECE with their positive energy can make a difference through play for autistic tamariki in their centres. The kaiako will be given a few strategies of how to do that and some ideas to encourage tuakana-teina (peer play) between autistic tamariki and their non-autistic peers will be shared.
Thecla Moffat (Early Intervention Manager, Autism New Zealand) is an educator who has been in the teaching field for over three decades. Thecla is passionate about inclusion and advocate for children’s rights and needs to be met in their educational settings.
Thecla has experience teaching from early childhood to primary school. She joined the tertiary sector in educating New Zealand’s teachers between January 2013 and October 2015 working as a lecturer at New Zealand Tertiary College. In her first year at New Zealand Tertiary College, she wrote the course guide for Inclusive Education Level 7. In October 2015 she joined the New Zealand Ministry of Education as an Early Intervention Specialist. In August 2019 Thecla joined Autism New Zealand to start their new early intervention services. She has a huge interest in inclusive education for children with diverse needs and promoting emotional and social competencies in the early years with special interest in autistic children. She has done research in inclusive early childhood education and promoting children’s social competencies. She sits on the Teaching Council Inclusive Education Advisory Group and currently sits on the academic programme board for New Zealand Tertiary College among other roles. She is a parent to three amazing children one of whom is neurodiverse. theclamoffat@xtra.co.nz OR thecla.moffat@autismnz.org.nz
Self-regulation & positive behaviour strategies - Robert Jensen & Nikki Wilson
ENGAGE is an evidence-based approach that supports the development of children’s self-regulation skills through intentional play. ENGAGE was developed by Professor Dione Healey (University of Otago) and has been widely researched in Aotearoa.
In collaboration with Methodist Mission Southern (MMS) and funding from the Ministry of Education, the programme is now being delivered across Aotearoa to equip tamariki with self-regulation skills to support successful navigation through school and beyond.
Robert & Nikki are ENGAGE facilitators for the Te Whanganui-a-Tara region.
Play is good for you! - Robin Christie
The reciprocal nature of learning between child and adult relies on a shared language - the language of play. This universal language is unspoken, and is strongest in the presence of curious, wondrous, joyous educators. You are already fluent in this language, and the amazing diversity of playful approaches you bring to your ECE setting is a huge strength of our profession! This entertaining and thought- provoking session will reinforce the importance of playful adults in children's learning, examine the research around the role of humour in human development, and share practical tips for staying playful every day.
Robin Christie is an early childhood teacher, playscape designer, and the co-founder of Childspace Early Learning Centres in Te Whanganui-a-Tara, Wellington, Aotearoa/ New Zealand. He is passionate about creativity in the early years, developing empowering learning environments, and getting more good men into ECE. You can get hold of him anytime on robin@childspace.nz .
events.description:
Early childhood education relies on diversity within teaching teams.
In this session, Max and Mike will unpack how stereotypes impact collaboration and how every kaiako adds unique value to teaching teams.
In this talk kaiako will get to know how men in ECE with their positive energy can make a difference through play for autistic tamariki in their centres.
Thecla has experience teaching from early childhood to primary school.
You are already fluent in this language, and the amazing diversity of playful approaches you bring to your ECE setting is a huge strength of our profession!

events.id: Matt Maltese | Meow Nui, Wellington-92 Vivian St, Te Aro, Wellington 6011-All Events In
events.name: Matt Maltese | Meow Nui, Wellington
events.venue: 92 Vivian St, Te Aro, Wellington 6011
events.long_description:
Matt Maltese | Meow Nui, Wellington
⏰ Pre-sale starts Thur 30 Oct at 11am (local)
⏰ General tickets go on sale Fri 31 Oct at 11am (local)
⚡️ Sign up for pre-sale access
PRE-SALE: https://bit.ly/MM26_ps_DNU

Handsome Tours are proud to present Matt Maltese on his highly anticipated return to Australia + New Zealand this March!
The tour follows the release of his sixth studio album Hers – his most insular and intimate record yet, and his first fully self-produced effort since his acclaimed 2019 LP Krystal.
Existing in a twilight world, Hers pairs heartfelt songwriting and dry witticism with the gentle quiver of strings, a flourish of woodwind and the sound of a creaking old piano. It captures Maltese at his most personal, trading irony for honesty and humour for vulnerability.

Much like kindred spirits Randy Newman and Father John Misty, beneath Maltese’s sumptuous melodies and classic pop craftsmanship there’s always a lyric that stops you in your tracks – sometimes breaking your heart, sometimes making you laugh. Across the album’s eleven tracks, Maltese’s trademark wit is still present but wielded with restraint, often emerging through self-deprecation and quiet revelation.

Having first established himself in 2018 with his debut Bad Contestant, Maltese has since evolved into one of the UK’s finest young songwriters. The albums that followed cemented his reputation for transforming the mundane into something dream-like, his piano harmonies, playful lyricism and quintessentially British wit resonating around the world.

In late 2024, Maltese embarked on a headline tour across Asia, Australia and New Zealand, following sold-out runs through the US, Europe and the UK – including his biggest performances to date at The Wiltern in Los Angeles and London’s Electric Brixton. With Hers, he now steps into an even bigger chapter: playing to larger rooms than ever before and connecting with an audience that continues to grow from Sydney to São Paulo, Jakarta to Tokyo.

Audiences can expect an enchanting live experience that blends Maltese’s new material with an favourites spanning his six-album catalogue – poetic, wry, and unashamedly human.
events.description:
Matt Maltese | Meow Nui, Wellington ⏰ Pre-sale starts Thur 30 Oct at 11am (local) ⏰ General tickets go on sale Fri 31 Oct at 11am (local) ⚡️ Sign up for pre-sale access PRE-SALE: https://bit.ly/MM26_ps_DNU Handsome Tours are proud to present Matt Maltese on his highly anticipated return to Australia + New Zealand this March!
The tour follows the release of his sixth studio album Hers – his most insular and intimate record yet, and his first fully self-produced effort since his acclaimed 2019 LP Krystal.
Existing in a twilight world, Hers pairs heartfelt songwriting and dry witticism with the gentle quiver of strings, a flourish of woodwind and the sound of a creaking old piano.
It captures Maltese at his most personal, trading irony for honesty and humour for vulnerability.
Much like kindred spirits Randy Newman and Father John Misty, beneath Maltese’s sumptuous melodies and classic pop craftsmanship there’s always a lyric that stops you in your tracks – sometimes breaking your heart, sometimes making you laugh.

events.id: Field Trip Presents - Paws & Pours (Wellington)-Herd Street, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: Field Trip Presents - Paws & Pours (Wellington)
events.venue: Herd Street, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
We’re turning the park into one giant, dog‑friendly, Field Trip playground.
Paws & Pours is a DJ‑led, social day out where dogs, their humans (and humans that just like dogs) come together for music, beers and sunshine. It's Giant Picnic vibes, but with paws on the grass.
Expect DJs with live sax, styled chill zones, food trucks, dog bakery, cocktails, beers AND games for you and your doggo.
Professional dog trainers and handlers will be on site throughout the day to monitor behaviour and support dog safety. The event is designed to accommodate a range of dog temperaments, with space to move, pause or opt out as needed.
Add in a pet photographer, groomer, pop‑up bars, lawn games and a best‑dressed dog costume competition, and you’ve got a seriously good day out.
This is Field Trip, just a little cuter.
What’s Included
DJs and live music throughout the day
Pop‑up bars with cocktails, wine, beer and non‑alcoholic options
Styled picnic lounges, umbrellas and chill zones
Dog enrichment toys and play areas
Dog treat stations
On‑site dog trainers supporting safety and behaviour
Pet photographer pop‑up
Dog groomer pop‑up
Best‑dressed dog costume competition
Plenty of space to relax, roam and socialise
Dog Safety & Welfare Policy
Dog safety and responsible ownership are taken seriously at this event. Use your common sense. If your dog is not social, comfortable in busy environments, or around other dogs and people, this event will not be suitable.
Dogs must be friendly, social and comfortable around other dogs and people
Owners are responsible for their dog’s behaviour at all times, all dogs must remain under owner control
All dogs must be fully vaccinated
Dogs over 8 months of age must be spayed or neutered
Leads are required on arrival and departure, with designated off‑lead play zones where appropriate
Professional dog trainers and handlers will be present throughout the event to monitor behaviour and step in where required
Dogs showing signs of distress, aggression or overstimulation may be asked to take a break or leave the event
Failure to follow guidance from trainers or event staff may result in removal from the event.
FAQs
Do dogs need to be on a lead?
Yes. All dogs must be on lead at all times, except in clearly designated off-lead areas.
Will there be water and shade for dogs?
But of course. There will be water stations and shaded chill zones available throughout the site.
Are puppies allowed?
Puppies are welcome if fully vaccinated and comfortable in social settings. All dogs over 8 months must be spayed or neutered.
Can children attend?
Children are welcome if accompanied by a parent or legal guardian. They don't need a ticket. Please make sure they know not to pet dogs that aren't theirs without permission

events.venue: Paraparaumu Memorial Hall
events.long_description:
EQUINOX SONG AND SOUND CEREMONY
Come and Sing, Sound and Meditate!

Want to mark the important time of the Autumn Equinox!!

Come and join with us on Sunday the 22nd March for a group ceremonial gathering in Paraparaumu.

We will explore sacred conscious sounding practices to balance and align the energy system, sing healing chants and songs from different traditions, and explore guided vocal improvisation for freedom, upliftment and joy!

There will be guided journal prompts around the energy of the Solstice and the whole session will finish with a full sound healing.

Everyone is welcome and there is no need for any particular preparation or pre existing skill.

Please get in touch with any questions or to book. Come and enjoy Song, Chant, Sound and Healing!!

So looking forward to gathering for the Full Moon, and the preparation for the Equinox. Come and join with us to invoke and celebrate the energies of balance, creation, abundance and celebration at this profound time of year.

This session will explore singing, chanting, sounding and conscious voice empowerment practices. We will also explore energy practices like Qigong and meditation. All within a ceremonial framework.

Everyone is welcome. Limited spaces. Get in touch soon

You are warmly invited to book to join this powerful sound and voice ceremony which will work with Spirit, the forces of Nature and Bryony's skill and expertise in creating sound for growth and transformation.

This is a special opportunity to tune into the sacred energies and potentialities of this time: opening us up to balance, healing, nourishment, new growth and positive change.

Bryony will invoke and work with the healing power of the supportive energies of Spirit, ancestors and our highest Selves. Bryony's has an extensive background experience with Spirit, the Earth forces and sacred lands; these forces are central to her practice and Self.

She will lead you firstly in a process of meditation, conscious sounding, toning and singing healing chants.

This use of our voices to co-create a sacred group sound is uplifting and transformative and will support you in your process of healing, releasing and visioning.

There will be time for guided journaling and intention setting.

The second section of the workshop will be a focused and dedicated sound bath which will bring balance and deep relaxation, into a sense of stillness and peace. There can be a sense of gratitude and appreciation.

Both the conscious use of the voice and the sound healing have many benefits, which are verified by science and which can effect us positively on the physical, mental, emotional, energetic and spiritual levels. A document which has more information about these benefits can be provided on request.

All are welcome:
I look forward to sharing with you and supporting you in this ceremony.

Investment for full 2.5 hours

$77 - full price - https://buy.stripe.com/bIY9Ep67A00xdwYcND

$59 - concession - https://buy.stripe.com/8wMaItcvY6oV0Kc7ti

Please contact me if finances are a challenge for you and we can make it work for you to join.

events.long_description:
Come and join us for our 7th annual Newtown Community Meal, hosted at Newtown School, a celebration of the incredible diversity, creativity, and collaboration that makes our suburb so special.
This is a shared meal that truly reflects Newtown, featuring food that has been grown, sourced, foraged, and prepared right here in our community. Together we’ll enjoy an abundance of amazing kai, including homemade dumplings, locally foraged preserves, and bountiful salads made from locally grown produce.
This event is about celebrating the very best of our suburb, our people, our cultures, and the food that brings us together. Everyone is welcome, so please bring your whānau, friends, and neighbours.
Doors will open at 3pm with music, snacks and time to connect with your neighbours. The main meal will be served at 4.30pm
As always, this is a koha-based event. You’re invited to contribute what you can, but most importantly, we’d love to see you there and share a meal together.
We can’t wait to celebrate Newtown with you.

events.id: Courageous Communication™ | 1-day Workshop | Wellington | 24 March 2026-Rangimarie Room — Museum of New Zealand Te Papa Tongarewa,55 Cable Street, Wellington, New Zealand-All Events In
events.name: Courageous Communication™ | 1-day Workshop | Wellington | 24 March 2026
events.venue: Rangimarie Room — Museum of New Zealand Te Papa Tongarewa,55 Cable Street, Wellington, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Courageous Communication™ | 1-day Workshop | Wellington | 24 March 2026
Get great at having hard conversations with Kaila Colbin

About this Event

Has this ever happened to you?
You’re sitting in a meeting and there are 50 elephants in the room with you that nobody is mentioning, and you’re doing the strategic plan but everyone knows it’s never going to work because the team don’t have the capability or the capacity and that one person never follows through and that other person thinks her work is better than it is, but nobody says anything and as you leave you think well THAT'S three hours I’m never gonna get back…
It’s hard to say the hard thing.
But saying the hard thing is the only way we can deal with what’s actually going on.
The number one indicator of a lack of courage is an inability to have hard conversations.
Hard conversations are scary. Our hearts start pounding, our tummies clench, our mouths go dry.
Hard conversations feel dangerous. If I say this thing, he’ll be offended! She’ll be angry! I’ll get in trouble!
Hard conversations are tempting to avoid. Nobody else is mentioning these elephants. Why should I?
But what if you were great at them?
What would it mean for your relationships?
What would it mean for your career?
What would it mean for your life?
Kaila Colbin has worked with more than 4,000 people to grow courage as a core competency and a clear framework has emerged from that experience.
In this 1-day workshop, you’ll build the skill and muscle to get great at having hard conversations.
We’ll cover the specific elements of how to communicate and what to communicate.

When: Tuesday, 24 March 2026, 9 am-4:30 pm
Where: Rangimarie Room, Te Papa Museum, 55 Cable Street, Wellington 6011
Lunch, afternoon tea and all-day tea and coffee are included in the registration.



Need help with the cost?
If you are an Educator or at a Not-for-Profit, you can automatically access a special rate of $595 + GST when you register (a $150 discount off our standard General Admission rates).



Our Health and Safety Plan
Boma is committed to delivering safe events. We follow best practices suggested by the New Zealand health authorities and work closely with our suppliers to prioritise health and wellbeing.
Our comprehensive health and safety plans ensure you can book with certainty and attend with confidence.



Our refund policy
For details on event refunds and transfers, please see our refund policy.


About the Kaila Colbin
Kaila Colbin is founder and CEO of Boma, an organisation building a world of intentional, intelligent, courageous leaders.
An award-winning leader renowned for impact, Kaila developed TEDxChristchurch into New Zealand’s flagship TEDx event and brought Singularity University to New Zealand and Australia, supporting thousands of people to engage with exponentially accelerating technologies and their impact on humanity. She trained with Dr Brené Brown as a Certified Dare to Lead™ Facilitator.
As a founder of the non-profit Ministry of Awesome, Kaila played a critical role in developing Christchurch’s startup ecosystem. She has extensive governance experience, and has been involved with mergers, capital raises, and company sales in the US and NZ.
A native New Yorker, Kaila’s work to champion Aotearoa New Zealand on a global stage saw her given the 2022 Kea World Class New Zealand “Friend of New Zealand” award. Her purpose in life is to be an uplifting presence.

If you have any questions about this event, please email us at .

The number one indicator of a lack of courage is an inability to have hard conversations.
She’ll be angry!

events.long_description:
Palmerston North | Food Lovers Masterclass
Are you finding that you're constantly throwing away un eaten food? It's time to level up with our Food Lovers Masterclass! You'll learn how to store food like a boss, decode those pesky best before dates, use up leftovers, and save enough to buy a yacht (okay, maybe just a canoe).

This is a fun but informative session and you will leave inspired with a cool goodie bag full of samples to get you started.

Ticket price - $10, get a goodie bag worth $40

events.long_description:
Dare to Dream Jr. - Presented by Chilton Saint James School
Dare to Dream Jr. is a dazzling musical revue, featuring songs and scenes from some of your favourite Disney musicals!

About this Event

Celebrate a century of Disney magic with Dare to Dream JR., a vibrant musical revue bursting with colour, heart, and show‑stopping songs. Follow a group of young dreamers as they discover courage, friendship, and the power of imagination - because when you dare to dream, anything is possible.
Brought to life by Chilton Saint James School’s talented Middle and Senior School students, this high‑energy production features beloved numbers reimagined for the stage, toe‑tapping choreography, and plenty of feel‑good moments for the whole whānau.
Performances:
Tuesday 24 March at 1.00 PM
Tuesday 24 March and Wednesday 25 March at 6.30 PM
Tickets:
Adult and concession tickets available
Accessibility access is available

Orchestrations by Patrick Sulken

events.id: The Effective Speaker, Wellington 25th & 26th March 2026-Level 28/100 Willis Street, Wellington Central, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: The Effective Speaker, Wellington 25th & 26th March 2026
events.venue: Level 28/100 Willis Street, Wellington Central, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
1 or 2 Day Presentation Skills Workshop
Limited tickets available. Get in now so you don't miss out!
When effective presenters speak, they do more than inform - they influence, persuade, and inspire. That isn’t magic; it’s method. With the right tools, anyone can build genuine connection and move a room.
This workshop is for leaders, emerging leaders, technical specialists, and professionals who want practical tools and techniques for speaking in both formal and informal settings.
Short on time? Attend 1 Day (Foundations) for all the core skills. Ready for a bigger shift? Choose 2 Days (Advanced) for one on one coaching and deeper transformation. Pick what’s right for you.
You’ll leave with the tools to present more clearly, confidently, and with the influence your role demands. This is not just for the stage. You will use these skills everyday.
The workshop format
Small group format for maximum practice and feedback (no massive groups).
Learning is adapted and personalised for maximum value (no cookie-cutter approach).
Hands on, practical learning, with easy to apply tools and techniques (no sitting around listening to theory).
The Effective Speaker - One Day Workshop (Foundations):
Wednesday 25th March
A hands-on day where you’ll learn our step-by-step SpeakerMap™ system to plan valuable presentations quickly and with ease.
You’ll learn the principles behind useful visuals, how to manage nerves, and three delivery techniques you can use immediately.
Foundations is best for technical experts who know their stuff but struggle to get it across, and nervous presenters who want a safe, practical reset.
What you’ll learn
Plan engaging content (fast)
Use the SpeakerMap™ to develop a clear Key Message and structure that keeps audiences attentive without overload.
Plan faster, make better decisions about what to include (and what to ditch).
 Design useful slides (not wallpaper)
A simple but revolutionary way to design slides that support — not sabotage — your message.
Practical guidance on using AI to fast-track draft slides and create supporting documents.
How to use PowerPoint to keep you on track without putting your audience to sleep.
 Keep nerves under control
A proven psychological approach to calm the mental chatter that causes waffling, speed talking, and blank moments.
Build a personal plan to shift focus from “me” to the audience and the outcome you want.
 Deliver in a natural, engaging way
Three delivery techniques that help you look credible, be engaging and feel confident.
How to vary pace and emphasis so your key points actually land.
How to cut the filler - the “ums” and “ahs” - and keep your flow.
 Plenty of practice
You’ll practise each technique in pairs or threes — supportive, safe, and highly practical.
Includes
A full day of training
All food and drinks during the workshop
The Effective Speaker workbook
30minute one on one follow up session
Investment: $1,200 + GST (Early Bird Pricing $995+GST)
The Effective Speaker - Two Day Workshop (Advanced)
Wednesday 25th March & Thursday 26th March
Gain all the skills from Day One - and then take them further. If presenting is central to your career growth, this is the coaching workshop you need.
Over two full days, you’ll create a significant shift in your communication skills.
Day One gives you the foundations to make presenting easier and more effective.
Day Two consolidates and extends these skills. You’ll go deeper into content planning, adapt the tools to your real work presentations, and get personalised coaching to develop your own authentic style.
You’ll also learn strategies for handling even the toughest audiences. The workshop is practical, hands-on, and focused on learning by doing - presenting, receiving coaching, and observing your peers.
If you’re ready for lasting, transformative change in your communication skills, the two-day option is the best choice.
What you’ll learn
Everything from Day 1 (Foundations) PLUS
Go deeper with planning
Apply the SpeakerMap to plan an actual presentation that you can give. 
Dive deeper into crafting valuable messages that you can use in the future. 
Rehearse in a way that actually works
A practical way to prepare when time is tight — so you own your words.
Shift from competent to compelling
One-on-one coaching targeted to your specific needs.
Video feedback plus our inside-out coaching methodology to reconnect you with the techniques you use naturally in conversation.
How to use silence, pace, notes, and the remote without looking stiff or artificial.
How to speak with energy and authenticity, not speed and panic.
Eliminate “ums” and “ahs”, look confident (even when you’re not), and create a sense of commitment that audiences feel.
An understanding of your personal communication strengths and the areas you need to focus on for growth.

Handle audiences like a pro
Strategies for side chats, interruptions, distractions, disagreement, and the odd angry voice - while staying calm and in control.

Includes
Everything in Day 1, plus:
A second full day of training
All food and drinks during the workshop
Videos of your presenting and coaching sessions
The Effective Speaker workbook
60minute one on one follow up session
Investment: $2,500 + GST (Early Bird Pricing $2.200+GST)
What past participants say:

"The overall experience of the course far surpassed my expectations. I came in hoping to gain some valuable insights and tips for better public speaking, but what I received was so much more. I developed a newfound confidence in my ability to communicate effectively, learned how to captivate an audience, and discovered strategies for managing nerves and overcoming stage fright. I would recommend this effective speaking course to anyone looking to enhance their communication abilities. It's not just another course; it's a transformative experience that will empower you to become a more confident and persuasive speaker" Alex Goryachev, New Zealand Green Building Council

“This course not only met my expectations, but it completely exceeded them. This has been one of the most transformative courses I’ve attended. Jane totally revolutionised the way I now approach presentations. Having felt fear in the past each time I have to present to large groups, for the first time I now feel like I have the tools, understanding and ability to approach presentations and conquer my fear. I can’t thank Jane enough.” Nadia Marsh, Head of Bids, Tonkin & Taylor
"I have never been in such a well-run course (I've done a lot) Jane was amazing she held our attention from start to finish each day. I feel we all learnt so much and I will definitely be taking her advice on how I can improve myself. This course was well above what I expected, Jane had a great way of communicating. Typically, people tune out or lose interest by the end of the day. This was not the case for us. I honestly thing it’s the best course I’ve been on in my 4 years with WCC." Joshua Harding, Team Leader Consents, Wellington City Council

“The course is awesome. The balance between talk time, practical learning and feedback is perfect. The trainer really made the course for me - she is sensitive and responsive to people’s needs and is genuine in her approach to give the learners as much out of the time as possible. A very polished and well-planned course.” Huia Grey, Department of Conservation
"By far the best course i have attended in any organisation, either here in NZ or abroad. The format of the course was engaging and there was a great balance between listening, engaging and participating. I look forward to using the skills used presenting at our next Team Hui!"
Matthew Townsley, Medical Council of New Zealand


"Really great course, no pressure environment with a good mix of interactive and book work. Have walked away feeling more confident in how I am going to put my presentations together."

Jessica Stokes, Emergency Management Team, New Plymouth District Council
"It was good, practical and useful tools "not rules" for business comms and pressos. Good to learn some of the other things you don't often learn in traditional presentation skills training. Really good engagement and interaction - the team were impressed we were all engaged right until the end! Easily one of the best courses I have been on in this line of work. Keep up the good work! "
Brad Stansell, Channel Account Manager, Pax 8

events.id: The Fab Four-The Opera House, Wellington, New Zealand-Wellington NZ
events.name: The Fab Four
events.venue: The Opera House, Wellington, New Zealand
events.long_description:
It’s the uncanny, note-for-note renditions of classics that have earned them fans around the world. The Fab Four has been described by the LA Times as “The greatest Beatles show in the world”. The tribute act is making its way to The Opera House in Wellington in March 2026. The four singers stand out for their remarkable authenticity and attention to detail, bringing the essence of The Beatles to life in every show. 
The Emmy award-winning Fab Four will recreate many of the songs you love, like Can’t Buy Me Love, Yesterday, A Day In The Life, Twist And Shout, Here Comes The Sun, and Hey Jude. You’ll get to explore the early days of Beatlemania through to the later, more experimental phases of the band’s career. 
Witness a performance that perfectly captures the spirit of The Beatles. Their memorable music defined the rock genre.

events.id: Unity Book Club March 2026 | Automatic Noodle-57 Willis Street, Wellington Central, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: Unity Book Club March 2026 | Automatic Noodle
events.venue: 57 Willis Street, Wellington Central, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
About the book: 
You don't have to eat food to know the way to a city's heart is through its stomach. So when a group of deactivated robots come back online in an abandoned ghost kitchen, they decide to make their own way doing what they know: making food—the tastiest hand-pulled noodles around—for the humans of San Francisco, who are recovering from a devastating war.
But when their robot-run business starts causing a stir, a targeted wave of one-star reviews threatens to boil over into a crisis. To keep their doors open, they'll have to call on their customers, their community, and each other—and find a way to survive and thrive in a world that wasn't built for them.

Melissa and Eden will be hosting our monthly book club to discuss some of the excellent recently released books.

In March we will be discussing Automatic Noodle by Annalee Newitz.

We have limited tickets available so grab a ticket sooner rather then later and tell your friends and whānau.

Drinks and snacks provided. If you have any specific allergies, let us know and send an email.

If you have any further queries send us an email to wellington@unitybooks.co.nz and address it to Melissa.

events.long_description:
The Disco-Punk band at the end of the world...
ELECTRIC SIX return for The Greatest Hits Tour
After sold out tours in both 2023 AND 2024…NOTHING CAN STOP Electric Six!!!

An ELECTRIC SIX show outrageous, irreverent, decadent, bizarre and a lot of fun!
A spectacle where rock, disco, funk, and raw absurdity collide in a neon-lit frenzy. Expect a full-throttle blitz through their Greatest Hits - Danger! High Voltage, Gay Bar, Down at McDonaldz, Dance Commander, Synthesizer, I Buy the Drugs and more!
A concert, a theatrical experience, and an art exhibit all in one!
Three decades in and they’re still the most unpredictable party in town. No overthinking, no pretension - just a raucous romp. If you’re ready to dance, shout, and get weird...this is a night that you wont forget anytime soon...
“A raucous and eclectic crowd were in the mood to party… and there wasn’t a soul in the place who left without a huge smile, such is the effect of Electric Six” (The Razors Edge)


San Fran holds a Supervised License, meaning minors are welcome to attend events at San Fran so long as they are accompanied by a legal guardian at all times whilst at the venue. Minors are of course not allowed to purchase alcohol under any circumstance.

events.name: Live Music - Ryan Edwards
events.venue: Get Fixed Bicycle Cafe & Panhead Bar,16 Parumoana St, Porirua City Centre, Porirua 5022, New Zealand, Porirua
events.long_description:
Live Music - Ryan Edwards
Ryan Edwards is a singer, guitarist and performer of the highest quality. Kiwi born and raised, he took his music overseas where he played on stages and in cafes and bars in England, France, Ireland and The United States.

Whether he’s playing his own original songs or giving his own feel to some of the best songs ever written - his warm vocals, his knack for knowing the right song to sing at any moment and his tremendous repertoire makes him a favourite with audiences of all ages.

"I was lucky to grow up in a time when music was something special. The radio stations played the latest music, but they also dipped back into the 60's and 70's, and I just soaked it all up. Many of the songs I sing are unlearned - they're just 'in there' somehow - from just listening."

events.id: Kintsugi Workshop in Wellington // The Bond Store - Distillery-The Bond Store,21 Birmingham Street, Paraparaumu, New Zealand-All Events In
events.name: Kintsugi Workshop in Wellington // The Bond Store - Distillery
events.venue: The Bond Store,21 Birmingham Street, Paraparaumu, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Kintsugi Workshop in Wellington // The Bond Store - Distillery
Re-use, Re-Purpose, Beautify with Gold!! Come along and learn the magical art of Kintsugi with Artist Ema Frost in this new Sip & Kintsugi.

About this Event

Come and experience this unique Sip & Kintsugi workshop at the lovely Bond Store Distillery. You will get a gin tasting tray on arrival with three different gins with tonic. And why not come a little earlier and grab a bite to eat beforehand. (Must be 18+ yrs of age)
Learn the magical art of Kintsugi with Artist Ema Frost in this new Workshop. You can bring along a piece of your own pottery to restore in this beautiful style. (I'll also have a few as back up if you don't have your own piece) (All Levels)
Friday 27th March - 5:30pm - 7:30pm
Kintsugi
It's called kintsugi (金継ぎ), or kintsukuroi (金繕い), literally golden (“kin”) and repair (“tsugi”). This traditional Japanese art uses a precious metal – liquid gold, liquid silver or lacquer dusted with powdered gold – to bring together the pieces of a broken pottery item and at the same time enhance the breaks.
You will take away your wonderful finished work, plus your knew skills which will enable you to further your own Kintsugi in your own time.
This class is not just for budding or accomplished artists. It is for everyone to enjoy a relaxing day of art and design with Ema.
What you will take away:
A finished artwork piece
A understanding of Kintsugi
Knowledge and History of this beautiful art form.

Where: The Bond Store, 21 Birmingham St, Paraparaumu, Kapiti Coast 5032. NEW ZEALAND
When: Friday 27th March 2025
5:30 - 7:30pm

&t=6s

events.long_description:
Ear Health Australia Conference 2026 (Wellington, NZ)
Founded by The Ear Nurses at Crystal Clear Ears in partnership with the Ear Health Education CPD Portal, Ear Health Australia (EHA) is dedicated to advancing excellence in ear health and fostering professional growth across Australasia.

Our presenters are highly respected leaders in aural health nursing and education.

Tania, General Manager at Crystal Clear Ears, brings over 20 years of experience in critical care, ENT, and clinical governance, successfully leading one of Australia’s foremost ear health groups.

Cindy, with more than 20 years in critical care and ENT education, is the principal author of the Ear Health Education CPD Portal and microsuction training program for The Ear Nurses team at Crystal Clear Ears.

We warmly welcome both current and new members to join us for this inspiring and educational event.

Please note: If the conference is unable to proceed due to insufficient numbers, a full refund (excluding the TryBooking fee) will be issued.

events.id: Peach PRC — Wandering Spirit Tour-Shed 6, Wellington, New Zealand-Wellington NZ
events.name: Peach PRC — Wandering Spirit Tour
events.venue: Shed 6, Wellington, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Peach PRC is celebrated globally for her emotionally rich, unfiltered and vulnerable songwriting. Now the Australian pop sensation is coming to Wellington with a solo show that presents her magnetic personality and irreverent sense of humour. The Wandering Spirit Tour will help cement her reputation as one of Australia’s most influential new-gen pop visionaries. Peach has cultivated a deeply engaged community by pushing pop into bold and theatrical territory. 
With over 230 million streams across her discography and over 2 billion social views, Peach has established a large presence in the music world. Her debut EP ‘Manic Dream Pixie’ debuted at #1 on the ARIA Album Charts and won Music Act of the Year at the TikTok Awards in 2023. Rolling Stone magazine says of her rise, “Peach PRC is absolutely living her best life — and she’s bringing her fans along for the ride.” Joining Peach PRC in her Wellington concert are US pop newcomer, Maude Latour and Sydney pop artist, Salty.

events.id: Paul Ego 'STICK' Solo Comedy Show - WELLINGTON-Cavern Club,18 Allen St, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand, Wellington-All Events In
events.name: Paul Ego 'STICK' Solo Comedy Show - WELLINGTON
events.venue: Cavern Club,18 Allen St, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand, Wellington
events.long_description:
Paul Ego 'STICK' Solo Comedy Show - WELLINGTON
Star of ‘7DAYS’ and the voice of ‘Stickman, PAUL EGO, is taking his solo standup show ‘STICK’ right around NZ in 2026. Be prepared for maximum laughs as Paul talks stickability, sticky situations and, of course, stick-men. It’s taken 30 years of performing comedy for Paul to get off his butt and do a solo NZ tour, so this is both very exciting and long overdue! As well as his many years as Team Captain on the TV show '7DAYS', Paul has also been part of award winning Breakfast Radio shows for both MoreFM and The Rock. However, his crowning achievement now seems to be voicing 'Stickman' for PAK’nSAVE - something he happily admits is "the best job he's ever had".

events.id: FRUIT LOOP FESTIVAL-309 Rapaura Road, Rapaura 7273, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: FRUIT LOOP FESTIVAL
events.venue: 309 Rapaura Road, Rapaura 7273, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Fruit Loop Festival
Marlborough’s freshest music festival!
About the Festival
Fruit Loop Festival is Marlborough’s juiciest new summer gig! A full-blown celebration of music and dance, kicking off under the sun and well into the night. Think open-air energy - blending Marlborough's summer magic with a full-scale music festival. An insane line-up of DJs and live performers with production to match! From the first drop to the final track, it's where the beat hits harder and the drinks taste sweeter.
Fresh, wild, fierce - Fruit Loop is the party Marlborough has been waiting for.
The Line-Up
DICK JOHNSON: The heart of NZ’s electronic scene, Dick Johnson is a true house music heavyweight. With remixes for global icons like Fatboy Slim and Claude VonStroke, plus Kiwi favourites L.A.B and Tiki Taane, he’s spent over two decades electrifying dancefloors worldwide. A relentless force behind the decks - and music director for Synthony - Dick brings the fire every time.
SIN: Co-host of George FM Drive, Sin is plugged into the pulse of the dance scene and has quickly become a revered authority on all things electronica. She’s torn up stages at Rhythm & Vines, Homegrown, Hidden Valley, and international festivals from Fiji to the UK. With supports for legends like Fatboy Slim, Groove Armada, and Netsky, Sin brings high-energy house, techno, and ravey curveballs to every set.
KITA MEAN: Kita Mean is New Zealand’s award-winning drag superstar, known for her infectious charm, razor-sharp wit, and high-camp aesthetic. With a career spanning 15+ years across stages and screens worldwide, she’s wowed audiences from Aotearoa and Australia to London, Canada, the USA, and beyond. Winner of the very first RuPaul’s Drag Race Down Under and co-owner of the iconic Caluzzi Cabaret, Kita continues to dazzle with colourful looks, flawless mug, and hilarious timing. Quirky, kooky, kitsch, and quick - Kita Mean isn’t just a queen, she’s an experience.
PETE GREEN: Originally from the UK, Pete is part of the vinyl-digging collective Rare Specimens. His love for deep, worldly electronic sounds brings low-end warmth and an infectious energy to the dancefloor. Along the way, he’s supported artists such as Crazy P, Psychemagik, Audio Jack, and Christopher Tubbs, playing festivals and parties from Creamfields and Rhythm & Alps to Tempo Schmempo. Expect a set seasoned with Italo, ambient, and deep house flavours, dusted with disco, and finished with a splash of techno.
Event Details
Date: Saturday 28 March 2026
Time: 2pm - 10pm
Location: The Fancy Cow, Marlborough
R18 event - Photo identification will be required.
Return Bus Service:
Getting to and from the festival is easy with our return bus service. Pick-up points will include Redwoodtown Woolworths, Seymour Square, and Countdown Springlands. Purchase a return bus ticket when you nab your ticket.
A full timetable and bus information will be announced closer to the event.
Parking is strictly limited at the festival. Drop off recommended.
Tickets
Tickets are limited — don’t wait. Secure yours now!
Door sales may be available.
Have your ticket open and ready to be scanned at the gate.
Kaupapa
Fruit Loop is a safe, inclusive space where everyone belongs. If you can’t celebrate diversity, respect others, and bring good vibes, this festival isn’t for you.
Harassment or discrimination of any kind will not be tolerated. Anyone behaving this way will be removed.
Refunds and Cancellations
Fruit Loop Festival is a rain or shine event. The festival will proceed regardless of weather conditions, except in circumstances where safety is compromised or conditions make it impossible for the event to continue.
No refunds will be given for changes to the programme, line-up, or advertised performers.
Stay Connected
Follow us for line-up drops, updates and key event information: @fruitloopfestival on Instagram
