events.id: Astrophotography Masterclass: Capture the Southern Sky-Star Safari Observatory, 1169 Ponatahi Road, Carterton-Event Finder
events.name: Astrophotography Masterclass: Capture the Southern Sky
events.venue: Star Safari Observatory, 1169 Ponatahi Road, Carterton
events.long_description:
Spend an evening under one of the world’s finest dark skies and learn how to photograph the Milky Way, constellations and deep-sky objects. This immersive masterclass is designed for curious explorers, hobby photographers and anyone who has ever looked up and wished they could capture what they saw.

Your instructor is an experienced astro-educator, and you’ll be taken step by step through the art and science of night-sky photography with DSLR or mirrorless cameras. You’ll learn how to focus at infinity, choose the best camera settings, build compositions under the Milky Way, and work with RAW files, noise control and exposure strategy. You’ll photograph live star fields and leave with images you can genuinely be proud of.

No astronomy expertise or prior astrophotography experience is required — just your curiosity. Bring a camera and tripod if you have them, but if not, you can still attend, learn from telescope-linked imaging feeds, and gain the skills and confidence to shoot the cosmos on your own.

Held at Star Safari, right in the Wairarapa dark-sky heartlands, this experience takes place under the same southern skies recognised by Lonely Planet as one of the world’s top stargazing destinations. If you’ve ever wanted to try astrophotography, this is the moment, and this is the place.

What you’ll gain:
- Confidence to shoot the night sky
- Proven camera settings and workflow
- Real photos of the Milky Way and southern star fields
- Knowledge you can use anywhere the southern sky is visible
- A rare, premium learning experience under a world-class sky

Perfect for couples, travellers, creatives, astronomy lovers, and anyone who wants a deeper connection to the night.

Spaces are limited to keep the experience personal.
events.description:
Spend an evening under one of the world’s finest dark skies and learn how to photograph the Milky Way, constellations and deep-sky objects.
Your instructor is an experienced astro-educator, and you’ll be taken step by step through the art and science of night-sky photography with DSLR or mirrorless cameras.
You’ll photograph live star fields and leave with images you can genuinely be proud of.
Bring a camera and tripod if you have them, but if not, you can still attend, learn from telescope-linked imaging feeds, and gain the skills and confidence to shoot the cosmos on your own.
If you’ve ever wanted to try astrophotography, this is the moment, and this is the place.

events.id: Wellington Opera — Manon-St James Theatre, Wellington, New Zealand-Wellington NZ
events.name: Wellington Opera — Manon
events.venue: St James Theatre, Wellington, New Zealand
events.long_description:
For its 2026 season, Wellington Opera brings one of the most popular and enduring French operas to life. Manon by Jules Massenet will feature Kiwi-Samoan tenor Pene Pati and Kiwi-Egyptian soprano Amina Edris. Joining this powerhouse duo is another New Zealander, baritone Phillip Rhodes will sing the role of Lescaut. Manon tells the tragic love story of Manon Lescaut and the Chevalier des Grieux. The story unfolds in five acts, exploring themes of love, desire, and the consequences of choices made in pursuit of pleasure. 
Pene Pati is widely known for his Sol3 Mio fame. He is a recent New Zealand Arts Laureate and is the first Samoan tenor to perform on the world’s top stages, including the Opéra national de Paris, Covent Garden, London and the Metropolitan Opera, New York.

The story unfolds in five acts, exploring themes of love, desire, and the consequences of choices made in pursuit of pleasure.

events.id: Alan Davies — Think Ahead Tour-Michael Fowler Centre, Wellington, New Zealand-Wellington NZ
events.name: Alan Davies — Think Ahead Tour
events.venue: Michael Fowler Centre, Wellington, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Critically acclaimed stand-up comedian, actor, writer, and TV personality Alan Davies is heading to Wellington in 2026. His new show, ‘Think Ahead’, marks his first visit to Aotearoa in a decade. Like the latest instalment of his memoirs, White Male Stand-Up, the performance covers his extensive career, and the highs and lows he’s experienced. Alan says the show is about a late middle-aged stand-up comic. He thinks he’s Marty McFly, but he’s older than Doc Brown. He spends more time in the pharmacy than the gym and is subjected to relentless eye rolls from his kids. 
Davies is a staple of British television. He’s known for his performance as the eponymous hero in the long-running TV series Jonathan Creek, and as a permanent panellist on QI. His talk show, Alan Davies: As Yet Untitled, recently reached its seventh season. He is also one of the UK’s best-loved comedians.

events.venue: 82 Terrace Road, Akatarawa Valley, Reikorangi 5391, New Zealand
events.long_description:
All ages welcome to this mid-winter Retreat Day at Ngatiawa River Monastery.
9.30am start, and stay as long as you like.
Space for stillness, karakia, and child-friendly worship.
Community fun, good food, and relaxing around the fire.
Explore the Ngatiawa bush walks and sit by the river.
Evening bonfire with marshmellows!
Cost: Koha
Your koha covers lunch and dinner, morning and afternoon tea, and support for the Ngatiawa community ... so be generous if you can.
PLUS: Option of staying Friday and/or Saturday night in the lodge - if you would like to book accommodation please email ngatiawabookings@gmail.com

events.id: Rivalry and Revenge (Austen role playing)-25 Victoria Street, Wellington Central, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: Rivalry and Revenge (Austen role playing)
events.venue: 25 Victoria Street, Wellington Central, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Play Good Society (a Jane Austen role playing game) with your Facilitator, Johnny Bowtie.
Like Wickham and Darcy, deep seated rivalry and dislike often shapes the events and emotions of Austen's work. Whether it is two suitors competing for the same quarry, or two families fighting over inheritance, this session will explore characters who seek both reconciliation and revenge.
Good Society is a game of balls, estates, sly glances, and turns about the garden—at least on the surface. Underneath this, just as in Austen's own novels, it is a game about social ambition, family obligation, and breathtaking, heart-stopping longing.
Ticket includes game play and table snacks. Drinks & further food is additional.
We aim to provide an accessible and safe environment. Discounts are available for nonwaged members, early birds, volunteers and people buying multiple tickets. Please let us know how we can ensure you're included.

events.id: Daniel Champagne LIVE at Old St Paul's | Wellington (a Family Friendly Concert)-34 Mulgrave Street, Pipitea, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: Daniel Champagne LIVE at Old St Paul's | Wellington (a Family Friendly Concert)
events.venue: 34 Mulgrave Street, Pipitea, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
The young virtuoso, recently described as “the finest guitar player of this generation,” has fallen in love with New Zealand! — and after sold-out shows around the globe, he’ll bring his now-famous live show to 25 intimate venues across the country in 2026!
“Do whatever it takes to get in the front row!”
– Roots Magazine, UK
“A generational talent that must be seen to be believed.”
– The Calgary Herald, CANADA
OLD ST PAUL'S - WELLINGTON
✨ August 12, 2026
✨ 7:00pm doors / 7:30pm show
✨ Seated Concert
✨ FAMILY FRIENDLY with cheaper $20 tickets for under 18s
Don’t miss your chance to experience live music at its finest!
WHAT THE PRESS SAY
“The word ‘prodigy’ seems to entirely fall short of this soft-spoken young man’s skills. He coaxes sounds and melodies out of his instrument that literally drop jaws.”
– The Calgary Herald, Canada
“Today I saw the future of folk — festival-goers flocking in the thousands towards the main stage to witness a young musical phenomenon from Australia dish out an absolute show-stopper.”
– The Firefly Column, USA
“Daniel Champagne is a crossroads, fusing the strong traditions of blues, folk, and other roots art with pop showmanship and admirable lyrical ability. I firmly believe that he will become an ambassador for roots music in a time where it desperately needs representation.”
– The Indie Blender, Canada
“Reinventing roots guitar.”
– Rhythms Magazine, Australia
“Watching Daniel Champagne perform is a once-in-a-lifetime experience. He is a true prodigy who plays like no one else could possibly play unless they spent at least two lifetimes studying the art.”
– BW Review, New Zealand
Presented by Nightingale Concerts - the listening-room experience

OLD ST PAUL'S is one of Wellington’s most breathtaking and evocative performance spaces, revered for its grandeur, warmth, and extraordinary natural acoustics. Built entirely of native timber, the soaring nave and finely crafted interior create a sound that is rich, resonant, and deeply immersive. The scale of the space offers both intimacy and awe, drawing audiences into a shared listening experience where music lingers and breathes. Designed for seated performances and reverent attention, Old St Paul’s carries a rare stillness — a place where silence feels sacred, dynamics unfold naturally, and every note is given time, space, and meaning.

events.id: Dita Von Teese-The Opera House, Wellington, New Zealand-Wellington NZ
events.name: Dita Von Teese
events.venue: The Opera House, Wellington, New Zealand
events.long_description:
With her signature mystery and old-Hollywood glamour, Dita Von Teese is a global icon in the world of burlesque. She’s bringing an exciting new show to The Opera House in August. ‘Nocturnelle’ is a sensual spectacle inspired by the golden age of magic. It blends sophisticated striptease with the art of illusion for an unforgettable evening. Dita is accompanied by an ensemble of hand-picked neo-burlesque artists, so expect to be dazzled. 
Dita Von Teese is considered to have set the benchmark for American burlesque. The exotic and provocative art form has advanced under her unrivalled artistry and flair. The performer, creative director, and choreographer has sold out some of the world’s grandest venues, from Shanghai to New York. She is also a designer, collaborator, and entrepreneur. She’s forayed into fashion, beauty, music, and publishing.

events.id: Suzanne Vega-St James Theatre, Wellington, New Zealand-Wellington NZ
events.name: Suzanne Vega
events.venue: St James Theatre, Wellington, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Widely regarded as one of the foremost songwriters of her generation, Suzanne Vega emerged as a leading figure of the folk revival of the early 1980s. Four decades later, she is still writing and singing great songs. In her Wellington show, Suzanne will perform a career-spanning set. See her on stage at St James Theatre performing favourites like Tom’s Diner, Luka, Marlene On The Wall, and plenty more. There’ll also be new songs from her 2025 album, ‘Flying with Angels’. Joining her on stage will be longtime guitarist, Gerry Leonard, and cellist Stephanie Winters. 
Since the release of her self-titled, critically acclaimed 1985 debut album, Suzanne Vega has played to sold-out concerts across the world. She is a masterful storyteller who, according to one The New York Times critique, “observes the world with a clinically poetic eye.” Her song lyrics often focus on city life, ordinary people, and real-world subjects. They are notably succinct, understated, and immediately recognisable.
events.description:
Widely regarded as one of the foremost songwriters of her generation, Suzanne Vega emerged as a leading figure of the folk revival of the early 1980s.
Four decades later, she is still writing and singing great songs.
In her Wellington show, Suzanne will perform a career-spanning set.
See her on stage at St James Theatre performing favourites like Tom’s Diner, Luka, Marlene On The Wall, and plenty more.
There’ll also be new songs from her 2025 album, ‘Flying with Angels’.

SUZANNE VEGA | Sun 6 Sept 2026 | St. James Theatre, Wellington
𝐒𝐮𝐳𝐚𝐧𝐧𝐞 𝐕𝐞𝐠𝐚 will perform a career-spanning show including favorites like “𝑇𝑜𝑚’𝑠 𝐷𝑖𝑛𝑒𝑟”, “𝐿𝑢𝑘𝑎”, “𝑀𝑎𝑟𝑙𝑒𝑛𝑒 𝑂𝑛 𝑇ℎ𝑒 𝑊𝑎𝑙𝑙” and many more, plus songs from her latest album, 𝐹𝑙𝑦𝑖𝑛𝑔 𝑤𝑖𝑡ℎ 𝐴𝑛𝑔𝑒𝑙𝑠, which was released in May 2025 to critical acclaim. She will be joined on stage by her longtime guitarist, Gerry Leonard (of David Bowie band), and cellist Stephanie Winters.

- 𝐏𝐚𝐭𝐜𝐡

𝐀𝐁𝐎𝐔𝐓 𝐒𝐔𝐙𝐀𝐍𝐍𝐄 𝐕𝐄𝐆𝐀

Widely regarded as one of the foremost songwriters of her generation, Suzanne Vega emerged as a leading figure of the folk revival of the early 1980s. Accompanying herself on acoustic guitar, Vega sang what has been called contemporary folk or neo-folk songs of her own creation in Greenwich Village clubs. Since the release of her self-titled, critically acclaimed 1985 debut album, she has given sold-out concerts in many of the world’s best-known venues. Known for performances that convey deep emotion, Vega’s distinctive, “clear, unwavering voice” (Rolling Stone) has been described as “a cool, dry sandpaper-brushed near-whisper” by The Washington Post, with NPR Music noting that she “has been making vital, inventive music” throughout the course of her decades-long career. Bearing the stamp of a masterful storyteller who “observes the world with a clinically poetic eye” (The New York Times), Vega’s songs have tended to focus on city life, ordinary people and real-world subjects. Notably succinct and understated, her work is immediately recognizable—as utterly distinct and thoughtful as it was when her voice was first heard on the radio over 40 years ago.

events.venue: Meow Nui, Wellington, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Presented by: Destroy All Lines
Pioneers of the iconic Madchester sound, the Happy Mondays are heading back to New Zealand to celebrate the 35th anniversary of their seminal album, Pills 'n' Thrills and Bellyaches.
Fusing funk, rock, psychedelia, and house with the pulsating energy of the UK’s burgeoning rave scene, the Happy Mondays became the face of a cultural revolution. Their 1990 release, Pills 'n' Thrills and Bellyaches, catapulted them into the mainstream, spending over six months on the UK Albums Chart and earning its place as one of the defining records of the decade.
Fronted by the inimitable Shaun Ryder, with Bez ( freaky dancing and percussion), Mark Day (guitar), Gary Whelan (drums), Mikey Shine (bass), Dan Broad (musical director/guitar/keys), and Firouzeh Berry (backing vocals), the band will perform highlights from the classic album; including anthems like Step On, Kinky Afro, and Loose Fit, alongside fan favourites such as 24 Hour Party People, Hallelujah, Judge Fudge, and W.F.L.
Their enduring influence on British music was formally recognised in 2016 when they received the prestigious Ivor Novello Inspiration Award, a testament to their legacy as one of the UK’s most beloved and groundbreaking bands.
‘Always a great buzz when we play Australia and New Zealand . Looking forward to bringing the Happy Mondays Pills ‘n’ Thrills party there in September’’ - Shaun Ryder
This isn’t just a tour, it’s a full-throttle revival of Madchester chaos, and the year's wildest party is coming.

events.venue: 280 Church Street, New Zealand 4410,280 Church St, Palmerston North 4410, New Zealand, Palmerston North
events.long_description:
Shakespeare with Peter Hambleton
In 2026, thanks to our generous funder Mercury, the course is FREE to Manawatu students aged 14 to 18. Limited spots, express your interest: https://www.centrepoint.co.nz/basement-co-labs

Who are you talking to? An intensive, fun-filled session exploring what we can learn from Shakespeare's Globe Theatre in London, and the Pop-up Globe. We’ll delve into practical skills that will improve your focus, connection and confidence on stage. Great fun for newcomers who want to decode Shakespeare’s mystery, for those wanting to enhance their skills before 2027 SGCNZ Festivals, and for theatre-lovers!

Well-known Wellington Actor/Director Peter Hambleton (of THE HOBBIT movies, and local TV comedy HAPPINESS) has directed many of Shakespeare’s plays, including ALL's WELL THAT ENDS WELL, and THE COMEDY OF ERRORS for Manawatu Summer Shakespeare. He also appeared at Centrepoint Theatre in HUDSON AND HALLS LIVE.

The 2026 Barbershop Harmony New Zealand Convention will take place in Wellington from September 25–27, 2026, hosted at the modern Tākina Convention Centre. This three-day event will bring together barbershop singers, quartets, choruses, and enthusiasts from across the region for a celebration of harmony, performance, and community.

Attendees can look forward to a full schedule featuring competitions, workshops, coaching sessions, mass sing-alongs, and showcase concerts highlighting both emerging talent and seasoned performers. Tākina’s world-class facilities provide an ideal setting for vibrant performances and social gatherings, all within walking distance of Wellington’s cultural and culinary attractions.

The convention aims to inspire musical excellence, foster connection within the barbershop community, and offer an unforgettable experience for performers and audiences alike.

events.id: Cornelia Parker-City Gallery Wellington-Wellington NZ
events.name: Cornelia Parker
events.venue: City Gallery Wellington
events.long_description:
After three years of closure, the newly renovated and strengthened City Gallery Wellington Te Whare Toi will host the art of Cornelia Parker. The English visual artist is best known for her innovative and contemporary sculpture and installation art. Her large-scale, immersive installations explore themes of destruction and reconstruction, transformation and metamorphosis. Objects are exploded, crushed, and suspended in a world upended and remade anew.
Curated by independent UK-based curator Andrea Schlieker and City Gallery Wellington’s Senior Curator Aaron Lister, City Gallery Wellington's exhibition will encompass Parker’s long career as an artist. This includes an immersive sound and light installation, ‘Stolen Thunder’. The work gathers the sounds of approaching storms from around the globe and across time. The exhibition will also showcase her paintings, photos, films, and sculptures.
“I have always said this is the one exhibition I want to do before I die,” said Charlotte Davy, Ringatohu Toi Director Art and City Gallery Wellington. “I have been following Cornelia Parker’s work for the last twenty years. Bringing her mischievous, dark, and literally explosive work to Wellington is incredible.” 
Parker’s work often fills entire rooms and invites the viewer to move through and around the art. Given its physical scale, the blank canvas of the reopened gallery offers the perfect opportunity to host the exhibition. The exhibition will kick off in October 2026, carrying through to March 2027. 
Charlotte notes the exhibition’s themes are also of particular relevance to Wellington. “I hope that the exhibition and our return to Te Ngākau Civic Square will reflect our city and also help remake it. We are looking forward to opening with a bang.”
Hero image: © Cornelia Parker. Courtesy of the artist and Frith Street Gallery, London

events.id: Book Club: Emiko by Chieri Uegaki-Level 2/57 Willis Street, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: Book Club: Emiko by Chieri Uegaki
events.venue: Level 2/57 Willis Street, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Join us in person to discuss Emiko, a contemporary version of Jane Austen's Emma set in Canada.
(Order your copy through us by 20 March 2026 for delivery at the 23 May meeting or couriered in NZ)
About Emiko:
A busybody foodie avoids questions of her own future as she meddles in the love lives of those around her. Has this matcha-maker met her match?

Self-declared matchmaking GENIUS (a la Beyonce) Emiko Kimori has already found success by helping her aunt find true love, so when the new girl in town becomes her new BFF, it's only natural for Emiko to help set her up for social success with a suitable love match.

Emiko lives with her Ojiichan in a small town on BC's West Coast surrounded by friends and neighbors, including her childhood friend Kenzo Sanada, who wishes she'd spend less time playing matchmaker. But Emiko can so clearly see who belongs together, even when her targets don't know it themselves. She simply has to meddle - for the sake of true love!

As for her own romantic life though . . . who has time for that? Emiko is far too busy with her matchmaking schemes, her brunch recipes, volunteering, her bustling social life, keeping up her grades, eating said brunch recipes and making plans for after graduation. Plans she will absolutely decide on soon. Definitely. Maybe? But when Emiko ends up falling for the last person she expects, she finds herself caught in the tangled web of her own love matches. For the first time, instead of arranging from afar, Emiko has to figure out what it means to be in love herself, and that friendship and romance are more complicated than she ever imagined . . .
About the Author:
Chieri Uegaki is a second generation Japanese-Canadian and award-winning children’s author living and writing on Vancouver Island, in the traditional and unceded territory of the lək̓ʷəŋən speaking peoples, today known as the Esquimalt and Songhees Nations.
She graduated with a Bachelor of Fine Arts from the University of British Columbia’s Creative Writing Department and has written a number of stories for children, including the picture books Suki’s Kimono and Rosie and Buttercup (both illustrated by Stéphane Jorisch); Hana Hashimoto, Sixth Violin (illustrated by Qin Leng); and Ojiichan’s Gift (illustrated by Genevieve Simms).
When not reading or writing, Chieri consumes rom-coms and mysteries in any form, chooses appetizers over dessert most of the time, and tries to stay on top of her collecting problem. She is currently working on a number of projects.
Rachel Pilois (Book Buyer) on this selection:
There have been many retellings of Austen’s novels in the last 200 years. Pride and Prejudice easily wins the prize of Austen’s most adapted novel in both film and literature. In the last 20 years there’s been a noticeable growth in culturally (and gender) diverse takes on Austen’s work, with the most popular retellings being of Indian (i.e Bride and Prejudice) or African-American (i.e. Ibi Zoboi’s Pride) heritage. Sadly, some of her less popular novels (Mansfield Park and Northanger Abbey) have few adaptations in both film and literature, faithful or modern retelling.
With the 2026 theme of the JASNZ being diversity it made sense to choose a slightly less popular novel (only in terms of how many adaptations) and a slightly less common culture used in Austen retellings. Thus I settled on the upcoming YA novel Emiko by Chieri Uegaki, a Japanese-Canadian retelling of Emma.
Emma is a much beloved story and a much beloved character, who’s thoughts, actions and motivations are very recognisable in a modern teenager. Adding in the deep cultural etiquette of Japan as a likeness to the rules of regency society, makes Uegaki’s Emiko a brilliant and well thought out modern retelling of the Emma.
As it publishes on 9 September 2025, we can discover and discuss this new and exciting adaptation for the first time together! 
NB: Ticket numbers are limited to ensure ease of discussion. Afternoon tea is provided
FRIEND: bring a friend, get 10% off! Discount automatically applied
We aim to provide an accessible and safe environment. Discounts are available for nonwaged members, early birds, volunteers and people buying multiple tickets. Please let us know how we can ensure you're included.

events.id: Creedence Clearwater Collective-St James Theatre, Wellington, New Zealand-Wellington NZ
events.name: Creedence Clearwater Collective
events.venue: St James Theatre, Wellington, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Take a walk back in time to enjoy some of the most famous music of the 60s and 70s. Creedence Clearwater Revival was a juggernaut of phenomenal proportions. From their album debut in 1968 to their last album in 1972 the band produced some highly memorable songs. Many of them are still regularly played today. The Creedence Clearwater Collective recreates the success of the original band. The St James Theatre stage in Wellington will come alive with a six-piece tribute band. There’ll be a guest saxophonist and a vocalist who emulates the distinct sounds of original vocalist John Fogerty. 
The night promises to be full of iconic tunes including songs they wrote and songs they covered. Listen to hits like Have You Ever Seen The Rain, Fortunate Son, Bad Moon Rising, and Proud Mary.

Step into the eerie world of "Oh The Horror! 2.0" - a spine-chilling extravaganza awaiting all horror fans goths and Halloween enthusiasts alike (Venue TBC). Embrace the dark side from 10:00 AM onwards at this specially curated market presented by Flea Bag Events.
Are you ready to be mesmerized by a macabre display of handpicked items designed to cater to your eerie tastes? Join us for a hauntingly good time as you browse through a selection of peculiar and unique offerings guaranteed to send shivers down your spine.
Immerse yourself in the ghoulish atmosphere while indulging in the company of fellow enthusiasts. Music by On The Record will set the mysterious tone heightening your senses as you explore the market. Additionally vintage Halloween cartoons will be playing in the backdrop adding a touch of nostalgia to the event. While this all-ages gathering welcomes everyone we must warn you - there will be spicy items available for the brave souls. Feel free to bring your younglings along but beware of the thrills that await you!

events.long_description:
Last Song, Actually - Opening
Step into the whirlwind two years after the beloved China Inn changed hands.

The community is buzzing: tragedy, mystery, and mayhem collide as wedding bells threaten to ring. But who’s the real bride? Where’s the elusive groom? Why is everyone glued to their phones?

Continuing with the lovable characters we met in Last Song, Last Song, Actually is a comedic rollercoaster that is a love letter to the magic of karaoke, the warmth of the Palmy community and the haziness of late-night shenanigans.

NOTE: You do not have to see Last Song to understand Last Song, Actually – no one really understood that one anyway, but it was fun though!

events.name: Wellington Wild Coffee & Tea Workshop, forage, cook and taste + Healthy potluck
events.venue: berhampore island community orchard,Community Orchard, Adelaide Rd, Berhampore, Wellington 6023, New Zealand, Wellington
events.long_description:
Wellington Wild Coffee & Tea Workshop, forage, cook and taste + Healthy potluck
Foraging and Growing Workshops coming to Wellington. No need for prior knowledge we will learn everything from scratch.

Workshop description:

Come to enjoy learning over a foraged cuppa with a fun and hands-on workshop all about wild coffee and tea! We’ll head out to forage for plants that can be used as a coffee alternative, then cook, brew, and taste our way through the process together.
You’ll learn how to spot potential coffee subs in nature, prep them from scratch, and sip your way through a few different brews. Tasting is a big part of this one—so come hungry and curious!
No experience needed—just bring your sense of humor
neighbors, friends or come solo💚

_______
Come with your family, friends, neighbors and furry companions, please share this event.
_________
I encourage everyone to walk, cycle or bus to the event as part of the experience and help not to impact the environment. I will have some special gifts for the ones who do 🌻💚
________
Please allow enough time to immerse into the workshop with no rush"
_______
REGISTRATION IS Essential the event is number of registered people dependent.
50$ per person per workshop, 80$ for 2 ppl within a family, children are free, animals welcome. Volunteers of non profit organization's and community gardeners are welcome to come on a koha or vegetables from their garden bases if you prefer, make sure to indicate upon registration, numbers are limited. Please register here:
https://docs.google.com/forms/d/1JDsUTlOZYvF870A1bJ7JNxR5-eGL3tlCX3PZtMRRjV0/viewform

🔗 Learn more about my work: foraging and growing corner

Enjoy delicious fresh pasta, gnocchi, and other Italian favourites every Saturday at our cellar door. Each week features a different menu, including a vegetarian option.

Attilio earned his reputation through simple, fresh, and honest cooking, crafted with passion and the finest ingredients. He was the head chef at Moy Hall when they first opened, ran a gnocchi food truck at Schubert, and led the kitchen at Palliser. You’ve probably already tried his famous gnocchi, and if you haven’t, now you know where to find it.

See you all soon!

Cambridge Road team.

events.id: Lavender & Flower Farm PYO-Lavender Magic, 61 Blakes Road, Mt Holdsworth, Carterton, Carterton-Event Finder
events.name: Lavender & Flower Farm PYO
events.venue: Lavender Magic, 61 Blakes Road, Mt Holdsworth, Carterton, Carterton
events.long_description:
Your weekend escape starts at Lavender Magic surrounded by the calming scent of Lavender. As the evening cools, wander through rows of fragrant blooms and gather fresh flowers — the perfect gift for friends and family.

Nestled in a charming country garden, Lavender Magic offers breathtaking views of the Tararua Ranges, creating a stunning backdrop for relaxation and discovery. Whether you’re picking flowers, strolling among the lavender, or simply soaking in the peaceful atmosphere, this is the place to unwind and reconnect with nature.

Come experience the magic. Lavender Magic — where tranquility blossoms and the stars are brighter.

Lavender Magic is a Lavender farm and a Cut Flower Farm. It has about 5000 lavender plants and grows a range of cut flowers. In season you will find pockets roses, lilies, sunflowers, zinnias and dahlias. You can pick lavender and cut flowers!

Since 2007 Lavender Magic has won many awards for the quality of their lavender oil, which can be purchased on site along with balms, creams and sprays in the small farm shop.

We will provide you with everything you need. Cutting nips, rubber band and bucket. We will let you know which flowers are in season and available to cut.

Plan your visit: Lavender Magic is a great place to take time out, relax and recover.
Wear - Good footwear to explore the lavender field and surrounding gardens.
Wear - Sunglasses and slip, slop, slap on if a sunny day as we get full sun.
Bring - BYO food and drink is allowed. Or grab a coffee and something to eat from OUR PLACE CAFE who set up when available, check socials for details.
Bring - A rug if you want to sit in the lavender, but not on the ground. Some seating may be available on quiet days.
Bring - A journal or magazine, to ensure you take time out to reflect and relax
Bring - A friend and whanau to share your experience
Bring - A Team of friends, a pack of cards or games and just hang out for awhile
Bring - Your pet, if you are a responsible owner and promise you will pick up its mess and will not let it annoy others.
Bring - A camera to capture some of the magic and create memories.
A toilet is on site.

Lavender Magic is a scenic drive, about 75 minutes from Upper Hutt and Palmerston North.

Cut flower bouquets are available or can be ordered in advance to surprise someone special.

If you want something a little more private, we do hire out our property for photography and special events, contact Pauline on lavendermagic@outlook.com

How to get there:
Drive past the pizza place to get to Lavender Magic - Pizza at the Water Mill Bakery is open (Friday Only 5pm-9pm). Other things to do in the Mt Holdsworth area - Fernado Oscar Calligo may have Choripan the Argentinian Food Cart open (Check socials for dets) Paul Melser Pottery (Weekends Only), Jackie Pearson's Fine Art Gallery (Check for details), Rivenrock Mountain Biking Park (Check for details) and DOC walks (24/7) as Holdsworth is the main entrance to the eastern side of the Tararua Forest Park.

Mt Holdsworth, Carterton, Wairarapa is a great place to visit.

events.long_description:
Gindulgence Wellington 2027!
Welcome to New Zealand’s most celebrated boutique gin festival. NOW FEATURING rum, whisky, vodka, liqueurs and other spirits!

On offer is a fantastic line-up of 20 distillers showcasing a fabulous selection of 90+ gins and other spirits from New Zealand and around the world.

Explore this exceptional range with samples from all distillers included in your ticket price.

Delight your senses in discovering the flavours and botanicals, buy a specialty drink or two or just sit back and soak up the atmosphere.

If you’re looking for inspiration or education, the Gin Theatre will be in action with presentations from a selection of passionate distillers.

Don't miss this afternoon experience of gin-on-the-lawn at the new location of WAITANGI PARK.

Get your tickets here - https://gindulgence.flicket.co.nz/events/f29a3268-c174-40b8-88e7-afdbaf1eecf0?tc=wlgjan2026-fb-event

events.id: Marlborough Lines Classic Fighters Airshow 2027-79 Aerodrome Road, Burleigh, Blenheim 7272, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: Marlborough Lines Classic Fighters Airshow 2027
events.venue: 79 Aerodrome Road, Burleigh, Blenheim 7272, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Marlborough Lines Classic Fighters – ‘Putting on the Ritz’
We’re bringing the glamour back bigger and better for 2027!
Step into the golden age of aviation as the skies sparkle with the elegance of the 1920s and 1930s. Marvel at breathtaking aerobatics, feel the thrill as legendary WW2 warbirds take command overhead, and soak up the glamour of a bygone era.
Beyond the flying action, enjoy a weekend packed with classic cars, fireworks, fantastic food, live entertainment, and family fun. It’s a celebration you won’t want to miss!
🎟️ Tickets now available online – choose a single-day ticket for any day you prefer, or take advantage of our new multi-day passes. A Friday ticket includes the full day’s program plus the spectacular Twilight Extreme.
Join us in Marlborough for a show that promises to be unforgettable – we can’t wait to see you there!

events.id: Black Ferns vs British and Irish Lions-Sky Stadium, Wellington, New Zealand-Wellington NZ
events.name: Black Ferns vs British and Irish Lions
events.venue: Sky Stadium, Wellington, New Zealand
events.long_description:
The first-ever Howden British and Irish Lions women‘s series is coming to Aotearoa in 2027. With five games across the country, Wellington is to play host to one of three Test games. The competition is sure to be fierce and the atmosphere electric. 
Sitting at the halfway point between Rugby World Cups, the tour will offer high-calibre clashes between two rugby powerhouses. Ben Calveley, CEO of The British & Irish Lions, said the tour marks “something truly special for the women’s game.” With the first-ever tour title on the table, you can expect both teams to leave it all on the field. Let‘s fill the cake tin with stomping feet and edge-of-your-seat screams. The Wellington game is Test number two of the series, so pull on your jersey, warm up your pipes and get ready for Black Ferns fever to sweep the city. 
Tickets go on sale late 2026.
